column2: UW Health Madison Surgery Center Interventional Pain Program
column3:
UW Health Madison Surgery Center Interventional Pain Program in Madison, Wisconsin offers comprehensive pain management services for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our specialized team of board-certified pain medicine physicians, advanced practice providers, and support staff work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At the Interventional Pain Program, we utilize the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies to diagnose and treat various pain conditions. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, peripheral nerve blocks, and other minimally invasive treatments designed to provide relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience managing a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Headaches and facial pain

Multidisciplinary Approach

We believe in a comprehensive approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, physical therapy, medication management, psychological support, and complementary therapies. Our goal is to improve function and quality of life while reducing reliance on opioid medications whenever possible.

Location and Contact Information

The UW Health Madison Surgery Center Interventional Pain Program is conveniently located at 1 S Park St, Madison, WI 53715. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call +1 608-287-2990. You can also visit our website at uwhealth.org for additional information about our program and services.

As part of the renowned UW Health system, our Interventional Pain Program maintains the highest standards of patient care and safety while providing access to the latest advances in pain medicine. We accept most major insurance plans and work closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care for all our patients.

Midwest Comprehensive Pain Cr in Wauwatosa, Wisconsin offers specialized pain management services to patients throughout the greater Milwaukee metropolitan area. Our board-certified physicians and medical staff provide comprehensive evaluations and personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic pain conditions and improve quality of life. With over two decades of experience serving the community, we combine evidence-based medical approaches with innovative therapies to deliver effective pain relief solutions.

At Midwest Comprehensive Pain Cr, we treat a wide range of pain conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and post-surgical pain. Our multidisciplinary approach may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to promote faster recovery and better outcomes.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take the time to listen to your concerns and develop treatment strategies that address your specific goals. Our compassionate team works closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care and optimal results. New patients are typically seen within two weeks, and we offer convenient appointment scheduling for follow-up visits.

Location and Contact Information

Conveniently located near Mayfair Mall at 2500 N Mayfair Rd, Suite 300, Wauwatosa, WI 53226, our modern facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. Free parking is available in the adjacent lot for all patients. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call +1 414-771-7400. Our office is open Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, with select early morning appointments available for working professionals.

Mercyhealth Pain Center-Janesville serves patients throughout Janesville, Wisconsin and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized facility is dedicated to helping individuals experiencing chronic, acute, and post-surgical pain through personalized treatment plans and innovative therapies. Located on Mercyhealth's Janesville campus, our center brings together board-certified pain specialists, advanced practice providers, and support staff committed to improving patients' quality of life and functionality.

At Mercyhealth Pain Center-Janesville, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy coordination, and patient education. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and pain related to cancer treatments.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology that enables us to provide cutting-edge treatments including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive procedures. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, medical history, and specific pain condition.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life. Our team works closely with patients to develop comprehensive treatment strategies that not only address pain but also improve overall function and well-being. We collaborate with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care for optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 608-756-6049. We are conveniently located at 1000 Mineral Point Ave, Janesville, WI 53548. For additional information about our services and providers, visit our website at https://mercyhealthsystem.org/location/mercyhealth-pain-center-janesville/.
column38: Nicole Trewyn|Kati Vogel|mum|Albert Burnell|Laurie Muchow|Leellen Johnson|Kevin sors|Brandon Johnson
column40: My experience with Dr Shah and his department was very poor.  The injection was the worst pain I've ever experienced.   I had a shooting lightening bolt of pain from my butt to my ankle when he put the spinal needle in.  Prior to having this injection my pain was only to my knee, now the pain is to my ankle.  I left in a wheelchair as I was unable to walk.  2 1/2 months later this experience is still traumatic to me.|Dr Shah is one of the most compassionate Dr's. I've ever had. He listens,understands what I'm telling him. He has taken the time after my procedures to explain what was done and asks me if I have quest. I never feel hurried! The nurses are exceptional!|PLEASE READ TO THE END AS MY OPINION HAS CHANGED DUE TO LAST TWO APPOINTMENTS!  The staff is very friendly, caring, compassionate, empathetic yet are still very professional. I have always felt I was treated with respect and have always felt listened to. My issues have always been addressed and options for increasing comfort and decreasing pain are always thoroughly explained.  I have only had good experiences regardless of wether my appointment has been in person visits or telehealth.  They are very thorough at every visit with questions and going over patient health summaries to make sure any changes are up to date. The above is my review from several months ago I had given 5 . My last TWO CONSECUTIVE appointments have changed my review to the current 2.  Telehealth had to wait on my Telehealth appointment for OVER 2 hours for Dr. Shah to show up for the 5 minute conversation!  Next appointment I had to call to check myself in @ 9:45 for my "scheduled " 10:00 Telehealth appointment because no one called me to check me in!  I was then told it would be an hour before he would be available as he had procedures to do ahead of my appointment. I guess my appointment was less important.  Perhaps my Telehealth appointment should have been scheduled at 11:00 NOT 10:00. 1 appointment may be a mistake but 2 in a row shame on you!  People who are in chronic pain deserve to be treated with RESPECT, COMPASSION, EMPATHY AND KINDNESS! They should NEVER be treated as a "second thought" or "inconvenience" to other treatments. Peoples time is valuable just because we are not medical professionals does not make our time inconsequential.  We should not be made to feel that way.  This facility need an overhaul and changes need to be made.  I am a positive, understanding laid back person however I am now feeling frustrated and disrespected. Please get your s$&t together and treat your patients better. We deserve and expect it!|The whole experience was great.  Staff excellent.  Even though Dr. Shah is a White Sox fan (go Cubs) I found him to be amicable and knowledgable.   He's my pain doctor.|3 xs I heard him repeat using the same medication I was found to have an allergy to and another medication that causes me urinary problems. Anesthesiology is a far cry from seeing a neurologist. In business of injections and refused to acknowledge my own experiences over and over. If I ever opted for spinal injs I would have a neurologist do. Ridiculous to not listen.|I was the 1st apt. The doctor didnt show up to the clinic for over an hour after my apt. Then he rushed me through in less than 5 minutes. He cut me off when i tried to speak. And did not do any exam or anything in the apt. It was TERRIBLE! he was arrogant and rude.|Couldn't see the doctor and they scheduled ur appointment and have wait almost an hour|Dr. Shah and the nurses are always very friendly and helpful.  Dr. Shah always listens to and answers questions honestly.  The here nurses are the BEST!

Jeffrey Gorelick, MD serves Milwaukee, Wisconsin and the surrounding communities with exceptional medical care from his convenient Wauwatosa location. With a commitment to patient-centered healthcare, Dr. Gorelick has established a reputation for combining clinical expertise with compassionate service. His practice offers comprehensive medical services designed to address a wide range of health concerns while maintaining a focus on preventative care and patient education.

At his Wauwatosa Avenue practice, Dr. Gorelick provides thorough examinations, personalized treatment plans, and ongoing care management. Patients appreciate his attentive approach and the time he takes to explain medical conditions and treatment options. The practice emphasizes building long-term relationships with patients to ensure continuity of care and improved health outcomes.

Practice Information

Dr. Jeffrey Gorelick's medical practice is conveniently located at 2626 N Wauwatosa Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53213. Patients can easily schedule appointments by calling +1 414-771-2707. The office is situated in a professional medical building with ample parking and accessibility features for patients with mobility concerns.

Patient-Focused Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Gorelick's practice is his dedication to treating the whole person, not just symptoms. He takes time to understand each patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and health goals before developing customized treatment strategies. This comprehensive approach helps ensure that patients receive the most appropriate and effective care for their individual needs.

New patients are welcome to contact the office to learn more about available services or to schedule an initial consultation with Dr. Gorelick.

column40:
Dr. Gorelick, truly is a special find in a Doctor. I started to see Dr. Gorelick in 1999 after a car accident. I have had the unfortunate experience of other injuries, which he also dealt with.
He has also made sure, at every visit, to not only know my physical concerns, but also my stresses. This of course takes extra time than the common Doctor is usually allowed.
Dr. Gorelick's compassion and knowledge have truly assisted with my injections, physical activities or anything else needed in my patient plan.
As a Doctor, a fellow human, if you or a loved one is needing a knowledgeable opinion, I would take the time to call and see him!|Dr. Gorelick is the first draft of very many that I have seen that has actually taken the time to listen to me and go through the years of surgeries and injections and drss that I've seen seen  and is helping me work out a plan to get my life back as much as it can be. He is my hope and he is very caring and professional.|This man changed my life.
He's the most compassionate, learned doctor in the state. He literally gave me my life back.
If his wife knew how much I love him, she'd take a restraining order out on me.
If you are struggling with chronic pain,

Pain Rehabilitation Associates in Milwaukee, Wisconsin provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the greater Milwaukee metropolitan area. Our specialized clinic focuses on evidence-based approaches to chronic pain treatment, combining traditional medical interventions with innovative rehabilitation techniques. Located in the heart of Wauwatosa, our team of board-certified physicians and licensed therapists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At Pain Rehabilitation Associates, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates physical therapy, medication management, interventional procedures, and behavioral health strategies to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. We specialize in treating conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, fibromyalgia, and pain resulting from workplace or auto injuries.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our practitioners take the time to listen and understand each patient's unique pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals. This collaborative approach ensures that treatment plans are both effective and sustainable for long-term pain management.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern clinic at 2626 N Wauwatosa Ave in Milwaukee features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment, comfortable treatment rooms, and a dedicated physical therapy space. The convenient location offers ample parking and is accessible to patients from throughout Milwaukee County and surrounding areas.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 414-771-2707. Our friendly staff is available to answer your questions and help determine if our approach is right for your pain management needs. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure patients understand their coverage options.

Pain Care Centers (formerly Pain Consultants of the Rockies) serves Cheyenne, Wyoming and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists has been helping Wyoming residents find relief from chronic pain for over 12 years, establishing ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider throughout the state. With seven convenient locations across Wyoming, we've built our reputation on compassionate care, innovative treatments, and personalized approaches to pain management.

At Pain Care Centers, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our board-certified physicians utilize the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies to address various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. We develop individualized treatment plans that may incorporate interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and complementary approaches to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Substance Abuse Recovery Program

Beyond traditional pain management, we offer specialized programs for patients dealing with substance abuse issues. Our comprehensive approach addresses both pain management and addiction recovery, providing a supportive environment where patients can receive the care they need without judgment. Our substance abuse program includes medical supervision, counseling, and ongoing support to help patients achieve lasting recovery while effectively managing their pain.

Visit Our Cheyenne Location

Our Cheyenne clinic is conveniently located at 4136 Laramie St, Suite A, Cheyenne, WY 82001. The facility features state-of-the-art equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed with patient comfort in mind. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (307) 212-6270 or visit our website at www.paincarecenters.com. Our compassionate staff is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

Pain Care Centers serves Casper, Wyoming and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our team of dedicated healthcare professionals specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions and opioid dependency. With a patient-centered approach, we develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each individual seeking relief from persistent pain that has lasted longer than 12 weeks.

We provide expert care for a wide range of chronic pain conditions, including:

- Back Pain

- Diabetic Neuropathy

- Arthritis

- Foot, Leg & Knee Pain

- Cancer Pain

- Hand, Arm and Shoulder Pain

- Headaches

- And many other chronic pain conditions

Comprehensive Treatment Options

At Pain Care Centers, we believe in offering the full spectrum of pain management solutions:

Medication Management

- Non-opioid medication options

- Responsible management of opioid-based medications

- Customized medication plans

Interventional Therapies

- Spinal Injections

- Nerve Blocks

- Stem Cell Therapy

- Rhizotomy procedures

- Spinal Cord Stimulators

Opioid Dependency Treatment

We understand the challenges of opioid dependency and offer compassionate care through our Suboxone program, helping patients safely manage dependency while addressing their pain concerns.

Visit Us

Address: 5850 E 2nd St STE 100, Casper, WY 82609, United States

Phone: +1 307-212-6270

Website: [paincarecenters.com](http://paincarecenters.com/)

Our experienced team is committed to helping you regain control of your life by effectively managing your pain. Contact us today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward relief.
column11: Pain Care Centers is operated by a group of professionals committed to diagnosing and treating chronic pain and opioid dependency conditions. Chronic pain is any pain longer than 12 weeks and includes Back Pain, Diabetic Neuropathy, Arthritis, Foot, Leg & Knee Pain, Cancer Pain, Hand, Arm and Shoulder Pain, Headaches, etc. We offer the full spectrum of options to manage and control your condition, such as pain medication management including non-opioid medications and proper management of opioid-based medications. We also will educate & provide you on interventional therapy options such as Spinal Injections, Nerve Blocks, Stem Cell Therapy, Rhizotomy and Spinal Cord Stimulators. We help opioid dependent patients with Suboxone program.

Powder River Pain Clinic in Gillette, Wyoming offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. John Mansell. Established to serve the communities of northeastern Wyoming, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches and personalized treatment plans. We combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce dependency on pain medications.

At Powder River Pain Clinic, we provide a range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Dr. Mansell brings extensive experience in treating conditions including back pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical discomfort. Our multidisciplinary approach may incorporate nerve blocks, epidural injections, physical therapy recommendations, and medication management when appropriate.

Our Commitment to Patient Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take time to listen to our patients and develop comprehensive treatment strategies. Our modern facility at 3100 W Lakeway Rd, Suite 3 in Gillette is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. Dr. Mansell and our dedicated staff work collaboratively with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care for optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 307-696-2996. column40:
Dr. Mansell doesn't mince words or sweet-talk you, but that's not why people seek out pain management in the first place. He's blunt and to the point, but most importantly - he KNOWS what he is doing. He shows he cares by TREATING you, which is worth far more to me than any words.

I injured my back in my mid 20s, in the Army, and suffered crippling sciatic pain well into my 30s. MRI and Nerve conduction studies confirmed an issue, but SEVEN specialists were unable to find the underlying cause. Most offices wanted to prescribe medication, not treat the underlying issue.

I drove up from Casper to meet with Dr. Mansell and we discussed in person. He suggested a treatment approach that I had not considered and convinced me to give it a try - I was skeptical, but willing to try anything out of desperation. Prior to treatment, I couldn't lay on my back, wear a belt, lift anything heavy, or wear anything but the loosest sweatpants. This was my life for nearly SEVEN years.

In the months since I first worked with Dr. Mansell, I have  nearly returned to my prior fitness level. Even more than that, I can SLEEP through the night again.

Give him a chance to work with you. I was limping through life, wondering how I could possibly be a good dad to my children when I couldn't even get a good night's rest.

Working with Dr. Mansell changed my life. If you're ready to give up after bouncing from office to office, GIVE HIM A CHANCE.

I can't articulate just how grateful I am. My quality of life went from 2/10 back to 10/10.|The care my husband received from Dr Mansell was exceptional. He listened attentively to our concerns and provided personalized treatment that yielded positive results. The entire team at the clinic displayed a high level of friendliness and professionalism and made us feel comfortable throughout. We would definitely recommend Dr Mansell.

Thank you Dr Mansell and staff for all you do!|Accepted my daughter as a patient to treat her when she has a trigeminal neuralgia flare. Called Monday, scheduled injections Friday. Calls me after I get a check in time and time off work to say he does not feel  comfortable doing the injections since it's been a long time. Why would you accept a pain patient without looking at their chart? So unprofessional!!!! Said they reached out to some other docs, have not heard back... very disappointed|Most awful doctor I have ever dealt with. Rude, disrespectful and insulting. I've never been to a more unpleasant physician! Do NOT recommend. I will go out of town from now on.|Had a very horrible experience with dr. Mansell.  He is rude, very arrogant,patronizing,condescending,lies, doesnt listen and cut you off when you try to explain something to him .He is also very rough when he does your treatment .Never in my life have I met such a nasty, mean doctor.  ( I have seen plenty of doctors in my life and worked with them as I am  a retired RN) Will never go back to him again. His staff behaved like ice robots and even though I was 45 min early they rushed me through .  I felt very uncomfortable and was quite upset for days after, and wish I never had let him treat me and had walked out before the treatment as it was quite obvious the moment I enter the place  that this place wasnt a pleasant place to be. The nurses just rushed you without any friendliness abd compassion|Dr. Mansell is a very knowledgeable doctor. He is a no nonsense, old school and straight to the point physician. I have struggled with chronic pain for many years and I was beginning to feeling hopeless. Every other doctor I saw wanted to put me on medications instead of treating the cause of my pain. I was hesitant to see him because of all the negative reviews. However, I have not had one bad visit with him and I feel the best I've had in years! I highly recommend Dr. Mansell.|They did some injection in my spine between L3 & L4, it helped with two pinched nerves in my spine. I was surprised with the results being so positive and so quick. I give 3 stars because they do not do well with accuracy in billing. They have been trying to correct this, I am stilling waiting on a $500 cash refund. From 2022. I'm writing this in June 2024. I was also charged a $50 no-show fee. That I had to pay when I couldn't leave work.|Dr. Mansell is an outstanding resource. I have been a patient for 2 years and have never had a negative experience. Patients have access to a portal that allows direct communication with him throughout the day. Extremely knowledgeable and has patients long term best interest at heart. His staff is courteous and his nurse Sarah is very knowledgeable and always on point.

Pain Care Centers serves communities across Wyoming with comprehensive pain management and substance abuse disorder treatment services. Established in 2011, our network has grown to encompass 7 strategic locations throughout the state, making specialized care accessible to residents in multiple regions. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals combines evidence-based approaches with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions and opioid use disorder (OUD), helping patients reclaim their quality of life without unnecessary travel.

At Pain Care Centers, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our integrated approach includes medication management tailored to each patient's unique needs, durable medical equipment (DMEs) to support recovery and function, and advanced interventional procedures that target pain at its source. For patients struggling with opioid use disorder, we offer Suboxone treatment in a supportive, judgment-free environment focused on long-term recovery.

Our Wyoming Presence

With our flagship location at 800 Coffeen Ave Suite B, Sheridan, WY 82801, and six additional facilities strategically positioned throughout Wyoming, we've created a network that brings specialized care closer to home for residents across the state. Each location maintains the same high standards of care and comprehensive service offerings, ensuring consistent quality regardless of which facility you visit.

Patient-Centered Approach

Since opening our doors in 2011, Pain Care Centers has prioritized individualized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain and substance use disorders. Our providers work collaboratively with patients to develop strategies that improve function, reduce reliance on opioids when appropriate, and enhance overall wellbeing through sustainable pain management techniques.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit www.paincarecenters.com or call us at +1 307-212-6270.
column11: Pain Care Centers, with 7 locations in the great state of Wyoming since 2011. Wyoming Pain Institute serves Gillette, Wyoming and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as a premier medical facility, our institute specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches and personalized care plans. Our team of board-certified physicians combines years of specialized training with cutting-edge techniques to address complex pain issues that affect our patients' quality of life.

At Wyoming Pain Institute, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management strategies. Our treatments include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication therapies. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that each patient's pain experience is unique, we develop individualized treatment plans that address not only the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and psychological components. Our compassionate staff works closely with patients to establish realistic goals and improve functional outcomes, helping them return to activities they enjoy.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 3100 W Lakeway Rd, Suite 3, in Gillette, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. The comfortable, welcoming environment reflects our commitment to providing a positive experience for all patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information

Summit Medical Center Pain Clinic in Casper, Wyoming offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Todd A. Hammond, MD. Established as a premier destination for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, the clinic employs a multi-disciplinary approach that addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes of persistent pain. Dr. Hammond has distinguished himself as one of Wyoming's leading interventional pain management specialists, combining advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients reclaim their quality of life.

At Summit Medical Center Pain Clinic, patients benefit from individualized treatment plans designed to achieve specific therapeutic goals. These include reducing pain intensity, increasing physical mobility and functionality, developing effective pain management strategies, and decreasing dependency on pain medications. The clinic's holistic approach recognizes that chronic pain affects not only physical health but also emotional wellbeing and daily functioning.

Specialized Expertise

Dr. Todd Hammond brings extensive training and experience in interventional pain management techniques. His expertise allows the clinic to offer a wide range of advanced procedures and treatment modalities tailored to each patient's unique condition. The clinic specializes in treating various chronic pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain resulting from injuries or surgical procedures.

Patient-Centered Care

The team at Summit Medical Center Pain Clinic is committed to providing compassionate, patient-centered care in a supportive environment. They take time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and pain experience before developing customized treatment plans. This comprehensive approach ensures that patients receive the most appropriate and effective interventions for their specific needs.

Contact Information

For consultations or appointments, patients can reach Summit Medical Center Pain Clinic at +1 307-232-3235. The clinic is conveniently located at 6350 E 2nd St, Suite 190, Casper, WY 82609. Additional information about services and treatment options is available on their website at https://summitmedicalcasper.com/summit-pain-clinic/.
column11: Summit Medical Center Pain Clinic uses a multi-disciplinary approach to treat chronic pain. Dr. Todd Hammond is among the leading interventional pain management specialists in Wyoming. Dr. Trevin Thurman joined Premier Bone & Joint Centers in September of 2020, bringing over a decade of specialized experience in pain management and physical medicine. A native of Idaho, Dr. Thurman returned to the Rocky Mountain region after an extensive educational journey and private practice experience. His comprehensive approach to pain management combines interventional techniques with rehabilitative strategies to provide patients with effective, long-term relief.

Education and Credentials

Dr. Thurman completed his medical degree at the University of Utah in Salt Lake City before undergoing residency training in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation at the prestigious Harvard Medical School in Boston, Massachusetts. His specialized training continued with a fellowship in Interventional Pain at the University of Washington in Seattle. Dr. Thurman maintains dual board certifications from the American Board of Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and the American Board of Pain Medicine, ensuring the highest standard of care for his patients.

Specialized Care and Services

At Premier Bone & Joint Centers, Dr. Thurman applies his extensive training to provide comprehensive pain management solutions. His dual specialization in both physical medicine and pain management allows him to develop integrated treatment plans that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain. Patients benefit from his holistic approach that may include interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative techniques.

column40:
I am very pleased with the care I have received from Dr. Thurman.  He is very thoughtful in his approach and communicates effectively regarding the plan of care.  I feel he is highly skilled in the procedures I have had done.  I have seen improvement in my situation, both in function and in pain.  Highly recommend.|I would say service overall is pretty good, all the people that work there are very nice. My only semi-complaint is that on check ups it feels kinda rushed. I'm kinda a shy person and I cant always think on the spot and I feel like talking about it can be rushed sometimes. I do understand that other people need to get in and have appointments or they might be a little behind, I just feel a little rushed is all.|Doctor Thurman quickly analyzed my mri and suggested an injection.
He seemed confident that this will help my issues.
I was impressed that the staff could get me scheduled as quickly as they have.|I had an MRI ordered by Thurman. Insurance required 6 weeks of physical therapy before they approve an MRI. His office was also notified. I completed the 6 weeks and set up an appointment to see Thurman. His assistant was the one that help setup the therapy by calling them. I waited 30 mins to see him. I could hear him not wanting to see me.. which was strange. He sent in a staff person that said he doesn't want to see me and nothing he can do without an MRI. I told the staff person if he doesn't want to see me just tell me and I can go somewhere else.
The problem is they must not communicate within. To get an MRI after therapy he would have to reorder it. Thurman came in and first thing he said was to be "blunt". Will he didn't want to see me which was confusing. His attitude was incorrect. He also said will you have to much going on with you. I was like that's why I am here. I told him was he a back and spine specialist? He walked out and left me there. My feelings are he wanted to go home as it was almost 4:00 pm and upset because he wasn't possible informed by his staff that set up the therapy and my appointment. I would never recommend this place at all. Very miss communication within, hearing him outside the door, his body language and saying will to be blunt. Unwilling to actually listen and walking out.
I run a company and will share my experience to others. Very unprofessional.|Very knowledgeable, came to the appointment with specific info based on MRI - exactly the specialty visit I expected. Also, everyone was friendly & I really didn't wait at all.|Dr Thurman was great, professional patient and just absolutely great THANK YOU!|This Doctor does not mess around. Great and straight to the problem.  You will be glad that you got to see this Doctor.|Dr. Thurman communicates very well with his patients and as importantly listens. I couldn't be more pleased with how my pain management is going with my lower back/sciatica pain. I've been fighting this for the past 3+ years and am finally finding relief with Dr. Thurman's help.

Wyoming Pain Medicine serves Cody, Wyoming and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through evidence-based treatments and personalized care plans. With our team of board-certified pain specialists, we address a wide range of pain disorders including back pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome.

At Wyoming Pain Medicine, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach that combines interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies. Our treatment options include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication protocols. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs and circumstances of our patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing collaborative relationships with our patients, taking the time to understand their pain experiences and developing strategies that align with their lifestyle and goals. Our compassionate team works diligently to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence and focusing on functional improvement.

Our Facility

Located at 424 Yellowstone Ave #250, Cody, WY 82414, our modern clinic offers a comfortable environment equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The convenient location provides easy access for patients throughout Park County and beyond.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 307-213-9713. Additional information about our practice, including patient resources and educational materials, can be found on our website at http://www.northwypain.com/.

Wyoming Pain Medicine is committed to helping patients reclaim their lives from the limitations of chronic pain through compassionate care, medical expertise, and innovative treatment approaches.

At Pain Care Centers, we offer a multifaceted approach to pain management that includes:

  • Chronic Pain Management - Utilizing the latest diagnostic and therapeutic techniques to address persistent pain conditions

  • Opioid Use Disorder Treatment - Evidence-based programs for those struggling with dependency issues

When I saw the doctor again today, he was rude and impatient, seemed to be unhappy about me not following his recommendations two years ago. He didn't ask about the circumstances around the condition this time. The appointment was over in less than 5 minutes. He said he wouldn't discuss anything with me today. I asked him if we are done when I saw him in the hallway. He then told me we are done. I respect the doctor's expertise and opinion. I just have issue how his opinion is communicated. At QC Kinetix, we utilize state-of-the-art biologic therapies designed to harness your body's natural healing abilities. Patient-Centered Approach

column11:
We are a highly results-driven facility specializing in the diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation of injuries and other musculoskeletal disorders. Because no two patients and no two injuries are the same, we are committed to providing a variety of treatment options. We develop customized treatment programs created specifically for each patient's individual needs and requirements.
We have an excellent relationship with local and regional orthopedic providers and other specialists and can steer you in the right direction if you do not respond to conservative management or we feel your injury warrants such referral.
If a recent or recurring injury is hampering your lifestyle, contact us today for an appointment.
column38: Stacy Frude|Megan Estes|Mallory Costigan|Cody Lax|laramiekreeper|B CA|Jason Arnold|Walt Gasson
column40:
I did not think my son would be able to run indoor track due to the level of discomfort he was experiencing from what we thought was a sports related injury.  David went above and beyond to get to the root of the problem and provided adjusting, needling and therapy, all of which have been very effective, and my son is currently running and competing without any discomfort!  Once again, Spine and Injury Clinic has helped our family get and stay healthy and do what we love to do.  We have had great experiences with both Dylan and David and are thankful for their excellent care!|Thankful for Doctor Dylan and his compassion and generosity. Our family was traveling through and I became very ill with vertigo. However one simple adjustment really helped me to start healing that day on.|I strongly recommend and support the Spine & Injury Clinic. It is the best place to go for chiropractic, massage, and physical therapy.
The Spine & Injury Clinic has been with me through 3 back surgeries. Starting in 2016 to present. I don't know where I would be without David Milam, Catlin Fairfield, Natalie Motor and her assistant Maddie. They helped get me where I needed to be to set me up for success for my 3rd back surgery September of this year and they have been there for me as I recover. Thanks to this amazing team of people my recovery is going to have the best outcome possible. My care team is hands down the best and they are incredible people.
The office ladies have been amazing as well, helping me get scheduled and rescheduling if need be. The office ladies are polite, kind, and wonderful.
Thank you to everyone at the Spine & Injury Clinic for being incredible. I appreciate you all more than I will ever be able express.|Amazing people!  Great service and quick, easy to get an appointment and was able to get in and out very quickly. They walked me through everything and listened to me like I was a person, not just a paycheck. Would highly recommended.|Dr Gabe was awesome! I have never been to a chiropractor before and he was incredible. He is a knowledgeable and personable young man. I so thank him for all his help!!!! I will have no problem using him again!!|I've been going to the Spine & Injury Clinic of Laramie for three weeks now, and it's been a great experience. The facility is state of the art, and makes use of Altitude Fitness next door. The staff is super friendly and professional, and my PT (Natalie) is empathetic, has taken the time to get to know me, and is flexible in her treatment...responding to my needs. Her treatment plan is challenging, but it's helping me focus and has already improved my strength and stability and reduce my chronic pain! I didn't want basic PT...I wanted sports/functional-fitness focused PT and that's what Natalie provides!|Great staff! The pain is gone and I can go back to work. I particularly enjoyed the needle work. Thanks to David and the team.|I had a bilateral knee replacement five months ago. The first two weeks sucked, but now I'm back to full speed. The care I got from the staff at Spine and Injury Clinic was world class. I've worked with lots of physical therapists, but Tiffany Polson is the absolute best. Big shout outs to Kyle, Bailey, Alex and everyone else who made me feel like I was their only priority!

column11: HealthFirst is a medical practice that blends the best of traditional and alternative medicine with compassion and genuine concern at their offices in the Greater Denver Area and Cheyenne, Wyoming. Led by holistic medicine physician, Jonathan W. Singer, DO, the team takes care to give each patient his personal attention and dedicates the time needed to get to the cause of complex issues. Dr. Singer received his bachelor's and master's degrees in food chemistry from the University of Wisconsin-Madison in Madison, Wisconsin. During that time, he invented an alternative to the food colorant Yellow No. 5, creating a natural option that's now standard in the food industry.

Dr. Singer is a wealth of knowledge and provides guidance with information that  goes along with our beliefs regarding health and our bodies best interest. Dr Singer and his staff are friendly and very accommodating,  willing to answer questions  at any time. Since then, he has been our go-to provider, and the people in his office are always pleasant to work with!|Dr. Singer is one heckuva good guy. I enjoyed my visit with him and my treatment so I will probably be back sometime again to have some more done.|The first time I saw Dr. Singer was 9 years ago when I was going through one of the most difficult times in my life. Thankfully, I found Dr. Singer and he helped me get back on track and feeling better in no time. He listens, he cares, he's extremely intelligent, professional and proficient at what he does.  It's remarkable how quickly he can get to the bottom of root causes affecting our health. He's the best doctor I've ever found...honestly a gift to his patients.|Dr Singer, DO is one of the most patient people I know. I am always grateful to have him as my physician.|Like nothing I've ever experienced!  I believe he is going to help me!!!  Wonderful personality too and his nurse is very friendly and encouraging. I definitely recommend!|My visit at  Dr. Singer's office was a pleasant experience. His commitment to patient care and his patients well being is truly commendable. Dr. Singer,. column11: Premier Bone & Joint Centers, located at 1909 Vista Drive in Laramie, Wyoming, is a state-of-the-art healthcare facility offering a comprehensive range of orthopedic and physical therapy services. Their experienced team of orthopedic surgeons, physical therapists, occupational therapists, general practitioners, and pain management specialists collaborate to deliver tailored treatment plans, combining advanced medical techniques with a compassionate approach. Whether you're seeking relief from acute pain, rehabilitation after an injury, or proactive management of chronic conditions, Premier Bone & Joint Centers is committed to improving your mobility and quality of life.

column40:
I had to get a new custom made brace for my right foot from the Mobility Center at Premier.   Matt Harris, the lead provider at the center, helped me get the perfect brace and customized it to fit me perfect.  Matt really took his time and made sure everything about the brace was perfect for me.  He is great at his job!  I highly recommend Matt.  He really knows his stuff and is great with his patients.  With his expertise and help, I am now doing all the things I want to do -- skiing, hiking, biking and playing pickleball!  Thank you Matt Harris!!|Dr. DiPompeo was great.  She was very patient and answered all my questions.  I have heard great things about her also at the hospital where the procedure will be performed.  The surgery scheduler, on the other hand, wasn't nearly as patient.  She was very pushy.  I'm glad the surgery is scheduled and I hopefully don't have to deal with her again.  But I feel very confident in Dr. DiPompeo and expect a good outcome.|Dr Levine is a magician.
My new knee is remarkable. Back to work in 7 weeks!
All of the people at Premier Bone and Joint are extremely professional and very kind. I highly recommend them to anyone in need|Amazing service at the Laramie Campus! This team readily displayed highest caliber of quality care and second to none customer service. Our son was having a significant surgery and this team put our entire family unit at ease with their humble yet reassuring confidence as well as spirit lifting humor.  Our thanks to each bedside clinician that provided expertise and made us feel like we were hanging with friends.  Renae RN, Trish RN, Ashlynn RN, Dr. Levine Surgeon, Rick PA, Dr. Proctor Anesthesia. A special thanks to Angela Manager who brought a personal connection and ensured the entire process was as smooth as possible. All members of this team have my family's sincerest thanks.|I wouldn't go here again as I was lied to.  I woke up serious knee pain, I couldn't get in with my surgeon who I planned on having knee replacement with but was told they take walk-ins here.  Dr. Levene said all he could was a cortisone shot and told my wife and I it WOULD NOT delay surgery so I got the shot.  After he left he sent the handyman in with different size J-braces to try, which didn't address my issues anyway.  I saw my surgeon the next week who said 3 months to surgery now.  I've been taken by mechanics before but not a doctor.  To make it worse it pushed me after the new year and had to start over on my deductible.|Dr. DiPompeo was wonderful. She took the time to go over all of my imaging and made sure that I understood my options.  I feel very confident that she'll take great care of me.|Dr. Levene is a great surgeon, based on previous experience.  He is professional and very thorough. Great outcomes with shoulders. Knees and hips.  I would highly recommend him for your orthopedic needs.0|My visit with Dr. DePompeo was real good. She goes over everything with you and makes it real clear. She is very open and honest about what is going on if surgery is needed. I would recommend her to all I know with similar issues.

column40:
Dr Shane has changed my life.  After numerous injuries and a few concussions, he
Was the first doctor I saw that looked at all my ailments holistically and put a plan in place to help address them.  Dr Shane helped me gain the ability to ride again.  Not only do I have far less body pain, but i have improved energy and balance.  I highly recommend Dr Shane.|Dr Shane has been very thorough and patient with my unusual symptoms. He tries multiple approaches to address everything I throw out at him. I appreciate his efforts to get to the bottom of my issues.|I've worked with Dr. Shane for many years with chiropractic care, functional medicine, and quantum neurology. He is always, kind, attentive, incredibly knowledgeable, and caring. He has helped me through a lot of medical challenges with good results. I highly recommend him and his programs of care.|I have been suffering from back pain that just kept getting worse for over 11 years. It got to where it was causing burning pain in my legs as well as numbness and tingling that went clear to the tips of my toes. I was short with my family due to the pain. Missing out on life. I had done physical therapy, massage therapy, chiropractic, as well as seen two different neurosurgeons. Muscle relaxers helped initially but going with non surgical spinal decompression with Dr. Shane's approach had been the ONLY thing that has helped. I went from having a normal daily pain level of 5-8, to now 0-2. It's like the disc herniation never even happened. I've been given a second lease in life!|I'm absolutely satisfied with the care I've received from Dr. Shane and his Staff. He is extremely professional and has a skill set second to none. They are very accommodating, he educates his patients and has a profound affect on the progress of their healing. I truly can't say enough about how great of an experience I've had at Dr. Shane's office. I highly recommend him for excellent health care.  Thank you so Much, Jennifer L.|It was a great exam with many questions  answered. I have done  decompression  twice now with Dr. Shane and both times I went in with a lot of pain and after completing  my treatment  plan, I have no lower back pain. I highly  recommend them.|Warning! Dr. Mark Shane charges $188 for the longest sales pitch ever. He wants to convince you that your only option is to spend 6K+ laying on his decompression table aka Cody Disc Center.|The most knowledgeable personable and humorous man I ever met in any other office - and I've visited a lot of other offices. The doctor really convinced me about the treatment, after I told him of numerous failures I had experienced and trying other therapies. You won't go wrong here.

column40: Wow.... The most recent review on here as well as the other negative reviews sadden and anger me. We have been going here for over 10 years and they are hands down the ONLY people I would go to, trust or recommend to anyone! I have recommended people to them and they all loved them as well. I feel like these negative reviews are coming from people who must have done something HORRIBLE to be asked to find another provider. There are very specific rules in place when getting treatment and you would have to be doing something VERY wrong to get kicked off treatment. And even if that happened I know that NOT ONE of them would leave someone to die or in pain and would help find somewhere else to treat you if you did break your contract unless YOU treated them with absolute disrespect! These ladies and Hammond are AMAZING! Jaime, Sarah, Todd, Naomi and Tristan are the best staff and have become family to us! I love them all so much and I know for a fact they ALL deserve respect and kindness as they deal with ALOT! of grumpy, upset people in pain daily and still have smiles, kindness, compassion and grace! They are all rock stars and DO NOT! deserve ANY of these bad reviews or to be bad mouthed! Thank you Summit staff for making us part of your family and caring for us in our times of need! You simply are the best!|I was seeing Kidder for 3.5years, she had me on a narcotic. All cuz I didn't get blood work done, cuz my life went chaotic from having an infected tooth to being kicked out of my home, she cut all my medication off and refused to give me anything for withdrawals. Also to top it all off Naomi the receptionist there, is friends with my daughters dad who is my ex. He somehow found out that I was going there and what medication I was on. She violated HIPPA laws. Do not go there unless you like drama or almost dying. You can't have someone on something for 3.5years and then just cut them off without putting them in serious risk.|Summit pain clinic does an amazing job managing pain. I feel like a person to them not just a number. They explain in terms that I can understand about my condition and explore every option to help try to keep me comfortable. This group of people are awesome highly recommend|I was recently at Summit with a family member for MRI's. I want to say the staff was knowledgeable, courteous and professional. From the pre-auth, to scheduling, to registration and the techs! The entire team went above and beyond to explain their part and ensure we were taken care of!|Dr Hammond and his staff helped my wife with chronic back pain for the past 3 years. They have been friendly, kind, professional and actively fought with our insurance company to get a procedure approved. Could not say enough good things about Summit!|I have to give a huge shout out to the entire OR staff. Absolutely everyone I encountered was fantastic. They made me feel so comfortable and calm. I can't say enough about their kindness and outstanding bedside manner. I can't remember all the names, but I do remember a few. Thank you to Dr. Swan for doing an incredible job with my sedation! Thank you to Shauna, Ariel, and Vicki; you are each outstanding and have wonderful patient care skills. Would recommend this staff over and over again, they are all absolute gems.|Such a wonderful staff! I felt taken care of from the moment I entered the building until the time I left. Kim at the Front Desk was welcoming. Devina in Admissions was friendly & professional and kept me informed of the wait time. Procedure nurse Jess (RN) was very knowledgeable, professional and attentive. Recovery nurse Stephani (RN) was caring & had a great bedside manner - she helped me walk back to the front desk after my procedure when I was still a little groggy. Scott the Anesthesiologist had me under in less than a minute. Thank you to Vicky (Tech), Kim (RN) and Sarah (RN) as well. Such a pleasant experience. Thanks again everybody! AND THANK YOU TO DR SHEAR!!|My friend and co-workers have gone here including my family.  All told me not to go with Dr H  or deal with Jamie. I chose to go to them. Dr H kept trying to get all these off the wall Procedures done and thank God my insurance company said no. Something happened to me in my life recently and something bad happened to me. Instead of talking to me about what happened they stopped helping with the one thing that helped Me have some what of a normal life. They can make this right. But I'm sure they won't choose to.  The Receptionist that I talk to was kind of mean and disrespectful toward me Made me feel like I'm nothing. So if you enjoy being treated like a number and not a person.  Well this is the right place for you. Hay summit stone medical center I'm not a number I'm a human bean. Do something make it right.  All let everyone know if they do.

column40:
After a surgery for a neuro-stimulator, I was told to be followed by a pain management clinic. When I called this clinic, they wanted a referral from my surgeon in Florida. When advised he considered this a violation of HIPA, I was sent to medical records at De Paul to send for records. Advised there, that was the responsibility of the MD's office. Was informed by medical specialists that all my records from Florida and Colorado needed to be in their office before I could get an appointment. A simple look at my thoracic and lumbar MRI's would have assured them of the necessity for the neuro-stimulator. But the unclear procedure, the rudeness, the suspicion with which I was addressed would see me driving to Colorado before ever considering this clinic.|I've been seeing rheumatologist, Dr Robert Monger, for about a decade now. He is absolutely amazing. He is compassionate, listens to all my concerns, and is very knowledgeable. The staff there is also very kind. I highly recommend him.|Nobody ever answers their phone. The voice mail menus let you believe someone will call you back within 24 to 48 hours.  Be advised these are business hours. Example: leave a message at 10AM Thursday , maybe they'll call back between  Monday afternoon  and probably by Wednesday afternoon.

If you thought they would call back the same day,  you're setting yourself up for disappointment.

The actual  medical care is top notch, despite the unrealistic expectations set for you by the misleading prompts in the voice mail system.|I've been seeing Dr. Monger since around 2003.  He's always really personable and is willing to talk to you outside of appointments for quick advice and opinions.|Worst ever. Just a waste of insurance or Money.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Fresno

At Pain Clinics of Central California, we understand that chronic pain can dramatically impact your quality of life. As specialized pain management physicians, we are dedicated to helping our patients regain control over their suffering and return to the lifestyle they desire. Our comprehensive approach addresses both post-operative discomfort and chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We proudly offer expert care for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Cancer Pain

  • Sciatica

  • Herniated disc

  • Spinal stenosis

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia

Our team at 3793 E Shields Ave in Fresno combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to deliver effective pain relief solutions. We specialize in treatments like Radio Frequency Nerve Ablation (RFNA) that have helped many patients find significant relief from chronic back pain. Visit our website or call us at +1 833-478-1818 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a more comfortable life.
column11:
Chronic pain can take a terrible toll on your quality of life. A pain management doctor can help you gain control over the suffering and live the lifestyle of your choice. At Pain Clinics of Central California, we aim to provide the best possible care to our patients. We specialize in treating discomfort after operations, such as post lumbar laminectomy, and acute or chronic pain caused by the conditions such as:
- Cancer Pain
- Sciatica
- Herniated disc
- Spinal stenosis
- Complex regional pain syndrome
- Fibromyalgia

Dr Telijada is so knowledgeable kind and professional. He has great knowledge and you can tell he genuinely cares about his patients. It is now 2:02 and I'm in the back and yet the Dr still hasn't came in. I will stick with visalia office. Never again in fresno hopefully.|Dr Femi is not only knowledgeable but also took the time to address all my questions and concerns. I left the clinic feeling confident in the care I received. If you're looking for a reputable clinic with a compassionate doctor, look no further than Pain clinic of central California|My experience with Dr. Femi  is outstanding because he listens to me. He hears my needs and when I'm in pain he sends me either to therapy and provides the help that I'm actually needed. I appreciate his time and concerns and his staff for being there for me and I just wanna say keep up the good work thank you again and I would recommend anyone.|Dr Femi is a Great Doctor he treats me very well and he's a kind, friendly, caring, understanding person. If it wasn't for him to send me to get the injections that I need I wouldn't be feeling like I do right now the injections help me with the pain I have and it helps to control the pain and pressure I always have  I appreciate it that I have a Doctor like him(Dr Femi). Thank You for all the help and support you have given me over the years that I have been with you.
Thank You
Your Patient
Nancy Barron|Wondering how come reception won't pick up the phone? I was seen at the beginning of February and they did not make a follow up appointment for me. So i called to do so and I got through to a pesron but she refused to schedule my appointment. She transfored my call. Why is it so hard for the person who answered my call to just schedule it??|Dr. Femi is very professional, he an excellent provider. He is been doing my injections since 2018 and has been very helpful with my pain. The staff are very good too. I will recommend this doctor to anyone dealing with pain.|This Review is for the Modesto location.Most of the staff is nice. But the doctor's treatment is very disappointing. They kind of act like everyone who comes in is just looking for drugs. I've always had negative drug tests and I've come to them in extreme pain, only to be prescribed Tylenol or ibuprofen. I don't need to see a doctor for medication I could get over the counter. The doctors are very dismissive even when told multiple times that Tylenol and ibuprofen don't work. I wanted so much to like this clinic because the staff is nice. But I can't give a good review when they leave me crying in pain. (Again this was the Modesto branch)

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Fullerton

At Premier Pain Consultants, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. As a leading pain control clinic in Fullerton, our team of specialized anesthesiologists and pain management physicians is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. We offer a wide range of advanced treatment options including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Non-surgical pain relief solutions

Led by our compassionate specialists, we take the time to listen carefully to each patient's concerns and develop personalized strategies for effective pain control. Our state-of-the-art facility at 150 Laguna Rd Ste A in Fullerton combines medical expertise with a patient-centered approach to deliver exceptional care. For comprehensive pain management solutions, contact us at +1 714-525-8822 or visit our website to schedule your consultation today.

Dr. Joseph Ho provided exceptional care to my elderly mother. He not only addressed her pain quickly and effectively but also took the time to create a well-thought-out plan for managing the underlying issue. Words can't fully capture how remarkable Dr. Ho is--his kindness, thoroughness, and genuine compassion truly set him apart. For someone of my mother's age, his humility and care made a world of difference. My mom still talks about how wonderful he is, and I couldn't agree more. Dr. Ho's dedication and expertise are deeply appreciated.|Dr. Ho is excellent.  He spends the time necessary to correctly diagnose the issues and consider the best possible options for pain relief.  He is friendly and considerate, and obviously great at his job.  Good Man!|My mom has been seeing Dr. Ho for her back pain over the last 3 years and the experience has been fantastic. Dr. Ho has tried varies treatment plans for her and her back pain has been relieved quite a bit after the latest treatment. Dr. Ho is always attentive and listens to my mom. His office is great at following up with all the appointments and make sure we don't miss any.

Only one suggestion for the clinic: if they can do some tele-meds for patients that don't need to be in the clinic physically, such as treatment follow up visit, etc., that would be even better.|Great place. Dr. Joseph Ho is amazing doctor and his team is wonderful also. They did amazing job on my back surgery for my car accident settlement case. I left the office feeling better almost immediately|Dr. Ho is a very exceptional doctor who is patient and understanding and listens to you to truly understand your needs. column40:
The booking management is at its worst here, I had an appointment at 11 Am asked my boss for a quick doctor visit, arrived at the clinic at 10:55 filled the paperwork work and waited until 12Pm to get in. There was another patient waiting and I was talking to her, she was scheduled for the exact same time and the same doctor. No wonder why the doctor is behind his schedules! Better to respect patients time and not schedule them at the same exact time.|I've been going to Pain Specialists of Orange County for some time now and it's been a lifesaver. I have herniated disks and I couldn't even take several steps let alone walk for work. After completing several sets of epidurals I was able to avoid a major back surgery. The staff has always been super friendly and make you feel comfortable during all the procedures and the routine check ups. Would recommend to anyone who needs relief from daily pain.|Dr. Mousavi is a great and personable doctor.
He makes sure that his patients get the best care and treatment. The assistants and staffs are very approachable. Always a delight to interact with them.|I would be lost without the help of the Nurse Practitioners. The residual pain from my mouth cancer is never going away. The entire staff is caring and professional.|Dr. Shahbazian is one of the most amazing compassionate providers I have ever dealt with. Many providers rush you out of their office leaving you feeling as though you were rushed and your questions were not answered. He actually takes time with you instead if rushing into the next patient and makes you feel cared for. The staff is also very welcoming. I would highly recommend him.|Dr. Mousavi is very professional and empathetic. He listens and doesn't rush through the appointment. Vanessa, medical assistant, is also easy to talk to and very pleasant. I highly recommend OC Pain Specialists.|I've had Chronic Pain Disorder for about 15 years due to 2 failed back surgeries and age along with other issues have just piled on. I moved and had to find a new Pain Specialist which is so stressful. This is such an important relationship. If you can't manage your pain to a tolerance level you can deal with, how can you cope? I feel very fortunate to have found Dr. Mousavi. I feel comfortable getting my spinal injections and him keeping me on course with my treatment plans. Great Team at all of their offices.|Appreciated Dr Mousavi's approach and concern. I was involved in a horrific accident with a large tractor trailer and sustained some significant muscle and skeletal painful injuries. His diagnosis and giving me the right medicine to relieve the pain was very helpful. His referral to my neurologist was also much appreciated.

column38: Lacey Clifton-Jensen|Carina Eddy|Jon Hanson|Rugger Ducky|Kelly Hall|Linda Cox|C Tognazzini|David West
column40:
They are abandoning their patients. I've been a patient for years and had 5 surgeries with them. In the last several months they have dramatically changed their policies to block patients from getting care in any sort of reasonable timeframe, leaving them in pain for an unethical amount of time. Today I was informed that all Botox services would cease after I've spent weeks trying to get my routine treatment and jumping through countless hoops for them. They have no plan, no referrals, no support for patients that have been having this pain service with them for years. I can't fathom how they think this is the way to treat patients.|Worst office experience. If you don't care if you personal information is yelled across the lobby, ok. Or that the scheduling staff cancels appointments without letting you know, please this may be your place. I let the staff know this was not ok with me. Oh, and they had another patient getting mad cuz he had to wait. He got so mad, after he growled at me that it was my fault (ha!) try blaming the appropriate people dude! Plus he was using curse words. Did the staff do anything?  Nope. So go here is you are a Masochist.  This is my story and my opinion.|I was refered by my doctor to this place and I go make an appointment the pa saw me and said they would approve my Botox treatment and to wait for the insurance to approve it. They said it takes 7-10 business days for it to be approved. I call them after two weeks since I did not hear from them.

They told me it was still pending with my insurance.

I call the insurance company and they said there was not even a pending authorization.

I call them back and they said someone would call me back and they never did. I repeat call backs and I go to there office and it was closed during normal business hours.

Finally someone says they will call me back. Someone did call me and and I missed there call. They said they no longer go through insurance for Botox even though they advertise it on there website.

They said they can send it off for a prescription or something to that effect on the voice mail they left me.

I have called the main office and there authorization department at least six times at each line and no one will call me back.

I have never had such poor customer service from a doctor's office.

No one has since called me back. If they would have just called me back and let me know they don't provide that service that would have been fine. But they can't even do that.

Mind you I am in pain waiting for them to reply.

If you want terrible customer service and for them to never call you back go see them. The worst doctors office I've ever been to. If I could give zero stars I would.|1st appt went well, got in to see a PA who was great. She wanted more time to go over my complex case, and made an appt with me for today.

Yesterday I got a call from a woman at the clinic who told me I needed to show up 15 min early today to fill out their new intake. I said "As long as it isn't Phreesia." She replied it was. I told her I don't sign away my medical info to 3rd parties who resell it.

She then cancelled my appt for today. Either I allow my data to be sold, or I cannot get pain management. I asked to speak to the mgr and even called back an hour later, never got a return call.

Shame, I really thought this was a service of compassionate providers. Instead it is gatekeepers who must be getting a cut from Phreesia for giving up patient data.

Ironically my Allergist is next door, they have had Phreesia 2 years but appropriately opted me out when I asked.

TLDR: Providers seem great, staff is anything but.
*********
After going into the office and asking for a manager callback (I am seen at a provider in the same building who has opted me out of Phreesia for 2 years) I got one the following day.

The manager does not believe me that Phreesia sells medical data to pharmaceutical companies for targeted advertising. It is openly on their website.

She refused to allow me to have any follow-up care in this clinic simply because I need to protect my PHI. There was no exception made, no matter how I offered to do the paperwork.

As a disabled veteran, my PHI is tied to my income. Access to one means access to benefits info. I cannot risk that. Not even for much needed pain management.

When you begin to question the ethics of a pain management clinic, you wonder where else they fall short in their ethics and business practices.
Reduced to 1 star because it won't let me do 0.|Zero stars.
I had an appointment for 8:00 a.m. The receptionist who made the appointment, Miguel, called me the day before to confirm and instructed me to arrive at 7:45 a.m. to fill out paperwork which I did. At 8:30 I asked him if he knew how much longer it would be because I had another appointment. He told me my appointment wasn't until 9:00.
I let him know he had called to confirm my 8:00 appointment with me the day before and had asked me to arrive at 7:45 to fill out paperwork.
He then said sorry, I was wondering why you were here so early for your appointment.
I then told him again, my appointment was at 8:00 and he had confirmed that fact with me yesterday. He did not attempt to have me seen, he just said sorry again.
Don't waste your time with this office.|First off the location is not the best for those who have severe pain and difficulty walking. Arrived for my appointment 15 minutes early as requested so I could fill out paperwork. Arrived and there wasn't a person in sight other than another patient waiting.  While waiting for someone to show up and help me another person walked in. And then another. Finally someone was at the receptionist desk and I started walking up and he rudely said he was just looking something up. He then proceeded to check in the 3rd person that walked in, then took the second person to the back after checking her in. I then get called back by a doctor, I think his name started with an H, who then proceeds to talk to me about my situation while firmly stating he would not allow me any pain meds (I have severe pain and nothing has helped aside from pain medication) . I scoffed at him after realizing this guy doesn't want to help me with my pain, he simply wants to inject me or do an epidural, even though when all was said and done, he told me he wasn't sure their kind of treatment would work for me since he is doubting my diagnosis. He was knowledgeable, but definitely looking out for his pocket instead his patients. Then AFTER this consultation He had me do vitals my blood pressure was high, but I was in extreme pain. The person who did my vitals had no idea how to pronounce any of my medications. Vitals took almost 15 minutes. Anyway, this is not the place for me. Unfriendly and incompetent staff, dirty and extremely cold waiting room. Would not recommend if you have serious pain issues.|I've been going to Dr Mozingo (Pacific Pain)for over 20 years. He has the best diagnostic skills. The other Drs are very skilled , attentive to your health care. Well being is there goal for their patients.
I'd highly recommend any of the practicing Pain therapist.|Dr. Roshan was excellent! He did a great job explaining the procedure we are considering including the pros and cons. And he was a wonderful listener, taking the time to answer all our questions. We didn't feel rushed like he had other things to do. A very pleasant experience!

I love Roxanne Manuel. She is so patient, caring, understanding, and absolutely cares about her patients! I've had 4 neck surgeries, back surgery, and trying to avoid major back surgery! Pain is a horrible thing to go through, so I'm grateful to have a place where Doctors, and staff can understand what you are going through. I sincerely appreciate this office, and everyone who works there!!!|I have been seeing Roxanne PAC since 2010. Her and all of the other doctors at CRPM have all been very attentive and caring to my specific pain issues. Then my 3 spinal surgeries happened and they worked closely with my spine surgeon. I very much like CRPM. I have recommended them to my bf and he is now a happy patient. Thanks everyone. Merry Christmas.|I have been a patient of CRPM for several years to treat chronic spine pain and everyone there has been outstanding in every way. I have always had excellent care from the front desk to the Dr.'s office. The entire staff is friendly, courteous and professional at all times.

The Doctors are compassionate, knowledgeable, and will explain any changes in care, medication, or injury at a level that can be understood without trivializing the injury or your comprehension.

If you're in pain I would highly recommend Centers of Rehabilitation and Pain Medicine.|I recently visited CRPM Medical and had an incredibly positive experience. From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was welcoming.

**Tina** at the front desk deserves special recognition. Her professionalism and warm demeanor immediately put me at ease during what can often be a stressful experience. She was efficient in handling paperwork and made sure I was well-informed about my wait time, which was surprisingly short.

The medical staff at CRPM Medical are equally commendable. They provided thorough explanations of procedures, listened attentively to my concerns, and treated me with the utmost respect and care. What stood out to me was not just the medical treatment but the genuine compassion shown by everyone especially  PA-C Manuel. The front desk to the medical team. It's clear that CRPM Medical values patient care deeply.

If you're looking for a medical practice that combines expertise with a personal touch, look no further than CRPM Medical. Highly recommended for anyone in need of medical services!

Place works with patients to provide the best care. I want to eliminate as much medication and still be pain-free. Was referred here did urine mind you they make you wait until urine is back before prescribing. I understand that however my past doctors would do Urine test , labs and prescriptions all on the same visit and if there was an issue with your urine this would be addressed on your follow up appointment. The pain clinic wanted me to wait another two weeks for another appointment. My primary requested the urine results. After 20 minutes my primary comes back in the room and says " There's no issues " with the urine and I'll be writing a bridge script  for you and he did . Just be careful with them because if there is ever any issues they will just ignore you and then wonder why you leave . I have my original pain management back . Again I'm sure they are nice people but they are not patient centered at all in my experience.|I have been a patient with JZ in Arul Doraswamy office since 04/25/2015. we have an open doctor and patient relationship. I just love him i remember i gave a dirty test one time from the dentist office and he explain it how and why and we had a healthy conversation about it.
