Thank you,

Angela Bridge|I've been a patient at this clinic since 2011; started with Dr D and have been seeing JZ for the last few years. Dr. Joseph Ho provided exceptional care to my elderly mother. He not only addressed her pain quickly and effectively but also took the time to create a well-thought-out plan for managing the underlying issue. His patience and attentiveness were evident as he listened closely to her concerns and explained everything in a way that was easy for her to understand. Words can't fully capture how remarkable Dr. Ho is--his kindness, thoroughness, and genuine compassion truly set him apart. For someone of my mother's age, his humility and care made a world of difference. My mom still talks about how wonderful he is, and I couldn't agree more. Dr. Ho's dedication and expertise are deeply appreciated.|Dr. Ho is excellent.  He spends the time necessary to correctly diagnose the issues and consider the best possible options for pain relief.  He is friendly and considerate, and obviously great at his job.  Good Man!|My mom has been seeing Dr. Ho for her back pain over the last 3 years and the experience has been fantastic. Only one suggestion for the clinic: if they can do some tele-meds for patients that don't need to be in the clinic physically, such as treatment follow up visit, etc., that would be even better.|Great place. column40:
The booking management is at its worst here, I had an appointment at 11 Am asked my boss for a quick doctor visit, arrived at the clinic at 10:55 filled the paperwork work and waited until 12Pm to get in. There was another patient waiting and I was talking to her, she was scheduled for the exact same time and the same doctor. No wonder why the doctor is behind his schedules! Better to respect patients time and not schedule them at the same exact time.|I've been going to Pain Specialists of Orange County for some time now and it's been a lifesaver. I have herniated disks and I couldn't even take several steps let alone walk for work. After completing several sets of epidurals I was able to avoid a major back surgery. The staff has always been super friendly and make you feel comfortable during all the procedures and the routine check ups. Would recommend to anyone who needs relief from daily pain.|Dr. Mousavi is a great and personable doctor.
He makes sure that his patients get the best care and treatment. The assistants and staffs are very approachable. Always a delight to interact with them.|I would be lost without the help of the Nurse Practitioners. The residual pain from my mouth cancer is never going away. The entire staff is caring and professional.|Dr. Shahbazian is one of the most amazing compassionate providers I have ever dealt with. Many providers rush you out of their office leaving you feeling as though you were rushed and your questions were not answered. He actually takes time with you instead if rushing into the next patient and makes you feel cared for. The staff is also very welcoming. I would highly recommend him.|Dr. Mousavi is very professional and empathetic. He listens and doesn't rush through the appointment. Vanessa, medical assistant, is also easy to talk to and very pleasant. I highly recommend OC Pain Specialists.|I've had Chronic Pain Disorder for about 15 years due to 2 failed back surgeries and age along with other issues have just piled on. I moved and had to find a new Pain Specialist which is so stressful. This is such an important relationship. If you can't manage your pain to a tolerance level you can deal with, how can you cope? I feel very fortunate to have found Dr. Mousavi. I feel comfortable getting my spinal injections and him keeping me on course with my treatment plans. Great Team at all of their offices.|Appreciated Dr Mousavi's approach and concern. I was involved in a horrific accident with a large tractor trailer and sustained some significant muscle and skeletal painful injuries. His diagnosis and giving me the right medicine to relieve the pain was very helpful. His referral to my neurologist was also much appreciated.

column38: Lacey Clifton-Jensen|Carina Eddy|Jon Hanson|Rugger Ducky|Kelly Hall|Linda Cox|C Tognazzini|David West
column40:
They are abandoning their patients. I've been a patient for years and had 5 surgeries with them. In the last several months they have dramatically changed their policies to block patients from getting care in any sort of reasonable timeframe, leaving them in pain for an unethical amount of time. Today I was informed that all Botox services would cease after I've spent weeks trying to get my routine treatment and jumping through countless hoops for them. They have no plan, no referrals, no support for patients that have been having this pain service with them for years. I can't fathom how they think this is the way to treat patients.|Worst office experience. If you don't care if you personal information is yelled across the lobby, ok. Or that the scheduling staff cancels appointments without letting you know, please this may be your place. I let the staff know this was not ok with me. Oh, and they had another patient getting mad cuz he had to wait. He got so mad, after he growled at me that it was my fault (ha!) try blaming the appropriate people dude! Plus he was using curse words. Did the staff do anything?  Nope. So go here is you are a Masochist.  This is my story and my opinion.|I was refered by my doctor to this place and I go make an appointment the pa saw me and said they would approve my Botox treatment and to wait for the insurance to approve it. They said it takes 7-10 business days for it to be approved. I call them after two weeks since I did not hear from them.

They told me it was still pending with my insurance.

I call the insurance company and they said there was not even a pending authorization.

I call them back and they said someone would call me back and they never did. I repeat call backs and I go to there office and it was closed during normal business hours.

Finally someone says they will call me back. Someone did call me and and I missed there call. They said they no longer go through insurance for Botox even though they advertise it on there website.

They said they can send it off for a prescription or something to that effect on the voice mail they left me.

I have called the main office and there authorization department at least six times at each line and no one will call me back.

I have never had such poor customer service from a doctor's office.

No one has since called me back. If they would have just called me back and let me know they don't provide that service that would have been fine. But they can't even do that.

Mind you I am in pain waiting for them to reply.

If you want terrible customer service and for them to never call you back go see them. The worst doctors office I've ever been to. If I could give zero stars I would.|1st appt went well, got in to see a PA who was great. She wanted more time to go over my complex case, and made an appt with me for today.

Yesterday I got a call from a woman at the clinic who told me I needed to show up 15 min early today to fill out their new intake. I said "As long as it isn't Phreesia." She replied it was. I told her I don't sign away my medical info to 3rd parties who resell it.

She then cancelled my appt for today. Either I allow my data to be sold, or I cannot get pain management. I asked to speak to the mgr and even called back an hour later, never got a return call.

Shame, I really thought this was a service of compassionate providers. Instead it is gatekeepers who must be getting a cut from Phreesia for giving up patient data.

Ironically my Allergist is next door, they have had Phreesia 2 years but appropriately opted me out when I asked.

TLDR: Providers seem great, staff is anything but.
*********
After going into the office and asking for a manager callback (I am seen at a provider in the same building who has opted me out of Phreesia for 2 years) I got one the following day.

The manager does not believe me that Phreesia sells medical data to pharmaceutical companies for targeted advertising. It is openly on their website.

She refused to allow me to have any follow-up care in this clinic simply because I need to protect my PHI. There was no exception made, no matter how I offered to do the paperwork.

As a disabled veteran, my PHI is tied to my income. Access to one means access to benefits info. I cannot risk that. Not even for much needed pain management.

When you begin to question the ethics of a pain management clinic, you wonder where else they fall short in their ethics and business practices.
Reduced to 1 star because it won't let me do 0.|Zero stars.
I had an appointment for 8:00 a.m. The receptionist who made the appointment, Miguel, called me the day before to confirm and instructed me to arrive at 7:45 a.m. to fill out paperwork which I did. At 8:30 I asked him if he knew how much longer it would be because I had another appointment. He told me my appointment wasn't until 9:00.
I let him know he had called to confirm my 8:00 appointment with me the day before and had asked me to arrive at 7:45 to fill out paperwork.
He then said sorry, I was wondering why you were here so early for your appointment.
I then told him again, my appointment was at 8:00 and he had confirmed that fact with me yesterday. He did not attempt to have me seen, he just said sorry again.
Don't waste your time with this office.|First off the location is not the best for those who have severe pain and difficulty walking. Arrived for my appointment 15 minutes early as requested so I could fill out paperwork. Arrived and there wasn't a person in sight other than another patient waiting.  While waiting for someone to show up and help me another person walked in. And then another. Finally someone was at the receptionist desk and I started walking up and he rudely said he was just looking something up. He then proceeded to check in the 3rd person that walked in, then took the second person to the back after checking her in. I then get called back by a doctor, I think his name started with an H, who then proceeds to talk to me about my situation while firmly stating he would not allow me any pain meds (I have severe pain and nothing has helped aside from pain medication) . I scoffed at him after realizing this guy doesn't want to help me with my pain, he simply wants to inject me or do an epidural, even though when all was said and done, he told me he wasn't sure their kind of treatment would work for me since he is doubting my diagnosis. He was knowledgeable, but definitely looking out for his pocket instead his patients. Then AFTER this consultation He had me do vitals my blood pressure was high, but I was in extreme pain. The person who did my vitals had no idea how to pronounce any of my medications. Vitals took almost 15 minutes. Anyway, this is not the place for me. Unfriendly and incompetent staff, dirty and extremely cold waiting room. Would not recommend if you have serious pain issues.|I've been going to Dr Mozingo (Pacific Pain)for over 20 years. He has the best diagnostic skills. The other Drs are very skilled , attentive to your health care. Well being is there goal for their patients.
I'd highly recommend any of the practicing Pain therapist.|Dr. Roshan was excellent! He did a great job explaining the procedure we are considering including the pros and cons. And he was a wonderful listener, taking the time to answer all our questions. We didn't feel rushed like he had other things to do. A very pleasant experience!

column3:
Your Pathway to Comprehensive Pain Relief

At Pain Medicine Consultants, we are renowned across Northern California for our exemplary approach to pain management. Our team consists of double-board certified doctors trained at prestigious institutions including Harvard, Stanford, UCSF, and Mayo Clinic. We understand that pain is not one-size-fits-all, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans focused on improving your quality of life without relying on powerful medications or major surgeries. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Innovative minimally-invasive procedures

  • Alternative pain management techniques

  • Customized treatment plans for acute and chronic conditions

  • Compassionate care with excellent bedside manner

Located in Corte Madera, our calm and welcoming office environment is designed to put patients at ease. We're committed to empowering your journey through pain management with solutions that address the root cause of your discomfort. Visit Pain Medicine Consultants today or call us at +1 925-386-2483 to begin your path toward lasting relief.
column11:
Welcome to Pain Medicine Consultants: Your Pathway to Pain Relief
Empowering Your Journey Through Comprehensive Pain Management
Pain Medicine Consultants is renowned across Northern California for its exemplary approach to pain management and the extraordinary experience, bedside manner, and training of the Harvard, Stanford, UCSF, and Mayo Clinic double-board certified doctors. Our commitment is to offer not just pain relief but a transformed quality of life for those grappling with the complexities of acute or chronic conditions. We will try to get you better without powerful meds or big surgery.
At Pain Medicine Consultants, we understand that pain is not one-size-fits-all.

column2: Centers of Rehabilitation and Pain Medicine
column3:
At Centers of Rehabilitation and Pain Medicine, we are dedicated to helping our patients return to pain-free, normal lives through our comprehensive approach to pain management. Unlike traditional practices, we treat pain as the primary concern rather than just a symptom, focusing on identifying and addressing the root cause of discomfort. Our team provides a personalized, one-on-one experience for each patient by combining our extensive medical expertise with thorough patient education and state-of-the-art technological innovations.

Our Specialized Services Include:

  • Comprehensive pain management solutions

  • Customized rehabilitation programs

  • Advanced diagnostic procedures

  • Innovative therapeutic interventions

We pride ourselves on developing tailored treatment plans that address each patient's specific needs using the latest available technology. Located in Placentia, CA, our clinic at 1041 E Yorba Linda Blvd #210 has been serving the community with exceptional care for many years. Our goal is to ensure the overall well-being and quality of life that our patients deserve. For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our official website or call us at +1 714-223-7000.

column40:
I receive very good care at this facility. They are very prompt, no waiting in the waiting room. Roxanne is the best. She always tries to help me with the medication I need for my severe back pain. All of the staff is friendly. Office is always clean. I would not go to any other office for my pain management!|I have been a patient here for almost 20 years. I have been through 4 providers. Every one of them have been very thoughtful and helpful with my pain management. I have a lot of issues and they never pass any of them off as me just complaining. The rest of the staff is wonderful.  Everyone in the office goes above and beyond to make having chronic pain less painful. Thank you CRPM|I have been going to this office for years! I love Roxanne Manuel. She is so patient, caring, understanding, and absolutely cares about her patients! I've had 4 neck surgeries, back surgery, and trying to avoid major back surgery! Thanks to Dr Koshy for giving me shots in my back to relieve my pain! Everyone from Tina the front desk, Augustine the assistant ! I Thank God I was referred to this office. Pain is a horrible thing to go through, so I'm grateful to have a place where Doctors, and staff can understand what you are going through. I sincerely appreciate this office, and everyone who works there!!!|I have been seeing Roxanne PAC since 2010. Her and all of the other doctors at CRPM have all been very attentive and caring to my specific pain issues. Then my 3 spinal surgeries happened and they worked closely with my spine surgeon. I very much like CRPM. I have recommended them to my bf and he is now a happy patient. Thanks everyone. Merry Christmas.|I have been a patient of CRPM for several years to treat chronic spine pain and everyone there has been outstanding in every way. They offer many different proven approaches to treating pain and asses each patient carefully and individually -- you are not treated as if on an assembly line. The doctors and staff have always been highly ethical, caring, and compassionate and I would absolutely recommend them to anyone suffering from pain in any part of their body.|I have been a patient @ C.R.P.M. for well over 10 years. I have always had excellent care from the front desk to the Dr.'s office. The entire staff is friendly, courteous and professional at all times.
Roxanne, P.A. and the others are always worthy of 5 star !|Have been coming to CRPM for ages. The staff is top notch in answering any questions you may have prior to, during, or after visits. The Doctors are compassionate, knowledgeable, and will explain any changes in care, medication, or injury at a level that can be understood without trivializing the injury or your comprehension.

If you're in pain I would highly recommend Centers of Rehabilitation and Pain Medicine.|I recently visited CRPM Medical and had an incredibly positive experience. From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was welcoming.

**Tina** at the front desk deserves special recognition. Her professionalism and warm demeanor immediately put me at ease during what can often be a stressful experience. She was efficient in handling paperwork and made sure I was well-informed about my wait time, which was surprisingly short.

The medical staff at CRPM Medical are equally commendable. They provided thorough explanations of procedures, listened attentively to my concerns, and treated me with the utmost respect and care. The facility itself is clean, modern, and well-organized, which adds to the overall comfort of the visit.

What stood out to me was not just the medical treatment but the genuine compassion shown by everyone especially  PA-C Manuel. The front desk to the medical team. It's clear that CRPM Medical values patient care deeply.

If you're looking for a medical practice that combines expertise with a personal touch, look no further than CRPM Medical. Highly recommended for anyone in need of medical services!

column3:
Sacramento's Leading Interventional Pain Management Specialists

At Capital Pain Consultants, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for adults throughout the Sacramento area. Led by our expert physicians, Dr. Sharon Leano and Dr. James Kim, we specialize in treating a wide range of disruptive and disabling pain conditions including:

  • Back pain and neck pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS)

  • Herniated discs

  • Joint pain

  • Chronic pain conditions

What sets us apart is our multimodal approach to pain management. Rather than relying on single solutions, we develop personalized treatment plans that combine effective strategies to address your specific pain concerns. Our compassionate team takes the time to understand your unique situation, working closely with you to improve your quality of life and restore function. Visit our official website or call us at (916) 564-3377 to schedule a consultation at our Auburn Boulevard location in Sacramento.
column11: About Capital Pain ConsultantsCapital Pain Consultants is a leading interventional pain management practice serving adults of all ages throughout the Sacramento, California, area. Led by Sharon Leano, MD, and James Kim, MD, the Capital Pain Consultants specialists compassionately treat disruptive and disabling pain conditions, including back pain, complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), herniated discs, joint pain, neck pain, and other types of stubborn chronic pain. Capital Pain Consultants uses a multimodal approach to chronic pain management, which means the professionals look beyond single solutions to use a combination of effective strategies to manage pain.

column40:
Place works with patients to provide the best care. I want to eliminate as much medication and still be pain-free. Dr. Kim has worked with me on this goal with excellent results|Drs.Kim and Leano truly care for their patients, they listen to me, my concerns and possible procedures to improve my quality of life. I recommend them all of the time. They are worth the #4 hr round trip visits.|Dr. James Kim is awesome! He is really knowledgeable and display a lot of empathy for his patient.|Understaffed.. Dr Kim was ok,  recommended a procedure for me that required authorization from my insurance. 2.5 months later and the staff can't seem to get it together to submit all my info to the insurance company even after I have called and email several times and gotten reassurances that they are going to do it.
It took a month to get my appointment scheduled and another couple to get in to see the Dr. I drove 1.5 hours to get there by 9am and still waited an hour to see the Dr. In the meantime one woman came in for her appt only to be told she didn't have one. She produced the card they gave her with the date and time on it so they squeezed her in. Another woman came in with receipts from every bill she paid in the previous year because they were double charging her for a couple visits. You will be required to take a pee test for drugs. I am giving up on them and starting the whole process again at another place. Hopefully it will be better.|Husband goes to this clinic and they never answer phones, insurance preauthorizations never get completed, medications forget to get sent to pharmacy, and the office could not care less about helping to fix the problem.  We have to show up in person to get anyone to speak with him (more than once for same issue) since they won't answer phones due to under staffed office.|Avoid this place at all costs. You will wait for hours beyond your appointment. You will be belittled by them on your lifestyle and habits. They are rude to disrespect people who do not deserve to have a practice. Heather up front is OK somedays, but she's the only one, I'd assume it's due to her bosses sucking.  Not A Recommended Place For Anyone Who Wants Real Help.....|I have been a patient since 2004 when Dr. Stephens was there and since then have seen many other doctors/ assistance in their transition before it just being Dr. Kim and Dr. Leano. I am very pleased with both these doctors but I mainly see Dr. Leano and she's great. Always attentive and helpful. Dealing with pain everyday is hard enough so having great doctors definitely helps.|I have been a Pt. here since the days of Dr. Stephen and have seen many changes but the things that stay consistent are the continued patient support and the desire of all the staff, who genuinely care, to help each of us! Dr. Kim has been great navigating through the uncertain times of pain control in the US and he's addressed all my issues and concerns. He's gone above and beyond to help me try to be more comfortable. As patients we must have patience with our Doctors and their staff. It's truly not their fault we're in this situation, blame the Federal Government and never take it out on staff!

Was referred here did urine mind you they make you wait until urine is back before prescribing. After 20 minutes my primary comes back in the room and says " There's no issues " with the urine and I'll be writing a bridge script  for you and he did . Just be careful with them because if there is ever any issues they will just ignore you and then wonder why you leave . I have my original pain management back . Dr.Paul Ky, DO.|My first visit with the PA I was very impressed and also with Doctor once I met him for the first time. They were very thorough and asking their questions about where the pain was how it felt and their goal was to find the root of the problem of the pain. Tests were ordered. It took a couple months. We found what the problem was and referrals were done to the doctors that can help. Unfortunately
it requires surgery. And that aspect I give them a 10 They are great! The only problem I have was every single month I had a problem getting my prescriptions to help with the pain I was constantly calling in every month and requesting with the pharmacy to call in the script to get my prescription. I'm hoping soon that this will be resolved. Of course when I left a message I always asked him to recurring my call and update me on the status I never got a call back. Other than getting my prescriptions timely,  I love the doctors. I'm so glad that my general doctor referred me to them.|Dr. KY is the best at what he does.  Very knowledgeable and explains everything very clearly.   The front office can be rude at times and unprofessional.  The gossiping and standing around while patients are waiting to be helped at the front window.   I had asked a question about the co-payment that had not been asked for before.  It was like talking to a dear in headlights.  They had no clue and did not offer to ask billing about it.  At that time it came up that I had been accumulating charges for one full year.  Not once did I receive a bill nor was it brought to my attention until I had asked about the co-payment.  It's ashame Dr. KY does not have a front office staff equivalent to his knowledge and understanding.|I have been going to Advanced Pain Solutions for well over 10 year's. specialize in the evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment of all types of acute and chronic pain conditions. We combine cutting-edge technology with a patient-centered approach to develop customized treatment plans that address your specific needs and goals.

column40:
Cancel your plans for the day appointment at 1130 called back about 2pm. While you see the employee talking laughing casually while you're frustrated in an overly pack waiting room.|Amazing doctor without him I wouldn't have known I needed surgery.
Thank you, Dr. Salazar.|I was seen on 5/6/24 as a new patient on a referral from my primary care physician because I have been experiencing severe lower back pain. Upon arrival I noticed that the doctors office stays fairly full. All my registration papery was done online for an 8:45 appointment I was called back to the room at 9:30. No heart rate taken, no blood pressure taken and no weight taken. The amount of patients in and out and only seeing doctor Salazar it seems as if he really didn't spend much time with the patients which was a concern for me as I have multiple health issues and a team of doctors at Stanford. As I waited in the room I was so optimistic that I was going to be on the road to pain relief and better mobility to enjoy my family and outdoor activities. Dr. Salazar entered the room introduced himself and pulled up my pain chart in which I had circled my areas of pain. He then asked what kind of work do I do, I explained I'm disabled and worked up until 2015 due to a brain injury in 2013. He asked while working what kind of work did I do and I began to explain to him the work I did involved lots of heavy lifting. I then started to give him information about my back telling him that while employed I had an incident where I had a spasm in my back while at work was taken to hospital by ambulance given muscle relaxer by IV and back to work in 2 days. I had X-ray and all necessary treatments to determine if there was anything else wrong and there was not. At this point doctor Salazar stopped me and said he can't see me until I bring a release of my settlement which I tried to explain to him there was no case, no settlement, no fury treatment needed because I had a muscle spasm. He no longer wanted to hear about my medical as it pertains to my visit all he said was if he's supposed to be paid by workers comp and he's paid by my insurance at this point he said he can't see me until I bring a worker's comp release. I have no release there was no case and I was referred by my primary care and this was not a comp claim. As I sat there trying to explain he shut the computer down closed my file and said follow me, I'm still sitting there in shock because I've never been treated this way he then turned around and said louder follow me and walked me out! I'm still in disbelief and when I got to my car I called my husband and cried! He was not at all interested in my medical history or anything else. It was clear he wanted nothing to do with me other than getting me in and out. He doesn't have time for a new patient as he doesn't have the time to spend with the patient. At the front desk I explained to the receptionist I'm not sure what just happened and I immediately contacted my primary care physician. I prayed about what happened to me yesterday and was going to just move on but I received an email survey from doctor Salazar's office this morning. I decided to open it and complete the survey which was questions and answers only ( agree, disagree, etc) once I completed the survey I was hoping to find an area to elaborate on my experience but there was not! So that's why I decided to leave a review. If you are a new patient with multiple health issues like myself, I have heart issues, blood pressure issues as well as autonomic issues that I will deal with for the rest of my life from a brain injury. With that being said my health care team has to have time to properly communicate with me as well as time to communicate with my physicians at Stanford as this is critical in my healthcare and doctor Salazar clearly doesn't have the time for that. I am thankful for this platform to put my experience out there as I have learned that I have to be proactive in my healthcare.|Dr Salazar has been my pain management physician since 1998. Over the years he has treated me I have NO complaints. His has an outstanding staff who are attentive to the patients needs. Dr is always up on the state of the art ways to treat his patients. I highly recommend Dr to my family, friends and anyone who will listen. Often while waiting, which is never long, the patients will talk to each other about the treatments they are receiving. It is wonderful to have a group chat with people who understand and have pain as an issue in their life. To top it off there is always candy on your way out.|I get my pain pump refilled here every month. I love these doctors and their staff. Each and every one in the office is pleasant to work with. I've been coming here over 5 years and have received excellent care every time I've had an appointment. I really appreciate their continued social distancing and mask  wearing and enforcement of the same for all of their staff and patients. I really like having all services available to me at one place... billing, labs, surgical services, and regular appointments. I couldn't ask for a better place to receive my regular care.|I have been a patient of the center starting 1999 when Dr Kalamakarian was the Dr formerly called San Juaquin valley pain management center with PA Mr. . Mr Johncox is excellent with a relaxed great bedside manner he always listens to my level of pain and where it stems from. He is knowledgeable professional and easy to talk to thank you!  I have seen him also close to 22 years. Dr Salazar took over and he is a great doctor with a funny relaxing manner and has done many epidural injections that were successful along with monthly pain pump refills. I trust them all 100%. Their entire staff the medical assistants are always friendly and I enjoy seeing them for my monthly visits. The entire office staff is very professional and friendly I would never go anywhere else for my chronic spinal pain treatment.|The staff and doctors at Dr. Salazar's office have always shown me much respect and care!! They have shown the utmost in professionalism and excellent medical care!!  I have had the privilege of being a patient at Dr. Salazar's advanced pain management team for eight-plus years. My comfort and needs from my monthly appointments to my medical care have always shown to be their number one concern.|My name is m.j iqbal, i was a pt.with dr. Salazar for several years.  He cares for his patients.   He tries his best to see that his patients are pain free by prescribing the right meds, injections and physical therapy.  His staff is very courteous and helpful.   The only reason i stopped going there is due to insurance problems
Dr. Salazar is great.

Advanced Pain Management has been very helpful for me after my  accident when a large box truck rear-ended my car.   They have been supporting me and providing specialized treatments to help with the pain.   Want to give special thanks to Chris.  He has been selected to work with me via telephone to make sure my needs for pain medicine and any other concerns about my rehab are resolved as much as possible.   The company has doctors/medical techs/nurses who provide excellent service.  Very professional and well trained.  They actually understand that you are in pain but just want to be treated like an adult who can understand the issues and follow instructions for the staff to help as much as possible and as soon as possible.   They were always on time for my appointments whether at the clinic or by telephone.   THANKS to all staff and doctors.|Pain Management,  or CAUSE of pain identification.Extreme headaches, loss of feeling in left index finger. Did I say EXTREME headaches?
-After 2 or more MRI's.
-After X-rays of
-neck
-back
-spine
Just could not figure it out!
So treatment of anesthesia and shots of a  dont remember drug, then the prescription of Vicodin.
All better now. NOT!
Its the Mayo clinic they are the best, really punched up my Blue Cross PPO, and co-pay. Cha-ching$$$$$

Pain killers waiting at the ER Door. X-ray neck (and MRI from outsourced Mayo$$$)
ER Doctor shows me Xray and says see that little itty bitty piece of shrapnel or something in your spine/neck? Is hitting the main nerve on your Left side, creating, all the above problems.

The staff members were nice as well.|Honestly it too soon to give a proper rating. Just had my procedure done yesterday.  I was in and out quickly and the staff was very nice.

They got a fast approval from my provider and I was in that week. That in it self is great. When your in pain getting treated quickly is needed and appreciated.

Now just hoping this will elevate my pain and discomfort.

Thank you Advanced|I was treated very well by Doctors and staff members. This facility is always neat and clean, the environment is very good! I would recommend this facility to anyone that is looking for a pain management Doctor... I could go on and on about this place and their staff. Thank you!

column3:
At California Pain Medicine Center, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions through our multidisciplinary approach to patient care.

Personalized Treatment Plans

We begin with a thorough evaluation to develop a precise treatment plan tailored to each individual's needs. Our philosophy emphasizes starting with conservative interventions before progressing to more dynamic treatments when necessary. We take pride in our active involvement model that empowers patients throughout their healing journey. Our specialist team brings together diverse expertise from:

  • Physical medicine and rehabilitation

  • Low-dose Ketamine infusion therapy

  • Clinical psychology

  • Neurobiofeedback

  • Physical therapy

We incorporate cutting-edge pain management technology, including implantable devices such as spinal cord stimulators and neuroaxial drug delivery systems, to effectively manage chronic pain and treat spinal cord anomalies. Located in Santa Monica, our team is dedicated to helping patients regain control of their lives through innovative and compassionate care. Visit our official website to learn more about our comprehensive services or call us at +1 310-264-7246 to schedule your consultation.
column11: California Pain Medicine Center tailors an approach that begins with a thorough evaluation and precise treatment plan. . The initial interventions will be conservative and then become more dynamic if required. We use a treatment model that places active involvement in patient care. Our specialists have backgrounds in various disciplines, including physical medicine, low-dose Ketamine infusion therapy, rehabilitation, clinical psychology, neurobiofeedback, and physical therapy. We incorporate the latest advances in our treatments to manage pain and treat spinal cord anomalies. Our pain management technology includes implantable devices such as spinal cord stimulators and neuroaxial drug delivery systems.

column40:
Dr. Prager is exceptional!  He and his team gave me my life back!

Dr. Prager listened to me and directly, empathetically, and confidently, explained a clear plan. He gave me hope!  Dr. Prager with his team, and Kelly, his knowledgeable and patient Nurse Practitioner, set about getting my pain under control. They never let me go. Dr. Prager and his team are truely outstanding in the field of pain management.|I've been a patient of the California Pain Medicine Center for almost 25 years. From the doctors to the nurse practitioners and front office, they all deserve five stars. Dr. Prager and Dr. Barnard are caring physicians on the cutting edge of new research and treatments. Erica Jenkins, the nurse practitioner, deserves ten stars. She goes out of her way to provide every patient with the very best care and treatment. She listens! The front office, (especially Andrew and Itxayana) deserve a special shout out for all their organization of appointments and procedures. Trust me when I say they fight insurance companies for the procedures patients need. I am blessed to have this entire team in my corner.|Note: It has been 10 YEARS (!!!) since I wrote this review! Dr Prager is still my pain doctor and has never failed his promise to take care of my pain ....  so I could have a better life

Dr. Prager opened his new practice, California Pain Medicine, in Santa Monica several years ago and we followed him there

As far as I'm concerned, no other pain doctor comes close to Dr. Prager. You can look up his impressive credentials, his education, professional alliances, his medical and surgical experience. I will relate my personal experience.

When I first saw Dr. Prager, I was laying in a reclining wheelchair, shaking in pain. I had a heating pad on my abdomen and ice packs all around my pelvis. I have a severe form of interstitial cystitis (which destroys the lining of the bladder) and pudendal neuralgia, for which there is no cure and no effective treatment. I had been ill for over 15 years, gradually declining until I was bedridden for the last three years. I could not walk, sit, or even stand. The pain was relentless, day and night, and I was at the end of my rope.

However, as Dr. Prager started talking, I began to feel a glimmer of hope. He really seemed to understand the kind of pain I was in, and my confidence grew as he outlined a plan that would possibly give me back my life. Out of all the doctors and specialists, and after all the failed treatments and surgeries -- Dr. Prager was the one who finally helped me.

It has been more than two years since I had the surgery that gave me back my life. In November of 2012, Dr. Prager implanted an intrathecal pain pump into my abdomen. It contains a mixture of three medications which drip slowly into my spinal fluid and, to put it simply, anesthetize (deaden) the pain signals. We knew it would work because a trial with the same medications a month earlier had been an astounding success. I remember SITTING without pain for the first time in 4-5 years, and WALKING, by myself, around the nurses station at least 7 times!

Today I am walking, laughing, and enjoying life. I can go places, eat at restaurants, see the latest movies. My husband and my sister, who were there during the darkest hours, cry tears of joy when they see me happy and doing things. My husband has  been known to get misty-eyed simply from coming home from work and finding me in the kitchen cooking dinner.|I have been in pain management for over 12 years due to a chronic long term illness. I saw the same great pain management practice since diagnosis. I moved to CA in February. I reached out to California Pain Medicine Center and Dr Gabriel Barnard even before I moved so, I  would have no lapse in care. Dr Barnard has been so great in continuing my care with much empathy, passion and understanding. His office staff have also been extremely nice and helpful, and they answer the phone and get back to me quickly anytime I need something. I 100% + recommend California Pain Medicine Center for anyone needing excellent care.|Dr Barnard is great.   He is very attentive and thorough.    I didn't feel rushed which I really appreciated.  Fingers crossed that I can finally get relief from the pain.|This review is very long overdue. I should have written this a while ago. Dr. Prager, nurse practitioner Erica Jenkins, Dr. Barnard and their team are the best in their field. I have been to my fair share of pain management doctors over the years. Dr. Prager and Erica, by far, provide the best and most thorough care to the point where they supersede expectations. They truly listen, ask questions, and take their time. They never finish an appointment if there are any remaining questions or concerns. They have improved my quality of life beyond what I had achieved with other practitioners. I wish Erica was my primary provider. She deserves gold stars for everything she does. They are all a wealth of knowledge and so caring. It has been an honor and pleasure to be under their care. It has been a true blessing.
I've had consults and a procedure with Dr. Barnard. He and his team were also equally great. If I need another procedure, I would only want Dr. Barnard from here on.
The office staff are also so nice, patient, friendly, and efficient.
I wholeheartedly recommend this practice. They are amazing.|Went to UCLA Med Center where Dr Gabriel Barnard treated my torn left shoulder with a temporary electronic implant to see if it helps the pain.  Hopefully it will work and a permanent implant can be used.  I will update the status of yesterday's procedure when I follow up with Dr B next Friday.

I have great confidence in the skill and judgment of Dr Barnard and his staff as I have been treated like the most important person in the world and cared for with a very high level of competence and compassion.

I am hopeful that I get relief from severe pain and I very much appreciate Dr Barnard's honest assessment of my issues telling me the procedure should provide relief but realistically it probably won't be 100% pain free.

I am very grateful for this procedure being tested on me since my condition does not allow for surgical repair of the torn shoulder.

I am happy to answer any questions regarding the procedure and my treatment under Dr Barnard.  Just know that I would not have this procedure performed by anyone other than Dr Barnard.

Sincerely

Michael Rosenthal
Woodland Hills CA
July 8, 2023|Dr Barnard is an empathetic and knowledgeable doctor who really listens to the patient. I'm currently receiving stellate ganglion block injections to treat CRPS. I've had 4 injections so far over the course of 2 months, and they have gradually been reducing the inflammation and pain in my wrist and hand. It's important to communicate clearly to the doctor so that he can adjust his course of treatment accordingly. CRPS is tricky to treat and before each injection Dr Barnard checks in with me to discuss how things are progressing and then determines his next course of action. During each procedure, Dr Barnard describes exactly what he is going to do step by step. He adjusts the amount of medication according to what he determines will be most effective. I feel very well cared for and reassured that I will recover from CRPS.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Bakersfield

Are you organizing your life around pain? At Central California Pain Management, we understand how chronic pain can limit your daily activities and quality of life. Our multifaceted approach to treatment focuses on three key goals: reducing your pain levels, helping you develop effective pain management strategies, and improving your ability to accomplish everyday tasks. We offer a comprehensive range of specialized pain control services including:

  • Individualized pain assessment and treatment planning

Our dedicated team of pain management physicians works collaboratively to address various pain conditions at our state-of-the-art medical clinic in Bakersfield. We invite you to visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 661-587-2468 to schedule a consultation at our convenient location: 8303 Brimhall Rd Building 1500, Bakersfield, CA 93312.

column3:
Revolutionary Ketamine Therapy for Depression

At Interventional Anesthesia & Pain Management Clinic, we provide cutting-edge ketamine infusion therapy for patients struggling with depression. Our advanced treatment offers several significant advantages over traditional antidepressants, including remarkably fast onset—sometimes providing instant relief—and requiring only monthly or bi-weekly sessions after the initial treatment phase. We're proud to offer a therapy that is substantially more effective than most conventional antidepressants currently in use. All treatments are administered under direct medical supervision with constant monitoring to ensure your safety and comfort throughout the process.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services:

  • Ketamine infusion therapy for depression

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Ongoing pain management support

We invite you to visit our website to learn more about our innovative treatments. Located at 1007 N Lake Ave B, Pasadena, CA 91104, we're committed to providing you with the most advanced therapy for depression available today. Call us at +1 626-345-9735 to schedule your appointment and take the first step toward the relief you deserve.
column11: ADVANTAGES OF KETAMINE THERAPY FOR DEPRESSION, let us take a quick look at the advantages of ketamine infusion therapy in depression , those may include, fast onset, at times it is instant relief, it is only once a month or once every few weeks after the initial phase of therapy, ketamine is very effective, much more so than almost all other recent antidepressants recently in use. It is administered under direct medical supervision and with constant monitoring, just to mention a few points,and this is to be continued. Please come and visit our clinic, we would love to provide you with the newest and most advanced therapy for depression ever. Please call to set up and appointment to get the relief you need, our promise to you is to give you.

Signed Joyce Acquaah|The staff is VERY attentive and helpful. Dr. Malik is caring and knowledge about everything I told him about. When I started going to him I had a lot of problems with pain and depression he made me hopeful.  I've never seen a doctor  care for his patients like he does,it made me feel supported.  I recommend him for any pain,depression and more.  His Ketamine program is highly recommended as well.  You will not be disappointed with Interventional Anesthesia & Pain Management Clinic. column3:
At the California Pain Medicine Center, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions through a methodical approach that begins with thorough evaluation and precise treatment planning.

Personalized Pain Management

Our philosophy centers on starting with conservative interventions that evolve dynamically as needed, always maintaining active patient involvement in the care process. We bring together specialists from diverse backgrounds including:

  • Physical medicine and rehabilitation

  • Low-dose Ketamine infusion therapy

  • Clinical psychology

  • Neurobiofeedback

  • Physical therapy

We incorporate cutting-edge advances in pain management technology, including implantable devices such as spinal cord stimulators and neuroaxial drug delivery systems to effectively treat chronic pain conditions and spinal cord anomalies. Our multidisciplinary team at California Pain Medicine Center is committed to helping patients regain function and improve quality of life at our Santa Monica location.
column11: California Pain Medicine Center tailors an approach that begins with a thorough evaluation and precise treatment plan. . Our specialists have backgrounds in various disciplines, including physical medicine, low-dose Ketamine infusion therapy, rehabilitation, clinical psychology, neurobiofeedback, and physical therapy. We incorporate the latest advances in our treatments to manage pain and treat spinal cord anomalies. Our pain management technology includes implantable devices such as spinal cord stimulators and neuroaxial drug delivery systems.

column40:
I have had several treatments for lumbar stenosis over the last three years with Elite Pain management.  They provide excellent pre and post procedures to patients.  You are comfortable,  pain free and well attended while being treated.  I highly recommend Dr Cheng and his team.|Everyone is very nice and professional. I've been seeing Elizabeth for several years now. Dr Cheng is such a caring physician and I have to mention the team that does the injections and surgeries there, Hanna, Erika are all Amazing I highly recommend them all.|Dr Cheng's group at Elite Pain Management is awesome. I was referred to them by my Primary MD for neck pain. Instead of just assuming I had arthritis and putting me on yet more pain meds or other treatments, I was sent for an MRI. Dr Cheng personally called me as soon as he got the results letting me know that I had a large mass on my cervical spine. He spoke to me with care and compassion and referred me immediately to a wonderful Neurosurgeon and I had the mass removed ASAP. Thankfully my come has been very good! Dr Cheng always called back when I had questions and always made me feel cared about. Thank so much to Dr  Cheng and your wonderful staff!|Everyone was very cordial. My procedure was explained to me very well. It was difficult to get an appointment.|It's a very bad clinic. The front desk can't make an appointment for patients. It takes nearly two months to wait for the doctor's reply. Please stay away from this clinic.|I called to schedule an appointment so I could get some trigger point injections and it was definitely a different experience; they took my info including my insurance details and said they would call me back within the next few days after reviewing to let me know if they would accept me as a new patient... it was a bit odd that I couldn't schedule a consultation and I wasn't asked what I wanted to be seen for.

I will post back after hearing from them so readers can see the result of my experience.  Definitely a first for me with not being asked any qualifying questions.

The gal that I spoke to on the phone couldn't tell me what she meant by "the doctor needs to review before scheduling an appointment"

Either way, I hope I at least get the question of what I'm looking to have done and what sort of treatments I need whether it be injections, medications, multi-modality, etc.|I had a terrible accident years ago that left me with chronic back pain, among other things. My back surgeon recommended Dr. Cheng at Elite Pain Management and it was the best thing that could have happened to me.

First, everyone in that office is wonderful. They truly care about my injury, about my life and they do everything they can to make sure I can live as normal and pain-free a life as possible.
Also, I have procedures on my back a couple of times a year. I just had one 6 days ago and I am already so much better. These procedures are not easy to say the least. Due to a brain injury that I sustained during the same accident that damaged my back, I am practically immune to sedation. Only general anesthesia works on me. Which means that during these procedures, I am fully awake and aware. The doctors here know this and they remember. Each time I have to have this done, they do everything in their power to make sure I am comfortable. They'll have conversations with me about my family, movies, things I've bought on Amazon. Whatever it takes to distract me. They are fast and incredibly efficient. And most importantly they are incredibly kind. I can't recommend them enough or be more grateful for all they do.|Everyone here at Elite Pain Management is superior to any other pain specialist I have seen. Dr Cheng is especially caring and does a thorough job of getting you through your treatment. Good communication and very timely visits (very little wait time, if any at all) are just a few more reasons they are 5 Star.

Dr. Kerr is professional, personable and polite. She's down to earth. She makes sure you understand everything during your visit. Her assistants are excellent as well. I'd definitely refer my family and friends to this office. Thank you Dr. Kerr for taking good care of me.|Dr. Kerr treated me when I was having excruciating pain around my right rib cage. She tried so many different things to help me & believed me about the pain I was having when others wouldn't. It wasn't until years later that a doctor found I had 3 paralyzed shoulder muscles. They had collapsed onto my rib cage T-6-T-12 causing the intercostal nerve pain. I needed 2 surgeries. The first a total reconstruction of my rt. shoulder in the back area & one more shoulder surgery in the front to help correct the problem. Dr. Kerr was there for me through all of it and I am forever grateful.
Dr. Kerr listens very well, and I find that her depth of knowledge, not just in pain management, but in other areas is amazing to me. She has helped lead to me to look into other paths for help in other areas of my life for pain relief as well!
I thank God for her walking beside me & for her trying to help me through a very horrible time of pain. I don't know how I could have made it through that time in my life without her compassion, understanding and her faithful care.|Fran is a wonderful nurse and all other staff are very professional, even the one who gives me a ride to surgery and out to the car.

Our Specialized Services

  • Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) treatment

I first started treating with Dr. Loomba in 2021 approximately.  His calm demeanor was welcoming after being seen by another doctor who was mean and didn't seem to care much if at all.
My insurance changed in the middle of obtaining the treatment that was needed.
After an almost three year break in treatment I started to decline.
I changed insurance carriers and was referred to Dr. Loomba once again.
After two months, I can honestly say I feel better. It's because of the treatment, injections and meds, but also the fact that I'm being seen by a provider who cares.
His staff is great as well.|They all treated me with such respect and explained everything as my procedure was being performed. My doctor was very accurate, informative, and attentive to all of my questions and concerns. I would 100% recommend this office to everyone, thank you again! I've waited almost a year for some pain relief, and kept getting the runaround everywhere else until I got to this wonderful office!|Dr. Loomba Your dedication to your profession and your patients is truly admirable. Always goes above and beyond to ensure his patients receive the best care possible. Thank you|Dr. Loomba is a compssionate and caring Dr. The staff is very friendly and also caring to your concerns. Dr Loomba is the best pain specialist I have ever been too. He listens and takes his time with you, as though he is your friend. I definately would say go to him.|I am very pleased with dr. Lumba's care.
He took the time to come up with a plan for my care which is exactly what I have been looking for in a dr..
I thought I knew what my care should be and through his experience he took control of the situation and satisfied my need for actual health care.
Thank you Dr. Lumba|Dr. Loomba was very helpful at our intake appointment. He explained to me what was causing my hip/knee pain. We made a treatment plan. I'm hoping for less pain and a better night's sleep. I also want to keep up my exercise routine.|After many many years of trying to seek treatment elsewhere, I finally found a doctor and staff that are trying to help me with my chronic pain. Everyone here listens to my concerns and are helping me feel better.
Thank you|I would give zero stars if I could. This man does not listen or let me speak. He hasn't spoken to a single doctor of mine in the 9 months he's been treating me. My other physicians say they have reached out with no response. I believe them because they've done it in front of me and once I leave the building, I can't get ahold of anyone in the office either. Plus they kept me alive while I was a dying quadriplegic, so I trust them. Last week, he yelled at me in front of a resident and said, I don't care about your doctors appointment with your Neurologist. You can just find another pain management doctor. I have it recorded. It's crazy and that's it exactly, he just doesn't care. If it was one of his family members, I guarantee he would have made time to do his job. I have so much more but what's the point. My body is literally eating itself from the inside so I have to go through all of the hassle with insurance to start all over. Bottom line, if care about you or your loved one's health, do not go to Doctor Loomba. He is terrible.

column40:
In October I went in for an MRI Guided Epidural in my C6/C7. I said yes to sedation. I go in on the day of my appointment, I see them wheelchair people in and out like it was a McDonald's. When it's my turn an older Caucasian women is in charge of my IV. I tell her my arm is kind of chubby. I said this to her "The last time I had a MRI guided epidural with sedation the nurse used my hand not my forearm." She said "no it's ok ill find it" so she puts the needle in and keeps poking me. Trying to find the vein. She said "there it is." As I go in to the room I  take my shirt off lay face down on the table. The nurse picks up my arm and proceeds to administer the sedation. As she pushed in the sedation it didn't go into my veins it stayed between the skin and the vein on my forearm creating an instant searing sensation. I was screaming in pain crying after and after a few minutes they realized to put sailine to try to stop the pain. 2 minutes later they wheel me out and don't tell my fiance anything about what happened she was confused and didn't understand why I was in pain. It felt.like someone put a Shirt Iron inside my forearm. It's reminded me of my experience at LAGS another pain management business that was shutdown. I've been calling them trying to figure out how they're going to make my arm feel Normal again they hang up on me and ignore me. Cops can't do anything.  No one's holding them responsible for injuring me and torturing me. My insurance doesn't care. My arm doesn't feel the same it seems plastic. I don't trust a business who doesn't take accountability for its actions.|I want to say that Nor Cal Pain Management has been amazing. All doctors are very knowledgeable and the staff is very nice.
I am a 37 year old female with two kids, a chronic medical condition, and have adverse side effects from prior medication I was on. Which all has caused me extreme back pain, blood clots, swelling, and sciatica/leg pain in my right leg. I was referred to this clinic by my primary doctor. I was amazed at how thorough they were in conducting a proper interview in determining my root pain. They have done test and have been managing my pain with approved medical methods. All the doctors are amazing in helping their patients in getting pain relief and getting to the root of the problem, which I appreciate so much. I just started here and I already know that with ongoing maintenance I am going to be feeling a whole lot better with the medical issues I have.
Thank you so much to doctors at Nor Cal Pain Management, you are making a positive difference in people's everyday life|This place is a heap of unorganized unprofessional people. They will treat the patients like dope fiens instead of patients in pain. Employees have no sense of urgency and the ones that answer phones dont take the job seriously. And to think this place is considered "Pain Management" only thing they managed was wasting my time while smiling about it. I would never recommend this place not even to a enemy. Dont waste your time here this place is a JOKE|Inconsiderate of a patients time. Has one lingering up in the air waiting on a video chat all to only have the office close for the weekend without any consideration of contacting the patient back to let them know there was no longer any time left for the day instead of completely ghosting. Highly unprofessional.|Do not waste your time with this office and find yourself somewhere else to go. My husband was seen here for 4 years and never gave them a dirty piss test for his pain medication. His last test he got false reading and went down to the clinic to make it right and try to retest. Instead they dismissed him and pretty much told him to go figure out after just sending him for shoulder surgery and just having it done. They do not care about there patients no matter how long you have been with them.|OMG, the physician seems quite nice and caring. However, the staff is absolutely clueless and seem not to care. It's sad they only have one (1)I concerned, helpful employee, Lizzie! If you can get a decent appointment, count yourself lucky? Patient has been waiting since February for return appointment from hospital visit? Make it make sense......
I know what they only gave 3 stars and also wonder where they came from?|They have the appointment all mix they need to be more organized on scheduling the appointment for the patients to many patients in the office waiting to get treated|This is the best place to go for pain relief. Dr.lindenberg is great. He has the best bedside manor. I will continue to go there for my pain management.

At Central Valley Pain Management, we've been dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic pain since 1996 when Dr. Rhoades first opened our doors in Modesto, CA. What began as a solo practice has flourished into a comprehensive pain management center with five skilled providers serving hundreds of patients weekly.

Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions

We offer a wide range of specialized treatments including:

  • Acupuncture therapy

  • Trigger point injections

  • Botox injections

  • Safe opioid therapy management

We understand that chronic pain can be both physically and emotionally taxing, which is why we've expanded our network throughout the Central Valley to ensure our patients receive the care they need. Our office is physically open until 5:30 PM, with phone lines active from 7:30 AM to 4:45 PM Monday through Thursday. As long-time members of the Modesto community, we're committed to providing compassionate, effective pain management solutions. Visit Central Valley Pain Management at 1300 Mable Ave #2, Modesto, CA 95355, or call us at (209) 571-1992 to schedule your consultation.

Dr. Rhoades opened his practice as the sole provider and has expanded to 4 more providers since and serves hundreds of patients every week. CVPM is always looking for ways to provide relief for its patients with services like acupuncture, trigger point injections, botox injections, and safely managing opioid therapy. column40:
Hi I am Esther A. I am waiting to be seen here please call me soon you have my paper work I was so happy to here you take special care of Seniors living with chronic pain it's over whelming  and to speak to a companionate doctor who cares and truly wants to help me I'm so greatfull so please call me soon I know I will finally get the help I need  thanku|They're awesome and prompt with providing you service..
Never had a bad experience...
They call you back same day!!!!|I had a referal and medical records for my genetic issues since 2001 showing all treatments and drs and every report...the new patient office lady never called me.  I came into the office to be told she was on vacation!   So for a week nobody handled her stuff!  I finally came in and got to talk to her.  She said:   my records were not written clearly enough for her to even read, which i brought in disc form typed but she never even looked at either!  She wouldn't let me even see the main male dr that everyone said was compassionate.   I saw him in the hall and tried to ask him to book me,but this crazy new patient lady jumped in front of me and completely blocked the dr.  She told me the dr was busy...when the dr actually smiled at me and took 2 steps toward me by the left counter.  The dr looked so embarrassed that this sraff lady did this:  both arms sticking out like a basketball player!
I have xrays,ct,mri that show all my injuries and even diagnosed at san fran genetic hospital!   The bloodwork is full proof as well!  There was an actual review here that said to go ask the dr directly for an appointment and dont even deal with new patient lady!
So it was clear that this office lady was aware people were told NOT TO DEAL WITH HER!
This was in 2020...
This office lady is NOT A LICENSED DR!!!
SHE HAS NO TRAINING OR STATE LICENSE TO DIAGNOSE OR REJECT PATIENTS!  THAT IS NOT HER JOB!!!
SHE HAS NOT BE TRAINED NOR STATE BOARD CERTIFIED TO DIAGNOSE OR REJECT PATIENTS WITH PAYING INSURANCE AND TESTS!!
I WAS GOING TO SAC STATE FOR LICENSED DERMATOLOGIST MD!!!
I KNOW THE BOARD OF CALIFORNIA!   IVE HAD MEETINGS WITH THEM!
THIS OFFICE LADY IS OPERATING OUTSIDE THE SCOPE OF HER PRACTICE/ LICENSE...
ILL BE RECORDING HER NX TIME FOR PROSECUTION.   THIS CANT GO ON....|Stay away from this place this is just a money, Mill, and a pill mill. They cancel and reschedule your appointment for the same thing numerous time over just so they could charge insurance company.
Two nurse practitioners there seem to be extremely unprofessional and only focus on generating money and not taking care of people just by the way to cancel and reschedule the same appointment over and over. On two occasions I was there right by the exit door I've seen cockroaches on the ground. Stay away from this place.|I have not only back issue but other issues I am waiting to see specialist for.
My primary and gastro specialist also are within a group who do not prescribe pain meds. I was sent to another pain place in manyeca and they do not prescribe pain meds. I was finally refered to pain management. I went in with medication in my system. Told the doctor this before I ever tested very first appointment. I could see if I was under contract with them. But no I was red flagged and told there's nothing they can do. My husband works 6sm to 3:30 pm it's not feasible to go to the er every few days to get pain medication. Not only that if you are going there every few days than you will be labeled drug seeking. I am not going to give up the friend who helped me overcome pain management while I was trying to get the referals and appointments. I'm not saying that's the right way. But when a  person is trying to do the right thing and get there own script so they can do it the right way and be turned down it's wrong. If I had signed a contract with you and than showed up with something else not mine in my system than absolutely cut me off. But it was very first appointment and no contracts had been signed.  I'm being sent to specialists for a current situation. It's not just the back problems. Which ate severe enough themselves. . I had been on pain medication many years but my primary fired me for no related issue. I was left reeling and finding a doctor to deal with pain meds is very hard. You have to go to appointments and if you do not care for that new doctor you have to wait a month to see the next new doctor. You find one you like he has to refer to get images to get you to pain clinic this all takes months. I'm sorry I could not handle the pain. And someone helped me. That person should not be punished for showing human kindness. I should not be punished not being under contract. On my very first appointment.|I did my consultation and we decided on a treatment but there was a problem with insurance approval. After sorting out the insurance issue I called and left 8 messages with the referral department over the course of two months but never got an answer or a call back. Two months after that I had given up and was already seeing a different doctor when I got a call saying they had to reschedule the appointment for my treatment due to scheduling issues. Not only was I never informed of this appointment in the first place but that was three weeks ago and I still haven't heard anything about the new appointment.|I see the Dr's or their staff every 3 months and have been very pleased. They are always very friendly and helpful.  Sometimes the wait is a little longer than others, but always within reason.  At the same time I never feel rushed through my visit, as I have with other Dr's I have seen, which have been many over the years.  Thank you for your caring.|I have been a patient there for many years now, i pay cash, and  yesterday at my appointment i was told that they will not schedule my next appointment until my balance of 75 dollars is paid. How sad is that during a pandemic,  as hard as it is to make money because my husband works for the schools that are shut down, so moneys been tight....  and my doctor  is refusing to see me until i pay my account off... i have always made my payments,  and i have been with them for so long to be treated like this very sad... this is a very heartless facility...  i thought it was harsh that within a year period their prices went from 50$ to 75, then to 150, and thats if you only see the assistant.... 200 if you see the Dr... but refusing care during a pandemic is even lower!!! Lets not forget their mandatory drug tests cost 225 each.... the only reason i have a balance was because they raised the price on the drug tests, and gave me 4 tests back to back..... so i don't recommend this facility any longer

column40:
First, let me clarify: the actual provider is why I gave a 5* rating. Getting TO the provider was also challenging I almost gave up. More on that below. The provider was on time, thorough, and caring. Again, 5* on my appointment.
I am a new patient.  I called and left several messages and received no callbacks. I called again and someone answered (yay). I was asked to fill out online forms before I could have an appointment  I filled out the forms and waited almost a week, then called back and left a message.I called AGAIN, and the person who answered said she couldn't see the forms. She gave excuses for not calling me back. I asked for a supervisor and she put me on a long hold. She came back to the call and said she found the forms. No apology about any of the lack of response from them. The good news is that there was an opening soon and I got an appointment (yay). Overall, very poor assistance. It's important that the front desk is prompt and responsive, especially with a provider for pain and psychiatric services!|Check-in process was swift ON-TIME and professional.
Dr. Ananth was focused, thorough and reassuringly very UP FRONT and HONEST with his examination and evaluation.
In an age where face-to-face patient care is virtually non-existent, this level of attentive and personal 'care and concern' is/was extraordinary.|I can't say enough good things about Pacific Pain and Wellness. They have truly been there for me through some of my most challenging times. The entire staff is incredibly supportive and compassionate. They go above and beyond to make a difficult  situation better and less lonely.|Have to admit I enjoy my first visit here. Dr. Ananth and his staff were incredibly helpful. Lobby & office space were very nice as well. Dr. Ananth spent time listing to my concerns and gave me plenty of time during my visit. Super hopeful !|Visited office on urgent status for my chronic osteoarthritis condition which was reviewed, treated, given medication for, and was given referrals immediately for treatment. My attending physician was very thorough and attentive to my needs, a real comfort.|Check in process was great, all done on iPad. The office staff and medical assistant were very helpful and knowledgeable. Dr Ananth took the time to go over everything and to help ease my fears/concerns.|My regular therapist requested I seek a psychiatric evaluation for some challenges I'm experiencing. My insurance listed this office. They were very insistent that I would not be able to see the psychiatrist first. The front office was nice, the psych nurse who did my intake was kind but not thorough in that she kept mixing up my information and appeared to write notes inside of her planner. She did share with me that she was very concerned about my problems and would speak to the psychiatrist, so I felt hopeful about things.

She called me late that evening to state the psychiatrist, who did not meet with me, request any records, or consult with my regular therapist, says I'm stressed. I agree. Part of that is because I am not receiving the care I am requesting. So... the search for a psychiatric provider continues and although other reviews here state he's fantastic with physical health, I cannot attest to any confidence in his ability to provide mental health support.|Very warm and inviting atmosphere! The staff makes me feel like first class. Even after several years every experience is great.  Thank you guys

column3:
Your Pathway to Comprehensive Pain Relief

At Pain Medicine Consultants, we are renowned across Northern California for our exemplary approach to pain management. Our team consists of double-board certified doctors trained at prestigious institutions including Harvard, Stanford, UCSF, and Mayo Clinic. We understand that pain is not one-size-fits-all, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans focused on improving your quality of life without relying on powerful medications or major surgeries. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Minimally invasive interventional procedures

  • Integrative pain management techniques

  • Specialized treatment for acute and chronic conditions

Our commitment extends beyond simply managing symptoms—we aim to transform your quality of life by addressing the root causes of your pain. Located in Pleasant Hill, we invite you to discover how our patient-centered approach can help you reclaim your life from pain. Visit Pain Medicine Consultants or call us at +1 925-966-4025 to begin your journey toward lasting relief.
column11:

Empowering Your Journey Through Comprehensive Pain Management
Pain Medicine Consultants is renowned across Northern California for its exemplary approach to pain management and the extraordinary experience, bedside manner, and training of the Harvard, Stanford, UCSF, and Mayo Clinic double-board certified doctors. Our commitment is to offer not just pain relief but a transformed quality of life for those grappling with the complexities of acute or chronic conditions. We will try to get you better without powerful meds or big surgery.
At Pain Medicine Consultants, we understand that pain is not one-size-fits-all.

Well, Dr. Shinaman MOVED MOUNTAINS for me again yesterday to help me get rid of a week-long migraine. In fact, today is the second time in the last 5 weeks he's done this for me. He is the best doctor I've ever had. I can't believe how lucky I was to meet him and for him to take me on as a new patient 5 years ago. And I'm not talking about him giving me pain meds or opioids! He's not that kind of doctor so don't ask.

I am a very unique migraine case-maybe 5% of what works for everyone else works for me. He's tried so many things for me and they're finally under control day-to-day. If you're looking for an amazing pain medicine doctor, Dr. Richard Shinaman at PMC is your guy! He's honestly the best doctor I've ever had. Cares about EVERYTHING going on with me not just the pain. He's been so open to trying new things on me and I'm just so thankful he takes my pain seriously. He didn't quit on me when the first 2, 3 hell, 10 things didn't work like ALL of my prior doctors. He genuinely cares and tell me the last time you could say this about ANY of your doctors.

The practice is A++ and so is Dr. Richard Shinaman!!|Dr. Longton and his staff are outstanding. Their pain management care has made it possible for me to maintain my ability to function and a high quality of life for many years. I tried other pain management doctors in the past, but none are as skilled and caring as Dr. Longton and his Physician's Assistant, Brooke.|Dr. Longton, Is the Best.  I had my first injection last month.  I'm due for my second one this week. I do not feel any pain.  And I'm 76 years old.  And this is a FIRST for me not to have Back Pain.  He also did one for my Wife in her neck.  Everything went Beautiful and Doing Great.  Thank you Dr. Longton, and your Wonderful Staff. Everything you need is under ONE ROOF.  That make's it easy for the patients.  And that's what it's all about!  Thank you|Dr Longton was referred by a neighbor who had great results working with him. To date, I've been very impressed with Dr L and hope my treatments yield results. Time will tell. Meanwhile, I'm happy to have a plan and to be working with Dr L on my back pain issues.|I like Dr Longton he's a pleasant man who you can actually have a conversation with many doctors are so clinical. I fear that in the future I'll be seeing a lot more of him &  he does his best using his expertise in the pain medicine field to help your orthopedic issue|Dr. Longton treated me for a complicated, chronic issue with my SI joint.  He inspired my confidence with his diagnosis and surgical solution, which resulted in relief for my severe pain. He is a very knowledgeable, capable and caring surgeon; I trust and recommend him fully.|The Bass surgical center has got to be my favorite of all surgical centers I've been seen in. The staff are always friendly and the nursing staff go out of their way to make ones stay as comfortable as possible. Dr Longton has a positive word to say on one's way into the surgery room. keep up the good work !!!!!
