column40:
I was referred here by my lawyer and I'm a happy camper. The office is super clean and warm. The decor is fancy. Free bottled water was an excellent touch.
Dr. Nadiv was very honest and caring. Excellent bed side manner.  He answered all my questions and put me at ease. He explained PRP therapy process and possible results.
Dylan drew my blood and it didn't hurt one bit. He was very gentle and caring. He walked me through the process and told me after care for the puncture.|Dr Samimi is 100% the best pain management doctor I've ever been to. He is present and empathetic. Every phone call and email has been promptly returned. I truly believe that he cares about my well being and it shows with the treatment I receive. We have talked about moving from Los Angeles but he is one of the things that keeps us here. I dread the day that I ha e to find another pain management doctor. You're the best Dr Samimi.|Dr. Samimi has been my Pain Doctor for over 4 years. He has a wonderful disposition and works with you to address your pain challenges. He is honest and super friendly, responds to your emails in a timely manner and just is a great guy!
I highly recommend him to anyone who is serious about working on their pain and not just looking for a pill doctor.|Dr. Samimi was a blessing for our family! My husband was in crippling pain and had not slept in days. He did not rush through the appointment, if anything, he took his time, reviewed the xrays and even consulted with my husband's primary physician. He gave helpful therapeutic and medicinal suggestions, and did not give up until he made sure my husband normalized and could lead a pain-free life again. Since that time, I have referred my brother and also my best friend to Dr. Samimi, and they both feel the same way we do - that he is intelligent, listens and figures it out!|Dr. Samimi has been really helpful and caring about what I'm going through. I have neck and upper spine pain as well as an autoimmune disease. Fortunately I was referred to Dr. Samimi by a top rheumatologist several years ago. I appreciate that Dr. Samimi believes and understands what I'm going through, from the first time I met with him. He has come up with pain treatment plans that have been more effective than just taking strong pain meds by themselves, and helped me go off the meds I didn't like.

Dr. Samimi has always been there for me when I've needed him, whether it's answering emails between appointments, calling in refills, and countless other things. He always does his best to work with our insurance to find the best treatment available that can be covered. He always takes his time to listen to me even when I have a lot to go over. He has excellent bedside manners and compassion.

The other doctors that work at the practice are also great. I'd feel confident using any of them.|Wonderful office. Responsive. Average wait time. Never feel rushed. Dr Samimi is one of the best physicians I've ever had. Chronic pain is debilitating. He's always available to help. He takes everything seriously. And he's happy and smiling all the time.|I just wanted to thank both Dr. Lalani & Dr. Sammi for the wonderful experience my brother  and myself had last week at your clinic.   The entire staff was amazing from check in to check out.
Again thank you for such a great experience.|Dr Samimi is a very kind and knowledgeable physician and he has consistently given me 5 star care the 3 years I've been a patient of his. I would recommend him to anyone looking for a pain management physician. His office staff is also very friendly and helpful with any paperwork or appointment issues that come up.

column40:
Mr. Adler is probably the best pain provider I have ever seen. He takes time with you, he is intelligent, educated, explains things well, listens and has a good bedside manner.
Tammy his CNA is also professional and courteous.
Pacific Pain Medicine has a lot of treatment plans for you as an individual they do not take a cookie cutter approach like a lot of other providers.|When you live with chronic pain most likely you have been to numerous doctors with varying degrees of satisfaction. When I moved to California my new primary suggested that I see a pain specialist. I was resistant at first having heard of some bad experiences from other people. I was referred to Pacific Pain and I was lucky enough to be given an appointment with PA Jeremy Adler. He was professional, patient, knowledgeable and it was clear he was dedicated to his profession. He listened to my history, took into consideration my input, thought both in and outside of the box.  He used his broad-based understanding of how the body works (and sometimes doesn't)  along with his in-depth knowledge of medicine, how they were designed to work and the broader way they work in the body, to come up with the right regime for me.
He adjusted appropriately as needed.  He stays on top of the latest information in the field and his patients benefit from this. After more years than I care to mention of going from doctor to doctor with not great success he was not only able to get my pain under control but he was able to come up with the correct diagnosis for me, (which numerous specialists had not) and then referred me to the proper specialist resulting in even better quality of life.  His assistant Tammie is equally as professional, caring, and dedicated to doing the best for the people in their care.  I have the utmost respect for Jeremy and highly recommend him and Pacific Pain.|I have suffered with chronic fatigue syndrome and fibromyalgia for 25 years.  I have seen so many specialists and tried just about every recommendation out there and no one could help me.  I finally found Jeremy Adler and it has been life changing.  He knows more about pain and my health issues than every specialist combined that I've seen.  He is so knowledgeable and he really cares about his patients.  He always listens, answers all my questions, and I never feel rushed or blown off.  He has improved my pain so much that I can now have some enjoyment back in my life.  If you need a pain specialist, he is definitely the one to see!|I found everyone to be very professional, very interested in my condition, and very gentle and respectful when speaking with me about my condition. I'm most impressed With Jeremy Adler and his assistant Tammy. Both are very professional very caring people. I recommend Pacific pain for any condition you might have based completely on my experience.|I have been a patient of Jeremy Adler's for 8-9 years. He is an excellent problem solver, very intelligent & extremely patient. (He is so good that he trains pain management doctors around the county.) He is always aware of the current pain management treatments & technology. When I need injections I see Dr. Perrizo at their Oceanside Outpatient Facility.|Jeremy Adler is an outstanding provider. He listens, takes the time to answer questions and curtails the treatment to one's individual needs. His medical assistant Tammie, is also exceptional.|My life would be significantly different if I didn't have Pacific Pain Medicine as a part of my life. They've never approached my care as a "one size fits all", they listen to my needs and wants and always work with me to solve any issues and support my needs. Their outside the box thinking has allowed me to live a relatively pain free life without the permanent side effects of surgery nor side effects of typical opioid medications. They work with the difficult to deal with insurance companies to get me what I need and fight for my needs.
I've dealt with a few other practices to manage my chronic disease and it was always opioids or more procedures (which make them the most money).|Prime example of an arrogant, condescending facility who has no interest in what they do or providing you any relief. They do excel in giving you the run-around. In their view, remember, you're the patient and it's all your fault. My first appointment was outright cancelled and I was turned away at the door because I didn't receive paperwork they claimed they mailed.
They have no time for you to fill out paperwork there. Clearly demonstrating they have no concern for the patient, only what the patient can do for them, i.e. "we only want your money". What an overtly pathetic facility!

Established in North San Diego in 1984, Pacific Pain Medicine Consultants proudly stands as a pioneer in pain management, having opened California's first single specialty surgical center dedicated to pain treatment. Our legacy of excellence continues today as we provide comprehensive pain management solutions to patients throughout Oceanside and surrounding communities. With nearly four decades of experience, we have been instrumental in advancing the specialty of pain management at both county and state levels.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

  • Minimally invasive lumbar decompression procedures

  • Advanced injection therapies

  • Customized medication management

  • Innovative pain relief techniques

  • Multidisciplinary treatment approaches

We take pride in our role as a comprehensive training site for physicians entering the specialty, while continuing to offer educational conferences, state-of-the-art clinical research, and advanced treatments. Our team collaborates with multidisciplinary specialists to ensure each patient receives personalized care for optimal pain relief. Visit our official website to learn more about how we can help improve your quality of life through effective pain management.
column11: Pacific Pain Medicine Consultants was originally established in North San Diego in 1984 and opened the first single specialty surgical center for pain in California. The practice has been a leader in advancing the specialty of pain management at the county and state level and has served as a comprehensive training site for many young physicians entering the specialty. Pacific Pain Medicine has provided educational conferences, state of the art clinical research, advanced treatments and collaboration with multidisciplinary teams. The tradition of excellence continues at Pacific Pain Medicine Consultants.

column40:
As a new patient, I tried for 3 weeks to get a call back for an appointment. I am a chronic patient who needs meds, but no calls. I finally called the front desk and still got the answering machine. Finally after 3 weeks I got a call and gave me an appointment in the next 2 weeks. My former pain doctor faxed them all my records but no mercy. I am running out of my meds which my primary doctor can't authorize. I have Complex Regional Pain Syndrome and cannot live without pain meds and I am running out since I have already reduced the recommended dosage and I am on the verge of going to the ER due to severe pain.
I have not seen their doctors to make any comments but, from the call experience, I am not sure what to expect. Once I get another call to see the doctor soon, I will revise my comments.|I have seen Dr. Owusu for years and he is an amazing doctor. After many medical issues including cancer and non repairable orthopedic problems, I lived a lifetime of pain. I had a limited quality of life and until
I saw Dr. Owusu I began to lose hope. He has provided solution after solution and I've been able to keep working full time and keep up with my young son. They monitor you closely and recommend cutting edge techniques to help you live the best life possible. Dr. Owusu is both compassionate and highly knowledgeable. He has managed my care through multiple surgeries as well. You don't have to live your life in pain! Be open to their suggestions, they really try to help you solve long term problems! Thank you!|Dr.Perrizo and his team and all the support people here are amazing. I had chronic back pain, had the Mild procedure ( minimally invasive lumbar decompression ) and it worked for me. I have hope for less pain and am gaining back the confidence to live my life again.
Many thanks to this team.|Dr. Perrizo and all the staff at Pacific Pain have been wonderful from pre-op to surgery, And again in post-op care. I thank them for their professionalism and care.|I've got a lot of relief from Dr. Perrizo and his team.   They're very knowledgeable on advancing innovations and are great at determining strategies for improving life.|Simply the most professional, knowledgeable and experienced pain management team you can have. Dr. Davis has been phenomenal and really helps me live a fuller, more active lifestyle. The team at Pacific Pain really listens and consistently puts their best efforts into my care. Absolutely my pain management team of choice. Highly recommend to anyone looking for tangible results for a better, pain managed life!|I highly recommend Pacific Pain Medicine  Consultants. I suffered a back injury in 2005 and have been a patient at several pain management groups in San Diego. Dr. Jeremy Adler, PA, PhD has treated me for about 5 years. I give a 5 star rating for many reasons. The entire staff are highly professional, knowledgeable and respectful. They have various treatment plans that are well thought out and effective. If you're willing to work with them in treating your pain you'll receive twice your effort in return!|I have been in a lot of pain for many years.  Pacific Pain Medicine Consultants have helped me deal with the pain in a professional safe approach.  It has made a world of difference to me.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  If I ever need a refill or prior-authorization, the staff and doctors have always had my medicine refills ready (usually within a couple of hours) and the prior-authorizations within 24-48 hours.  I have waited a week or two in the past sometimes for prior-authorizations. It's very nice to have those completed quickly.  Overall, Pacific Pain Medicine Consultants have a group of great office staff members, doctors, and nurses.  They will strive to give their patients an absolutely dedicated personal experience to battle with whatever pain each person has the unfortunate burden to deal with.

column3:
Pain Specialists of Orange County Mission Viejo serves the Mission Viejo, CA community with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located at 25982 Pala Ste 280, this specialized clinic offers expert care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Their team of board-certified physicians provides advanced pain management treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

The clinic's approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with personalized treatment plans. Their pain management physicians utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to identify the root causes of pain, rather than simply masking symptoms. Patients benefit from a comprehensive range of services including epidural injections, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management.

Expert Physicians

The medical team at Pain Specialists of Orange County includes highly trained physicians with extensive experience in treating complex pain conditions. Dr. Mousavi, Dr. Gerayli, and Dr. Michael Shahbazian are among the respected specialists who have earned praise from patients for their attentive care and effective treatment approaches.

Patient Experiences

The clinic has earned a strong reputation in the community, with numerous 5-star reviews highlighting both the quality of care and the compassionate approach of the staff. Patients consistently mention the physicians' willingness to listen and develop personalized treatment plans.

One patient, Roxanne Oehlenschlager, shares: "Dr. Mousavi and his staff are the best. He has helped me so much since I started seeing him in 2020. I recommend him to anyone having pain issues."

Another patient, Brett Hickman, notes the clinic's responsiveness: "I needed an epidural ASAP for my back and they squeezed me in same day when no one else could. Dr. Gerayli was very attentive and understanding."

Comprehensive Services

The Mission Viejo location features both consultation rooms and a surgical center, allowing for seamless care from diagnosis through treatment. Their approach emphasizes finding long-term solutions rather than temporary fixes, with many patients reporting significant improvement in mobility and quality of life following treatment.

For appointments or more information, patients can contact the clinic directly at +1 949-297-3838. The convenient Mission Viejo location serves patients throughout Orange County with accessible, specialized pain management care.

column3:
Pain Care Providers is a leading provider of pain management solutions for patients throughout Orange County and Southern California. Located in Irvine, CA, this premier pain control clinic was founded by Drs. Amir Rafizad and Reza Mahrou with a mission to deliver patient-centered care focused on providing long-term relief from both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their state-of-the-art facility at 113 Waterworks Way offers comprehensive treatment options utilizing the most advanced equipment and technology available in pain medicine today.

Pain Care Providers specializes in treating a wide range of painful conditions including neck pain, back and spine pain, neuropathy, sciatica, herniated discs, and spinal stenosis. Their approach emphasizes noninvasive pain management techniques designed to address the underlying issues that cause or contribute to pain, rather than simply masking symptoms.

Expert Medical Team

The practice is led by board-certified anesthesiologists who bring extensive expertise to pain management. Dr. Rafizad and Dr. Mahrou have established a reputation for their thorough evaluations and personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique circumstances and medical history.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Pain Care Providers apart is their commitment to involving patients in their treatment decisions. Many long-term patients appreciate the collaborative approach where their input is valued before prescribing medications or recommending procedures. The clinic offers innovative solutions like neuro stimulation technology that can significantly reduce reliance on pain medications.

For those suffering from persistent pain conditions, Pain Care Providers offers comprehensive consultations and can be reached at +1 949-872-2400 to schedule an appointment at their Irvine surgical center.
column11: Pain Care Providers is a leading provider of pain management solutions for patients in throughout Orange County and Southern California. Located in Irvine, CA, and founded by Drs. Amir Rafizad and Reza Mahrou, the practice specializes in patient-centered care aimed at providing long-term relief of acute and chronic pain. Featuring the most advanced equipment and technology, Pain Care Providers helps patients find relief from all types of pain, including neck pain, back and spine pain, neuropathy, sciatica, herniated discs, and spinal stenosis using noninvasive pain management techniques to correct underlying issues that cause or contribute to pain.

column40:
I paid $2500 for an epidural in my neck that didn't help. I'm in severe pain. My appointment with a spinal surgeon is on Tuesday. I asked the doctor to refill my pain medication only once. They want another visit for an additional $150. Why does healthcare only care about my money and not my well-being? I won't recommend this place if you're in pain.|Everyone was professional, helpful and nice as they were every time I have been in the office. Of course, Dr. Mahrou was awesome and knowledgeable. I trust his advice completely. This is the second time I've been to him for pain management. The first time was such a success, I trust him the second time. He cares completely for his patients. I couldn't ask to be in better hands|Doctor Mahrou has been my doctor for 8 years. During that time he and his staff (Christina specifically) really go above and beyond to make sure all patients are taken care of. I've dealt with many doctors and I've never ever come across one as compassionate and caring for his patients as Dr Mahrou. He genuinely cares for his patients and their medical issues. He is not one to just hand out medication freely he wants to find the root of the problem and give all options of care. I can't say enough good things about him. I truly consider myself blessed that I have a Doctor Who is stuck by me and cared for me the way Dr Mahrou has. When you go into any of his offices you will see the many awards and accolades presented to him for his service in the medical industry. Those are not just pretty wall decorations. He has earned and lived up to each one of those achievements and more.If you are looking for a better quality of life and a wonderful man who will be there to help you achieve that then Dr Mahrou is just the doctor you're looking for. We love Dr Mahrou and the whole staff at Pain Care Providers.|Dr. Mahrou is the best pain specialist I'd ever been to. He takes care of all my needs and really listens when I'm telling him of new pains that are occurring. He's very patient and very professional along with his staff as well. I would recommend him to anyone who ask me for a pain specialist.  Dr. Reza Mahrou and his staff are the best in Orange County.|Dr. Rafizad has terrible bed side manner and does not communicate well with his patients. If you can avoid going to see him for your pain. When going to the doctors for any reason we should be treated well and our needs should be first but that is not how Dr. Rafizad is, he was very rude, had terrible bed side manner with me, and didn't communicate how doctors are supposed to communicate with their patients.. The front desk staff is the same. They give you paperwork without saying a word even your first visit. Usually when I go to doctors offices the front desk is really friendly and helpful but this office NO ONE is... Just awful!|When I first moved to SoCal I needed to find a pain specialist as quickly as possible so that my neuropathy pain could continue being managed without interruption. Dr. Mahrou was the first one that accepted new patients and even arranged an appointment the very next day. Over the years, he has always valued my input before prescribing any medication. I've always felt that it was a team effort and not just being dictated on what to do or what meds to take.

Eventually, Dr. Mahrou suggested a neuro StimPak to help manage the pain in my hands. It has been a godsend. I truly believe it has prevented me from taking even more meds (which I've always been grateful that Dr. Mahrou prefers to find solutions that work rather than just increasing the amount of meds.) I am currently scheduled to go through the trial using the StimPak for pain relief in my feet. The stimulator does not solve the problems I have with pain, but it definitely gives me back a life that I could have easily given up on.

Dr. Mahrou has always made himself available to me, day or night, if I ran into any problems with either my pain medications or the StimPak. He has been an amazing rock at times when I felt my world was crumbling from constant and debilitating pain. He listens, allows me to have input into my own care and has genuinely shown that he cares about me personally. His staff know me by name when I visit and are always cheerful and accommodating. I wish I didn't have the pain, but if I have to have it, I sure am glad I have Dr. Mahrou in my corner.|Pain care Providers is  great clinic managed by Dr. Reza Mahrou. He is very open with his time and helps in any way he can. After 4 knee surgeries and complications with pretty severe back pain & neuropathy, he provides updated medical & technological solutions to help alleviate the discomfort. The staff is very professional, and they follow up quickly.  I highly recommend them to anyone looking to be helped with managing and improving painful conditions.|I suffer from lower back pain and I was miserable and depressed about my quality of life. I was in a pain management program and I had to seek better care. I went to my primary care and asked for new referral.  I selected Dr.Mahrou and my life is amazingly better.  He was very thorough in my consultation and listened to my history of pain. He examined me and ordered MRI'S and lab tests. He scheduled me for epidural for cortisone/steroid and found the exact spot of pain L5 S1. This allows for a nerve block to ensure that precise location. My pain was released from a daily 5 to 7 to no pain. I felt cured. However this wears off but Dr Mahrou found that nerve area where other doctors did not. I moved to Radio frequency ablation and my quality of life has improved 100%. I have received the RFA and it lasted almost a year. I have my joyful personality back that was lost due to chronic pain daily. I am willing to have this procedure annually for my quality of life to be able to appreciate all the things that life has to offer but not able to participate with chronic pain. I have been extremely grateful for Being a patient of Dr.Mahrou.

Modesto Pain Medicine Inc serves Modesto, CA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized team of physicians provides personalized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, helping them regain control of their lives through innovative treatments. At our McHenry Avenue location, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

Our board-certified physicians specialize in diagnosing and treating various pain conditions through comprehensive pain management solutions. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and treatment modalities including interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitation therapies. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures that each patient receives care tailored to their specific needs and circumstances.

Conditions We Treat

Patient Testimonials

Pain Medicine Consultants in Pleasanton, CA is renowned across Northern California for its exemplary approach to pain management. With a team of Harvard, Stanford, UCSF, and Mayo Clinic double-board certified doctors, we provide comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our philosophy centers on finding effective treatment options that avoid powerful medications or major surgical interventions whenever possible, focusing instead on comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's needs.

At Pain Medicine Consultants, we understand that pain is not one-size-fits-all. Our state-of-the-art facility at 2324 Santa Rita Rd #6 in Pleasanton offers the most innovative and minimally invasive treatments available. Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care, ensuring that each patient receives personalized attention and treatment plans designed specifically for their condition.

Expert Care from Trusted Specialists

Our team of specialists is led by physicians like Dr. Shinaman, who patients consistently praise for his knowledge, precision, and innovative care. As one patient shared, "Dr. Shinaman listens to understand my pain issues, explains treatments and procedures, and is a truly exceptional and caring care provider." This commitment to patient-centered care is evident throughout our practice.

What Our Patients Say

The quality of care at Pain Medicine Consultants is reflected in our patients' experiences:

- "Dr. Shinaman and his team are the reason I have been able to work and enjoy my life for the last 21 years. They are proactive and find creative ways to reduce pain without only taking medicine."

- "Professional, polite, friendly and caring staff at all levels, from the Receptionist to the Physician Assistant to the Physician."

- "Dr. Shinaman is one of the very best doctors I've ever seen. He's extremely knowledgeable, very professional, exceptionally personable, and has helped me immensely with my lower back pain."

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our practice specializes in treating various pain conditions with a focus on improving quality of life. We offer advanced diagnostic procedures and innovative treatment options that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, call us at +1 925-886-2817. Experience the difference that expert, compassionate pain management can make in your life.

column2: California Back & Pain Specialists: Vikram Singh, M.D.
column3:
California Back & Pain Specialists serves Van Nuys, CA with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Vikram Singh, M.D. Our specialized clinic focuses on addressing chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function. Patients seeking relief from back pain, neck pain, and other chronic pain conditions can find professional pain management services at our conveniently located facility.

Our pain management practice offers a range of evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Dr. Singh and our medical team utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain before developing customized treatment plans.

Treatment options include:

- Comprehensive pain evaluations

- Medication management

- Interventional procedures

- Physical therapy recommendations

- Rehabilitation services

Our Facility

Located at 6640 Van Nuys Blvd, Suite 101 in Van Nuys, California Back & Pain Specialists provides a professional medical environment designed with patient comfort in mind. Our clinic is equipped with modern medical technology to ensure accurate diagnoses and effective treatments.

Patient Experience

We strive to create a supportive atmosphere where patients feel heard and respected. Our administrative team works diligently to manage appointments efficiently, though patients should be prepared for potential wait times during busy periods. For appointments or questions, patients can reach our office at +1 818-884-5480.

Why Choose Us

Dr. Singh brings specialized expertise in pain management to each patient interaction. Our approach focuses on developing comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain conditions. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we're committed to helping our patients find relief and improve their overall quality of life.

They gave me a generic diagnosis and handed me a bunch of brochures only mentioned INJECTIONS & SURGERY. It was clear they were just trying to upsell me on unnecessary procedures.They pushed me into scheduling more EXPENSIVE appointments, without offering any real solution for my pain.

Seeing the "I do not recommend" "avoid at all costs", I was like "why'd my attorney send me here out of all places?" To start, when you walk into the building, it's spotless. The interior design is beautiful. Then the front desk girls are so nice and funny. They got me all set up with the paperwork because I didn't fill out a half that's on their website, but it was no big deal. I waited a little while because they were busy, and then Dr. Lurye came up to me and introduced himself. He was fun and interesting to talk to. He went over my past MRI's with me and told me all of my options for treatment. I agreed to physical therapy, so we'll see how it goes :) thank you!|The best part of this clinic is the people up front. The lady's and Juan, do an awesome job, assisting with any questions or concerns and setting up appointments is easy. The wait time for my procedure was rather long, the patient before me had major procedure done which is why I had to wait as long as I did. I would suggest they manage the patients times better.|Worst place ever. Avoid at all cost. My lawyer sent me here for my motorcycle accident. They never return your calls. I was supposed to get 3 epidural injections. Only got one. They never scheduled me for the other ones. My case closed and I needed a refill on my meds. They flat out refused to refill the meds and said it's not their problem. To go to my primary care doctor if I needed medications. I told the manager that that was illegal. They can't just refuse treatment and stop seeing me without me having medication to get me through till I'm able to get in with another doctor.  I told he I wanted to file a complaint. She said she didn't care and for me to get an attorney if I wanted to file a complaint. Worst customer service in the world. I don't know how she could even be a manager. In my opinion this place is not worth the thousands of dollars  they billed my lawyers office. Avoid at all cost.|I HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND COMING TO THIS CLINIC. Here is some details about this clinic. To begin my first appointment was schedule an appointment a month ahead and the day before my appointment they called me to reschedule my appointment. I had already made that day my injection day and I wasn't going to work but until the day before they called to reschedule.
I reschedule my appointment and today was my second reschedule appointment. While being in the waiting room. The room was empty and there were like about 3 people in total in the room they told me that my wife had to leave and wait outside. That's ridiculous that they sent my wife outside in this extreme heat. Not only that but there were another two people that were behind me and they went inside and only one was getting injected. I felt extremely discriminated because there was rarely anybody inside the room and they were kicking my wife out. This is the second time i come to this clinic and  the security gaurd always looked at me in a disgusted way like if I was a homeless or a dangerous. Not only that but they let the security gaurd in but not the customers. This is unacceptable. I recommend taking your business somewhere else.|Amazing migraine doctor, I've been suffering from chronic migraines for 10+ years, I went from one doctor to the next trying to find relief, I finally found Dr. Singh. On my 1st visit I ended up getting a migraine in the office, (nausea, blind spots, pain, all the horrible effects aside from just the pain), they immediately gave me an epi pen type of injection called sumavel and it immediately stopped the migraine. No other doctors I'd seen had even heard of this
medication! Dr Singh is always on top of latest medications for migraines, great listener, great staff. Highly recommend him. I've been a patient for over 5 years, and while the sumavel stopped working for me after a few months, he and his staff are always on the cutting edge of the newest meds and treatments, working tirelessly to help manage my symptoms.

column48: Why is the wait so long. My appointment was scheduled for 11:30a.m. It is now 12:17pm.
column49: I am sorry to hear that the wait was over 30 minutes. We provide our paperwork online for patients to fill out prior to their appointment, which speeds up the wait time. We also want to emphasize that arriving 10 minutes prior to your appointment will allow you to be seen by a doctor faster. If a doctors schedule has been pushed back due to surgery or any other reason, we will make sure that you are aware of the longer wait and do everything that we can in order to get you in faster.

column3:
Pain Clinics of Central California - Stockton, CA

Pain Clinics of Central California serves the Stockton, CA area with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to help patients regain control of their lives. Our specialized team provides the most advanced techniques to reduce and control chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We welcome new patients seeking relief from debilitating pain conditions at our modern facility located on Precissi Lane.

Our clinic specializes in a wide range of pain management treatments including therapeutic injections, medication management, and innovative interventional procedures. Our physicians take time to thoroughly review diagnostic imaging, conduct detailed examinations, and listen carefully to each patient's description of their symptoms before developing customized treatment plans.

Expert Medical Team

Our pain management physicians bring extensive experience in treating various chronic pain conditions. Dr. Letsa, one of our highly regarded providers, has received particular praise from patients for her thorough approach and compassionate care. Our medical team stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to offer the most effective treatments available.

Patient Experiences

Many patients have shared positive experiences about their care at our clinic:

Robert Contreras noted: "They truly listen to their patients and have a desire to help. We're finally getting our life back and finding joy in living again."

Heather Long shared: "Amazing healthcare does exist! After several treatments and a couple of visits, I'm happy to say I'm just about 80% better now. The injections were nearly painless and almost immediately effective."

While we strive for excellence, we acknowledge that some patients have experienced challenges with appointment scheduling and phone communication. We continuously work to improve these aspects of our service.

Location and Contact Information

Address: 4505 Precissi Ln STE A, Stockton, CA 95207

Phone: +1 833-478-1818

Hours: Please call for current office hours

New patients are always welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans. Contact our office today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

1.	Appointment Delay: The doctor was 35 minutes late for my appointment. When I arrived, the previous patient's appointment has NOT even started... This indicates extremely poor time management.

2.	Outdated Facility: The furniture and equipment in the office seemed outdated and in need of maintenance, which affected the overall experience.

3.	Inaccurate Diagnosis: While the doctor was friendly and talkative, his medical knowledge is poor. I came in for a consultation about left hip pain but was given an MRI referral for my left shoulder instead...

4.	Billing Issues: I was shocked to receive a bill that was over 10 times higher than expected. Reaching the billing department was challenging since only one person is working for billing and she's out of office half the time. When I finally spoke with someone, I was told the issue was due to my insurance. I later discovered that the doctor is not in-network with major insurance companies like Anthem or Cigna, despite initial impressions given over the phone that they were. They are only in-network with something called Multi-plan, which led to much higher costs for me.

Conclusion: Based on my experience, I would recommend avoiding this practice due to lack of transparency and issues with both service and billing.|Always professional, always caring. If you don't need the meds, Dr Nissan is the doctor to see.|Dr Nissan is a very good and compassionate Doctor. Soft spoken and gentle. He listens to you and tries his best to help with your pain.|I had a T11-L3 fusion in 2003. I had been in extreme pain ever since I broke my back, until I found Dr. Nissan. I had tried everything suggested to me, even Ozone Injections, Blood Cot Matrix injections, Pulsed Electro Magnetic Field Therapy, Cox chiropractic, and more. Somethings helped somewhat, but no real relief for extended period of time, mostly less than a month. I tried two other pain specialists that gave steroid injections, but relief was not great and did not last long. My pain level was always 6-8, and often a 9 or 10. Getting very frustrated, I searched for a new pain doctor, and I found Dr. Nissan. He performed a total of 4 steroid injections on me at L3-L4, L4-L5, SI joint, and L hip in 2019.  That is the best I had felt since breaking my back!! I am so grateful for Dr. Nissan and his excellent care. He is so compassionate, a great listener, and he really cares about his patients. After seeing multiple doctors, therapists, chiropractors, etc., Dr Nissan is the only one who really got me any significant and lasting relief. I highly recommend him. In late 2019 I moved too far to be able to see him for treatments, and I have yet to find another pain specialist even half as good as Dr. Nissan.|Not that I'm pain-free--that's not going to happen with Fibromyalgia and aging faculties--but I'm better. Dr. Nissan has not only helped me regain a level of physical functionality that I can live with as a woman in her 50s, but he has also played an important role in restoring my dignity and confidence, not as another statistic of chronic pain sufferers added to the list, but as my own woman of color who deals with chronic and acute pain symptoms. Having him on my medical team has been fantastic! If you live in the Inland Valley and are looking for individualized     , look no further.|Very caring doctor the best medical pain specialist in Southern California!

Expert Pain Management in Napa

As qualified physicians who deal with painful conditions daily, we understand the debilitating impact chronic pain can have on your quality of life. column40:
I've had this happen twice to me but the most recent is absolutely ridiculous. The first time I was prescribed a medication for my back and waited days to hear back only to have my pharmacy tell me it's never been sent in so I called they gaslit me and said it was sent in, I accepted that answer sighed and hung up and magically the pharmacy got the script shortly after. Then this most recent time I waited a whole week and nothing so I called and nothing, then I called the next day and waited on hold for over 20 mins for them to tell me it was my fault the prescription wasn't sent in because I didn't hand over my old meds. I was never told this, they never called to tell me and I wouldn't have known unless I called, it also doesn't take 20 mins to come up with that. I will still come but have an advocate because these people DO NOT CARE about their mentally ill patients and have no accommodations for people like me. No communication and if you reach out it is absolutely horrendous. They weren't short staffed either so there's no excuse|**UPDATE: FOLLOW-UP APPOINTMENT**

Prior to my mother's follow-up appointment, I called the office to confirm the time. It took multiple tries to reach the front desk, and unfortunately the same receptionist answered the phone and responded in the same manner, rude and dismissive. Not even a, "Have a nice day" at the end of the call.

By this point I am contemplating not even coming back, but this isn't about me it's for my mother. While we were in the waiting area for her name to be called, the same receptionist had attitude with patients over the phone, like they were inconveniencing her by calling.

This is difficult for me because everyone else in the office has a much better attitude than her. From the nurse who took my mother's vitals, to the doctor who gave her treatment. I am only continuing to come here until they can figure out my mother's condition.

I would love to say this office is great and welcoming. Unfortunately, for the (heavyset) receptionist being there, it is not and I would recommend to look elsewhere.

----------------------------------------------

**This review is mainly for the (heavyset) receptionist at the  front desk**

My mother was referred to this office through her insurance, so this was our first visit. We received a text message stating to arrive 30 minutes prior to our appointment to fill out paperwork. As we are from out of town, it is often difficult to anticipate traffic in the Bakersfield area (I would also like to note that they had not given me the address, I had to look it up on my own). It was in an area where there are multiple clinics and offices, and I didn't realize they were located behind the building.

Upon arrival the receptionist seemed annoyed and immediately stated that we were late and that the paperwork would take 30 minutes to fill out (we were AT LEAST 5 minutes late). I'm not sure if she meant anything behind her tone, but I was hoping she would not cancel our appointment at that moment, especially driving from out of town. I usually give everyone the benefit of the doubt, so she probably had a bad morning. She gave us the paperwork and reiterated how much we had to fill it out before her appointment.

I noticed while filling out the paperwork, the same receptionist had a totally different attitude towards other patients that came in, much nicer more welcoming.

Filling out the paperwork was fine, as I have done this plenty of times before, rearing the end all it needed was my mother's signatures. The receptionist then called us over again only to ask if we were finished filling out the paperwork and stated how much time we had left (again we had at least 5 minutes left before her appointment, minutes wasted calling us over). We finished just in time with minutes to spare, and they even called her 5 minutes after her appointment.

I understand how important keeping an appointment is, it definitely goes both ways. However the way we didn't feel welcomed and somewhat chastised by the receptionist was very discomforting. I will make sure in future appointments to ask for someone else.|Doctors Wilson is great but the office staff could use some work on dealing with patients.  It's made known on the voice message when calling for refills that they won't contact about your refill so I guess if problems arise you're out of luck.  There's also about a dozen different mailboxes to choose from for requesting refills via voice mail.  I can see how messages can get lost in the shuffle.  The receptionists seems to always have an attitude.  I used to bring my father here years back and noticed a really inappropriate Willy Wonka meme taped to the window where you check in with a caption to effect of "so tell me know how you running out of your meds is my problem."  I see that's gone now but that pretty much sums up the process of dealing with this staff.

I recently contacted them via voicemail to refill my pain medication.  For the last four months I had to call monthly for every refill and never had an issue.  I noticed a few days later I had a refill available from the VA website (I am a VA veteran referral) so I requested a refill from there and of course it's the VA so it's late.  I don't know if an extra refill was called into the VA or if they noticed I had a refill and just ignored my request.  Either way I flunked out of the Jedi mind reading academy so if I hadn't noticed this extra refill, I'd still be waiting on medication that was apparently never ordered.  Better late than never I guess.

So now I'm off meds that are starting to cause headaches and insomnia from the withdrawals but like Willy Wonka says, how is this their problem?!  It'll probably be up to another week for the VA to deliver.  It's bad enough having to deal with the VA but adding another VA level, or worse, third-party into the process and I'm done.  I'll just wait the withdrawals out and save the tax payers some money by not returning.|The staff were very kind and helpful. Dr.Palencia and Jacob Osborne FNP were Amazing!!! I Never knew how caring someone in this field could be. He took the time to explain my injury like no other Dr has before. Best service I ever got from pain management! I definitely recommend this place|I have been to a pain management since 2015 just got switched  to this one. I have had more done for me in 4 months than I had done 7 yrs at the previous place. They treat me with nothing but respect and they really act like they care. They called to check on me after the epidural. They actually take my calls. Love these people and Love this place. Everyone there.|Wish I could give negative stars. Absolutely atrocious!!! RUDE!! RUDE!! RUDE!! Uncaring, condescending, short tempered. Dr. Fisher is one of the worst humans I have ever been unfortunate to come upon. She is beyond rude! Comes in doesn't introduce herself when I left I had no idea who she was. Began with a barrage of questions that felt more like an interrogation then a doctor patient discussion. Her accent is so thick and she talks so fast I kept having to ask her what she said which didn't make her talk slower or more distinctly it only irritated her making her even more rude and short tempered. She never discussed with me my condition. She simply set me up for two injections which I did not want. I told her I wanted to know what was wrong and never received an answer. Then never telling me why she says she's going to send me to a neurologist. I quickly told her I had one and her name. Well, my neurologist's name is difficult to pronounce and both Dr. Fisher and the girl who was with her (who'd been snickering the entire time at Dr. Fisher's behavior) said they'd seen her name on my papers and began to make fun of it sarcastically pronouncing it all different ways like two bullies in elementary school. This is professional?!?!?

Never returned. Never took shots. Found another doctor at SCOI and he's great|Disappointed to see Negative Reviews. My first Appt I was late and the Staff was very kind and considerate.  My Dr., Carmen Fischer was Attentive and listened to.my issues. Her direction of care I believe will put me on the right track to being close to pain free soon.|Dr. Palencia is top notch! He is compassionate and extremely knowledgeable a true expert in his field! He actually cares about his patients!

column2: Integrated Pain Specialist of Southern California
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in San Diego

At Integrated Pain Specialist of Southern California, Dr. Kevin Smith and his dedicated team provide exceptional pain management services for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located at 7525 Linda Vista Rd STE C, San Diego, CA 92111, this specialized practice combines innovative treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain functionality and improve quality of life. The clinical team, including PA Aleksandr Filen and skilled nurses, creates personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs. With over two decades of experience serving the Southern California community, their comprehensive approach includes interventional procedures, medication management, and alternative therapies. For those seeking relief from persistent pain, visit their website or call +1 619-398-2988 to schedule a consultation with their highly-rated team known for their attentive, respectful care and successful patient outcomes.
column36: 8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|9 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|Closed|Closed
column38: Liz Fuller|Debbi Lubke|Bryan Bills|A T|James Scott|Ches Westerlund|J. Lahti|George Rebello
column40:
I love Dr.Smith and his staff especially Andrea, Amy,Nicole.  They are always so informative and kind. They explain what they are going to do and my results are always very good.  Thank you for making me feel better and making my pain manageable were I can function abs enjoy life. God bless you all. I really appreciate it.  E. Fuller|I have been going to Dr. Smith's office for over a year! The team and management are exceptional! The medical assistant - Amy  is so kind and compassionate and does such an amazing job. However, coming from a background of surgeons and doctors and OT and speech I would like to say that I highly recommend Dr. Smith And his team. They are kind -they are knowledgeable.
They   will manage your medication and they will review other options. They listen to everything that you have to say and give suggestions as needed!
They are 10 out of 10 in my book-|Dr Smith provides me with the best care, including median branch nerve blocks in my spine. Dr Filen treats me every four weeks and so much more. They are both great doctors.

I'm always treated well by the office staff and nurses, who are always extremely polite.|Does not care about patients. Front of office help is no help at all. Rude should be fired. Every nurse in that front office should be fired. They don't care about patients about the patients in pain or themselves. Once I'm done with this review I will be filing a complaint with the bbb and the medical boars of California and hopefully have there license taken away. I hope every nurse in the front does not get the pain management they need when there hurt and it festers like a bloody boil. When you call an office I hope they hang up in your face and you have no solutions no help and no hope. I will be suggesting to my lawyers to shut this facility down and go to another site. Thank you.|Dr. Kevin Smith and his chief colleague, Alex Filen, P.A. truly care for their people and practice with a competence on a higher level even than other "board certified" specialists. As a person with chronic pain due to arthritis there have been seven or eight other orthopedists, neurologists, a couple of other primary care doctors who claim to specialize is helping people with tough problems, who did not measure up this high.

On my first appointment with Dr. Smith he pointed out that one of the prescriptions written by a "board certified" orthopedist was causing my blood pressure to rise unreasonably high. Stopping that drug was more than worth the price of admission as they say.

For the past two years or more there have been many interactions with myself and the staff at Integrated Pain. Everything has been pleasant and in tune with my needs. Remember there are a lot of people involved when you are dealing with these prescriptions. Everyone along the line has to pay attention.

I'm part of an internet circle of people who have chronic pain and who use pain management services from Great Brittan, to the U.S., to Australia. As one lady put it, "Pain that won't go away makes me cranky." That is very true and must be kept in mind when considering some of these reviews.

One of the members of my group is in Tucson, AZ, where her stories of encounters with Emergency Room people and new treatment centers are just humiliating and hurtful.

There are only good things to be said for Dr. Smith, the Most Reverend Alex Filen, and the staff. Thank you goes out to them for their caring.|I have no words that will convey how grateful, appreciative, and thankful I am for the entire staff, Dr. , admin.
I've suffered with chronic pain for more than 30 years. I am not a mover and a shaker, but I'm also not a sitter.  And sitting was all I was managing until Dr.Smith and staff.
I have a pain pump now and I'm off the couch. So how do you thank someone who has taken you from the couch back outdoors?
Thank you.
Ches Westerlund|A very calm and peaceful environment upon entry.

I was greeted with a smile and immediately put at ease with Jiana. She thanked me for getting the forms in the evening prior which cut down on the wait time for my appointment.

A very short wait And I was called back by the RN Amy. Once again put at ease immediately. She smiled and was down to earth as we covered the basics and discussed our siblings (my sister came with me for support...She doesn't usually care for doctors or facilities for that matter... Just saying. I was honestly a little bit nervous she might get feisty because she can do that!)

Dr Kevin Smith entered the room shortly thereafter and, noticed by my sister, had a full page of handwritten notes that she mentioned to me later...means old school...we liked that. I was very pleased with a no sugar coating honest consultation and the fact that he actually read my MRI and notes prior to the appointment...was a relief! We didn't have to spend 20 minutes talking about why I was there. He already knew. More old school stuff. Love it! This doctor looks you in the eyes when he's talking to you he discussed a few things that were not included in my referral from my spine doctor. I concluded that Dr. Kevin Smith truly wants the HELP to find the least restrictive solution for living well. I didn't get the feeling that I was just another name coming through his office. He smiles and laughs and just gives you the feeling that you are spending time with an old friend discussing the days of old sitting on the veranda with an ice cold glass of sweet tea.

I don't think I could give a sweeter review than that. Thank you very much to the team at Integrated Pain Specialists of Southern California!

I look forward to going back for my spine injections with this team of professionals!

-Jenny-

PS My sister felt the same as me and she's really tough on doctors!  ;)|This pain specialist is the best from dr Alex to the front desk . Everyone there is super helpful and understanding of your needs . They never rush you or make you feel like you are just a number . They have always treated me with respect and have gone out of there way to accommodate for my needs which is really hard to find now. They listen to your needs and come up with a care plan that works fantastic. The staff is always very friendly and supportive and will make you feel like you are talking with friends . It is a very calm environment and is up to date on technology. If I could give it more stars I would they only let you give 5 stars but I would give them 100 stars if possible. I'm super fortunate that I was referred to integrated pain specialists and get the amazing care from the whole team . George

column40:
This office recently stopped providing service on my medications in November of 2024 based on a urine test that was not mine in Jan of 2024,  can you imagine what that has done to me in trying to find a doctor.  I have been on this medication for twenty years.  I would be very carful of this firm|Dr Moon is amazing. He has legitimately changed my life. Six months ago I was seeing another pain management doctor and absolutely hopeless following one failed treatment after another. Nothing helped and I spent my days wondering how I could continue to live like this.

Dr moon was attentive and listened well. He made me feel like he understood, cared, and validated my pain. More importantly he actually helped and gave me hope! I still have pain but it is so incredibly much better than before and it doesn't dominate every moment of my day anymore. There are even days now where I almost forget it! I am so thankful for him and for the relief he has provided me! I am able to look forward to things again and enjoy time with my children without being constantly distracted by extreme pain! Thank you Dr. Moon!|Dr. Moon is more than a Doctor he's a Friend.  He's patient, kind, compassionate, thorough, and knowledgeable in other kinds of medicine as well.  Dr. Roger Moon actually listens to my concerns and He and I both decide on the best treatment plan. The reception/waiting area is pleasant, has up to date reading material and cable TV.  Dr. Moon has great, professional, and friendly office staff members, who welcomes me with beautiful smiles at each visit.  He offers telephone appointments as well.   If you are in need of a great pain management provider or looking for a change try Dr. Roger Moon.|Dr Chou was awful didn't care about my pain. Had difficulty getting medications and he made me feel like I was a burden trying to get them to send the prescriptions to a new pharmacy. I changed offices after the visits. Rude and uncaring. Should not work in this specialty. Zero stars.|Dr. Moon is great and he truly cares.  He has a great bedside manner as well.

If they gave Michelin stars to Drs. as well as restaurants, Dr. Moon would be the ever elusive 5 star Michelin. He is wonderful.|Both Drs are very bad...run, don't walk from this office, but RUN!!  (If you want to live).  These Drs are verbally abusive & cannot admit to their misdiagnosis & in my opinion are most dangerous.  Their "concern" is for show ONLY.  They can & WILL turn on you without warning...give 'em time.|I got my non-surgical procedure/ epidural for herniated disc few months ago from other doctor but soon enough pain came back again. I felt how I became weakened and susceptible to pain despite taking pain-killers and muscle relaxers I was previously prescribed. However, visit to Dr.Moon has changed my life. He truly wants to manage and help me handling pain with various options available and suitable for me. I can say that I will trust him in fully with my back as well as my widespread pain all over my body. Most important part is how truly he takes sincere approach to soothe my pain. Thank you|Dr. Roger Moon is very experienced, gentle doctor. I have been bringing my mom to Dr. moon for back, neck, and shoulders pain treatment and he has been so passionate, and kind.. He gives us as much time as we need, listens to his patients and been always very accurate with his diagnosis... My mom and I are very happy with him and we really recommend him to any one who is looking for an excellent, kind doctor to go too.. Thanks Dr. Moon and we wish you the best in every aspect of your life. God Bless you! (Nadine M. And Vectoria I.)

column2: Pain Medicine: Adventist Health Physicians Network
column3:
Compassionate Pain Management in Hidden Valley Lake

At Adventist Health Physicians Network, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for residents of Hidden Valley Lake and surrounding communities. As part of a faith-based, nonprofit integrated health system serving more than 80 communities across the West Coast and Hawaii, our specialized pain medicine practice combines advanced treatment options with a whole-person approach to healing. Our team at 18990 Coyote Valley Rd includes highly skilled physicians like Dr. Azari and Dr. Morton who specialize in targeted pain interventions for back pain, collapsed discs, and various chronic pain conditions. We're proud to be part of a network of 37,000 compassionate professionals united in our mission of inspiring health, wholeness and hope. For personalized pain management solutions that address physical, mental, spiritual and social aspects of healing, visit our website or call us at +1 707-995-4546 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Adventist Health is a faith-based, nonprofit integrated health system serving more than 80 communities on the West Coast and Hawaii. Our compassionate and talented team of 37,000 includes associates, medical staff physicians, allied health professionals and volunteers driven in pursuit of one mission: living God's love by inspiring health, wholeness and hope. Together, we are transforming the American healthcare experience with an innovative, yet timeless, whole-person focus on physical, mental, spiritual and social healing.
column38: Sarah Sheena|Linda Anido|Laurie Lupica|Kathy Thomson|Don Harr|D Cole|Terri Hamm|Igor Steel
column40:
Dr Azari, Dr Morton and their teams are amazing, supportive, compassionate, and professional. They've helped take my pain level from a 7-8 out 10 to a 3-4 most days. They've helped me regain the ability to take care of activities of daily living and basic household chores. In doing so, they've restored my ability to enjoy life overall despite the residual chronic pain.|I really appreciate being able to receive the Target pain shots for my back because I have collapsed discs and discs out of alignment and so I get a lot of back pain. Doctor Azari is a great doctor. She's very thorough and also very personable and kind. I really appreciate her and her office staff are also extremely efficient and have great personalities when they're talking with patients.|All across their facilities, the customer service is impeccable. Everyone is super nice and professional. All the Doctors are approachable and they really listen to you.|Dr. Azari is outstanding! I have been her patient for many years. I have SEVERE back issues and she has worked with in many different ways to help control the pain. Without going into the long detail of my issues, we know that there is no correcting what I have, but she has been with me all these years coming up with different procedures, etc that work in helping to keep the pain under control. I have so much faith and trust in Dr. Azari.|Dr Azari has helped me find what the problem is for my pain and is starting more treatments soon can't wait. Thanks|Dreadful diagnosticians. They missed a compression fracture in my back. I suffer terribly from it. They could only say I exaggerated. I believed that about myself until someone was able to actually diagnose the cause of the extreme pain. Stay away from here. They did not take time to discover the truth. They jump to hasty decisions without treatment plans.|I have felt confidence in every doctor and nurse practitioner at Adventist Health except for Dr Wilson. He removed my gallbladder a couple of months ago and lied to me about the procedure, saying I would be fine the next day and all I would need for pain was Tylenol. I could not believe the amount of pain I was in that day and night. The next day I called Dr Wilson for pain pills. He said he wasn't surprised by my pain because my gallbladder was not working at all. If he knew I was going to be in pain, then why didn't he give me pain pills for my recovery. The nurses in recovery noticed my pain and gave me an oxy to at least be able to get back home.
I didn't not go back to Dr Wilson for my follow up. I have used google to check on what to eat and what to do while healing. He offered NO help or advice.
In my opinion, he is the worst doctor I've ever been to.|Kathleen did an exemplary job of helping me better understand how to coordinate my dietary needs and restrictions in regard to both diabetes and NAFLD.
I'm sure she went over her allotted time, and I think it's deplorable that Adventist gives many of its providers too many appointments in a day to handle properly for the patient's needs and for the mental health (and sometimes physical health) of their providers.

At NuVation Pain Group, led by Dr. Phillip Lim, DO, MPH, we specialize in providing comprehensive pain management solutions through cutting-edge interventional techniques. My first impression was the cleanliness and orderliness of the facility. Super sparkling clean. The receptionist was cordial and checked me in promptly. Each of the four successive professionals I encountered made me feel at ease as they explained their portion of the process. My wait time between each one was minimal and my epidural was quick and relatively painless once I adjusted my body to lie face down on the table because I could not lie flat.  The only downside was that the Doctor came in afterwards and I never saw his face, but he had a gentle manner that immediately put me at ease and although I awkwardly positioned myself, I was able to relax. He explained exactly what I would feel as he proceeded and it was over before I knew it.  Bottom line:  The Dr had a very nice bedside manner,  I really liked the staff, I was treated very well, and they were very organized and efficient.|Blessing it was really Amazing, and Beautiful Professional, Understandable, in every Situation of my mom's health all personal stuff from NuVation Pain Group.  My mom is really GRATEFUL with the receptionist nurses, and the Doctor With her kindness words in assisting her. I look forward in getting care from Dr. Lim and his staff.|Right from the start my experience with this medical provider was very good. First they called me right after my primary doctor sent them the referral. Second, I got an appointment within 10 days of the referral from my primary doctor. When I arrived, the office staff and the medical assistants were nothing but courteous, professional and personable. I'm very satisfied.|I had a wonderful experience at Nuvation Pain Center and am incredibly grateful for their care. From the moment I walked in, the entire staff was attentive, professional, and genuinely friendly. The pre-procedure process was efficient yet thorough. The team took the time to answer all my questions patiently and made sure I fully understood the procedure. At no point did I feel rushed or pressured -everyone, including the doctor, prioritized my comfort and peace of mind.
What stood out most to me was their humanity. They were not only professional but also very understanding and compassionate, which made a potentially stressful experience feel much easier to handle. I truly appreciated how they treated me as a person, not just a patient.
If you're looking for a pain management center that combines expertise with kindness and respect, I highly recommend Nuvation Pain Center. They've set the bar for what exceptional care looks like.|Attentive and professional. They are busy but fast, in a good way.  All staff are very kind and do not make you feel like a bother. Great experience and next stop 2 cortisone shots in right and left hip.|I saw Dr. Lim today for lumbar pain. He has great bedside manner and just a really friendly demeanor. He explained the reason for my pain based off of my symptoms and MRI, as far as physiology; as well as discussed options for treatment. The woman at the front desk who checked me in was friendly, nice, professional and informative (she also answered treatment questions I had when I was leaving). The staff member who went over my history once I was roomed was also friendly and knowledgeable.

I feel confident with seeing Dr. Lim for my pain and look forward to my first treatment in two weeks!

column40:
It took me 2 months to even get an appointment first I had to get another set of MRI done and then I had to get all my records from my previous doctor Darden and then I had to fill out a bunch of paperwork and then they made me an appointment. Finally you know took 2 months to get all the stuff together and really inconvenienced me and the first day of my appointment they requested a urine test and I guess I didn't pass it cuz the next appointment. The doctor not even the doctor Nelson the PA told me I'm never going to be eligible for any painkillers ever cuz I my test came back with something in it that they don't like and I told them up front that I had this and that you know cuz I said I was self-medicating because I've been in pain for 2 years and so anyway. Meanwhile they've been giving medial blocks and a epidural and nothing works. I've been in pain the whole time I've been with them and they've given me no advice whatsoever. I had to request physical therapy from them and that's helping me but I'm in pain all the other times and they're not going to give me any painkillers and I know that would work cuz I'm not in pain 24 hours a day. I don't like 24 hours a day. I just need a pill to take but I know I'm going to be in pain because I'm doing something horrible like my housework or my hair taking a shower. All of that is painful and I just need something but they just won't do it so they have been totally useless to me. It's just been a lot of trouble to have to keep getting ready for these surgery type issues that it's not surgery. It's a needle in my back for for one minute and it takes one minute for them but takes me a whole 24 hours to get ready cuz I have to have to fast and then I have to wear certain clothing. I have to get a ride there cuz I don't have a car and then I have to have a ride. Pick me up and this whole thing is just so frustrating for me. I need to find a doctor who who'll do something about my pain. This place could care less and I have a really bad back issue and they said so too.|I want to thank Ryan Nakasone and staff for ALWAYS treating me with Patience and respect not only to myself but to my girls. Sometimes I have to take them and then assistance we get is immediately as I enter the door p. I'm in a wheelchair and need help and with a smile I get it without asking. I have lots of health issues and Ryan has saved my life twice due to infections that he noticed as soon as i was seen.  He seen me sent me to hospital right away and my family and I thank him and agreed that this is a provider that cares . Hospital agreed that i could off died had an emergency surgery within an hour. Again THANK YOU ALL AT SPANISH HILLS.|Large off putting angry woman with glasses at the front desk is an absolutely horrible excuse for a human being. We were 12 minutes early for our appointment and she immediately tells us we had to reschedule. We apparently had to complete paper work prior to our arrival. She refused to give us the paperwork to complete and turned us away. She is a very rude and heartless person who seems to take pleasure in rejecting patients appointments. This woman rudely says "If you can read our sign" on the counter that states patients 15 minutes late have to reschedule. Yes I can read thank you. I can also read your body language and demeanor that you are a miserable human being.

We were 12 minutes early btw not 15 minutes late. She clearly had decided on her own her Dr's would not be seeing us that day.

How she has a job dealing with people at the front desk is mind boggling. If she represents this office the doctors are probably horrible as well. Stay away and tell your friends to stay away. Zero stars and she should be fired. I feel sorry for anyone that has to work with that creature and patients forced to use this clinic.|Absolutely disgusting treatment of my family. Front desk woman should be fired. We took my immobile  70 year old mother  in law in a wheelchair which is difficult enough to get her around to any office  and took time off work to get her to office arrived 10 minutes early, between the rehab center and the appointment the paperwork was to our surprise not completed. The front desk woman was extremely rude and refused to give us the paperwork to fill out then and there, and told us that we had to come back and reschedule Appointment . We asked why we couldn't just fill out the paperwork there to which she told us "can you read the sign." The sign says if you were late, you have to schedule a new appointment appointment. We were not late we were early. She told us we had to come back Monday, which would mean another day off work and another difficult task of getting there all to be dismissed on a Technicality on our way out the office Lady refused to give us the paperwork then to fill out he told her no thank you we will not be visiting this office ever  again for your despicable Treatment of people.|I love this group & my Dr. I've been going there over 2 yrs now. Dr Buchanan helped me more in the 1st few visits than all the 4 yrs total at my previous pain mgt office.|I'm not sure who peed in the cheerios of the people complaining about the staff in this office but I have to STRONGLY disagree. I have been a patient of Dr. Kia for 2 years now and not only is he a very kind, caring, excellent doctor, everyone in the building is as well. Irma at the front is truly a gift of pure love.  Elizabeth who answers the phone is always helpful with anything I call about and always has a cheerful demeanor, as is Valorie or anyone else who answers. All of the medical assistants respond promptly to any requests or questions. They are a busy office BECAUSE they are so good. Have you considered that? I know we are all in pain, and that makes it difficult not to be grumpy all the time, but don't take it out on the office staff of the doctor who is there to help you with your pain. They  are genuinely warm, caring people. I bet if you treat them as such you'll get the same in return. I am not related to nor personally connected to anyone in this office - I'm just a rando patient like anyone else. But when I see good people being mistreated I have to say something.|Do not go to this facility and especially do not use Caitlyn Tourje. She is un-professional and at best rude.|My name is Maria Medina and Ryan Nakasone is my provider. Ryan has not only been a GREAT provider but he literally saved my life one day when he sent me to the hospital because he was concern about me on my last visit. He took his time to call me on a saturday morning to check up on me i told him i was still in pain & had fever he sent me to the ER and i was really bad with sepsis and was told I made it on time . Hes a provider that really cares about his patients and ALL of the staff there REALLY cares about my girls and I. I no longer have legs and they help me and my lil ones as soon as i get there with no complaints. Front desk Irma greets us right away and she makes sure we leave with our health care issues taken care of. THANKS A LOT SPANISH HILLS FOR YOUR GREAT SERVICES. I finally found a facility that cares about my health and is helping me thru these rough times.
