column40:
Places like these and Drs like these should be put behind bars and closed. They are what  contributes to ruining lives in our community. Overprescribing their patients getting them hooked on opioids so that their tolerance increases constantly, not doing any due diligence to make sure their patients aren't getting hooked. Thank you pain associates for ruining our family! My husband is now on upwards of 10 a day, lying, hiding, taking it with alcohol....I would be appalled with myself if this was my profession. You give him a prescription for 90 pills in a month and in 3 days has gone through 40. That's how your "medicine" is being used. Legal drug dealers|Dr Barkow, Shasha and his staff are amazing. I had a painful digestive issue. No other doctor figured out what was wrong with me I was told it was a chronic condition, I would have to live the rest of my life immobilized in pain unable to eat.

I went to Dr. Barkow in two minutes he diagnosed me correctly. I did have to go back to my primary because it was a physiological condition that needed surgery. Basically my cervical spine has collapsed entrapping my Vega Nerve. Surgery was a success.

I have cone back to Dr. Barkow for a  lower lumbar condition. I trust him to help me. And if he cannot,  to tell  me so and send me to the correct Dr.

In any case this Doctor is the real deal!|After Dr. Barkow passed, I was treated as a drug addict. Dr. Barkow was the kindest, most compassionate pain management doctor in OC. The new "doctors" are more concerned with money and less concerned about their patients who do require medication.|This review is LONG OVERDUE! I want to thank ALL those who work  at OCPM. I have been a patient for over 16 years. I have had 3 spinal/ spinal cord surgeries and  suffer from Adhesive Arachnoiditis, which is extremely painful. Thankfully the medical staff (mostly Dr. Barlow before his unfortunate passing and now Steve Rhyan PA and Dr. Dedes) has kept my pain well managed.  I can't thank you enough for giving a quality of life that's worth living.

Although I appreciate all of the great care given by the people mentioned above, I wanted to specifically thank the office staff and Nghiem. Many times the workers behind  the scenes get overlooked. Therefore, I wanted to send my gratitude to all of them and highlight Nghiem. He has worked there for many years. Over time he has been promoted up to office manager.  This is understandable.  Anyone that has Nghiem as an employee is lucky and should hold onto him. Anytime I have called and spoke with him about something I needed he personally made sure that it was 110% completed.   I have always been so thankful for him because when you suffer from chthe last thing you want to do is fight with the insurance company or work with the pharmacy when it was an error on their part. Most recently I needed a copy of my chart and if possible in electronic format. As I mentioned before I have been a patient for 16 years. My medical record is hundreds of pages long.  He personally took the job on and not only was it in electronic form but it was done quickly.   Some offices only provided it in paper form, which is fine. It is understandable if  they couldn't do it; but  this just illustrates the quality of care Nghiem provides. I know it's not just me that he gives fantastic When I am in the office I have seen and heard him providing the same care for all.

When looking for a pain management doctor, it's important that you find someone who can effectively treat your physical pain. In addition, it is equally important that the doctor/PA has  great people working for them. I can't think of any better example of an exemplary care other than Nghiem and the entire OCPM staff. Thanks again for caring for me for the past 16 years.  All of your efforts have given me back a great quality of life. For that I am forever grateful.|Dr. Barkow,   the staff and Sasha RULE !! I want Dr B to become my primary MD.  But not sure he does that .. We handle all my pains with  Botox for migraines .. Works VERY Well , Highly recommended !! Cutting Edge in the pain and discomfort field..  Dr Barkow alerted me on another issue none of my several Dr.s spotted.  I've just got out of surgery for the red-flag  ailment Dr B  pointed out.. Quality of life is better already.. Thank You ALL !!! BB <3|I am in the process moving to SoCal and transferring my patient information from Central California to Dr. Barkow's office. His staff members are understanding and compassionate - and they have been very upfront about Dr. Barkow's practices regarding pain management. I am beyond impressed with how far they are going for someone who isn't even yet a patient. His staff is truly top-notch and I look forward to Dr. Barkow overseeing my treatment.|I recently started seeing Dr. Barkow and the team due to chronic pain in my back and shoulder.  I had a very bad day about a month ago and ended up going to Urgent Care and the ER both of which could not tell me anything that was wrong with me and chalked it up to fibromyalgia.  Dr. Barkow took the time to listen to me examine me and sent me to get X-Rays and an MRI. Low and behold there was something wrong and I am now on a treatment plan and getting the pain relief I need to start to be able to live a better life. Thank you Dr Barkow|Dr. Barkow staff is exceptionally nice the girl at the counter was slightly uneducated about all the processes that I believe she should have known. Dr. Barkow is a very narrow-minded thinker he said I was too complicated I do not need to hear that from my man who spent years in school to learn how to manage pain. He suggested steroid injections knowing I have osteoporosis I've been told that that is not a good idea by several Dr yet he still wants to proceed. He does not prescribe pain medicine if you are looking for a multi managed approach he is not the man to see if you want to stab in the back then I would say go because he's more than eager to do that. He will be taking an x-ray of my back my back was my secondary complaint my hips for my primary complaint certainly he should be taking an x-ray of my hips as well. However I suppose that's one more thing that he just doesn't do.

column40:
I think this place is wonderful. My first visit I received a back support, a neck support and a tins unit. They have a clean office and much better service than other pain management that I have experienced.|Went many times for injections, every time in waiting outside the room I hear the tech having long drawn out conversations about herself while I've been waiting a while. She even does this with me when I'm in there with her, I have to be short and not engage. Makes me wonder if that's why the wait is always so long|I had a call from a person named Brooke. She proceeded to question me about injections and setting up an appointment. I refused to discuss the injections with an office person. I told her so. I also explained how I struggle with my hearing and asked if the drs wear masks. She said they do. I explained that I am extremely hard of hearing and I lip read. Brooke told me she can ask the drs to speak up. I asked for an ASL interpreter. She said that it is my health insurance to provide one and not the office. I asked for the office manager name and number. I was given a bad phone number. If you are deaf/hard-of-hearing avoid this practice .|I have been to Central Valley Pain Management multiple times since late 2015 for steroid injections into my spinal canal as well as intramuscular injections for chronic back pain. column3:
Expert Pain Management in Valley Village, CA

At Greater LA Pain Specialists, we are dedicated to guiding you on your journey toward a pain-free life. Led by Dr. Hripsime Avagyan, D.O., who is double board-certified in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, our practice delivers evidence-based care using cutting-edge pain management technology. We specialize in both conservative and interventional treatments to address chronic pain conditions and significantly improve quality of life. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Personalized pain management consultations

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Innovative non-surgical interventions

Our highly experienced team creates a professional and welcoming environment where your comfort and recovery are our highest priorities. We take the time to thoroughly explain diagnoses and treatment options, ensuring you're fully informed and confident in your care plan. Visit our Greater LA Pain Specialists Website or call us at 747-277-4555 to schedule your consultation at our Valley Village office. We thank you for entrusting us with your care.

The doctor is in another league. She is a master of her trade and knows all aspects of her medical practice, excellent pain management specialists. Dr. has perfect bedside manner; she is extremely personable, kind, high energy, warm and has a genuine passion for helping her patients get better. She is brilliantly intelligent and truly works with her patients as an advocate to leave no doubt and always tries to get to the source of the pain. column3:
At El Dorado Pain Management Center, we specialize in providing comprehensive chronic pain treatment solutions using advanced medical techniques. Our dedicated team offers personalized care for patients suffering from various pain conditions, helping them regain mobility and improve quality of life.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We provide a range of innovative pain management treatments including:

  • Platelet Rich Plasma (PRP) injections - Effective for arthritis, shoulder, knee, hip, and small joint pain

  • Spinal cord stimulators - Advanced technology for persistent back pain

  • Pain pumps - Targeted medication delivery for chronic pain

  • Epidural injections - Relief for spinal and nerve-related pain

  • Radio-frequency ablation - Minimally invasive procedure for longer-lasting pain relief

Our professional team is committed to developing customized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain challenges. We take pride in our thorough approach, explaining all procedures in detail and ensuring patients understand their treatment options. Located at 1208 Suncast Lane in El Dorado Hills, we welcome new patients seeking effective pain management solutions. Contact us today at (530) 672-1311 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward meaningful pain relief.
column11:
Chronic pain treatment by using Platelet Rich Plasma injections, spinal stimulator, pain pump and Epidural injections, and Radio-frequency ablation.

Platelet Rich Plasma ( PRP ) is a widely used therapy for arthritis pain involving shoulder pain, knee pain, hip pain and other small joint pain as well.
Please call my office to set up an appointment for consultation on PRP therapy.

Located at 520 Illinois St in San Francisco, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with the latest technology to diagnose and treat various pain conditions. As part of the University of California, San Francisco—one of the nation's top universities for health sciences research—we continuously integrate cutting-edge research into our clinical practice. For appointments or inquiries, please contact us at +1 415-885-3552.
column11: UCSF Health is internationally renowned for providing patients with specialized and innovative medical care. We support our community's health with hospitals and clinics in San Francisco as well as a regional network of clinics and outpatient centers. Consistently ranked among the nation's best hospitals, UCSF is particularly recognized for excellence in neurology and neurosurgery; cancer care; heart care; diabetes; ear, nose and throat care; and psychiatry and psychology, among other services. We are part of the University of California, San Francisco, one of the nation's top universities for health sciences research and higher education.

column40:
Dr. Prasad Shirvalkar is wondrous and gifted. By the time I ended up here, through a maze of other providers,  I was desperate. He's approachable and personable, super easy to talk to, with boundless energy. Every five appointments I've had with him: new patient, infusion, video visit, in-office follow-up, procedure ... all of densely packed and helpful, clear strategy with rationale for treatment that makes sense. I love that he never phones it in, always engaged, laser-focused, never rushes, not distracted, takes the time to answer questions. He listens attentively and is remarkably responsive to nuance. Before my first appt., though hopeful and excited, I was apprehensive that I might have to waste my time listening to a hundred suggestions, all of which, over decades, I've already done. I was blown away by the new hypotheses and approaches Dr. Shirvalkar came up with.  I'm a 'glass-full person' and his optimism further buoyed me. He's knowledgeable and seasoned, knows his domain. When I went in for my cervical facet joint injections, I loved his skillful precise and deft technique--pinpointed in target, smooth and seamless... everything you'd want when needles are involved :-) He does not think cookie-cutter, not follow a prescribed flow chart. From the first appointment, he grokked the complexity of my case, that I've been around the block and needed a no-nonsense approach of targeted treatment. I immediately sensed that he "got" it, the extent of my chronicity and severity, that I'd been managing for a long time. He never invalidated or minimized what I was reporting. Though this might sound like "duh," and you might assume a provider wouldn't do this, I've experienced over and over again a type of invalidating. Dr. Shirvalkar does the opposite: he validates my subjective experience and is focused on finding a solution, on helping my symptoms, on easing the level of pain. He exudes a sense of caring and sincerely wanting my pain to be better; he genuinely puts in the time and hard work of thinking through the problem to come up with multiple possible solutions. He conveys them clearly, e.g. "We've done A., and if this last., we'll do A. Again. If A doesn't last, we'll do B., If not B., ... " This simple 'If then else' structure is crucial, because it injects me with hope. I live on hope. It's my food and water. This is priceless and he gives it not as mere communique, but as part of the treatment itself. He has cognitive openness that does not lend itself to bias, e.g. though I came in with a diagnosis emphasizing "X," he did not stay within these bounds of "X," and looked beyond. It's outside of this sphere, that we found another possibility: "Y," leading to another set of treatments, which has given me some relief. Dr. Jessica Marrone, the fellow who did a portion of my procedure, was solid and I loved how she came in beforehand to explain a distinction between nerves I didn't understand. Gabriel, Dr. Shirvalkar's assistant, is conscientious with follow through, kind and empathetic in telephone interactions. I feel so lucky to have access to this place and their services.This UCSF Center for Pain Medicine, access to a wealth of assessment, interventions ... all of it is bomb.|Dr. Heidi Reetz is the best pain doctor one could hope to find. When I first visited her office, the neuropathy in my feet felt like standing in two buckets of fire and my hands would lock up to the point I could not move them. I could not dress myself. The kicker: something in my health condition is causing hypersensitivity to medication. Respectfully, she helped me find an approach to my condition that has resulted in a cumulative healing path, working against conditions indicated as incurable and chronic. There are aspects of my total condition to address, though managing the pain aspect has taken a progressive path enough to say I am aiming for a life direction I thought was completely lost. Recovery takes time, willingness, patience, awareness, and behavioral change. Show up in the right mindset, hang in there, and Dr. Reetz will advocate for you and see it through as far as possible. Don't give up.|The UCSF Pain Management Center went beyond their expectations. With a holistic approach and expert guidance, they found relief from persistent pain they thought was insurmountable.  Full of gratitude for the support received, they enthusiastically recommend the center to anyone in search of effective pain management solutions.  #PainFreeAtLast #UCSFHealingHands|Dr. Henry and Dr. Cheng and their nurses have been amazing.  I have been in constant pain since I was injured 3/10/1999. the epidurals worked great but the steroids that made me feel better also caused me to gain A LOT of weight. Once the trial Spinal cord stimulator had time to work, I was finally almost pain free.  I can not wait until the permanent unit is installed on Tuesday.|I was never able to schedule an appointment. I called multiple times a week for several weeks, left multiple voicemails, and tried different phone numbers. I got one single call back the very first time, which I missed because I was on a work call. Despite me calling them back numerous times, and having a referral from my neurosurgeon that was sent to them, I was never able to schedule a single appointment.

I wish I could give more stars because I wish I'd actually been able to get in touch and receive their services. They need some serious improvements on the communication and scheduling front.|WARNING! 

I brought my partner here to see Dr. Yu to address her hip and ankle pain. What she received was an offensive and degrading experience and a far cry from proper medical care.

Dr. Yu and his student, Dr. Ly degraded my partner for having "too many" health conditions and chastised her for using a wheelchair despite her having a disability.

The doctors were ill-prepared for the appointment and were completely unaware of her medical history. They possessed such fragile egos that when they weren't able to think of a viable treatment plan, they resorted to blaming the patient.

In the end, Dr. Yu and his team of crackpot students' "expert" medical recommendations were to stop seeing her other UCSF specialists that have been necessary for managing her chronic conditions, spend less time at the doctor's and more time "living life", and to embrace positive thinking to mentally overcome her pain. Suffice to say, the UCSF pain management clinic is the most inept, unprofessional, and dangerous medical facility I have witnessed. What a complete joke. Do NOT go here if you have other options.|I requested to be seen here based on ucsf's reputation in medicine. My MD refered me here 3 months ago, then provided additional requested records 2 months ago. Still no response from UCSF. Just left a voicemail and based off the message, it's no wonder. Sounds.like one VERY bored bureaucrat is handling all new referrals. Do better UCSF.|Gave excellent care. Very empathetic and comforting . Allows the patient to have dignity and sympathy at the same time in formulating a plan to assist the individual. Am looking forward to more interacting with the staff who is very kind and professional

He takes time to listen to patient's concerns and explains all possible options to you. I am eternally grateful to Dr. Sedaghat for all that him and his warm and welcoming staff have done for us. It is unpredictable to know if there will be a wait when I arrive or not but that's typical for medical offices. I am aware of the fact that some appointments take longer than others so it doesn't bother me to wait sometimes. The medical assistants are very caring and Ive had no problems so far. The doctor himself is very knowledgeable and takes the time to find the root of my problem. My previous pain management doctor always seemed to rush me but Dr. Sedaghat is truly compassionate and takes his time. Looking forward to my next appointment|I feel so lucky to have found Dr. Sedaghat for my mother. I go with her to every appointment and the staff is friendly and professional and we rarely have to wait for our scheduled time. The best part of this office, though, is Dr. Sedaghat himself. He is extremely knowledgeable and compassionate. My mother suffers from chronic pain but, additionally, she is a dialysis patient and just had open heart surgery. Dr. Sedaghat not only treats her chronic pain, but also makes sure he is up to date on all aspects of my mother's health and that the treatment that he gives is appropriate for someone with her conditions. Specialized Pain Management in Fresno

At Advanced Pain Solutions, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. One in five American adults suffers from chronic pain conditions, with over 15 million specifically battling chronic back pain. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Paul Ky, our practice is dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions that help patients reclaim their lives. We offer a range of specialized treatments including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Advanced diagnostic services

  • Non-surgical pain management options

Our approach focuses on accurate diagnosis and effective treatment strategies that address the root causes of pain, not just the symptoms. Located at 6169 N Thesta St, Fresno, CA, we're committed to helping patients overcome the challenges of chronic pain and return to the activities they enjoy. Learn more about Dr. Paul Ky and how we can help you manage your pain effectively. Call us today at (559) 435-1757 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Chronic pain is a very common problem, with some studies saying that as much as one in every five adults in the US suffer from a chronic pain condition. Chronic back pain alone affects over 15 million American adults. Living with pain presents constant challenges, affecting careers, relationships, and every other aspect of life. It robs people of their ability to perform basic daily tasks and participate in the activities they enjoy. Moreover, it can inflict this toll over a long period of time as patients struggle to get the correct diagnosis or find the right treatment for them.
column38: Christine Altman|Sharlene Jumper|Mary Solis lian|Naomi Hagerdon|White Family|Larry Kaprielian|Christine Speckman|Chris Leake
column40:
I have been to many pain management doctors/centers.
I have just begun my journey with Dr. Ky. What I have noticed is he respects his patients because he runs his practice like a well oiled machine. I have been to both, his office and surgery center. Both places, you get tended to within 5 or 10 minutes. No sitting, waiting to be treated. Thank you Dr Ky and staff
In case I didn't mention, is staff is friendly, knowledgeable and easy to talk to.|Dr. Paul Ky and his team at Advanced Pain Solutions in Fresno California, are hands down the best pain specialist the central valley California has to offer. After seeing many specialist who either treated me like a drug addict and gave me virtually no help or hope that I would be able to live and even halfway normal life again after my back injury and subsequent botched back surgery that only made everything much worse . Dr ky was a breath of fresh air, he is an honest man who gives you the facts and does everything he can to help you regain as much mobility with as little pain as possible. I had been told by several neurologist, neurosurgeons and other pain specialist that after using a cane for almost 3 years, due to severe weakness of my legs and pain in my lower back and neck that I would probably be in a wheelchair by the time I was 50. That was about 15 years ago,  I can happily report that I just turned 50 in May and I no longer use a cane my legs are stronger than ever and I have a bright and happy future to look forward to. I highly recommend anyone looking for a compassionate and straightforward pain specialist that will do his damnedest to give you the best care possible and continues to educate himself as to new treatments available, that you visit Dr ky at Advanced pain solutions in Fresno California, he has been my guardian angel. He, his staff and other providers in is office will never know how much I appreciate and depend on his guidance for further treatment. So thank you all at Advanced pain solutions for giving me hope and allowing me to play with my grandchildren and really just for giving me a second chance at having a life with as little pain possible, which I had all but given up on, untill my first visit with you?|07/31/24 This is the first time I see his doctor Paul Ky, MD. He answered all my questions and I Mary answer all Paul Ky M.D. questions.
So far, pretty good. PAUL Ky MD. is very polite and gentle.
And I think Pual Mk M.D. gonna do a lot for my pain that I have. Paul Ky M.D. says I have very weak Bones and my nervous system Needs to be improved. Needs blood flow and my blood flow is very poor. That's why I am so much pain and Paul Ky. M.D. help me to understand how he's gonna help me on this pain if I give him 5 Star. That is very good Because the way he talks to you. M.D Paul K y is Doctor  very well|Dr Ky and PA Scott are wonderful. I've never had a Doctor tell me they didn't care about my weight, because it wasn't what caused my back and neck issues. I've haven't had such an understanding PA in several years. Dr. Ky listens and addresses my concerns. PA Scott really understood the breakdown of how my issues are all connected causing a snowball effect. What a relief to be somewhere where I'm not told to just loose weight, not told its all in my head or the classic "must be women's issues". I have struggled to live, exist really, for five very long years. For the first time I have hope that I can truly live a meaningful life again.|To: Dr. Ky and his staff, Thank you.
I have been a patient of Dr. Ky's for quite a long time, dealing with a severe spinal problem. From the very beginning, Dr. Ky has been a great doctor. His dedication to helping me has been unwavering, and I can't thank him enough. His staff is equally remarkable, diligently following Dr. Ky's guidance for my treatments. His staff are caring, kind, and positive people. Dr. Ky and his staff understand the pain their patients are in and work hard to help. To anyone in pain, I highly recommend you see Dr. Ky, no one else will offer you this level of care and relief. I rate Dr. Ky's private practice and surgical center a perfect 10 out of 10.  Thanks to his expertise, I'm out of the wheelchair and walking slowly, but I'm walking again. What he has done for me matters a lot and is important to me and my family.|I've been seeing Dr. Ky and Dr. Scott for the last eight years. Doctors are very knowledgeable and absolutely passionate and caring. There's a couple of negative reviews on here about phone service and appointment setting. I have to 100% disagree with both issues. Whenever I had an emergency or have to make an appointment change they're always willing to work with me if they're able. Honestly I don't know where I would be without Dr. Ky and Dr. Scott's help. They both work very hard because they're extremely busy and take the time to thoroughly explain everything. It can't be easy having to deal with a lot of people in pain and complaining but they do a fantastic job listening to us and helping us with all their knowledge. The whole entire staff is very friendly and always have treated me with the utmost respect. Also the place is always very clean and well maintained. Thank you to the entire staff for all your dedication and hard work.|I am a victim of several botched surgeries, and combined with a genetic condition, I suffer from excruciating pain every day. I cannot perform normal daily activities for myself or my children. Many doctors turned me away and denied trying with me. Dr. Keys is the only doctor that had hope for me and he saved me. He is the most patient, caring, knowledgeable doctor I've come across. His attitude, drive, and humor not only has allowed me to live, but has also made every step of this journey comfortable, safe, and enjoyable for me. His staff are amazing as well. I have a lot of respect for Dr. Keys as not only is he an astonishing doctor, he saved my life.|I am not a patient of Dr Ky's but I accompany my best friend to her appointments often. Dr Ky has an unprecedented bedside manner and is very thorough and efficient. He truly cares for his patients and does his best to help them receive pain relief. If you are looking for pain relief and not just a prescription for opiates, he is your best option.

column2: Pain Specialists of Orange County, Laguna Hills
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management in Laguna Hills

At Pain Specialists of Orange County, we provide specialized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our Laguna Hills clinic is led by experienced physicians including Dr. Mousavi and Dr. Shabazian who are dedicated to developing personalized treatment plans for each patient. We take pride in our compassionate approach to pain management, offering a range of advanced interventional procedures and medication management options. Our services include:

  • Spinal injections and nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Medication management

  • Joint injections

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we work closely with our patients to restore function and improve quality of life. Our team combines medical expertise with genuine care at our conveniently located office at 24953 Paseo De Valencia #5A in Laguna Hills. Visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 949-297-3838 to schedule your consultation.
column38: Madzhid Mashrabov|Audrey Diaz|Jeff Hill|Michele Moen|William Stow|Char Cianciola|michael lasky|Annette Howell
column40:
The best specialists in this center. You walk in and are greeted by the most kind, the best, the smartest, and with an excellent memory, a sweet, beautiful, genuine lady named Sigvid. It is better than any computer, he has a memory capacity of approximately 100,000 GB. She knows all the patients by name and knows the date of birth of some. In a word, a mega-super employee of the center. I dream of having such an employee in my office. My doctor Mousavi is the best pain specialist in the world. He is very courteous, polite, sincerely sympathetic to patients, competent and most importantly humane! I sometimes talk to his other patients, they all respect him very much. His assistant Romio is very cheerful, happy, positive and every time I see him I feel happy. you can joke with him and talk about your health.  Thank you very much my dear friends. You are the best!|Doctor Shahryar Mousavi  was an angel down from heaven. One of the best doctors I have ever seen as well as the nurse and there staff. I do not understand why they do not have 5 STARS.|I share the high opinion of all the other 5-star reviewers here. Especially, for Dr. Mousavi who has treated my condition. He's very kind, gentle, understanding, and knowledgeable...a model physician. And the staff here is, in a word, amazing! Plus, they always play a cool mix of 80's music in the office...thanks, Sigrid Go here, you will be happy (and relieved) you did.|I don't understand why this office has so few stars. They deserve 10. The staff is very nice, and respond whenever I call. I think they probably get sick of me calling but they are too professional to say so. Dr. Mousavi is the best doctor I have. He really tries to take care of his patients, and I am very sure of his ability to give me injections. They are all very nice, and Romeo is wonderful. He responds right away, and they have a lot of patients, so I am sure he is very busy. I think they are very responsive, professional and nice.
Dr Mousavi is an excellent doctor, and very kind. I am so glad that I came to his office. I feel they all give great care, and couldn't be nicer.|Dr Shabhazzian has always treated me with utmost respect and care, and his Physician Assistant, Jill Kremnitzer, is outstanding. They are efficient and consistent in their advice, testing practices, and medications. They work with me and my other doctors to keep my medication levels at a minimum while still performing the job as needed to keep my pain level under control.|I've been seeing Dr Mousavi and His staff for over one year now.  He is one good Dr. And man.
His staff are very professional and compassionate. The staff are quick to greet me
I know He is really busy but He is the only Dr. that has ever helped me manage my pain so well and help me understand my deasase.
They also have really good knowledgeable P.A.s Romeo and Victoria Soto, and Chica. The nurses are very good at their position as well.
I think highly of them all.
However, I usually go to Irvine office.|I am 77 years old with chronic knee problems and have been treated by multiple pain physicians over years.  Dr. Mousavi was the first and only pain management to "inject" my knees and they function at 90% of normal.
Most doctors perform "procedures" in THEIR
surgery centers which is costly and time consuming.
But most of all I remember a visitor who came to see me at Saddleback Hospital while I was
having cardiac procedures.  It was Dr. Mousavi!
It was winter and he was all bundled up for the
weather.  I said "who are you?
I have never had a doctor visit me in the hospital who was not connected with my case.
Dr Mousavi is highly intelligent, skilled and a
professional who goes above and beyond for his patients|Dr. Mousavi is amazing!  He listens to your wants and needs, he doesn't dismiss your pain. I have had other pain management doctors and Dr. Mousavi is by far the best.

column3:
Specialized Pain Relief in Huntington Beach

At Westside Pain Management, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of experienced physicians specializes in developing personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while improving quality of life. We offer a wide range of advanced interventional procedures and therapies including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)

  • Medication management

  • Joint injections

  • Specialized treatments for back, neck, and joint pain

Our Huntington Beach clinic features state-of-the-art equipment and a compassionate staff committed to timely care. We understand that living with pain can be debilitating, which is why we work diligently to provide effective solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Visit our contact page to schedule your appointment today or call us at +1 714-375-1122. We're conveniently located at 17822 Beach Blvd, Huntington Beach, CA 92647.

column38: Jodi Kaye|Dusty Katz|leendadll luna|Bruce McDougall|CHRISTOPHER MATTHEW PALADINO|Jodi Bolton|maria armenteros|Robyn Gerson
column40:
I am so happy with this office!  Got my new patient appointment so quick for the following week which is usually impossible that fast!  Got seen within 5 minutes and absolutely love Ryan and the Dr.  We went over so much and was so shocked and happy that they were able to give me a very much needed shot for trochantric bursitis.   The Dr was so attentive.  I walked out of there much better than when I walked in.  Front office staff are so sweet.  I am sooooo happy!  Woke up this morning feeling so much better!!!  They "get it!"  If you need real pain management,  go to Westside Pain Management.|I just left Dr. E's office for my first visit for an epidural. The negative reviews,  and the doctors not offering sedation for the procedure, almost prevented me from going. My pain made me overcome my hesitation. When the doctor entered the room, he completely put my fears to rest. He explained how he would perform the procedure and promised to not "torture" me. I agreed to give it a try without the sedation, and was pleasantly surprised at the positive results. The pain is subsiding and unless it returns, I will consider the procedure a success. At this point, I would recommend Dr. E|Long Beach location NEVER answers the phone or returns calls. I've never seen the same PA or physician twice. Once had a horribly rude doctor at a followp appt - he walked in without charts, aggressively asked why I was there, then said, "what do you expect us to do about it?" Gee, I dunno... maybe manage my chronic pain? Same doc didn't follow up on submitting request for treatment to insurance.... complete waste of my time (and $3 parking).

They've also failed to call at scheduled times for phone appts (med refills), then call multiple times/day instead of setting a new appt time. They've also phone-stalked me when no appt was scheduled.

Primarily pill pushers, which is great if that's all you need. If you want compassion and/or non-pill treatment, go elsewhere!!|My wife has been trying for months to get an authorization. Insurance company says they have sent it, but Dr. denies knowing about it. Calling is pointless as no one ever calls back.|So I've been a patient with westside pain management for over  3 years now.  I was recently incarcerated and was unable to make my last 2 appointment dates . As I was assaulted by the arresting officers I received injuries that I have not had originally before when seen by the Dr last . I went in as a walk in because when I call I never get a response or a call back for anything prior or recently.  I went to the long beach office knowing I would be able to see someone in the office to speak with about the chronic pain that continues as well as new concerns I was told they couldn't see me until I had a new referral due to the length of time since last visit , as I was able to get the ladies who kindly worked with me on getting my visit and seen today I explained I was hoping to nit have to go to the emergency room for a  perspiration and save myself the grief of being treated like a drug seeker and given 10 to hold me off when I have a prescription just to have the Dr on duty treat me as if I was seeking drugs and not seeking help for the not only existing pain but new injuries I received from said altercation then to be told they were calling the police on me for saying that this was the most unprofessional thing I've ever experienced with a pain management Dr in my 9 years of constant chronic pain and this was by the so called office manager that was on the phone with the front desk ladies I've had problems with the manager before for another issue but I will be looking  for a new pain management Dr|I've been seeing dr e for a few years the staff doesn't respond to calls they are not open the hours stated on the answering machine. When in lobby u never hear phones ring. Office manager never responds to calls. When addressing with doctor the concerns it doesn't phase him he brushes the comments off . They don't fill prescriptions as they imply they make u go without for multiple days sometimes weeks with no relief this office and staff have no regards for patience care the other medical staff will prescribe medications I'm allergic to when called to inform not able to reach anyone. Not a recommended place for ur pain management.|The staff, try's to cover for the Doctor, not coming for his appointments ,has the girls give a appointment for a call back he never calls back:
I live chronic back pain for years, I think Dr gets so busy that they really don't look at the patient anymore. You're just a file. I am now looking for another Pain Management.|The front office is completely inefficient, I have seen three doctors there and none of them have been able to get my injection correct my prescriptions go days without being called in. I'm on day five right now.

column2: California Headache & Pain Center: Chonghao Zhao, MD and Bu Kum Kim, L.Ac
column3:
At California Headache & Pain Center, led by Chonghao Zhao, MD and Bu Kum Kim, L.Ac, we provide comprehensive pain management through our unique multidisciplinary approach. Our center specializes in combining Eastern and Western medical practices to deliver exceptional care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Our Specialized Services

  • Fluoroscopy guided interventional pain procedures for difficult headache, neck pain, and low back pain

  • Multidisciplinary treatment models with proven success rates

  • Integrated Eastern and Western medicine techniques

  • Personalized pain management plans

We are committed to delivering medical excellence to all our headache and pain patients. Our priority is helping patients regain the best possible quality of life through targeted, effective treatments. Our state-of-the-art facility in San Gabriel offers a comfortable environment where patients receive compassionate care from our experienced team. Visit California Headache & Pain Center or call us at +1 626-457-1688 to schedule your consultation at our location: 420 W Las Tunas Dr, San Gabriel, CA 91776.
column11:
California Headache and Pain Center is a multi-specialty medical center that provides:
*Fluoroscopy guided interventional pain procedure for difficult headache, neck pain, and low back pain.
*Multidisciplinary treatment model with great success.
*Practicing the arts of the Eastern and Western medicine

The staff at California Headache and Pain Center are committed to deliver medical excellence to all headache and pain patients. Our priority is to help them regain the best possible quality of life!
column38: Presh Villa|Katharina Chen|Pamela Edwards|R&R TRANSPORTERS|Alex Gaffney|Alanda Ubiarco|Tien Design|Josh Adell
column40:
I trust Dr. Zhao, the only doctor who puts his finger on the exact spot I have pain. Unfortunately I have some permanent back issues, disc's & aging deterioration but the special injections that look scary but then aren't because...Dr. Zhao knows what he is doing, actually work. Neck injection today and I can turn my head again within 3 minutes. He's the best. Appointment times are reasonable and my insurance covers 97% of my treatments. And 1st floor is the nicest acupuncturist you'll meet.|Bad experience. We had an appointment and we arrived at time (we actually arrived 10mins earlier), then we waited more than a hour, and the nurse at front told us there are still two patients before us. What is the point I made an appointment ?! This was not the first time happened to us!! The worse time we waited was more than two hours. We waited in the front ,then when they called us, we went to another room for waiting. The Doctor we visited is only work on Thursday, but I think he handle more patience than he capable of so he can earn more. Btw the front desk was not than friendly when I asked how long I still need to wait. I am about to find another specialist, I can't waste half day in there every time I visit.|Highly recommend!  I've been to several pain management doctor's,  by far Dr. Zhao is the best.  He takes his time with you, listens!  He truly cares.  Since I have been seeing him, my pain has improved tremendously.   Best staff!|I have been a patient of this clinic for over 1 year, my low back pain is a lot better. I thank Dr. Zhao and his staff for helping me thru my recovery.  There are some days that you have to wait to see the doctor and your appointment time may be delay, but that is because Dr. Zhao takes his time with each patient and often performs urgent procedures, like he did on me on several occasions. He is a great doctor who cares and listen to all your complains.  I am so glad I found him and his team.

His office is very clean, and peaceful. The front desk very polite and professional. They do charge a fee for the use of credit card, but I did my research and it is legal, according to the California department of justice.

This doctor is definitely worth the drive and wait!|I have found almost complete relief from lower back pain with Dr. Zhao. I had two injections over a year ago, and I have had only occasional flare-ups. The no drug policy is so smart and so helpful. The doctor is wonderful as is the entire friendly staff. I highly recommend a visit to this center.|Been going there since last summer and I must say we have always been treated well. The doctors and the staff are very professional. Elizabeth and Stacey (girls at the front desk) are kind, welcoming and always greet us with a smile. Moreover, they have made a great difference in managing my back and leg pain for the past six months. Highly recommend Dr. Kim and Dr. Faruque.|Same person here from Yelp!

This pain center is a life saver. When I first came in, I had pain that felt like death to me... I was hopeless and didn't know how I could go on. I had my consultation with Dr. Faroque, then had the injection shot to my spine. My swelling was so bad that we were unable to get all the medicine inside, but the slight medication that went in did make a difference. From there, I went on to want to focus on acupuncture and physical therapy only. Dr. Kim who helped with my acupuncture therapy is amazing. She is very kind, and really cares for her patients (me). With Dr. Kim and the physical therapy team, my back is pretty much better. I still come by for my back stiffness here and there. I am really glad my Doctor recommended me. Thank you Dr. Faroque, Dr. Kim, the physical therapy team and to the nice front desk staff. Whoever is going through any pain, trust me I've been there. There is hope with Cali Headache and Pain center!|Excellent comprehensive care! From physical therapy, to cognitive therapy, bio-feedback, acupuncture, etc. Dr. Zhao takes time to write detailed notes. He knows me well, and my headaches have improved 85 to 90 percent. I used to have headaches 15 times a month or more. I am now down to maybe 2 a month. Thanks to medication, therapy, diet, a consistent sleep schedule, mediation, massage therapy, and hope. Dr. Zhao and Dr. Diep (sleep specialist) have helped me tremendously.

column38: Super Signs|Albert L.|Jerri Johnson|Michael Hawkins|Linda K.|Catherine Falk|Ashley Eung|Melissa Freeark
column40:
I love the staff, the one sweetest receptionist is the most polite Asian woman and I am blanking on her name. She may be one of the kindest customer service representative I've ever encountered at any office ever.

As for the doctor..... I can not get one single word in. If I try to it's "LET ME FINISH" he talks one million miles a minute. I'm trying to explain what is causing the pain. He doesn't want to hear it. It's his way or no way. It's frustrating because I have an actual severe injury and I cant do daily routines or activities.

He is pushing a very unheard of amount of gabapentin on me so he can make my pain medication dose lower. My psychiatrist said it was an absurd amount. It makes you loopy and incoherent. He needs to learn some bedside manners, be a little more polite and be a little less egotistical. He doesn't want to hear what the patient has to say. I've been on the same medication for 5 years (gabapentin) and he just keeps upping it and I told him I wasn't comfortable with that. He doesn't care. I told him the results it gave me and it went in one ear and right out the other.

The weaning down of the pain medication he  Abruptly decided to do during the most painful time of my recovery. But he wouldn't let me speak so I couldn't get that out. I'm just going to have to call at the end of the month and tell him when I am out of my medication.

The last few appointments I've had, I leave the office or the phone call thinking about all the things I wanted to tell him throughout that appointment that he would not let me get a word out. (Which is crazy because I'm A very social and outgoing person) I think I'm going to have to look for a new pain management doctor unless he starts actually listening to the patient and what is wrong. Not pushing regiments on them that they aren't comfortable with and just aren't working? I like him but it's disappointing every time I have an appointment. My PT & Orthopedic Surgeon want to speak to him to get him on the same page of where I am at in recovery. It's still such early stages and the PT is only going to get worse at least before it gets better. I wish he would just listen to what I have to say. My PT has been trying to get a hold of him, he just won't speak to him.
Every appointment just feels extremely rushed.|The best experience to date. Upscale, upgraded and Super clean office with Staff super friendly and attentive. This is V.I.P  Service that I was not used to.  I have tried 3 different Pain Management office for Spine Epidural treatment and Dr.Taher Saifullah is the smoothest, quick and painless from all. I was surprised how fast, friendly, Skilled and Competent Dr. Taher was. This place might be the Best kept Secret in the Pain Management Industry- I highly recommend.|Very efficient office. Super professional always on time. Proactive managing the pain first then figuring out what caused it. The only group who could relieve the intense pain.|Entire staff are wonderful people. Dr. Saifullah listens as does everyone else. I feel so much better since beginning my journey with them.|Dr. Saifullah is a God send.  Been to about 4 other pain management doctors  what a waste of time that was.  So happy with this practice.  His staff are so sweet and helpful.|Dr. Saifullah has zero bedside manners coupled with a dismissive style ego towards his patients. His front staff make you feel like you are a second class citizen calling repeatedly before any appointment to remind you of your co pay over and over again. Dr. Saifullah is stoic, cold, dismissive, and doesn't like a lot of questions being asked. It's his way or the highway. Since he can't handle challenging patients he'll refer you out to other doctors not in your network at all. As a spine specialist with the same X-rays seen by him and USC, it was kinda obvious I had a TOS issue that needed to be addressed in my upper spine but he missed that entirely. Sadly, his ego, impatience, annoyance and cold demeanor makes him an insufferable character.|Dr. Saifullah is wonderful. You can tell he knows what he is doing and cares about you. I was really nervous when I first came in and he definitely made me feel more relaxed. I had a few epidural shots here for my sciatic and it had been a world of a difference.I'm able to workout much more and get back into HITT classes. The office is also so clean and the admin staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. The back doctor I went to previously dismissed me and his staff was very rude. What a difference! Thank you so much.|Dr Saifullah and his team of staff have been incredible. The staff are kind, professional, and explain everything in detail. I truly feel like Dr Saifullah cares about my health outcomes and has made every effort to improve my pain and quality of life so that I can avoid/postpone surgery. He is incredibly attentive and knowledgeable, but is also a very sweet guy! I highly recommend Spine & Pain Institute of Los Angeles!!!

column2: Dr. Bryan X. Lee, MD - Southern California Center for Pain Management
column3:
At the Southern California Center for Pain Management, we specialize in providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

Advanced Pain Management Techniques

Dr. Bryan X. Lee combines his expertise as an anesthesiologist, internist, and pain management physician to deliver personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain. We offer a wide range of services including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Non-opioid medication management

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Treatment for postherpetic neuralgia (PHN)

  • Comprehensive chronic pain management

Our state-of-the-art facility in Pomona is equipped with the latest technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, taking the time to explain procedures in detail and develop customized treatment plans. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit our website or call us at +1 909-593-1002. We're conveniently located at 250 W Bonita Ave #160, Pomona, CA 91767.

column38: Theresa|Martha Keegan|Robert Garcia|Isaiah Galindo|Cassie Edwards|Alex Q|Yvette Vasquez|Janella Daniels
column40:
This office is unprofessional and unorganized.  They canceled my appointment and was unable to give me an appointment until another month. When I stated I may have to find another doctor.  The staff communicated this to Dr. Lee.  So doctor Lee had the staff call me to tell me they will no longer accept me as a patient .  I'm done as well. I did find another doctor whom was very knowledgeable of the nerve pain I was experiencing after having my type of surgery.  The new doctor didn't prescribe all this medication Dr. Lee prescribed.  Only one pill.  Maybe take the time to hire, staff that is educated enough to communicate with your patients .|If I could give a 0 I would
I had to wait almost 2 months for the initial appointment
When I met this doctor he right away told me he couldn't do anything for me because I had pain for too long and that I had seen too many doctors already, I had seen 2 , and one of them was treating me but I couldn't see the last doctor treating me because I had to move. I asked him to look at records from my previous doctor and he ignored me, wouldn't let me talk, he didn't even look at my MRIs
I told him it wasn't a good idea to continue with the appointment given the way he was conducting himself and he just repeated what I said and gave me a weird look, I walked out of the office
He walked in with a computer in hand and I was totally overwhelmed and disappointed with this approach
I'm puzzled to this day, it makes no sense|Dr. Bryan X. Lee is a miracle worker - He was able to treat my chronic pain which continued for over 1.5 years after shingles (postherpetic neuralgia (PHN)) through effective medication (non-opioid) and injections. I can enjoy life again.|Dr. Lee is a great and kind doctor, the injection that he recommended helped my pain. I used to be in chronic pain, but now this month I've only had two bad days which is a significant improvement compared to before. Again, thank you Dr. Lee!|WARNING! Please if you are thinking of neck injections from this doctor please DO NOT DO IT.  After the injection I started hearing buzzing, ringing, whooshing, hissing and humming in both ears and worst pain across the back of my head, neck and shoulders.  The ringing and humming is  24/7 for 1 year and 8 months now. It has really taken a toll on my health physically with no sleep for months! It's horrible! I've tried weekly massages, heat, cold and physical therapy to get some relief. Nothing helps! My quality of life is ruined by this doctor. PLEASE DON'T DO IT!!!
Dr .Lee will not admit something went/is wrong after the injection.
Horrible Doctor!|Rubbish from front office to Bryan X. Lee! The communication and professionalism are rudimentary.
Twice Bryan X. Lee diagnosed multiple issues while in office but when I got to the "surgery center" his treatment wasn't what had discussed at length in his office.

This office definitely milks insurance with unnecessary  appointments and insufficient treatment (ensuring to require additional appointments). If you feel the same and have IEHP please contact them. They are very interested in Brian X. Lee's business prentices.|I have been a patient of Dr. Bryan Lee off and on since 2011. Dr. Lee is compassionate and really cares about his patients. He and his staff are Awesome! I highly recommend him especially for back pain. His office is very clean regardless of the moron that complained about and said there were ants during a heat wave. Every were you go when it is 117 outside you will find an ant trying to stay cool inside. Dr. Lee has one of the cleanest facilities I have ever been too.
You will never find a more caring Dr. then Dr. Lee. He and his staff are truly a 5 Star Facility!

Thank you for all you do for me to keep me on my feet and able to continue walking!|Dr Lee is an AWESOME doctor. My pain was extreme and he is the one that figured out what was wrong. I am very grateful & thankful for all that he has done & going to do! I recommend him 100%!!! And oh he has an wonderful & hilarious bedside manner. You will not be disappointed. I have been a patient of Dr Brown for years and will continue to be as long as possible due to the level of care, attentiveness, and actual help i have received.   Dr Lin is very knowledgeable and has installed a spinal cord stimulator implant upgrade which has been a game changer for me, I can move more without needing to bring the bulky and painful battery charger everywhere with me.  (painful to me because of how tight the charger had to be to read the battery).  This whole team is amazing|Dr. Lin and his staff are very professional and very helpful. Dr. Lin is very patient and has been the only Dr. that was able to diagnose me when literally 20+ Dr.'s couldn't figure out what my medical conditions were for years and years. Dr. Lin has been the only Dr. that took the time to figure out what was wrong with me and has my medical conditions stable, under control. I'll forever be grateful to him for taking the time to find out what my medical conditions were. Staff makes you feel welcomed and are super sweet. Thank you Dr. Lin and Staff!|Dr Lin and his associates are very dedicated and listen. I have been able to have the amnio fluid injections . They are incredible and there are no side affects. Dr Lin, Beth, Mike and others really listen and when it comes to injections in certain areas get it right every time. I really appreciate all that they do, their patience and input. They also have a wonderful staff of people go above and beyond to help with appointments, billing and getting the insurance to do what is necessary for coverage.
I am very pleased with this office and the fact that they are able to do visits in o e office and a few feet in another building do the injections etc..
I am grateful that they are always willing to help me out when I have an issue with an appointment time. They always find a way to accommodate and really help me out when I really need the help.
This office of doctors and all team members work very well together and are very respectful to the clients/patients. I am very thankful and happy that I have found Dr Lin. I am constantly improving physically, mentally and emotionally. Pain does a number on me emotionally and mentally besides physically. That's a major plus in my book to improve all 3. I have good and bad days line everyone else but to have a dr and staff that are always available to answer any questions, refill medication or schedule a procedure in always a pleasant and quick manner makes me feel even better.
Thank you Dr Linn, Dr Beth, Mike and staff. I am grateful and appreciate your help and patience so very much. Without you I would be down and out.
You won't be disappointed with this pain management office.

Denise|Dr. Brown is a miracle worker. She did a injection procedure on my elbow. She used a ultra sound and found a torn tendon. Dr. brown and the staff are THE best. Dr. Brown explains every thing and is very gentle. If you are looking for the best of the best in care this is the place.

column2: LA Pain: Joseph Enayati, DO, Charles Gruver, MD, Brian Tong, NP
column3:
At LA Pain, we are led by our exceptional team of specialists including Dr. Joseph Enayati, DO, Dr. Charles Gruver, MD, and Brian Tong, NP. Dr. Enayati brings his fellowship training and double board certification in Pain Medicine to provide cutting-edge treatments for our patients. We pride ourselves on offering sophisticated interventions that aren't available at all pain management practices, including:

Advanced Treatment Options

  • Neural flossing techniques

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Regenerative medicine (stem cell and PRP injections)

  • Comprehensive traditional pain management services

Our approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than just treating symptoms. We develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique situation, combining our diagnostic expertise with surgical precision. Located in Los Angeles, our practice maintains the highest standards of quality and personalization to help our patients achieve long-term pain relief. Visit LA Pain or call us at (310) 651-6937 to schedule your consultation at our office on 822 S Robertson Blvd #100.

column11:
Dr. Joseph Enayati is a fellowship trained and double board certified Pain Medicine physician. His uses his considerable diagnostic and surgical skills to offer sophisticated treatments including neural flossing, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation, which are not offered at all pain management practices. He also provides a comprehensive array of traditional pain management services with the highest standards of quality, precision, and personalization. Dr. Enayati also offers advanced regenerative medicine treatments, including stem cell injections and PRP injections.

Dr. Enayati focuses on getting to the root cause of the problem to provide long-term pain relief tailored to each patient's unique situation.

for the first time I have been waking up and functioning well after ten years of suffering .

column40: If I could no star I would. I've been trying to call for over a WEEK now to talk to anyone about my mother's appointment since she's no longer fit to speak for herself and not ONCE did anyone answer the phone. a WEEK. that's over 50 calls that went unanswered and when I FINALLY got someone to answer, they put me on hold, picked it back up, didn't say a word and then hung up. I don't know what the hell is going on there, Lisa was amazing at handling the phones and now it's impossible to even get anything done without going into the office and making a Karen scene. Ridiculous.|Dr. Brazill and his team are amazing, they are very thorough and thoughtful.  I have been to many doctors over the years and Dr. Brazill was the only doctor that actually took the time to listen to my issues and come up with a plan.  He was able to give me my life back when chronic pain had stopped it.  I recommend Dr Brazill and his team, his staff are amazing, Don and Amy are excellent PA's as well.|I've been going here for over 5 years. I started with Dr Kevin Trinh and absolutely loved him. Had surgery and didn't have to go see him for 2 years. Now I'm back and Dr Trinh has moved back to his hometown, sorry he left but I wish him well. I have seen Dr Brazil for 1 procedure and cannot say anything bad. I was scheduled with Amy for follow up and that went well but I don't particularly care to see PA's so my next visit was scheduled with Dr Brazil. He's very busy so my appt was 1.5 months out. I've called every week to see if there are any cancellations but none have been available. Finally able to get scheduled sooner with Dr Hodge (I'm hoping for the best). As far as the staff....no big issues. They have been very accommodating and helpful with scheduling and anything else. I may have had 1 incident where someone was rude but in 5 years I don't think that's a big deal. She could've been having a bad day, we all do once in a while. I have never had to wait longer than 15-20 minutes for my visits but there are others I have seen in the lobby waiting from the time I got there to the time I left....don't know why. Overall, I am happy with Dr Brazil's office. The office could use some updating but it is what it is! At least they may be getting their own surgery center in the same building. That will be a plus!|I followed Dr.Hodge over here when he joined the practice. Unfortunately he has long since left and it has never been the same. The support staff has always been severely under staffed. Which is overwhelming obvious. You better bring something to do when you go to your appointment you will wait for a long time!!! Then there's phone calls!  You will leave message after message..... to talk to the receptionist, to make an appointment, to see if they even got your message because they haven't gotten back to you in days, to order your prescription, to see if they got your message because they haven't gotten back to you in days, and so on. If you have to get a 'prior oth' plan to have back up medication . And make darn sure you answer ANY & ALL calls you receive from them. After speaking to someone in person, 11 separate phone calls, 2 voice mail (or 3). I was told by one of the back support staff "Well I did call you back yesterday. You didn't pick up.". During the same call I was informed that they do not have an Office Manager. I have only met Dr a few times, he is very knowledgeable. The NP's are all so kind and personable. They (and not planning ahead) have kept me here. Not anymore. On to researching doctors|Horrible time management and communication. Dr Brazil has got to be the rudest Dr. I have ever met. Is consistently late with appointments and acts like its business as usual and you are supposed to like it. Unless you have nothing better to do than wait about 2hrs or more for him to get around to seeing you or even calling you this is your guy. If you like to be seen on time go somewhere else.|Always a pleasure knowing that I can always count on Dr Brazill or Dr Amy to Care for my issues, conditions, and mostly pain. They are honest, concerned, and very informative. I've been a patient 3 years at least and never had one issue. Heads up though, set your appointments and always be on time and don't forget, they are very popular hence very busy. As long as you're responsible and honest, and punctual you will never have an issue with them ever. Highly recommend them. No pressure, no discomfort, just you and a doctor and staff that's concerned about one thing only, safely and wisely managing your pain and conditions. Any doctor this good will be busy so be patient and get a referral.|Dr. Brazill and his PA Amy are always willing to listen. Sadly that may be part of the reason his appointments run so late. That has to do with the office stuff though. They must overbook. In the afternoon you have to wait 1.5 hours or more Dash that is the reason I took away one star. Otherwise they are a great place.|Horrible Medication refill place. Let my 98 year old grandmother run out of her pain meds for her back several times. Office doesn't return phone calls to living facilities to get refills taken care of. Even when she was seen for her refill the pharmacy never received the refill. This is unacceptable to have a 98 year old trying to live on her own and now has to go through severe withdrawals because someone didn't do their job. Her back is so bad she can barely get around, but tries her best. Why on the weekend!!

At Pacific Pain Physicians in Santa Barbara, California, we proudly serve as the greater-tri-county's leader in pain management care. Our practice is built on a

Three-Point Mission

that guides everything we do:

  • Precise Diagnosis - We pinpoint the source of pain using advanced diagnostic tests

  • Innovative Treatment - We utilize cutting-edge therapies to ease or eliminate pain

  • Patient Education - We teach valuable skills to help patients better cope with their pain

Our caring, compassionate medical team and bilingual support staff are committed to helping patients restore function and regain their quality of life. We understand that chronic pain can be isolating and overwhelming, which is why we work diligently to provide something many of our patients haven't experienced in a very long time: renewed hope. Visit our Pacific Pain Physicians Website to learn more about our comprehensive services or call us at +1 805-563-0363. We're conveniently located at 222 W Pueblo St, Suite B, Santa Barbara, CA 93105.

My mom had an appointment and she was 10 minutes late because my nephew had to get to school by 8.  My mom got there and they said she missed her appointment and she would have to wait another month.  Not only is she not able to get her refills now, but now shes having to go through withdrawals without a doctors supervision.  The way they are treating her I am telling her to look into medical mal practice.|Great doctors, horrible patient care and office staff. Despite the good work of doctors I cannot recommend this office. If you are in pain, seek help elsewhere. You will spend hours on hold, months waiting for insurance approval, and likely be spoken to in uncomfortable or rude ways by office staff. This is not an anomaly, I have been going to this office and receiving procedures from these doctors for 2 years. I have excellent insurance. But on almost every occasion of needing a procedure the office staff has made mistakes so insurance wouldn't approve my procedures. In one case, they forgot to submit it completely. I would see the doctors and they would say "ok schedule the rhizotomy" and while I was in a pain scale of 7/10 the office staff took over 2 months on 2 occasions to figure out the approval. If you are living with pain and want relief-- this is not the place for you.|Hands down the worst medical treatment I have ever received. It would take hours to describe how horrible Dr Hullander and Dr. Pires are at caring for patients. Avoid them like the plague.
I believe they both think that they are great doctors, but they fall short. I believe they are not concerned with the patients needs but only his own personal agenda. And possibly the insurance company's and politicians agendas.  Nickname Dr.Crusader

Will you convert? No No No!|Most of the staff is friendly and helpful with an extra shout out to a few staff members who really go above and beyond, firstly Marissa at the front desk! She is unbelievably friendly and kind and will always help you with whatever you need. She is bubbly and has great energy!
Also Mary who takes care of prescriptions and stuff! She is always friendly and kind and ready to help you figure out what's happening with your Rx stuff. She is super awesome!

The doctors that I have met with are all really great and nice too.

The only problem that I have run into is follow through with some of the PAs not following through on getting your new Rx to your pharmacy in a timely manner. And they have problems communicating sometimes. Sometimes the arc that you end up getting is not the one that you discussed with them in person. Which leads to major complications with insurance and pharmacy stuff.
So the staff is 3 star average, with a select couple that are totally 5 stars! And the PAs get maybe 4 stars for kind and helpful with sub average follow through. The docs are great, so they get 5 stars!

Overall, it's a great place. And it's probably the best pain center I've been too yet. Which is saying a lot, because I've been to about 6 different ones now. Also, a ton of the patients that go through the pain center are horrible, crotchety, grumpy, and our mean. Or they are junkies looking for drugs. There are not that many patients that are kind and gentle and compassionate. So if you catch a staff member that's in a bad mood, it's totally likely that they have had to deal with horrible patients all day long. So give them a break if you can!|I am supposed to be at where Pacific Pain Management in Santa Barbara on Tuesday at 8:00 for where they due pain  surgery in Santa Barbara, does anyone know?

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Madera

At H K Pain Management and Rehabilitation, we provide specialized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our practice, located at 816 W Yosemite Ave Suite 102 in Madera, offers a complete range of diagnostic and therapeutic services to address musculoskeletal pain and mobility issues. We begin with thorough medical examinations of the cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine, as well as evaluations of the pelvis and all extremities. Our advanced diagnostic capabilities include:

By far the WORST Dr. taking interest in my care. I wasn't there two weeks and recognized how conservative and inadequate my care would be and after my second visit (within two weeks) I had realized this was definitely NOT the pain management clinic that was actually interested in my true care. Dr. Sharon Leano started off nice and through on the first visit but on the second I had voiced my concerns approaching my 18th surgery and her post-op care (which was all I requested) (4-6 weeks)  about the Dr.s obvious direction of an alternative medication than what I had been using SUCCESSFULLY ( but now she wants to put her stamp on things and change it up) so now we're reinventing the wheel ?!?!?!
If it's not broke, why fix it ???
Needles to say this Dr. Dr. S. Leano instead, when as a patient just voiced my concern about the medication choice or direction she was leading to, she chose to be EXTREMELY RUDE, tell me "Well we'll see how you do w the medication" and I'm stumped thinking which medication ?!?!? But before I could gather my thoughts on what she said she chose to tell me basically "goodbye" and walked out of our appointment and proceeded across the hall to the next patient not even caring one bit that we were done or that I may have questions.  What DR. that actually CARES about your well being does this or acts like this ???
SO UNPROFESSIONAL!!!!!!   My 17yo son recognizes she doesn't deserve to care for people. I'm an upstanding father of two extremely successful sons of 31 & 17 (honor role)  I've had two successful careers. One of professional rodeo cowboy (Bullrider) (hence the multiple surgeries) and carpenter (framer/concrete)   I'm 55 and healthy and still fit just had some lumps and bumps from ride'n and they've required surgery. This Dr. SUCKS. RUN. DO MOT WASTE YOU'RE ENERGY OR TIME LET ALONE ANY MONEY CUZ SHE CERTAINLY DOESN'T DESERVE IT IN MY HUMBLE OPINION. IN JUST TWO VISITS SHE LABELED ME, JUDGED ME AND CATEGORIZED ME. THEN WOULD NOT ALLOW TO LISTEN TO MY CONCERNS ON MY MOST PAINFUL SURGERY TO DATE BEING MY 18th !!!!!! YA I KNOW A LITTLE. I'VE LEARNED OVER THE YEARS. OH, AND SAME SURGEON BTW. I HONESTLY HOPE SHE READS THIS REVIEW AND IT SOURS HER. I HOPE SHE LASHES OUT ON ME TO SHOW HER TRUE COLORS CUZ THIS IS ONE OF THE DR.S THAT PLATS CONSERVATIVE CUZ SHES AFRAID OF GETTING FLAGGED BY THE DEA AND JUST GETS THE PAYCHECK AS A PAIN M DR.ITS SIMPLE TO HELP THE EDERLY W  OCCASIONAL  CONDITIONS BUT SOMEONE LIKE ME WHO'S EDUCATED AND UNDERSTANDS HOWTHE SYSTEM WORKS IS A BIG PROBLEM FOR DR.S LIKE SHARON LEANO. AND FOR EVERY GOOD OR POSITIVE REVIEW.....I WANT YOU TO REMEMBER THIS ONE.  THE GUY WHO TOOK THE TIME TO TELL YOU THE ACTUAL TRUTH AND HAS NOTHING TO GAIN OR PROFIT FROM. I WANT YOU TO THINK ABOUT THAT. NEEDLESS TO SAY, I CANCELED  MY NEXT APPOINTMENT AND AS FAR AS IM CONCERNED I FEEL LUCKY I DODGED A HUGE BULLIT !!!!!
GOOD RIDENS   !!!!!!|I am a new resident of Elk Grove. Finding a good pain management  physician  was not easy. As I looked at reviews for doctors, Dr. Leano was the only doctor with a rating of five. I found out why. She is the best pain management doctor ever and her staff is great.|Dr. Leano is very caring, compassionate and professional. She is very easy to talk with, she listens and considers your ideas, thoughts and plans regarding treatment or medication. Dr. Leano not only manages pain issues but overall physical health helping each person maintain and improve their lives in work and relaxation.|Dr Leano is a Very  caring doctor she asks me how I'm doing and is genuine when asking that. She asks me all the time how she can help my pain. I live in chronic pain every single day, but the last few months I've been emotionally and physically exhausted! The past few months my legs have been in a lot more pain. Probably because I'm overwhelmed and stressed and stress and anxiety make my pain level so much worse. She is a very busy doctor but when she comes in to my room she is focused on me and asks lots of questions and gives suggestions on how to find joy in the midst of this hell that I call Lyme disease there is no cure and she does her best to make sure my pain is less. I'm grateful to her. After loosing my primary doctor of 15 years she is now the only one that I feel truly cares about her patients.|Dr. Leano provides consistently brilliant care.  She remembers to discuss all the important details with me in a comfortable, precise manner.  Most of all her personality is delightful.  The office is run by all professionals all the time with charm and comfort to boot!|This is a remarkable group of health care providers that Dr Leano has assembled in this office! From the time you walk in and are greeted by Tracy the magnificent, to whom ever is going to do your intake paperwork for you to the Doctors themselves it is just such an easy and enjoyable experience. I can be a bit of a dumpster fire sometimes and these ppl don't care. Their level of commitment to providing me with the best care possible is....well there are better words but they are just simply the very best|I would give 5 stars however, the  4 stars is only because there has been times I have been kept waiting over an hour past my appointment time.  The doctors and staff themselves are extremely professional and helpful.  Both Dr Leoni and Dr. Kim are very friendly and answer any question I have in a way that I comphrehend easily.  The office staff also are both enjoyable to speak to and very willing to assist in any appointment/billing issues.  The only  complaint I have is the extended wait time.|I have seen Dr. Leano many times.   She is always caring and addresses all the questions I have during my visits.
