column40:
Dr. Roofian and his staff are incredible.  They are treating my wife who suffered a PI injury, and she couldn't be in better hands!|Dr. Roofian is wonderful. He always takes time to explain everything to me in a way I understand. He comes up with non invasive ways to help with my chronic back pain, he doesn't give up, and he's helping me so that I can put off surgery for as long as possible without being in excruciating pain. He truly cares and I love how he combines holistic medicine with modern medicine. I would recommend him a thousand times over! If you're experiencing pain and/or at the end of your rope and frustrated, go see him, I promise he won't disappoint!|Dr. Roofian, as I have become to know him as a patient, he is very knowledgeable and gives sound advice and opinions on my treatment plan and care. He is very informative on new treatment methods associated with the type of injury I have, which is well appreciated. He has a great front office you can tell when a provider make sure that they are up on their interpersonal skills because this keeps patients coming and also patients are a great referral system. Thank you Dr. Roofian and staff for my care.|Dr roofian is a terrible doctor. Highly not recommended|I went in for an epidural in my upper back (c1 area) and within a day I feel like a new person. My nerves don't pinch when I rotate my neck in certain positions today.  Dr. Roofian and his staff are great, and he lets you know everything he's doing.  Finally, I feel like I can continue with my neck therapy and get better results by being able to work harder with less pain.|Miss leading. Office visit is in-network with blue shield PPO but facility to do any diagnostic procedures is out of network with Blue Shield PPO.
I called his office and I asked if they excepted Blue Shield PPO. I said I would most likely need to do some diagnostic procedures so I wanted to make sure they were In-network. they said yes so I made an appointment with Dr. Roofian. He was very nice and answered all my questions and we decided that I needed a diagnostic test.  When I followed up on insurance approval, the office told me they were OUT OF Network for the diagnostic procedure.|I have seen many pain management specialists in the past 15 years.  Doctor Roofian is not just a pain management specialist that writes prescriptions without truly listening and assessing the medical issues.  He recommends natural approaches to permanent healing.  He doesn't start with high doses of medicine like most doctors.  He is not the type of doctor that will make negative comments to his patients regarding recovery.   He gives great long term recommendations for recovery vs masking the pain temporarily.  I arrange to have someone help me make the longer drive because he is worth it.
I truly believe I finally found a doctor that will help me transition to natural healing.  Although he does treat in all methods, he listens to what I want long term.
Thank you Dr. Roofian!|Dr. Roofian is a dedicated and caring professional. He assures that his patiences progress and feel better. His staff are courteous and helpful. All they look for promoting a safe and caring environment. I personally can say that my back, neck, and hip pain has decreased satisfactorily with Dr. Roofian Treatment.

Our Advanced Pain Management Services

column11:
Dr. Jaimish Gwalani, is an ACGME Fellowship trained pain management doctor dedicated to helping people manage their chronic pain. He specializes in interventional pain management - which includes joint injections, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulators and epidural procedures among treatments.

His goal is to provide the best care he can for each patient and truly believes that starts with listening to them and developing the best treatment plan. Whether it's physical therapy, acupuncture, joint injections or a surgical consult, he makes sure his patients get what they need when they need it.
column38: Keith Stirling|Bonnie Coleman|Tina "T" Gage|Tiffany Mikkelson|Elizabeth Partida|Danielle markley|joyce lopez|Karen Conard
column40:
I couldn't get medical records in almost 3 months because the doctor never responded to messages about them from his office. Before that couldn't get a referral for pain management where I moved. When I first saw Dr Gwalani it took almost 7 months to get a referral for medication management. Great in person but otherwise nothing gets done|Dr. Gwalani is so kind and understanding. He is on top of techniques for pain management and has helped me so much. The staff and surgery pre-op staff are top notch and I really appreciate them. This is the place to go. I was at my end with medical help and then I found Dr. Gwalani.|Just went to Doctor Gwalani. He did exactly what he said . I'm so scared of needles,  he said that I would be out and wouldn't feel a thing.
My neck has been hurting me for years , I had given up on getting any relief.  I truly hope getting this injection in my neck will a leave some of my pain.
So I'm giving this pain management treatment Facility a 10 out of 10.
Great staff and great care|If I could give 0 stars I would. I was a patient of Dr. Gwalani about 15 years ago(give or take). My current neurologist is trying to get records of the 2 epidural injections, the 1 facet joint injection and the EMG test he did; they will not fax it over to my current PCP or neurologist. They wouldn't even give me the physical results when I was a patient, the staff said I wasn't able to look at them or have any copies; which I found extremely weird as I've never had any issue getting a hard copy from any Dr. or specialist I've seen.

A huge issue was when I went I let Dr. Gwalani that I had a medical marijuana card and asked him if that would interfere with my urine screens for my meds, he said it wouldn't and I had/have no issue with stopping if my Dr. says so. Well when I had my urine screen it apparently was a problem and all my meds were taken away right there. When I asked about potential withdrawals, he said because of my age I wouldn't have any; that wasn't true. So I was kicked off of my meds for something he said was ok and when I went to make an appointment after that, the staff said, "do you still want to see him since he isn't writing you controlled?". Like I was there for controlled substances, I was there for my pain(with my PCP's referral)and the amount of injections he did proves it(like 6).

My favorite shady thing he did was he once prescribed me Xanax. When I told him I didn't need the refill he gave me and didn't finish the prescription; he asked if I still had them and if he could, "have them to give to some patient who is poor and can't afford them", word for word. I of course gave him them since he was my Dr. and I thought he was being sincere, I only thought it was strange after the appointment when I was in my car. Now I know thats strange and would never do that.

When I saw him I was 22-23 and I really think he judged me with my age looking back. I didn't ask nor want back problems at a young age, but I did/do and expect not to be treated like I'm faking, especially when I have the MRI's(and reports, all info)to prove otherwise and jump through all of their hoops.

If you can, save yourself the trouble and grief, and go to another pain mgmt Dr.; if you have to see him, I hope he has done a self reflection and has changed how he treats others and Dr.'s. As many people have said he has good bedside manner, everytime I met with him he treated me as I was a hassle, lying and just wasting his time; though he had all my reports from the tests I did prior, the new ones and the ones he had me repeat("because there's no way that's right!", it was).

Save yourself the hassle, please.|I had low back pain and leg pain caused by degenerative disc disease for years.  I was advised to have back surgery. After back surgery by a neurosurgeon my low back and leg pain continued and I was not able to walk properly and had limp.  After several procedures, the last procedure Dr .Jaimish Gwalani  performed did the job.  It did take time but being patient and understanding paid off.  Dr. Gwalani was able to relieve the horrendous amount of pain that was of an astronomical dimension.  Of course I do have residual low back and leg pain now and then but it is a lot less than before.  I can walk properly without a limp and without a walker or cane and I can even dance.  Thanks Dr. Gwalani so much for eliminating that dreadful pain.  Also Dr. Gwalani's staff is very professional and caring. This will be the best Christmas!|Dr. Gwalani and his staff are amazing! I just had the spinal cord stimulator surgery and I feel better than ever. It's definitely changed my quality of life. It hasn't even been 2 weeks and the change is great! Thank you for everything Dr. Gwalani and staff!|Dr. Gwalani is an outstanding physician,  from my first visit  I knew I was in good hands.  When I told him about my pain he knew exactly what I was talking about and knew what was best for me. I trust Dr Gwalani  with my life. Thank you Dr Gwalani you're awesome and the staff is wonderful and friendly  you guys rock! It takes me 1 hour and 10 minutes to drive to my appointment with Dr Gwalani and I would drive longer if I had to. I highly recommend Dr Gwalani to anyone seeking pain treatment  he's the best.|The staff were pleasant.  Expect to stay about 3 or more hours for injections.  No problems anyway

column40:
On 11/11/24
I had an appt. I now have a new ins.medicare they do not require me to have referrals, but a Dr. Order my medicare carrier DOSE NOT! do referrals & Said you find your own specialist When I called inland pain specialist the recpst  said I need a referral. I assured her I did not I needed an order. She said OK please get an order from the doctor saying that I needed to see a pain management specialist that was all she said so I got the order. When I came to my appt head recpst ask if it was for their facility I said I don't know she said it had to be for the facility. I said you did not tell me that or I would have got it for your facility. I had to try to get a Order correctly done and faxed to them so I could see the Dr that day which was not able to be done because My primary Dr staff was out to lunch & I did not get the order in time I had another appt that day to get my car fixed
I never seen the Dr & I had to leave for my other appt The recpt proceeded to a short-lived disagreement about the referral process again she said I need it I said I don't my carrier Does not do referrals it is an order I have to have from the Dr She did finally leave it. I am a believer of a person may be having a bad day that could be reason for the attitude they have so I never judge, but I can tell you That the head recpst Had a very rude attitude towards me and ignored me when I am positive she seen me waiting to be helped. I thought she is busy at the moment didn't interrupt. I stood there for approx 5 min I know she seen me she looked up at an Already established patient and smiled at them. She did this to a few patients that had come in, but to me she had a very rude attitude. I do not know why. I tried to be very polite and kind as I believe that is the way the Lord would like me to be treat others as you would like to be treated. I am not singling her out the other recpst that was there was very polite and pleasant she  answered my questions and addressed me in a very professional manner she was a younger woman they head receptionist was an older woman. So I could actually not tell you how good of a Dr he was  I never got to see him due to the negligence of the head recpst guidance in what I need to do in order to be seen by the facility I really need to have seen a pain specialist Dr this month due to I could not use my Previous pain specialist due to ins change, not under my control this facility was the only facility that had an appt this month and I was grateful to find it. I really could have used a consultation and got back on the road to getting injections in my back which I desperately need and one day will require me to have surgery due To the issues I have that will not get better without surgery. Surgery only manages it and lightens the pain that I have but the pain will never go away. The quality and productivity of my life depends on going to pain management. For the rest of my life had this receptionist guided me with the proper instructions on what I needed to see the Dr then I would have seen the pain specialist that day because of her negligence and her attitude of I did nothing wrong but this is your problem lady not caring. I never got to see the doctor and she was not helpful in anyway. Again, I remind you, she was very pleasant to already establish patient. Her attitude was very rude , disregarding & ignoring me
I usually do not Usually give bad reviews, Even when I've had a slightly bad experience due to the fact that maybe somebody is having a bad day but I feel in this experience that I should let this be known for the simple reason that maybe this person to be aware of their actions so hopefully they will change for the benefit of the Dr practice & the benefit of helping the patient, which is the reason the Dr has the practice is to help the patients This did not happen in my case
The Head recpst  had a very bad bed side manner i'm not sure why in my case why this has happened I do try to be polite and kind|When I first started coming here I didn't have to pay my IEPH/Medical cover my visit and medicine nonetheless the last time I went for my appointment they told me I have to pay $30 dollars that was in 2023 I didn't receive a notice or update before my appointment telling me I would have to pay a fee to see the doctor and for office visit I stop going there. that is so so wrong they want me to pay while charging my IEHP/Medical WOW|Excellent overall,I would just say to everyone leaving angry reviews & to new patients to not end up frustrated.
Get a referral in writing (Don't fax)

If you get a new prescription,ask them to check if the pharmacy has it or better yet talk to pharmacy 1st, because if they don't have it you might have to go see Dr again to get new script,I understand there are very strict rules & don't blame the Dr or staff,even if it might seem like they are unhelpful, just try to be aware of that & this is best Dr who reminds me of patch adams,he made me laugh despite being in tears from pain & female Dr is super nice & made me feel cared about!
Staff is kind too.

I would advise you send an email to them which seems faster,& never get frustrated with the receptionist who I'm sure is tired of addicts calling angry amongst non addict calls(just wait to talk to Dr in person or email,who is only person who can do anything basically),understand her job is hard,she is very kind if you are respectful & also apologize if you are at ALL rude even by accident ,like I did.

Ppl need to understand they deal with all manner of ppl & have a hard job. I regretted not just accepting when receptionist said I had to see dr again to fix problem(because I was worried I'd have to wait a week/month without meds)I see now I should've just drove the next day to see Dr, because it's hard to fix prescription issues over phone.(don't argue,rules are rules)
(I know it's hard when you are in pain,but don't listen to haters who expect unrealistic things)

Only difference from this Doc & patch Adams is,this docs sense of humor is much funnier,he made me feel like I was important,& he is VERY personable & likeable like you've known him for yrs. 10/10|Dr Katibi is nothing short of Awesome!! He is extremely kind, caring and makes you feel as though you are his only patient! Although flooded with many patients,  he never forgets to address each and every medical issue during every visit-I highly recommend Dr kakibi, and his staff!
C Ramirez|Please let me say: the Doctor may be good, however, they are negligent when it comes to causing patients to be 2 to 3 weeks late on their medications. There will be a civil suit following this practice due to negligence. They have been sent texts, voicemails, phone calls etc...still no results, they have caused their patients to end up in more pain and going to the ER.....negligence at their fullest!!!!|I have been going there for 2 years. Last week I went back to get a refill. Filled out the form and paid the 60 like always. Then a front office lady called me up and asked if I was here for a refill. I said yes. She told me that they'll call it in and thati didn't need to see the dr. So I left and later on called the pharmacy and they nothing was called in. I called the office and pharmacy on Wed, Thursday, and Friday and nothing. I decided to go down to the office first thing Monday morning. They tried to charge me another 60 which why do I need to pay when I didn't actually do an office visit?!? Another lady came in right after me and something happened to her. The office manager, atleast I'm assuming is the office manager is giving us both a hard time and being very rude. We just wanted our prescriptions refilled. I feel like the are just taking advantage of people.|By far the best place in the High Desert. Dr listens with heart and compassion he is friendly and takes his time with his patients I've never felt rushed or not heard here and I love that. The woman up front are nice and quick and great at there jobs. Thank you all for the hard work and making a difference in so many of our lives that deal with pain.|I have been going here for over a year and they are the only doctors who have helped me. I have a lot of very serious health issues and these people are great. I really love the 2 receptionists at the front. They have a hard job because people come in and yell at them constantly, but they just calmly take care of the situation. I really appreciate this place and the people here so much.
If you do not have insurance it is $200 to be seen. Very steep, but worth it if you need a pain doctor.
Thank you all so much for being there for me!!!

column48: Does he prescribe pain meds like norco?
column49: While he did not prescribe my pain medication for me, as I was under contract and care with a Neurologist in town, we had discussions about meds and he was open to prescribing, if he became the sole provider of all of my pain medications. That is what the law requires. If he's not in agreement with that approach to treatment, no; he's conservative, but he's not averse to properly attending to the needs of his patients. He's a wonderful man and Doctor.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management in Sacramento

At Advanced Pain Diagnostic & Solutions, we are dedicated to definitively diagnosing the source of chronic pain and developing personalized treatment plans that maximize relief while minimizing opioid use. Our patient-centered approach encourages active participation in therapy, fostering mutual accountability between our compassionate team and those we serve. We provide a comprehensive range of services including:

  • Precise pain source diagnostics

  • Customized treatment planning

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management with minimal opioid reliance

  • Ongoing support throughout the healing journey

Located in Sacramento at 650 Howe Ave #600, our facility combines advanced medical expertise with genuine care for each patient's unique needs. We believe in creating an environment of mutual respect that ensures integrity throughout the delivery of care. Visit our website or call us at (916) 953-7571 to learn how we can help you regain control of your life through effective pain management.
column11: Our mission at Advanced Pain Diagnostic & Solutions is to definitively diagnose the source of chronic pain and to provide an evolving course of treatment that maximizes pain relief through the active participation of patients in his/her own therapy with the lowest possible dose of opioid pain relievers. column40:
I refuse to see Raza again. Recently when my medication was back ordered he refused to replace it with an equivalent amount or with something with only slightly higher dosage. He said I had to call around and find a place to divert the prescription to. I got in touch with five other pharmacies and no one had the. I informed the clinic of this but it changed nothing. He would rather that I had nothing while I wait for my prescription to come in. This is not medicine. This is sadism. Any other time this has happened with any other provider at this facility, they have provided me with an alternative prescription. He also has attempted to gaslight me at least once by claiming he told me things when he actually did not. I'm going to continue to go to this facility because I've been going there for years and they've been truly wonderful but if I run into anyone else like this person then I will consider taking my insurance elsewhere.|I would not recommend seeing dr REZA HE IS VERY DISRESPECTFUL AND HE GOES BASED OFF HOW U LOOK . He looked me up and down today and told me that he's not going to prescribe me any medication and said that my dr shouldn't have prescribed me anything. His tone is very bad when speaking to patients. I cried when I left that facility because I felt very much attacked . I'm African American and all the patients are mostly non colored ppl . I've been having extremely bad pain in my lower back and Spine and to tell me I'm not getting medication is very upsetting. My dr referred me to this facility if I was not needing this it wouldn't have gotten approved. I would like them to do an investigation on the doctors because that's not fair to the ones that really have chronic pain issues and they treat you like ur a dope fein needing a fix . It's very unprofessional .|I highly recommend Dr. Raza he is a wonderful pain management advocate. He is compassionate, kind and a great listener. I always feel welcomed  and he never rushes me. Also I am hard of hearing and he always goes out of his way to communicate in a manner that I can best understand , which is such a relief for those of us who struggle to hear . His friendly demeanor is refreshing and I always look forward  to my monthly appointment with him. Plus the front staff at this Howe ave location are so helpful and patient. I canceled my appointment tomorrow with HADDADAN. I am going to Rocklin for treatment. I was not treated with care or respect. He needs to investigated. The whole clinic does! column48: Why is ramdom testing required?
column49: The real answer is not as kind. Money, doctors get a huge kickback per test, as much $3000 per test. Testing is done mainly to protect the doctor, insurance companies and the fake opioid epidemic, mainly fake in regards to prescription medications (The CDC even combined OTC medication to create that highly exaggerated number, which is still way fewer deaths than alcohol and cigarettes). Very few pain patients sell their medication, about .0000001%. Sadly drug testing methods, especially those used by pain doctors have extremely high false positives. Many doctors do not know how to read these tests and will throw out a patient for a false negative too. If one is taking street drugs why does that disqualify them for pain management? Addicts do not have pain? If taking street drugs that means they have access to illicit fentanyl, so why put them in a position to take more dangerous drug (if cut). Prescribed fentanyl is extremely safe, and by itself is almost impossible to overdose from.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management Solutions in Atascadero

At Pacific Pain Physicians, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management services to help improve our patients' quality of life. Located at 8844 Morro Rd in Atascadero, CA, our team of experienced physicians specializes in treating various chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We offer a wide range of advanced interventional procedures and therapies, including:

  • Targeted pain injections and nerve blocks

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Joint and lumbar spine treatments

  • Sacroiliac joint therapy

Our calm, quiet facility is staffed with knowledgeable professionals who take the time to thoroughly explain proposed treatments and procedures. We understand that chronic pain can be debilitating, which is why we're committed to providing compassionate care in a supportive environment. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please call us at +1 805-563-0363 or visit Pacific Pain Physicians to learn how we can help you manage your pain and improve your quality of life.

column40:
The practice continues to change their policies to the point that it's impossible to get care even as an established patient. I'm past due for a treatment I've been getting with them every 3 months for years and have been struggling to get care only to be told today "we're no longer providing it" so all of the hoops they've been making me jump through to get my treatment were for nothing. They gave me no warning that these changes were coming and led me along as if I would continue to get care if I kept trying. People come here because they are in pain. To continually mislead patients who are in pain and give them false hope is shameful. Then they billed me for the appointment where they mislead me into believing I would receive care. They have no plan to help patients continue care other than to tell me to find a neurologist who might offer these services knowing all neurologists have a waiting list of at least 6 months. I won't be back.|This outfit helped me and I'm grateful to Dr. Travis Martin, Dr. Mozingo, and Dr. Pires for giving me the relief I needed in my lumbar spine and sacroiliac joint. I was suffering terribly and was incapacitated and although this took time and effort and going back again and again I got the help I so desperately needed. I will be forever grateful and I will continue to seek them out if I need further help. Thank you, Pacific Pain Physicians.|Pacific Pain Physicians did a Rhizotomy on my neck 3-1/2 years ago, and it's still working! I am so pleased with their treatments that I'm going in for 2 nerve blocks, followed by a Rhizotomy on my low back. Yes, it's painful, but nothing compared to the debilitating, chronic pain without the treatment. These docs are all wonderful at what they do!|Pacific pain doctors are compassionate,  caring, and have made my life have a better quality. Nurses and front office are all amazing. This office goes above and beyond to help their patients.

I would recommend them to anyone who is suffer from chronic pain. I have severe rheumatoid  arthritis and suffer from imense pain in every single joint. Degeneration in my back, knee, and my ribs. I am in getting injections often due to my debilitating disease. Their care goes beyond just patient care they treat you like family.

Thank you to all at Pacific Pain for giving me my life back.|Dr. Piers had an excellent bed side manner and was very explicit regarding my chronic condition. I would absolutely recommend him, wonderful doctor.

My referral has my address incorrect. I live in Paso Robles, CA.
(((REFERRAL SHOWS I LIVE IN GOLETA - WRONG!!!)))|Being referred to Pacific Pain Physicians I can honestly say has been one of the worst things to happen in my life. column40:
My doctor wrote a note telling Boomerang to maximize my telemed appointments due to numerous health issues I have.  They said the best they can do is every other month.  If I'm not mistaken, that is illegal according to the ADA. ( Americans with Dusabilities Act). I asked for a referral to another clinic,  but I was asked to wait until a supervisor was contacted....again. I've been going to the same office for about 15 years. The only reason I can think of for them to ignore the note from my doctor,  is pure greed.  I would think a patients health and well being would be their #1 priority. Should something happen to me while I'm there or even getting ready for an appointment and they've ignored my doctor??? 8 months ago I received an email saying they were now proudly offering telemed appointments for their patients.  Where? Certainly not at this office. The providers are good here.  They also agree that I shouldn't have to go in.  They have done their best to intercede on my behalf to no avail.  Is the supervisor a medical doctor? I doubt it. Who are they to say anything about my health?|Dr. Sabine is amazingly professional, informative & caring. I love her positive attitude and style. I had never had acupuncture before and she eased me right into it and now I look forward to my appointments. She always knows when I'm hurting and where to place the needles to lessen the pain, she's attentive and intuitive! Very grateful for her and her staff for being amazing consistently.|I appreciate the professionalism and caring atmosphere at the practice of Dr Hammer. I have had such difficulty with my care and insurance. I  enjoy the time, effort and kindness as well as professional knowledge put into helping me with my health problem.  The office staff is always helpful and kind and this doesn't seem to always be the norm for office staff I interact with at other practices. I feel very confident with care at this practice.|I have gone to Dr. Jones office for 10 years.  He and his staff are well organized and educated.  As a former Office Manager, I'm very critical of good communication and management.  I cannot tolerate misinformation and I am easily frustrated by errors.  This office is PERFECT, never a problem.  And they are happy and friendly!  I have severe degenerative disease.   I've had neck and hip injections as an out patient with 100% success.  I won't let anyone else touch my spinal column.  I'm 60 years old, thank god for injections they work the best.
Kelly Orlandi|The staff is amazing here at Boomerang Healthcare right from the welcome in and I will be right with you, to do you need help. To top it off Dr. Kairav Shah is amazing he listens to your concerns and wants to see you get better. He really is about his patients and their health, when I broke down in tears Joseph Sims who Scribes for Shah hurried to grab me tissues and it made me feel comfort. I've seen a few doctors,  so many attitudes but they don't realize that I was the one in pain. I drive almost an hour for my appointment. I am so lucky to be in the care of IPM and the staff members. I wish I would've found him sooner.|I feel very fortunate to have Dr Adam Hammer as my primary care physician at Boomerang Heath Care. Dr Hammer is an excellent doctor who is thorough, considerate and professional. Also also Crystal has been extremely helpful in getting things approved from my insurance company. I am not sure where I would be without her expertise. She has never let me down and is very kind and always willing to help me. I travel over an hour one way, to be seen at this office and I have been a patient for 13 years.|I have been with Dr Jones for many, many years!  I can not express how much pain relief I have gotten.  Dr Jones has a very soft manner, he is very caring, he explains what he is going to Do to help me with my pain and follows up with me to see how procedure has helped.  I have nothing but positive help from Dr Jones and his staff!  The staff is always friendly and tries to make me as comfortable as they can.  There happy and caring.  The office girls are sweet and friendly.  My experience with Dr Jones, staff, and office have always made me feel like I'm important and they want me to feel  safe and pain free. My son also goes to Dr Jones for years and he feels the same!|I appreciated being able to complete my health history and sign forms online prior to first visit. This helped shorten my time in the waiting room. Support staff was helpful and friendly. Dr. Jones was friendly, very knowledgeable, listened to what I wanted to tell him and then offered great treatment options. It was apparent the goal was to help fix the source of pain and not just mask it.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions Across California

At Vital Pain Management, we are a multi-disciplinary medical group dedicated to the evaluation and treatment of both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our integrated team of specialists brings together expertise in Pain Management, Physical Medicine, Neurology, Psychiatry, Osteopathy, Acupuncture, and Chiropractic to provide comprehensive care tailored to each patient's unique needs. We maintain multiple convenient locations throughout California to better serve our communities, including:

  • Bay Area: Downtown San Francisco, Walnut Creek, Pittsburg-Antioch area, Oakland, and Pleasanton

  • Sacramento region

  • Southern California: Beverly Hills and San Diego

We understand that navigating pain management can be challenging, which is why we've simplified the financial aspect by accepting Medicare, most private PPO insurances, Workers' Compensation, Auto, and Personal Injury cases. Our Walnut Creek office at 710 S Broadway Suite 212 serves as one of our primary locations where we deliver personalized treatment plans focused on improving quality of life and functional outcomes. Learn more about our comprehensive approach to pain management at Vital Pain Management or contact us at +1 925-464-1151 to schedule your consultation.

column40:
My experience was very friendly and professional. They made me feel very comfortable and made sure to take care of all my necessary medical needs. Great service. Highly recommend.|Making an appointment not so easy.  Left a few messages and got a call back two weeks later.  The appointment was with Jonathan, very efficient, Marie I believe was the nurse who covered the first time patient info,, very thorough.  Jonathan was great, answered many questions, thought the greatest problem I am having now is with my hip, he did some maneuvering of my leg and indicated it was a pinched nerve!  Answered even more of my questions and suggested a cortisone injection...have balked at those but he provided the 'method' of which they follow as well as suggesting a more recent MRI.  Went back for the review with Olivia, there are some rather difficult 'bulges' on lower vertebrae but advised to 'try' the injection to help with the pain.  I go back in a couple of weeks for that proceedure, you can not imagine how much I am hoping it will work....my restrictions are getting worse, walking is a problem, pain is constant.  So let's hope this works, trusting them!!|The people were great. The office staff was very receptive. And the provider I saw was very informative. What I don't appreciate is being told to be there 15 minutes early. Then I waited 30 minutes. By the time I left, I had been there over an hour, which ended up costing me Over $7 to pay for parking.|When I was seen at my appointment everyone was very professional and friendly. They examined my range of motion on my injured body joints. During the examination I didn't feel any pain or discomfort. But that night I started to feel pain and it got worse throughout the night. I was in severe pain and stiff. My pain level was 10+ to the point I could lie down to sleep. I called during office hours and spoke to the person that answered the phone. I let her know I was in severe pain and I wanted to speak to someone that could help me. She transferred me to someone that could help me. Once the transfer was complete and the phone rang, I got the voicemail and it said to leave a message and they would get back to me on the same day. I left a message letting them know in the severe a was experiencing. I NEVER GOT A CALL BACK! About three weeks later I get a call from them. The call was to schedule my procedure. I never got a call regard the message I left them. Do you think I would schedule a procedure with that office after the way I was neglected? No! I lost all faith in them. I wish I could have given them zero stars.|I was having severe hip and knee pain. I called Dr. Tatevossian's office and explained my situation and how miserable I was feeling. The office staff in Glendale were extremely kind and understanding and spoke to the doctor. I was able to be seen the same day with a little bit of a wait which I did not mind at all. I was assessed by Dr. Tatevossian and received cortisone injections and anti-inflammatory medication and my pain was relieved over time. Dr. Tatevossian treated me 5 years ago for pain in the opposite hip which helped tide me over until I was able to have surgery. He has always treated me with compassion and respect. I am forever grateful to him.|Professional staff, caring, clean and equipped with the latest technology, it was done so quickly and correctly, the next day I received a call asking how I was feeling, I am grateful to you, I feel very good. Thank you DR Tadevosyan|The support staff that handles communication with "current" patients say that they are short staffed according to scheduler Stephanie Contreras.
However, if you call and pretend to be a NEW PATIENT,  you get a live human when you call and press 3.
When they find out you are a current patient trying to get help, they get mad.
It's almost as if new patient calls are more important than established patients are.
Stephanie Contreras also takes approximately 10 days to manage any message we leave if she ever calls back at all when the question is urgent.
If, or when she does eventually call back, she blames the neglect on short staffing, then gaslights and downplays the broken communication issue.
She also told me that I needed to have extremely painful procedures "in the office" (rather than the surgical center) without IV sedation because she said my insurance REFUSED to pay for the surgical center.
She had zero empathy when telling me this falsehood.
Turns out that my insurance DID pay for it.
Tatevossian billed for the surgical center the day after my procedure and my insurance paid it 4 days later.
SHE LIED TO ME.
The stress I endured by being told my insurance refused to pay for the surgical center when Tatevossian billed upwards of $23,000 for it, and thinking that the amount would be an out of pocket cost to my family was immeasurable.
Furthermore, the last procedure I had with Dr. Tatevossian, (a Stellat Ganglion Block) on November 4, 2024, I woke up from sedation mid procedure and asked if we were done.
Someone put their hand over my mouth and told me not to talk as if their mishap was my fault.
It was horrible.
Were they trying to save money on sedation?
When I asked Dr. Tatevossian about it, he barked at me.
He pretended I needed to be awake for a procedure I needed to hold perfectly still for. Hence, the hand over my mouth and being told NOT TO TALK.
When I had a Cervical Epidural last May of 2024, without warning or any mention of what was coming, Dr. Tatevossian jabbed me in my upper back that felt like a hot poker "before I was sedated" and this caused me to tense up so much during the procedure that AFTER the procedure, I had such a stiff neck I could not turn my head right or left afterwards. I was terrified.
I wondered if I had chemical meningitis.
I called them for help and got voice mail AGAIN!
It took forever to get help.
Was this pre sedation jab yet another way to save money on sedation and also save money by not hiring staff who will answer the existing patient calls?
He is very hard to reach after a procedure in such emergencies.
Dr. Tatevossian was rude to me and he has hurt me during 2 of the 3 procedures I have had with him.
I believe that he may be running a mill at his surgical center and putting profits over people.
I left his practice not only because he doesn't seem to care about his patients concerns, feedback or communicating with them after they become established patients, but also because he hurt me and treated me like I wasn't supposed to bring it up.
He barked at me for it.
His focus is on the new patients, cutting corners to save money, and getting us in and out of the procedure room as quickly as possible so he can bill for it.
In my family's experience, this doctor has a big ego, and is over-rated. Added to everything else, he has terrible bed side manner.
As his patient, I am already in a great deal of pain.
The Tatevossian pain management medical practice imposed so much extra stress and frustration onto my family that any pain relief I received from a procedure was greatly overshadowed by a huge emotional cost. NOT WORTH IT.
I guess you can't know good, until you know bad.
I have a new pain management doctor whom I love. they answer their phones, value their patients, and would never downplay a concern.|For quite some Time, I've been dealing with lower back pain, and balance issues.
I was fortunate to have a Consultation with Dr. Andrew James Bach, who referred me
to Physical Therapy, with Prat Dhotre.

For several months I've been seeing Prat,
for regular sessions of Physical Therapy,
and I feel way much better than before,
minimizing the pain, thru specific exercises,
as well as improving my balance.

I am Grateful to both Dr. Bach, and Prat.

Gustavo H. Vintas, MD

My problem was my primary doctor don't help out on my other medicine. I got to this clinic and it really felt like they was judging or it was like a discrimination whatever it is I felt really out of place, I got in there and talked to the doctor and told her about everything I have been through. I have been through so much stuff since I was eight years old from 8 I got hit by two cars from 2014 been carjacked and they literally almost killed me And 2024 on April 22. Apparently some lady who did not have insurance basically hit me and I lost control and I hit a tree head on. I broke my pelvic broke my first thing the doctors mouth was a stem procedure. I did my research on that, this lady never asked me about my medicine my current medicine nothing like that. She all prefer me to do the thing that would probably be best for you. I did my research on it. If you do your research on that stem apologist thing whatever they stick in your spine is not for me and I'm very upset and very unhappy. They never suggested nothing else. I left the clinic go to the counter to schedule another appointment. The lady said it's nothing in here and the system saying you got another appointment she said give me a minute she goes back and said the doctor said you never told her nothing, I don't understand if a person has been coming to your office. I think you need to schedule a appointment or talk to them about their previous medicine I think because I was black and they don't understand I'm American. I'm Choctaw. I don't know if color of my skin I definitely felt like I had a bad experience at this at this location whatever it is I don't know if they felt like I was lying except everything I have been through through my life and the pain I'm going through. I also wanted to give a shout out to Heather in billing. She was very communicative dealing with insurance and seemed happy to answer any questions as we tried to navigate the insurance process.

5 stars across the board. Thank you for making the effort and caring about your patients, keep up the great work!

column3:
At Colorado Pain Care, we are led by

Dr. Robert Moghim, MD

, a Board Certified Anesthesiologist and distinguished pain management specialist. With extensive expertise in interventional pain management, Dr. Moghim has established himself as a leading clinician in the Denver area, dedicated to providing comprehensive pain relief solutions. Beyond his clinical practice, Dr. Moghim is the founder of Onyx M.D., a nationwide physician staffing company that has expanded to all 50 states and was recognized in the Topgrading 3rd Edition book as a true Topgrading organization.

We offer a comprehensive range of pain management services including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Nerve blocks and injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Regenerative medicine treatments

  • Customized pain management plans

Our state-of-the-art facility at 2696 S Colorado Blvd #240 in Denver features advanced medical technology and a compassionate team committed to improving our patients' quality of life. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, ensuring each individual receives personalized care tailored to their specific pain conditions. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, visit Colorado Pain Care or call us at (303) 468-7246.
column11: Dr. Moghim is a Board Certified Anesthesiologist and practice leader at Colorado Pain Care. As a top pain clinician, Dr. Moghim founded Onyx M.D., a nationwide physician staffing company with corporate offices located in Denver, CO and Dallas, TX. The company has established a national staffing presence in all 50 states, thereby creating revenue growth that puts it on track to become one of the largest privately held physician services company in the United States. Most recently, Onyx M.D. was recognized in the new Topgrading 3rd Edition book released on August 16th, 2012, as a true Topgrading organization. To augment the service aspect of the company, Dr. Moghim implemented an employee-directed community outreach program called S.C.O.P....

column40:
I have received the BEST CARE since day one! The doctors and the nurses have given me the best care as possible. They are so knowledgeable kind, efficient and know exactly what they're doing. They have always been so nice to me and made me feel special as if I'm the only patient they have. I could not say enough about Dr Dr. Moghin & his staff!!! You can really feel how much that you really care about you! Couldn't ask for a better doctors, nurses or even the front desk. I love them all! Best of all I'm getting the relief I need because of them.|As a patient at this office for approximately four years, I have developed a deep appreciation for my pain management team. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Moghim and NP Hortense, I have received exceptional care. If you are seeking effective treatment for chronic pain, I highly recommend this office as a trusted and reliable resource.|Dr moghim was amazing! He talked us through everything before he did it. He was reassuring, and answered every question we had. I would highly recommend to go to this clinic if you are in pain and needing help. This facility has helped me stay out of pain!|Dr. Moghim is great never feel pain with my injections.  He has been a miracle worker and I am functioning now.  His staff is amazing too.|The staff is excellent, always a pleasure. Doc talks to you and treats you like you've know each other for a long time. Takes the time to explain and make's sure you understand. Answers all questions without rushing you out the door. You feel like you matter and not just a number. I highly recommend!!!|Poor Experience on all fronts.

Saw Dr. Moghim in May for info on peripheral nerve stimulator for my knee.  I seemed like a good candidate and he said someone from his office would call me with the cash price (the procedure is not covered by my insurance) for the procedure within a few days.  That never happened.  I called his office numerous times.  You can't get in touch with them.  Usually I am routed to a call center in Milwaukee , Wisconsin.  The people there say they will leave a note for Dr. Moghim's office staff to call me back with that quote.  Fast forward six months.  every month I get a bill in the mail.  I was not going to pay the bill until his office got back to me with the price.  In September I decided to pay the bill even though they still had not gotten back to me with a quote for the stimulator.

They still have not credited me for my payment.  I called the call center in Milwaukee and they said they have not received my check  I tild them I could email them a copy of the cleared check from my bank and they said that was not necessary.  That was aver a month ago.  So........today I get another email stating that I have an overdue balance and that I am subject to a 30% surcharge added to my bill.  Additionally, 6 months later and I still do not have a quote from his office on the cost of the stimulator.  They make it almost impossible to speak with someone in the their Denver office.  All of the options when you call eventually send you back to the same group in Milwaukee.  My experience with Dr. Moghim and his office has been very poor.|Front desk people were awesome as well as nurse who checked me in .... I'm paying out of pocket so obviously getting some help was important to me ...due to being perscribed a pain med in my past I felt like the doctor immediately looked at me a certain way(as the first thing she said when she came in the room was "so you get hydrocodone" even though I never once mentioned wanting any from them .despite noticing issues that would CAUSE PAIN I felt like I was rushed , treated poorly and overlooked.  It's honestly a shame that due to stringent regulation and societal issues I am treated as if I am not worth the empathy of the person I'm coming to for help . I was considering atleast going through with some of the treatment options but I'm having an internal battle as to weather I want to spend hard earned dollars with an establishment that treats patients how I was treated. Not very happy
My goal here is not to bash it's to hopefully get the doctor to see the error of her actions and interject some humanity back into her actions , fingers crossed

I saw the female doctor who's name started with an e , I wasn't seen by doctor robert however you guys are all one office correct ?

The doctor I saw named dr eleasa hulon
Was absolutely the right forum|Left stellate ganglion nerve block this morning. A lillte nervous because the needles. Procedure was excellent and Dr moghim was wonderful!

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Metro Denver

At MD Pain, we are dedicated to providing specialized treatment and pain management solutions for patients suffering from various types of chronic pain. Our expert team of pain management physicians focuses on treating a wide range of conditions including:

  • Neck pain

We take pride in our patient-centered approach, offering personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual's specific needs. Our state-of-the-art facility in Englewood is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies to ensure the highest quality of care. We're currently accepting new patients with or without referrals from all Metro Denver areas, making it easier for those suffering from chronic pain to access the relief they deserve. I wouldn't go anywhere else for my chronic pain problems!|I have been with MD Pain for a few years now and I definitely recommend anyone with back pain to see them I just had a lumbar and cervical MRI's and they saw something on my brain and had me do a brain MRI and they unfortunately found a tumor that is cancer and Rachel was very sorry for the findings and was very respectful on letting me know what they found. So even though I got some bad news I will stay a patient with Dr Cecca and his PA Rachel because they are very professional and have feelings for me as a patient. Love all of you from Brian in the front all the way to everyone in the back. Rick B.|Dr. Checa came highly recommended, I was very hopeful to get some relief. Located in Lakewood, we fuse heartfelt healing with innovative medicine to address your unique pain challenges. column11: Hello humankindness. It's more than a tagline. Humankindness is one of the many things we all have in common. It's the good within us. The power that connects us. column40:
Mt experience with Amanda Miller was excellent. So kind, courteous and professional with a smile  she listened to me which is very important. Especially with all my issues. Thank you Amanda|All the staff are very kind and supportive. Dawn Eldridge has overseen my treatment. She is professional, informative and very knowledgeable. My pain treatment has been second to none. I will continue my treatment with these specialist.|Amanda is always amazing! I have been going to see her in this office since my stroke at the end of 2021. the entire experience in the past 3 years has just been (surprisingly) incredible. Amanda has been incredibly understanding and empathetic towards my situation, and she has always been willing to almost bend over backwards to help me with as much as she can. She's also very, VERY patient with me and my intermittent memory issues like forgetting to set an appointment for a new MRI (Sorry Amanda!). All of the nurses and other staff there have been wonderful, also. Always willing to work with me for times that will fit my changing needs four everything from appointments to even finding transportation to and from the office. Dr March has been really cool, as well, for the times I've seen him for procedures like ablation. Overall, this has been one of the best doctor's offices I have had the pleasure of being a patient at, and I have never really liked going to see doctors. I would definitely recommend this office for anybody who is also in the unfortunate situation of needing pain management care. These doctors, NPs, nurses, and all other staff have simply been amazing the entire time I've been a patient here.

I want to add a huge "Thank You!!" to Amanda and all the others here who have made each visit so simple, and warm. It's not a cold, sterile type environment that I've become used to at so many other practices. You and your staff make my visits so positive, and you're all always so inviting, willing, and HAPPY to actually help people, and your patients can definitely feel that. column38: Traci Coughlin|realdeal holyfield|Pamela Finley|Mercedes Boone|Kate Col|Carin Walden|Nick T|Peggy Hicks
column40:
Referred here for back pain. I was told it would be a few weeks to get started...that's fine, I understand it's a process and I wasn't in a rush. After 4 weeks of not hearing anything (their sheet says to call after 2 weeks if you don't hear anything), I called a couple of days ago left a message and no call back so I called again today. I end up on the phone with I believe an MA-didn't get a name but sure wish I had. She was shockingly rude. I was trying to explain, with upcoming travel and insurance change coming at the first of year how do we move forward a little faster. She said they need info from me. Some of that info was records from another practice. That practice did send the records and called to let me know they had. I'm starting to feel frustrated by her attitude at this point and ask as nicely as possible how come someone didn't let me know all this information was needed 4 weeks ago. Got excuses...understaffed, doing the best they can...valid excuses, but excuses none the less. Then she tells me I keep interrupting her and won't let her complete a sentence. Shocked, I asked "are you serious?" She was. Not surprisingly I felt exactly the same way - she'd interrupt before I could let her know I had records sent to them and why the urgency to move faster. There was no need for this to escalate the way it did. Common courtesy would have worked wonders. There are 2 sides to every story so I expect she's complaining about me on the other end. I'm not perfect but I didn't escalate until she did. I ended up telling her, never mind I won't be coming back. I'm not in enough pain to be willing to deal with this type of attitude. I will say the front desk, Cheryl, the gentleman who answers the phone and the PA I saw were wonderful!!! If you have thick skin this practice might be worth fighting through the rude ones. I won't know but hopefully they do help others with their pain.|In my experience with this office, there is a lack of empathy and understanding for patients' needs. After adhering to my advised treatment plan, the need to address a billing discrepancy in an amount over $400 arose. After presenting an account audit with all of my insurance explanation of benefits, they were able to correct the over billing. I assumed the problem was resolved and even referred a professional colleague. When I needed to schedule a follow-up appointment I expected support, but I was met with barriers and denied care. I was advised I would need a new referral from my PCP first. I ended up with other insurance and going to another clinic, but after a few years my insurance changed and I was re-referred back to Accelerated Recovery. When I called to schedule a re-entry appointment I was advised they would not see me as I had gone to another clinic, they were busy and that it was their policy that patients seen elsewhere were not able to return. While the providers I interacted with at Accelerated Recovery were competent, the overall professionalism of the practice fell short, leaving me feeling undervalued and unsupported as a patient.|The care is great from the docs and the nurse practitioner. Also the front office staff is wonderful. Never make you feel rushed, or it's a pain in the neck to answer your questions. In fact, I asked one of the front office employees if they went through customer service training. It's a pleasure to go to their office.
Pamela F.|I initially had a frustrating experience when they charged me $75 to sign my FMLA paperwork that I already completely filled out and all it needed was a signature. I asked during my appointment after paying a $50 copay. I ended up paying the $75 because I really needed the paperwork in order to protect my job. My pain has been unbearable and there are times I am unable to work because of it. I shared my frustration with my husband, who was also upset about being charged $75 for a signature. He then posted a negative review to about it. I called the next morning and requested a refund because my chiropractor agreed to sign my paperwork for free. They called me and cancelled my future appointment because apparently it is a "liability" for them to continue to treat me after receiving a bad review. But had it been a positive review there would not had been an issue. I wished I had look at some of negative reviews prior to scheduling any appointment here because I was completely unsatisfied with the lack of care I received and being treated as a dollar sign rather than patient. If you want quality care by a provider who genuinely cares about your pain, this is not the place to go!

Just want to add that it is NOT illegal to share your experience or frustration to anyone privately or on a public forum. That is called FREE SPEECH. Nothing I said in my initial review was inaccurate. I never said it was illegal to charge $75 on top of the copay, but it is wrong. Especially because another provider reviewed my FMLA Documentation and signed it with no charge. Sure, the Dept of Labor allows you to require payment, that doesn't mean it right to charge a patient $75 to sign a form that I already filled out for them to make it easier, on top of the $50 I paid that same day to been seen. That is my point this facility is choosing to charge patients a significant amount to sign an FLMA document on top of the copay. Just another way to squeeze money out of patients who are just seeking quality care for their pain. Their response should be enough. This place is so afraid of bad reviews that they would rather discharge patients instead of discussing the issue(s) with the patient.|Not to be dramatic but, I wish I could give Accelerated Recovery Specialists and the staff infinite stars!!

I have a very complicated case.  The providers that treated me were always kind, sincere, empathetic, and most important (to me) is the explanation of treatment plans.  Additionally, my questions were always answered. Always.  Even if the answer was "it's not exactly clear" the next sentence was how we can tease the issues apart to see what the ailment is stemming from.  Dr. Leggett always reassured me there are many tools in the toolbox that we can try and to not lose hope. I was near starstruck at the depth of knowledge of Dr. Leggett.
Any less than stellar review for the office seems to be a subjective misunderstanding of insurance plans or ineffective personal communication.
Elyse is an absolute rockstar as well as Ms. Cheryl and many many others.  If you're having trouble, ask clarifying questions and be patient with the process.|I was referred here and saw the PA. i was told they would call me for an injection after they checked with my insurance. they did not. i called after 10 days and they told me it takes a longtime to get precerted. ( my insurance doe not require precert)now over three weeks later nothing. if you are in pain this is not the place for you they will abandon you. I am a doctor (retired and i would not have sent my patients there if i were still practicing.So now i must consider other options.|Dr. Leggett's attention to detail and overall knowledge of back/nerve issues is quite frankly unmatched in COS. Would recommend starting here prior to doing pain management docs or surgeons. Wish I found him sooner in my back/leg nerve issues.|I have had medical procedures from Dr. Sparr in 2018 and now 2024. He is absolutely amazing and has a great sense of humor. He is the most thorough and compassionate doctor I have ever had. I have a work-comp injury and he and his staff have gone above-and- beyond to make certain I get the treatments I need.  His staff is exemplary and work like a well-oiled machine.  I can't praise this group of professionals enough.

column40:
Dr Johnson very helpful to me past couple years Great in doing injections. Just wish getting appointments was a little easier!|Dr Johnson and his team were great. Listened to my needs and concerns and answered with understandable dialect. As the procedure moved on they explained what was happening and what I should feel. When it was all over they took great care to make sure I was fine and able to stand and walk.|Update 8/20/24: I see Dr. Luke Johnson every 3 months for regular lumbar injections. Dr. Johnson is such a great pain management doctor!  He and his assistant Karina are consistently caring, great communicators, and they honestly want to make you feel better!!  Dr. Johnson honestly cares about you as a person and wants you to feel as good as possible. Every time I come for a procedure, he begins by asking how I have been doing the past few months and what I've been doing. He always remembers details about our previous conversations and strives to put me at ease before the procedure. He explains each action and what I should feel during the procedure. Dr. Luke Johnson is really such an awesome pain management doctor!  Thank you so much Dr. Johnson.

1/10/23: After my most recent procedure I had some unexpected discomfort and wanted to wait a bit. Dr. Johnson and Karina checked in on me for the next 30 minutes, getting me water and an ice pack and making sure I felt comfortable enough to leave. Karina even called me the next morning to make sure I was feeling okay. (Thankfully I was back to "normal!"). It is so refreshing to have a doctor and assistant who care enough to
provide such personal care. Thank you both, very much.
If you need a pain management specialist I highly recommend Dr. Luke Johnson with no reservations!!|Dr. Johnson and his assistants are friendly, efficient, and competent. The injections were, as usual, painless. Dr. Johnson delivers exceptional healthcare and relief from pain. He is also an excellent surgeon. I suffered two spinal compression fractures a couple of years. He performed kyphoplasty surgery on me, and I experienced complete recovery and no pain since that surgery.|I had injections in the lumbar area of the lower back.  Minimal discomfort as I was not sedated, only local area was numbed.  Was pleased with the result.|I have a bad tail bone from flying fighter jets/ hard ejection seats and the Spine Center solved my major pain problem without surgery. Dr Johnson and his staff are true professionals. The medical treatments have changed my life. I was seen by Dr. Tam Nguyen for an ablation procedure. The office was nice and clean, brightly lit. Front desk staff was pleasant and I wasn't made to wait. There was a place for people to help themselves to a cup of coffee, tea, hot chocolate etc.
The furniture is not super comfortable for people with spine issues, but Dr. Nguyen had told me he wasn't the one who had chosen the decor and he would have to consider that.
The nurse that gave me the IV was excellent, painless, and only one stick. Better than the ER. The other nurses were wonderful and the procedure was done well and has helped.
Dr. Nguyen and his staff are pleasant, professional,  and caring. The office is clean. I will recommend them any time.|THE PA ( Melanie ) IS superb! Marina is incredible! I have zero complaints and am grateful for your service. Unfortunately, I simply need to go in a different direction re: my care! Nothing but love for your company and team! I thank you for your time and support. Kuda and I are eternally grateful!|The front office staff is always friendly and easy to talk to. I was there for an initial consultation with PA Stephanie. Her and the nurses were very professional, thorough, and answered all of my questions. Kind, And I felt like they're this way with all of their patients. All of my concerns were addressed and taken care of. I highly recommend this practice!|Every staff member that I interacted with were very, kind, respectful, professional, and very informidable. The only reason I gave them a 4 star is because they don't manage your pain with any medication and I was unaware of that but that really wasn't their fault it was more my doctor's fault when she referred me to that clinic. So other than that they are one of the most amazing pain clinics that I've been to in a very long time.|I am truly upset with Dr. Tracy. I told him I was taking an antibiotic. He should've stopped me right there and said we need to get this infection cleared up first before we do these injections. I jumped through hoops and got my appointment moved up and got there and was advised by the other doctor that it's probably not a good idea to do.  He even stated that he would not let his own mother do it
I've been with Dr. Tracy many years and very disappointed that he did not take the time to tell me that maybe I shouldn't or I absolutely should not get these injections right now.
Truly disappointed. I would like a new doctor in your facility or I'll go to another facility.
Do not trust the doctor Tracy has the patient's best interest|My husband & I both go to Premier for pain management. Rebecca listens & cares. She truly wants to help relieve our pain. Dr Feldman is amazing. He talks you through procedures, tells you step by step what he's doing & follows up to be sure it helped with pain. My husband had a stimulator placed in his neck for pain relief. We worked with Rachel who is knowledgeable & patient. She is excited  to share the progress with us. He couldn't keep his head up before. Since the procedure he's doing so well. The office staff is friendly, caring & wonderful to deal with. It's a fantastic office & I would recommend it.|We look forward to my husband's appointment with Lauren. She's thorough and we know she really cares about him. She is very friendly and interested in our lives.|Going to premier spine and pain institute was a first for me. I've never been to a pain place before. I was very pleasantly surprised. The woman that I met with was very positive and very pleasant and gave me a great deal of Hope in dealing with my pain. She said out a plan and we're already going forward with it. I'm looking forward to my treatments.
I have since received treatment to test out if the shots are in the correct place and the pain relief I received was amazing. I'll be going back for additional shots to make sure my body is able to handle what they are doing and soon I will receive a long-term shot and I am so excited. This is a wonderful company. I would recommend it to anyone.
Started getting my permanent shots and it's working great. Can't wait to have more places added so I can function like a human!

column40:
I have NO clue how these people have so many good reviews. I'm glad others are having a great experience. My husband was looking for a pain care doc that is closer as he's been going to Golden for the last 4 years. We thought this place would be a good choice. At the first appointment, Dr Moghim complained about having to document so much for new patients. He claimed "providers are running from the practice" because of it and that it takes away from patient care. Isn't this a part of patient care? I would think that they would want to document as thoroughly as possible with all regulations they have to deal with. After he suggested a few interventional treatments, my husband made it very clear that he did not feel comfortable with anyone sticking something in his back. He continued to insist on it. My husband felt very uncomfortable at that time and did not want to go back but I talked him into a second chance. We went back in January and saw the NP, Hortense. After a short discussion about the procedure, she proceeded to express her concern over his last urine test. Somehow, his medications didn't show up. We were dumbfounded by it because he wears a weekly patch, which I change every week. She then said she would not prescribe his meds, which he was almost out of. I even told her that he's been on these meds since 2009. Coming off of them suddenly might be very dangerous. Nobody seemed to care. What I want to know is, why would you wait until January to tell someone this when you had the damn results in October. Oh I know- so they could get paid for another visit!! My husband was so upset knowing that he was going to be very sick without his medicine and he walked out. I sat for a moment but her nor the PA said ONE F'ING WORD!! I was shocked that they did not even try to say anything to stop him from leaving. This was their patient, who they cared sooo much about. Who they show sooo much compassion for. Of course, I followed after realizing they did not care or have any compassion for their upset patient. They were looking at him like he was some junkie seeking medication. He has suffered unimaginable pain since 2009 after a head on collision totally blew up his whole foot and ankle. He has been on these medications ever since. It really blows my mind that these providers don't take people's histories into account as they should. To just completely cut him off of everything was dangerous and, quite frankly, STUPID. I tried to call them to see if they could prescribe him something while he withdraws but of course, they never called me back. Surprise surprise. Totally unprofessional and ridiculous! News flash- labs DO come out wrong sometimes! No one can argue that point and if you do, you really need to bone up on your knowledge of lab practice. If you're looking for a new pain management provider, I would think hard before coming here! Btw, I am writing this review from the emergency room where he is being treated for severe withdrawal. Maybe I should send them the bill!!|I have been a patient for many years off/ on! They've always treated me so kind, with patience and compassion! I especially love Hortense and Dr Moghim! They are the best! I recommend this practice to everyone I know. In fact, we refer many of our patients to this practice as well and they all come back with nothing but the best compliments!|Probably the worst pain care clinic I have gone to in the last 15 years.  Their Castle Rock office has no MD's.  They have no place to do procedures....you have to go to Denver.  There is no follow up to the patient after treatment ( pain injections/ MRI results.  There is only a NP in Castle Rock as all other professionals leave and go to Denver office.  I would never refer a patient there!|Worst place I've ever been to it took me 7 months get in with the pain management place they gave me medicine and then said I had to do a new urinary analysis it's been over 25 days and I'm still waiting for the results to come back they give me attitude and treat me rude every time I call to figure out what's going on they also told me if I'm not a drug addict I shouldn't care right now how long it's taking which is very rude to say when you're in pain I came there for help never been treated worse Julie told me I shouldn't care how long it's taking if I'm not a drug addict which is very rude to say when you're in pain and came for help and they put you down and make you feel horrible|Hortense is a very caring, understanding and very knowledgeable.  She takes time to listen and tend to whatever issue I am having with my pain. Yasmine is a great medical assistant with a happy kind face to greet the patients. Tiffany is a fantastic receptionist always smiling and very courteous , it's great to walk in and be greeted by her. I highly recommend this awesome Castle Rock team to help you to get your life back on track if you suffer from Chronic Pain. You won't regret it!|Hortense is an amazing provider! She is always honest with her patients, and tells you what you need to hear in order to move forward in your treatment plan. This office is modern and beautiful, and the staff always makes me feel heard and helped. Would recommend!|I've been seeing Hortense Ngoe for about two years. She is friendly, patient, professional and caring. She is a pleasure to see and I believe she is truly looking out for my welfare.
As for the rest of the staff, they are friendly too.
Really important is that they are mostly on time as well.|I have been using Colorado Pain Care for several years now, my Doctor Ms Hortens has provided exceptional care. her expertise, attentiveness, and genuine concern for my well-being have made a significant positive impact, her ability to communicate effectively, listen attentively, and address my health concerns demonstrates a high level of professionalism, her commitment is truly commendable, creating a trusting and supportive relationship. I highly recommend this outstanding doctor to anyone seeking top-notch medical care.

column40:
Dr Hong saved my life I'm a victim of severe crime and broke half the bones in my face he listened to me the first appointment asked me what I like to do and where do I see myself. He fast and adjusting my pain plan accordingly and working with my team of Dr's. There not enough pain management Dr's out there like him I highly recommend. I can tell he's picky with who he treats as he should this type of practice comes with alot of scrutiny and guidelines but Dr Hong is gem and I appreciate him taking me on as a patient.|I've been seeing Dr.Hong for about 4yrs now and he's always been very supportive and patient with me. I can't say enough good things about him and his entire staff they always have your best interest at heart!|Dr.Hong and his staff are incredible. From the front desk ladies being polite, courteous and caring to Dr. Hong being through at every appointment. I have never felt comfortable around any providers and I actually trust Dr. Hong and he absolutely makes me feel very comfortable. If I could see him for everything I would.|This place is excellent. From the front staff to the doctors everyone is kind and supportive. I moved from California to Colorado in the midst of being a severe chronic pain patient. It took some doing but I found Denver Pain Management and the rest is history. Dr Hong has been incredible. Helping me along the way through this very difficult pain journey. I have no problem coming to him with questions or ideas for changes in medication etc. Savannah at the front desk has been a life saver too many times to count. From dealing with the pharmacies to scheduling special appointment accommodations, this operation is truly fantastic. I recommend Denver Pain Management to anyone suffering from acute or chronic pain and beyond. They are incredibly knowledgeable, prompt, and caring. If your looking for pain relief or management in the Denver Metro area there's no better option!|I've been a patient of this clinic since they opened. They literally saved my life!! I was over prescribed medications from my old doctor and had no idea how much it affected my daily life. The doctors and staff helped me get on a proper manageable dose and my life has completely changed for the better. I can't thank them all enough for putting the light back in my life.Its also the reason I highly recommend this clinic to anyone suffering from any type of pain situation. You can have an amazing life with the proper care and Dr Hong is amazing at helping his patients.|After many years of trying to find a doctor to listen to my legitimate pain concerns I came to Dr. Hong. From the very beginning from scheduling, first appointment and ongoing every member of staff included the Doctor has been great. They never treat you less than and listen to your concerns. You don't realize how much of a difference a compassionate doctor can be.
Thank you to all the staff at Denver Pain Management you're all awesome.|I had to scramble to find a new pain management facility as my previous provider is no longer practicing. I found Denver Pain Management Clinic to have a very welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff. Dr. Hong was personable and thorough. I'm glad I found this place.|I'm really not sure where to begin. From the moment I first step foot in the door, I felt important and that the quality in which I live my life with multiple issues, mattered. I suffer severely from fibromyalgia, polyarthritis, nerve damage in both feet, a collapsing arch in my left foot along with tarsal tunnel in the same foot. I felt like I didn't want to live anymore as pain is so exhausting on so many levels. My depression has been haunting. I can say now that I'm doing much better, I'm getting my appetite back already after seeing this beautiful doctor for only two weeks. I'm getting my will to live, BACK!  How can you really thank someone properly for doing so much?  My kindness and gratitude is eternally extended to this office and Dr. Hong!
