column40: Absolutely changed my life for the better. Every person I have interactions with from the front desk to the nurses and my Doctor has been absolutely amazing.  They saved my life. Dr Sharma is one of the kindest most understanding people I've ever met. This soul Illuminates every room he walks into and touches the hearts of those lucky enough to know him.|Possibly the worst pain clinic in Colorad0.  I quit going because its a shot mill and they run you through like cattle.  they have no concern about outcomes, if they injure you during a procedure you are on your own.  One time a patient came in an ambulance screaming in pain and he was basically told to shut up. He was in a gurney, unable to walk, and I knew that was my future if I kept going to UCHealth.  I simply quit going as it was very far to drive for zero care.  Edit:  I would never go back after my experience at UC. I don't use any of your offices at all now.  I never had a good experience. I was also misdiagnosed eventually, abused, and ignored as a patient.  My friend was called a drug seeker, and sent home and almost died, because they misdiagnosed her. You're a disgrace.|Was a pt of Dr. V... I complained of severed neck pain all I got was 1 shot of lidocaine and some xrays... didn't do anything to help. I received no follow up. When I messaged him a nurse messaged back gaslighting me saying it wasn't severe enough to come in... fast forward to now I have been seen at different clinic with new x-rays and even mris.. I havs 4 herniated discs in my neck that could have possibly gone away with some earlier intervention (like I tried desperately to get) now it requires fusion surgery. Don't go here,they're obviously too busy to give proper preventative care or truly listen to their pts... please go anywhere else!!|I have to say I have been living with a very painful condition for 14 years, I am rather use to the medical gaslighting but this clinic took it to another level, first appointment was video, no it was not COVID yet, Dr had good ideas, until I was booked for some tests. Then its the" well let do shots" he heard nothing of what I said and obviously knew nothing of my condition or he would not have suggested shots, Ok the " Spinal cord Simulator"  Dude I just met you,on video????Really... Well OK I am going send over a formula for compounding, Yea OK OH $45 for a 2 week supply, do I look like I have that kind of money. So I wont/cant do any of theses things and they drop me, then has the God Damn nerve to tell my Primary that I am uncooperative, that includes all the doctors at this clinic that I saw. Gaslighting, no help at all just left me with sever depression and not a thing I can do about it. Edit: to the response, PATIENT REP IS JUST AS BAD AS THIS ORGANIZATION, THERE IS LITERATELY NO REASON TO CONTACT THEM THEM DO NOTHING.|First injection in tailbone was wonderful but lasted only 30 days. Follow-up injection caused severe pain that has lasted now for a month with little relief.  Dr. V did prescribe prednisone, but sent to wrong pharmacy. Communication with UCHealth in general has deteriorated drastically and prevents any real-time conversations.  Dr. V said he had no idea why the second injection went so horribly wrong and recommended a third injection which I refused.  Other than the prednisone which was finally sent to the correct pharmacy but did little good, there has been no follow-up, no helpful recommendations, no interest in my well-being. Very disappointing.|I have gotten pain from my migraines under control after many years of struggling and three brain surgeries (only worsened migraines) to stop my seizures. I also started receiving treatment in order to help my TMJ, and I am hopeful.|I've been diagnosed with CRPS and as a result I'm in pain 24/7 and cannot walk. I've had one injection so far and zero follow up. No treatment  plan other than physical therapy which I've had to wait for 6 weeks. With crps time is crucial as it progresses and spreads. They only offer injections and antidepressants. Not a lot of hope given and if you ask a doctor a question different nurses respond. I feel absolutely abandoned. I don't think they specialize in RSD or CRPS at all. I'm so frustrated. Expect a 4 day delay when asking questions.|My doctor ended up scheduling one type of procedure (three times) to work on finding a solution on managing my chronic pain issues. I was told that if that did not work for me, I would have a lot of other options to try. That changed during my last appointment, when I was told that my only option going forward right now is to do physical therapy (which I've already done twice) for MINIMAL pain relief that can take years. I was told great things about this facility and my high hopes have been crushed. I've been dealing with this pain for over six years, and when I finally thought I was getting somewhere, nothing. Extremely disappointed.

column40:
I am so happy we found this place. My father had been complaining of severe lower back pain for two months, and nobody seemed to know how to help him. Everyone just continued to suggest physical therapy or acupuncture; mind you, my dad was 75 and had severe rheumatoid arthritis, so PT did more harm than good. When we arrived for his appointment here, we were greeted politely and only waited a few minutes before being taken to a room. Ms. Ariel was so sweet to my dad and really took the time to hear his concerns. She weighed the pros and cons of certain tests and imaging to see if we could get to the bottom of his pain. She saw something that others did not and referred him right away for imaging that showed my dad had tumors on his spine, eventually leading to more imaging where we discovered he had tumors throughout his entire body. The office went above and beyond to get us to the right people who could expedite his treatments. Dino took extra time to explain telehealth to my elderly dad and even helped us to know exactly what to say to other specialists when the medical conversations became quite confusing. This was an overwhelming time for my family. Unfortunately, my father passed away 3 months later; however, had we not discovered his cancer, we would not have had the time with him that we did. My family is forever grateful for Prism and their compassionate staff for helping us to navigate this unimaginable experience.|I've been a pain patient for over a decade, and have been to a couple of Pain Management clinics due to relocation and what not.  I'm also an healthcare provider, so ive been both recipient and provider of healthcare for most of my adult life.

Ariel is very professional.  She is always pleasant and provides compassionate care.  She is also highly knowledgeable about the condition she is treating.  I highly recommend her to anyone seeking treatment for any debilitating pain conditions.|This office and employees are aware of each individuals needs and by their actions and how they sync things into a plan for each of us patients, then all one must do is commit to their help!!!
Rest assured your ailments/diagnosis and problems will be professionally tended too. Dr Franthrup and his care team in the Thorton office pivioting around one of the most qualified nurse practician out there; "Ariel Shaifer"! One notices immediatly the stock-pile of diffrent tools they aquired along with modern application and up-too-date medications and rehabilitations of drffrent options they offer. The entire  office staff at this location have multiple skills and often times get a patient in motion on any and all treatments available way ahead of schedule. As an older veteran, and I am living proof that the results from my past 5 years of treatment, 'Barnone' has increased the true quality of me walking, excersising etc. I am turning 70 yrs old and started with a cane, its a fact I have trailed walking thru wildlife parks for miles and up hills for miles..It feels so good for my mind, body and soul..I dont let it fool me tho! I am eager to always schedule my  continuious treatments planned out for me that I am committed to have! This later stage of my life and the higher quality drawn out it in my health improvement, via Prism Pain Management/Thorton office is a hidden gem that i protect and have and will keep which is the only reason I am shareing it with all of you readers!|Ariel Shaffer is great. But the reception is not they dont listen to paitients and what they are asking of. Ive had several issues with reception. In scheduling and trying to get prescription refills. And getting documents. There been times ive gone several days without prescriptions because of miss communication. One in particular is the older male receptionist there im not sure of his name. But he can be very rude. I think if it continues im just going to go to a different provider.|Dino, Dr. Shaffer and the whole team are amazing and very caring. They understand their patients and what they're going through. Very professional and caring about their patients. Would recommend them to anybody anytime!|Ariel Shaifer is amazing. She will listen to you what you have to say and not belittle and make you feel like you don't matter. She works with you to make life better and more enjoyable every day.|Ariel Shaifer is incredible. Not only has she taken great care of my pain concerns, but she is also lovely to speak with at every appointment. She takes her time, listens, and answers any questions I may have. It's rare to find a professional that combines such personal touches and care for a patient as a person with outstanding quality of medical care. I highly recommend becoming her patient|Ariel is the absolute best! She is a very kind, caring person and is very knowledgeable. If you are looking for a clinic where you are treated with respect and compassion, look no further as you will be in great hands with Prism pain management, Dr Frandrup, Ariel Shaffer and the entire team

column3:
Comprehensive Non-Surgical Pain Management Solutions

At Pain Specialists of Brighton, we provide personalized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team, led by Dr. Jeff Toups, specializes in developing individualized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life without relying solely on surgical interventions. We offer a comprehensive range of services including:

  • Medication management tailored to each patient's specific needs

  • Interventional procedures to target pain at its source

  • Alternative therapy options for holistic pain relief

  • Sleep disorder evaluations to address pain-related sleep issues

Our compassionate approach means we take the time to listen, understand your pain journey, and work collaboratively to find effective solutions. Located in Brighton, Colorado, our facility is handicap accessible with convenient parking. We're committed to helping our patients regain control of their lives through effective pain management strategies. Visit our website or call us at +1 720-823-0123 to schedule your consultation at our 435 S 4th Ave location.

column40: The staff is friendly and personable!  They do not make me feel like I am just a number here!  Dr. Jeff listens, values others' opinions, and hears you with an excellent bedside manner!|This place is amazing! Every single person that works here cares about how you are. If you need a pain specialist get in here. They are amazing, from the check in to getting help for your pain.|Everyone was very friendly but I was unable to get help. CRNA Jeff Toups said he didn't treat my condition (which I didn't expect him to) but my condition causes severe chronic pain which is what I came to him for help with. Maybe he felt he couldn't help me because I already have a Rheumatologist and a primary care doctor who prescribed me pain medication. Primary doctor are limited on the amount of pain medication they can prescribe so I was hoping I could get help with a longer acting medication, I am horrible at speaking up and voicing my thoughts mostly because it's scary to be direct about what you need because you don't want to be labeled as a addict or drug seeker. I used to be on a long acting and short acting medication in the past before the government got involved in healthcare and my pain was well controlled. I've been on the same medication for over 10 years and have never "lost or ran out of my medication early" it's the only medication that works without side affects, again I've been on the same dose and medication for years so I do not get "high" what so ever. I was hoping to get some better relief from the agonizing pain I live with everyday but I will continue being thankful for the medication I do get (because not everyone has that) and live one day at a time  Shandra G|I love this office!  They all are amazing Jeff Marsha Kirsten & Alexis! Very friendly and they make me feel so at ease every time I see them! Jeff definitely listens empathizes and has great ideas and tries to help me feel better. I have had chronic pain for many years and this by far is my favorite office ever!! Thank you all!|I'm not sure where to even begin. This group is absolutely amazing. Dr Jeff and his staff gave me my life back. When I thought I was down and out, they came in and saved me. They helped me fight through pain, pharmacies, insurance and so much more. Even after hours I got a call back fast! Absolutely great medical professionals and even better people! Thank you so much for everything!|I am speaking from experience with Dr Toups office. I get excellent care from all staff and Dr. Toups. The place is very clean and organized.  Parking is great. They are handicap accessible. I will refer Dr. Toups to anyone that needs pain management. Marsha is great and friendly. She is always happy to see a client walk in.|I am very happy with this business. The entire staff are friendly, compassionate, and professional. If you suffer with chronic pain, I highly recommend them!|Really care's about his patient's I was new to the clinic and he was going on vacation but I was starting a new medication and he took time out of his vacation to call me and make sure if anything needed to be changed he is very hand's on I appreciate him very much

column40:
Front staff -- So polite and professional. I look forward to seeing them every visit because they treat me with kindness and respect.

Nurses -- I have the same review as the front staff, but you can tell they care and remember you, it's important to be remembered.

My Doctor -- Is just wonderful and it's hard to find a doctor that cares.... she cares and you can't put a price on that.|With most first encounters, your not sure what to expect and even after the first visit, I still wasn't sure. Now I am glad to have her as my provider and she understands me. Give her a shot and don't judge on your first visit. You're decision will be made up on the second and it will be positive.|I've been a patient here for about 2 years, maybe a little longer. I'm just really unhappy with my current care. I don't feel heard, valued, cared about. I feel like they are treating me like a textbook case, and I'm anything but. There is no textbook treatment for Scleroderma patients because there are NO 2 Scleroderma patients that are the same. I'm getting frustrated because when you call for a refill the 7 days or longer recommend in advance they still wait till the very last minute of the day it's due or the day before it's due to get sent in. It's also frustrating that they shut off the phone at 3 pm. Close at 330pm. And are closed on Fridays. There's also NO after-hours number or emergency number for hospitals, drs, pharmacists, surgeons, etc. For someone like me who has a terminal disease with no cure, it is very scary. I have random surgeries out of nowhere and constantly end up in the hospital for being super sick or flaring up. Having no immune system due to being on chemotherapy, i get super sick a lot, and hospital staff can hardly ever reach the providers. When I first started here, they were attentive, listened, and seemed to care. But it's been going downhill for months. Which is sad because I really did like it here. My conditions are ONLY going to get worse. They will never improve. I've been on pain meds since I was diagnosed at age 4. I'm now 39. I know my body better than anyone, and I know what works for me and what doesn't. I don't appreciate being treated like I don't know as much as them when it comes to my body and my diseases. 90% of primary care drs and ER Dr's have never even heard of my primary disease, Scleroderma. There are no experts in this disease. All you can do is just try to manage all the many, many different symptoms because there's no cure. I'm going to be a lifelong pain patient, so I just wish I was being treated better and with more respect and decency than I currently am. If you just need a short-term pain dr, then definitely consider this place. They aren't "awful." I just personally feel i could be doing better and be treated better.|Leah is the best pain management professional I have ever experienced! She is very knowledgeable about everything that I need and manages my pain through her hard work and dedication! Her team at Metamorphosis Pain Management is AMAZING! They all take great care about their patient's pain relief and heathy living! I drive 4 hours round trip to see Leah and wouldn't ever consider changing! I wish I could give them 10 Stars!  Leah and her team has changed my life forever  for the better|Leah is the perfect provider.  She listens to my concerns and is a great problem solver.  Her office communication leaves a lot to be desired. When they get the refill line problems solved, it will be the perfect clinic. This is no reflection on Leah.|Literally the worst clinic in the Springs. After Apex abruptly closing and leaving its patients in the dark it is quite a feat to still do worse than them. I requested a different facility but somehow ended up here, which is being corrected now. If you appreciate being lied to and given the run around by all means go here, especially go here if you enjoy waiting 10 days to get your script sent in. After numerous calls and messages.|As always your staff was professional and kind. If I were to change anything it would be that I have trouble getting an answer at the front desk when I call. Otherwise I remain loyally your,
Dawna Baca|Love How The Doctor Shows She Cares And That's Very Important! Does Not Judge And I Just Feel Comfy Talking To Her About My Past. People Change And She Understands Without Passing Judgements!

column2: CU Medicine Interventional Pain - Cherry Creek
column3:
At CU Medicine Interventional Pain, we specialize in providing comprehensive, nonsurgical pain management solutions for patients suffering from a variety of painful conditions. Our outpatient pain practice is dedicated to decreasing pain while improving healing and function for those experiencing joint and spine issues, arthritis, and other chronic pain conditions.

University-Level Pain Management in Cherry Creek

We offer a multifaceted approach to pain relief that includes physical therapy and interventional procedures designed to help patients avoid surgery whenever possible. Our services include:

  • Joint injections (Hips, Knees, Shoulders)

  • Carpal Tunnel treatments

  • Spine interventions

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

Conveniently located in Cherry Creek, between Alameda and Colorado Blvd at 360 S Garfield St #550, our facility provides easy access for Metro Denver patients seeking university-quality care without the hassle of traveling to Anschutz Medical Campus. Visit our website or call us at +1 720-516-1251 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column11:
CU Interventional Pain is an outpatient pain practice focused on decreasing pain and improving healing & function in patients with a variety of painful conditions including all joint and spine issues, arthritis, and other painful conditions.
Our goal is to provide the highest quality nonsurgical care to our patients, helping patients avoid surgery by a multifaceted approach that includes physical therapy and interventional procedures that can provide pain relief.
Located centrally in Cherry Creek, between Alameda and Colorado Blvd, our new location offers easy access for Metro Denver patients seeking University-level pain management care without the hassle of traveling to Anscblocks, joint injections (Hips, Knees, Shoulders, Carpal Tunnel).

I highly recommend him for those in need of pain management intervention!|This is a very professional, caring & efficient place to be seen when you're not feeling well. column40:
Sara is ready for me when I get there. She has already looked at my chart with my history already has a treatment plan or direction of where we're going to go. My last visit she told me what she thought was happening and she was spot on. I had a herniated disc bulging into my spine so we're addressing it accordingly. Her treatment plans are actually finally helping me with my pain until the surgery I have scheduled. She talks to me like one-on-one and has a great personality. I was having a reaction to a medication. She called me within the day to check on me, get all the information and to change my medication. That's what doctors used to be like in my day so I think she's awesome and I would recommend her to everyone!!!!!|Priscilla Baber made my appointment easy. I have been in a lot of pain and I brought a list of things to tell her. She was so thorough that before I even brought up my list she touched on everything. Priscilla was professional and very pleasant. She picked up on my problem exactly and was able to discuss some help. Also I loved her MA- also very sweet and professional.|PA-C D'Orio has really taken the time with me to understand my pain issues and coordinate addressing them, I have had many experiences where I felt a health care provider was not really listening to me or paying attention and just going through the motions but I don't feel rushed through and feel like I'm really being listened to. Still working to actually solve the problems but I feel hopeful about the progress and attention I'm receiving.|Brittany like the other staffers I have met is the best. She gave me 4 shots, usually I cry. She has such great technique, and truly cares for her patients.  Wonderful staff. Thank you all, samy|Brittany is a kind, compassionate medical provider. I came into the office feeling down, in pain, and exhausted.  She listened to me carefully and provided several options to improve my situation. I left her office feeling much better and hopeful again.|Extremely awful company. My PCP sent my referral to them on November 6th. I received a call to schedule an appointment.
My appointment is scheduled for 11.22.24.
I received my reminder call on 11.20.24.
Then on 11.21.24 they informed me that my appointment has been canceled.
I was completely out of my pain medication on 11.22.24.
These clinics should not be allowed to pick and choose which patience they want to see, in which ones they don't want to see. If you are a pain management clinic that involves managing patience, pain, pill prescriptions, then you should not be allowed cancel anyone's appointments the day before they're appointment is scheduled.
They had my information from the referral for almost 3 weeks and decide to call me the day before my appointment with them and they knew I was going to be out of pain medication. The laws need to change that if any clinical pain management clinics schedule the patient an appointment. They cannot cancel the appointment for any reason. This would at least give patients who need their medication, not just want the medication, there's a difference.
I do not recommend going to them.You will get screwed too|I have been a patient of Brittany D'Orio for over four years.  She left the practice I was a client of and moved here.  The staff is superb!  The nurses are excellent.  The whole operation is geared to provide solutions to help you.  Excellent and professional at every step of the way!|It was my first appointment with Dr Notch. He explained various options and procedures to my understanding. I appreciated the time spent with us.

column38: Kristen Williams|Andi Clingan|Lauren Vecchiarelli|Brittani|Crystal Fuentes|Alexa Malara|Angela Claxton|Hawt Plate of Biscuits and Gravy (B&G bb)
column40:
Doctors Pouliot, Sam, and Sunny have all been absolutely amazing. Everyone there, including the front desk staff, treats me like family and I always look forward to my visits because they can actually be fun! They have been shoulders to cry on during tough times, and friends to laugh with during the good. I highly recommend this place and the doctors I listed above.|Dr's are all amazing.  Authorization department is a joke worst in the state. I had an appointment in January, I received approval from my insurance,  I sent it in the portal, left voice-mails, sent messages, went into the office. The Authorization expired.  I called my insurance,  I got an extension on the approval and to date still no communication and no willingness to schedule my procedures. I also need another injection,  went back in the office to the Dr 3 weeks ago and they have still not requested Authorization for the injection.  Good luck ever getting injection or procedures scheduled. I even asked for the office manager and was told no. This is unbelievable.|Dr. Pouliot has been my physician for years. He is the most caring, honest, and professional pain management physician I have ever had. I truly appreciate everything he has done for me and everything he continues to do for me. He focuses on reducing my pain without narcotics which I appreciate. Also, the staff is very welcoming and caring. Highly recommend him and this practice! They truly care about their patients!|Well the nurses were nice but doc was very short. The numbing meds didn't work. Bout a week after I started having an allergic reaction called in and staff really didn't seem to care the assistant didn't even pay attention to what I was saying when I explained what was going on. Then they still insisted I wait for the steroid to work. Well here I am 2 weeks post injection in worse pain than before sent an email. And go figure my follow up is still out a ways. Just over all frustrated with the whole process.|I have been seeing Dr. Poulliot for many many years now, and I will tell anybody that he is absolutely one of the most professional, friendliest, and smartest physicians I've ever had the pleasure of knowing or being a patient of. I have always felt like I have received the absolute best care in his practice,  I trust his judgment and that he always has my best interest in mind . His medical assistant Justina is one of the kindest people I've ever known; she is a true MVP here. I look forward to seeing her just as I would to visit a dear friend. She does her job incredibly well, she is always efficient and friendly. The front desk staff is also always very kind and professional as well. I know that I am in good hands here amongst the staff and the physician, and after working in the healthcare field for 20 years myself I've seen my fair share of "not so good". I would HIGHLY recommend Front Range Pain Medicine to anyone that is seeking professional, kind, and better than efficient care. I would say they are exceptional.!|I just got an epidural in my neck this morning and although I am not feeling the relief yet I wanted to say how professional all the employees were. They made me feel very comfortable and relaxed As this was the first time I was doing something like this. They also had a horrible Karen being incredibly rude and dramatic, which they handled the situation very well. Nurses and doctors need to get more credit for the stuff they have to deal with on a daily basis. Thank you all for an amazing experience and all you do for your patients. I'll see you again in six months.|I'd like to share my experience, I have had one fusion and two artificial disc replacements. I still continue to have severe neck and arm pain in both arms. Dr. Brown has done several injections and The other physicians assistant have been very helpful to treat my pain.

The front desk staff, is exceptional!
I called to get a claim number to contact my insurance, it only took a couple minutes. The front desk person immediately got what I was asking for!! very helpful!! Thank you!

I just seen all the other negative reviews, and I wanted to stand up for this amazing facility.
I highly recommend them. If you're looking for narcotics and not willing to try anything else, don't go there. Pills aren't always the answer.|Dr. Giradi is a brash, impolite doctor with no bedside manner. Guess he might have watched "House MD" and thought that's what compassion in medicine looks like.
I get that pain management has a lot of hazards I can't begin to understand, but to be without understanding of the patients pain or to assume they're just in there to get free dope is a bad way to approach medicine.

column40:
Dr. Krutsch has been my pain management doctor since 2017. He is kind and professional and he easily adapts to whatever your needs are.
His recommendations have always been spot on! If you're looking for a genuine, kind and knowledgable doctor for your pain management, you've found him.|This was my third time with Dr. Johnson, my neck, head, shoulder, arms pain, he work on them after pin pointing the nerves and help me for reducing the encrusiating pain to very lower label. Cen not get better than this. I recommend to any Denver patient to call them and that will do right thing in proper time.|Dr. Krutsch has the best caring, fun bedside manner I have experienced with a Dr. In a long time.  I am never nervous having a procedure done in the two years I've had the injections. He always tells me what he is about todo and has yet to cause much pain. He is the best!|I've had a migraine for 446 straight days. We've applied for the migraine shot probably a dozen times. Jenny found out what meds I had to try first and Melissa helped get me through all of them. They kept submitting and appealing and, finally, it was approved. They stuck in there and advocated for me. I feel heard and believed and I know they have my best interests at heart. I'm grateful for their advocacy and I highly recommend their care. I'm very grateful. Not everyone in my care history has been as supportive, not even everyone in this practice. I've had some pretty negative experiences (none as bad as Blue Sky Neuro), but Jenny, Melissa and Dr. Krutsch are wonderful humans and excellent caregivers. If you don't get the response you're hoping for, see a different practitioner. Don't give up until you find someone who is willing to fight for you and listen to you. Even with in the same practice care can vary greatly.|My father (John Owen) is a patient at Colorado Pain and our family really appreciates everything that Dr. Krutsch and the other members of the medical staff do for him.  He's able to do quite a bit of stuff and spend quality time with our family because of the care that Dr. Krutsch and the staff provide for my daddy.  Thank you Dr. Krutsch and Colorado Pain for being so wonderful to him!!|Dr. Krutsch has the best bed side manners I've ever seen. He's fantastic at his work and I would follow him anywhere. His entire staff is the best in the business.|He does my shots for my back.  He is always professional and thorough.  His staff is also wonderful.  They work with your schedule, always so nice. The shots, help tremendously.  His staff, Melissa particularly, is great.  Highly recommend.
(Dana Kate Leadford)|He is the most compassionate doctor  I have ever worked with for my chronic pain in my neck and right arm !!!  He does not give up and goes after the cause, with a passion while keeping your pain and comfort first and foremost!!!  If you are in need of a "real" doctor for pain, you need to work with him for real relief not just medications!!! He's the best !!!  I have been seeking relief for 10 years and finally going after the cause not just trying to mask it!!!

column3:
At Colorado Pain Care, our mission is to provide the most advanced and compassionate care to patients suffering from chronic pain. Our world-class physicians are dedicated to precisely diagnosing and treating the source of your pain, not simply masking symptoms.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We specialize in minimally invasive, non-surgical procedures that help patients regain their quality of life. Our services include:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Physical therapy options

  • Medication management when appropriate

Our team of pain management specialists works collaboratively to address complex pain conditions with the goal of getting you back to work, back to family, and back to living as soon as possible. Located conveniently in Lakewood, we're proud to serve the greater Denver area with exceptional care. Contact us today at +1 303-468-7246 or visit our Lakewood Pain Clinic website to schedule your consultation at our 12596 W Bayaud Ave #350 location.

column40:
DON'T USE THIS PLACE IF YOU HAVE SEVERAL CHRONIC ISSUES. I've had multiple problems with them. This last one, since I won't be going back, was the worse.  I have major depression.  Most days I'm good.  The one thing that will set me off is the worry of how much pain I will suffer if I don't get the meds to keep it under control.  I've been on these meds for 17 years. Well this happened and I ended up in the hospital.  One week later I have my appt with this place.  I'm told they can't give me any more meds because of my trip to the hospital.  If this was my only med, then sure take it away, but I have 5-7 other meds i can take. Also they decided this with out any concern for the withdraws I'll go through.  They have the power over your life here, they shouldn't have that control.|Dr. Krutsch and his pain care team are absolutely the best. The providers are very knowledgable and take their time to listen. I've come such a long way with their help and was even able to drastically reduce pain medications. Dr. Krutsch is my favorite Doctor ever. He is a brilliant and caring man. It's always a pleasure to see him, too. He doesn't miss a beat and always remembers everything you tell him, asking about your work, school,  family and really makes you feel like family. They offer many different forms of treatment to get you the care that you need and deserve.|I have been with this clinic for well over 6 years.
Everything was fine and dandy until they outsourced their billing and customer service this past year...
I have had a billing issues *since July of 2024* that no matter how I try to contact them, I cannot get help. No one returns my calls, not even the Office Manager for Lakewood. I have even walked in, crying my eyes out, begging Nicole and Lexi for help. Nothing.
***The amount of anxiety this situation has caused me is unreal.***
I have tried every month, multiple times a month to get them paid. I am waiting for them to send me to collections and start to ruin my credit.
Customer Service rep "ROXANNE" seems to be the main Gatekeeper and won't transfer my calls or let me leave voicemails for those involved that I need to contact. She "sends an email" that I NEVER get a reply from. Ever.
I used to love this place, but it has gone to hell in a handbasket, and VERY quickly.|I love this center! I highly recommend! To be greeted with a big warm smile a lovely Mrs.Nicole always there to check you in with a big hello!  They are so very nice professional they listen to your concerns made me feel so comfortable! My Dr Krutsch is awesome so compassionate always with a big smile knows my name,  he does all my prescedures he is awesome! Ms Kelsey is amazing! Listens to all my all my pain complaints and does everything to help me get thru my days!|I have been coming here for about 2 years. I am so fortunate I found Colorado Pain in Lakewood. The staff here is absolutely amazing from Dr. Krutsch, Jamie Xiong, to my physical therapist Will, and the front staff. Everyone has been amazing helping me on my journey. Thank you for providing such optimum care. I would recommend Colorado Pain in Lakewood to anyone who is looking for prestige care.|I started coming here for Botox injections for migraines. I have had migraines most of my life, they were getting worse and I was getting almost every day. The first experience I had, I called and scheduled an appointment at the Lakewood office. I verified the location and address multiple times and made sure it was at the Lakewood office. I went in on the day and was told I scheduled it at the Denver location. When I said no I made sure it was the Lakewood location I was treated very rudely. So, I had to schedule another appointment weeks later. My first appointment was ok and Botox was ordered and I came back for the injections. Dr. Krutsch was great and the Botox worked wonders. For the first time in over 20 years I had no migraines. I was beyond excited and would rave about the office and the shots to everyone I knew!! However, that all changed! I had to change insurance and knowing the office would need the new insurance and specialty pharmacy information. I called my insurance and got everything they would need ahead of time. I called the office and gave all that information over the phone before my next appointment (1st time). When I got to the appointment I gave the girl at the front desk my new insurance information again and she made copies of the card for my file (note this is time 2). I went in to see Jamie Xiong and made sure to give her all of that information once again. I gave her the insurance information and all of the specialty pharmacy information so she could order the Botox (this is time 3). About a week after my appointment I got a message from the pharmacy that my prescription was not covered. So I reached out via the portal and left message after message trying to get someone to get back to me and got nothing. I called the office and left message after message asking someone to call me back and nothing. finally I get a call from the office manager weeks later and she tells me that the insurance they have is expired. I had to explain it all over again and once again gave my insurance information, specialty pharmacy information (time number 4). I did let her know that I have been calling and leaving message after message and get no call back, I told her how I have left message after message on the portal and nothing back. she assured me she would look into this and get it taken care of. Finally my prescription was sent to my pharmacy. But, it was the wrong pharmacy. I found out because I took the effort and called my pharmacy to find out what was going on and found out it was sent to the incorrect pharmacy. It was sent to the regular pharmacy and needed to go to the specialty pharmacy, which I knew and got that long before this. I once again called the office and gave them the information of where to send it to. I never got a call but they did finally send it to the right pharmacy. However they didn't send the correct information and it was denied. I had to reach out to the pharmacy to find out why. I then called the office back and told them why it was denied and what they needed to send for it to be covered. Finally they got it right and it was approve.  Through all of this I got no phone call back from anyone besides that one call from the office manager.
After fighting and making phone call after phone call I have the approval and I get it sent to the clinic. My Botox gets delivered to the office and I get the call letting me know that I can now schedule my appointment. I get the appointment scheduled and about an hour or so later I get a call back and she tells me that my insurance is not active. At this point I'm pretty upset. So I once again give her all the information for my insurance, this is now the 5th time I have given this to the office. When I express my frustration of having to give my information over and over and over again I'm met with rudeness. When I express my frustration about not getting one call back I'm met with rudeness. I understand there are patients being seen and helped during the day but a quick phone call during down time is not that hard.|Dr. Krutsch, Dr. Moghim and the entire team at CO Pain Care have gone above and beyond for me. My insurance didn't approve an RFA last year because it was too early. I desperately needed it because I had to dance with my son at his wedding! The entire team worked it out with my insurance so I had the RFA 2 days before we left. Dr. Krutsch also does Myobloc injections for my cervical dystonia, even though he wasn't familiar with the drug before I told him about it. Everyone here is amazing!|Reece and Jamie truly cares for their patients! My husband and i have been coming here for years! Kudos to you both for always looking out for what is best for your patients! Glad to have both of you taking care of us.

column3:
At Denver Diagnostic Pain, we provide holistic, comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the Greenwood Village area who are living with chronic pain resulting from injuries or medical conditions. Our team of specialized physicians is dedicated to creating personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain, not just the symptoms.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments including:

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy

  • Minimally invasive surgical options

  • Holistic pain management approaches

Our physicians, including Dr. Rentz and Dr. Lucas, bring years of specialized experience to help restore quality of life for our patients. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why we take the time to listen and develop individualized care plans. Visit our Greenwood Village location or call us at +1 720-598-0805 to schedule your consultation at our convenient office located at 7800 E Orchard Rd Suite 350, Greenwood Village, CO 80111.
column11: Denver Diagnostic Pain provides holistic, comprehensive pain management services to patients living with chronic pain that is the result of an injury or medical condition.
column38: Misty F|Carolyn Sims|Alicia Sims|a h|Gwen Zink|Google Fi|Ronica Kirwin|Cynthia Preston
column40:
Terrible customer service, terrible staff, terrible doctor's bedside manner. Negative stars given!!!!!!

Denver Diagnostic Pain seems to only care about money. I have tried to make an appointment for months now and left several messages. They never answer the phone, they never follow up.

This office charged over $1000 just to be seen for pain meds, and refused to take insurance on an open case with an attorney, even though we were trying to close the case.

It has been months of being in pain and that doesn't matter to them. When Dr. Rentz came in, it was all of five minutes he was there, with a very arrogant attitude and rushing through.

I do not recommend this office!|I'm still waiting to see if this was worth a visit.  So far I don't have a good impression.  The MA was far better than the doctor himself and I didn't appreciate the fact that I made an appointment with one doctor specifically and was switched to another without any warning.  I would have cancelled the appointment had I known.  I drove an hour for this appointment and it was mostly a waste of time.

Edit:  Reduced rating to one star a week after visit.  They were supposed to send a prescription to my pharmacy and an image request and no one at the office did anything as a follow-up to my appointment.  So I was rushed through my appointment and the appointment resulted in nothing, not even the office following up with what they said they were going to do.  Don't waste your time here, it's just a money drain for nothing.  The doctor made it downstairs before me after my appointment so I'm wondering if he never gave my chart to his team to follow-up on.|If I could give a negative # review, I would have. All about the Almighty $ and throw in disgusting customer service. Don't wait over a month to tell patient insurance denied, when waiting on a surgical procedure you were counting on in 2 weeks.  Never, ever again!|If you are looking for a five star experience you should visit Dr. Jack Rentz and his team. They are amazing! I can not say enough wonderful things about the care I received at this office. I have been in pain for some time and Dr. Rentz is the first doctor that could help me find answers. Dr. Rentz is extremely knowledgeable and kind. He showed me models so I could visualize what could be causing my pain. He listened and took time to fully understand my condition. He put me at ease about getting surgery. He has amazing surgical abilities and exudes confidence in his line of work. The office locations are extremely clean and up to date. The front office staff is always friendly, organized and on time. They are extremely helpful in helping me understand my insurance information for each procedure and making sure my procedures are covered under my insurance plan. Every provider I have seen at this office goes above and beyond. They truly care about their patients. If you are in pain and looking for answers you should book a consult with Dr. Rentz. Thank you Dr. Rentz and team!!!! You guys are truly fabulous!!!!!|I love Dr Rentz and his staff! He always takes his time and listens! He explains things thoroughly. He and his staff are great!! And Sarah, my PA is so amazing! She listens to everything and isn't rushed. I appreciate the great care I receive from Dr Rentz, Sarah and The wonderful receptionist who gets things done!! Thank y'all!|Mo the receptionist made me feel welcome and my being there was important.  The care coordinator was very attentive and genuinely seem to care about my situation and finding the right plan for my wellness and recovery.  I would recommend Denver Diagnostic Pain Clinic over any other.  Thank you,  -Aaron S.|I love this place! They actually listen to you, spend time with you, and actively help you.
I see both Dr Rentz and Sara, PA, and both are amazing and kind.

Most of the front desk is amazing, fun to chat with and so great to work with! If you can avoid dealing with Mo (Moe?), you'll have the best customer service ever.

Highly recommend!|I really like their physician assistant.  The issue I have with this practice is the billing and scheduling.  They are very busy so you have to book to hold a place on the list (not my complaint).  However the last two times I have scheduled procedures I have found out just the day before what my out of pocket will be.  For those of us with these huge deductible plans and changing companies annually it is hard to know what a cost will be through their particular facility.  So when you learn the day before that you will owe several thousand and decide against that financial drain and to just live with the pai , they still charge you a fee.  It is just unfortunate...plus you are still in pain.  You feel ripped off by your health insurance,  sad about your broken body, and frustrated having to pay a fee when you know your appointment slot was easily back filled from the long list of other people wanting or needing these injections and rhyzotomies.

column2: Dr. Paul Leo, MD | Anesthesiologist & Pain Management Specialist -- Center for Spine & Orthopedics
column3:
At the Center for Spine & Orthopedics, we're proud to have Dr. Paul S. Leo as part of our expert medical team. As a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management specialist, Dr. Leo implements a comprehensive multi-modal approach to treating chronic pain conditions.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of advanced pain management solutions including:

  • Traditional interventional procedures (epidural steroids, joint injections)

  • Cutting-edge regenerative medicine treatments

  • Platelet Rich Plasma (PRP) therapy

  • Stem cell injections

  • Customized medication management

What sets our practice apart is Dr. Leo's commitment to combining various therapeutic approaches to address each patient's unique pain challenges. We take the time to listen carefully to your concerns, conduct thorough examinations, and develop personalized treatment plans that deliver meaningful results. Located in Thornton, Colorado, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Learn more about our comprehensive services at Dr. Paul Leo - Center for Spine & Orthopedics or call us at +1 303-287-2800 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Dr. Paul S. Leo is a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management doctor. He uses a multi-modal pain management approach which combines therapies, medications and interventional procedures. Along with traditional pain management methods, such as epidural steroids and joint injections, Dr. Leo is also an expert in regenerative medicine, including platelet rich plasma (PRP) therapy and stem cell injections.

column3:
Pain hurts, but effective solutions exist. At AdventHealth Pain Specialists Porter, we understand that solving complex problems of debilitating pain requires specialized expertise.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our team of dedicated pain management physicians offers advanced treatments tailored to your specific needs. We combine cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care to help restore your quality of life and functionality.

Our specialized services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Nerve blocks and injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

We believe that effective pain management requires a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Our physicians work closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that target the root cause of discomfort. Visit AdventHealth Pain Management Porter or call us at +1 303-762-0808 to schedule your consultation at our Denver location: 850 E Harvard Ave #125, Denver, CO 80210.
column11:
Pain hurts, we can provide pain management solutions.

It's a simple truth, an obvious fact. Solving the complex problems of debilitating pain is neither simple nor obvious. Often it demands the breadth of knowledge and skill that only a doctor who specializes in pain relief can offer.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Aurora, CO

At our practice, Dr. Tushar Sharma specializes in advanced clinical pain management techniques to help patients regain comfort and mobility. We provide expert care for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Back pain and sciatica

  • Neck pain and headaches

  • Joint, shoulder, and myofascial pain

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndromes

  • Cancer-related pain and neuropathy

Our interventional pain techniques include lumbar and cervical epidural steroid injections, nerve root blocks, facet blocks, and specialized joint injections for hips, knees, shoulders, and carpal tunnel syndrome. We combine medical expertise with compassionate care to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root cause of your pain. Located at University of Colorado Medicine, our team is committed to improving your quality of life through effective pain management strategies. Contact us at (720) 848-1970 to schedule a consultation at our Aurora office.
column11: I have expertise in clinical pain management techniques, including: back pain, sciatica, headaches, joint pain, shoulder pain, Complex Regional Pain Syndromes, myofascial pain, neck pain, cancer-related pain, and neuropathy. My interventional pain techniques include: Lumbar and cervical epidural steroid injections, nerve root blocks, and lumbar and cervical facet blocks, joint injections (Hips, Knees, Shoulders, Carpal Tunnel).

column3:
At Capitol Pain Institute Colorado Springs, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Colorado Springs area.

Advanced Pain Management Services

Dr. Meyer and our dedicated team offer a wide range of interventional pain treatments including:

  • Spinal injections and nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulator evaluations

  • Personalized medication management

With over two decades of experience, we take pride in our patient-centered approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Our practice combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care to help restore quality of life. Located conveniently at 6025 Delmonico Dr in Colorado Springs, we're committed to developing individualized treatment plans that address the root cause of your pain. For consultations or to learn more about our services, call us at +1 719-598-7562 or visit Capitol Pain Institute Colorado Springs to schedule your appointment.
column38: Dean Brehm|Mikki Andersen|kt parish|Kimberly Parker|Tiffany Zumwalt|Jane McNally|Patty Kochenower|Dan Jewell
column40:
I can't even accurately rate this physician, because I've had a referral to see him for acute neck pain for over a MONTH... i've called 4 times to try and get on his schedule and all I get from the call center in India is he has to review the referral before they can even schedule an consultation.  So, I'll just sit here in acute pain until this d-bag decides to "Review" my referral and grace me with his 1-2 minutes of precious time.|The most caring, knowledgeable, professional, polite, and personal group of individuals I have had the pleasure to encounter. Dr. Meyer is spot-on good and has shown me that he cares about his patients. I have also observed the care he personally gave to other patients, some with special needs, and believe he is a truly capable, competent, and compassionate professional physician.|Dr  Meyers made great first impression. Then complete lack of care afterwards. My mother was experiencing incapacitating back spasms for 6 days and office did not respond to calls (actually pleas for help). I don't actually know if Dr Meyer ever received the messages we left.  Contacted office manager who made excuses and was condescending. ZERO compassion or care. My mom's very compassionate orthopedic surgeon & PCP are not equipped to manage her pain any longer. The ER tried and failed to help her. Feels like the priority at this practice is on doing procedures and not in helping an elderly patient in desperate pain.  We were so hopeful but let down. I suggest Dr Meyer and staff review his Philosophy of Care that is posted on their site.|I can't describe how wonderful it is to be seen and heard by your physician, especially a pain specialist. Dr Meyer and his PA David have always  taken their time with me and shown great compassion and care.
Dr Meyer is helpful in trying to find just what's right for my pain management needs.
I never mind having to wait a bit because I know he is giving the same great care to all his patients as he does me.
His office staff are friendly and kind and have done their best to get me in when needed. It's obvious they are happy working in this office and with their doctors.|Worst doctors office EVER, do not go here. You can't get a straight answer, your constantly trying to get answers and NO ONE responds. I was even willing to make and pay for a doctor appointment and was denied. Another note..... I WAS NOT LOOKING for opioids. I went in trying to find a doctor to implant a Spinal Cord Stimulator, Dr Meyer told me he did not implant them but had a doctor that does. Ok, that didn't bother me. He obviously lied, my procedure was approved by my insurance company in Oct. Well it's Dec and still no doctor. Don't waste your time. They don't care about you or your health issues. Fund someone who cares.|I'm not sure the pain injections are going to work based on my prognosis but I'm glad I'm trying it before going down the surgery road.  I disagree wholeheartedly about the reviewers that have issues with the staff.  My experience has been nothing but professional, friendly, willing to explain everything and compassion.  I've only been in twice but have been in phone conversations several times besides my appointments and again, everyone is very nice and respectful of my situation and truly want to help.  Dr. Meyer is amazing.  My first injection was under sedation but my second was not and he walked me through every step and was cracking jokes with his staff that made me laugh and be at ease.  Every time I felt pain he would say with sincerity "i'm sorry" and that made me feel better.  I highly recommend Dr. Meyer and his staff.|I have been a patient of Dr Meyers and David Faron, PA for many years , my mother was a patient of Dr Meyers as well. I can't even begin to express what an amazing experience I've had with these physicians and staff. They not only treat your pain, they care about you and what's going on all around you and have helped me physically as well as emotionally. They are the most compassionate and caring group I've ever encountered , and I've not only seen many physicians as a patient and worked with many in my career . I guarantee this office will take such great care of you , highly recommended. I looked forward to my visits to see Alex and Nikki David and Dr Meyers and they always made me smile and feel better . I absolutely love these guys and there is no more caring group around .  Thank you all for taking such great care of me and being there for me in every way . You've all made such a difference in my life . God Bless you all and you are so appreciated .|The 5 stars are for Dr. Meyer and his staff. Great experience yesterday for my SCS Trial. The Capitol Pain Management  merger, on the other hand, has turned personal care into corporate care.

At Mountain View Pain Center, we are dedicated to finding the root cause of your pain rather than just treating symptoms. Whether you're dealing with pain from an injury or a chronic condition, our team of specialists provides comprehensive care in a supportive environment.

Personalized Pain Management Solutions

Each patient receives a custom treatment plan designed to address their specific needs and ensure optimal results. As an effective alternative to surgery and traditional pain management approaches, we offer a variety of treatment options including:

- Chiropractic care

- Physiotherapy

- Acupuncture

- Pain management procedures

- Customized rehabilitation exercises

Our integrated approach combines multiple disciplines under one roof, making your care journey more convenient and effective. Located in Northglenn, our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. Start your journey towards a pain-free life by making an appointment with us today or call us at +1 720-773-2464. We're conveniently located at 11990 Grant St #400, Northglenn, CO 80233.

column38: Elias Standley|Jerry Peer|Sasha White|Deborah Kerr-Couture|Molly McGuire|Kamali Spence|Robert Hill|Missy Marie
column40:
Very pleased with Mountain View Pain Center, they were able to schedule me quickly, they listened to what I had to say, did a little diagnostic and focused on that area, and were able to alleviate the cause, all within a 30 minute visit!!!!! Plus the prices are very reasonable even if you do not have insurance.

They also showed me a few stretches to perform for the next 2 weeks. It's been 1 week to date and I feel great, the stretches are helping immensely! The pain and numbness has gone from a 10 to a 1, and I am sure by the end of the second week it will be a 0

I had been experiencing numbness and a dual burning ache in my left arm and shoulder starting from behind my left shoulder blade for the past year and a half, I had been to several other chiropractors but none of them seemed to listen, they just perform a couple basic moves on you and take your money.|First off, I rarely bother to provide reviews because quality care should be every providers primary goal, right? But when staff go above and beyond to relax the patient and add some humor as well as sensitivity to their care, it deserves recognition. Such was my experience at the Northglenn clinic for the 2nd of 2 ablations.  Thank you Chris, Nicole and Dr. Gray for truly demonstrating care and compassion with just the right amount of light-hearted humor. Y'all are terrific!|I was so scared to get my injection shot but the staff made me so comfortable. Then after Dr. Matthew Gray was done, it was painless and fast.  The relief was instant and I cried tears of joy!! Thank you so much Mountain View Pain, Dr. Gray, and staff.|I absolutely love this place! They are such an amazing team of providers here & I am thankful they are helping me to reclaim my life! They are very understanding of the trauma my body has been through & include lots of encouragement to reach my goals Thank you Mountain View Pain Center 

Photo belongs to Elie Kerr|I absolutely love this place! I have had my pain go from everyday and debilitating to managed and under control with the help of physical therapy, acupuncture, chiropractor, trigger point injections, massage, Botox for my migraines, steroid shots for my bulging disc's, and medication that actually worked for my fibromyalgia (naltrexone in a micro dose), and no narcotics pushed for any of my pain. They don't push pills. They actually offer practical treatment that is working to reduce my pain and give me a body I can use again and not leave me bedridden like I was before. I would highly recommend this clinic to anyone experiencing pain.
The front desk staff is also amazing, especially Megan, she remembers my name and I don't even need to do anything when I walk in for an appointment anymore, they just already have me checked in, they're so attentive! Along with all the doctors and other staff I've interacted with. I highly recommend this place.
Pictured is the acupuncture room, the physical therapy area, the chiropractor area and the lobby.|Fraud 
No doubt that this place is committing insurance fraud. They want follow up appointments just to bill you. The billing department is terrible. It took them 11 months to file the claim with my insurance then billed me for the remainder over a year after I saw care. Pls seek professional help somewhere else. What they offer is not worth the hassle. Even their staff look over worked and overwhelmed.|I have chronic pain and was referred to mountain view by my rheumatologist .
I made the appointment and was seen by a Physician assistant .
We went over my problems and in my opinion I was not heard by her at all but she came up with a treatment plan and I started to do acupuncture and it helped some I had asked for some pain management health in the initial visit and was told that we needed treatment first witch I understand due to drug seeking junkies.
I did the treatment and like I said it. Helped
We'll I go through the treatment and a month and a half later I have my appointment for The p.a. again to discuss my pain and treatment plan.
I have to shovel snow to get to my vehicle to get to my appointment on time and when I get there they are closed? Wtf I call and was told they called to cancel the appointment due to weather.so I look at the time they called it was 20 minutes before the appointment.w.t.f in good weather I still would have been driving to get there on time ? And then I listen to the message and it tells me to call and reschedule the appointment. W.t.f ? You cancel and I have to call to make the appointment?
Well I went back for my acupuncture appointment today and I have to admit the young lady that does my acupuncture is and has always been professional and of the best quality.i thank her and hope she will find a quality place to work when this shit hole closes because the lack of care for the serious people in pain.
This place gets a f from me and the only thing they have going for them is the young lady that helped me.
Oh I never got any muscle relaxers or pain management at all .
Good luck if you decide to get help to manage pain at this place|These people lied about several things, but worse, are trying to keep my $275 cash because I don't have enough $ to get several procedures they sprang on me as being mandatory to be seen by them. OBVIOUSLY none of this was told to me when making the appt, because this is their scam, w/those who do not have ins. they also wouldn't give me a receipt either, so yeah- I think it's obvious what they are running here. they didn't even have my name or date of birth down right. Absolutely incredible. Now I'm going to have to get my attorney involved&its making my pain worse so I'll be having to sue for compensation. STAY AWAY. He advised me to make this review asap, since he said this is what some do. They have their people working in turkey and all over too, so it's way more elaborate than we probably even know. Again, STAY AWAY.

column38: Lynnette Daniel|Nichole|Abbie|Tina Madrigal|JH|Constance Schemmel|Kim Sherer|Karen Crouch
column40:
I am a patient of Erin Christiansen and I've been going to the Colorado Clinic for almost 10 years. I've always been very pleased with how I am treated. Erin makes me feel heard when I've spoken to her about my pain and I never feel rushed with my appointments. She is extremely knowledgeable and genuinely cares about her patients well being and finding the best solution for pain management. I would definitely recommend Colorado Clinic, as well as Erin, to others.

~Lynnette|I am leaving one star because you have to in order to leave a review. I was a patient here for about ten years, never had an issue. When my provider left, I was assigned to Shavonne to continue my care until I could get set up another doctor. My one and only apointment with Shavonne at first seemed to go well even though she had not even looked at my chart until my Telehealth appointment,which in of itself negligent. Next she told me they would do my knee injections but another provider would need to do them because she was booked, ok, no problem until I went to Scheduale the knee injections and was told by Elizabeth (Liz) that they don't do knee injections and haven't for about two years, which was a lie because my doctor was doing them about once a year. This Elizabeth then proceeds to tell me that the referral to the new pain office had been sent over and that they could not see me, which is a lie, legally, a medical provider is suppose to give 30 days of continued care to find a new provider and be able to see that new doctor. Next issue is, Shavonne obviously did not listen to me at my apointment because she put incorrect information into my chart regarding physical therapy, stating I refused recommend care - can't refuse something you are already receiving and have been for some time-had she of done her job correctly, she would have known this. Now, my new pain provider and I have been trying to get my records sent over to continue care since about September and nothing. Called a couple weeks ago or so and again spoke to Liz, who, again was extremely disrespectful and said she sent my records to my new doctors office on January 26th. Well I just had my monthly apointment with my new doctors office and she still has not recieved my records from Colorado Clinic - legally, they are required to have it sent over within 30 days. I stopped by the office this morning and it was locked up with a sign saying they are closed and to call the main number and guess what, nothing, just a recording that says to leave a message and then the phoneline hangs up. So, Colorado Clinic, here is the thing, you get me my records ready for me to pick up, you place them in my happy little hand for me to take to my new doctor and we won't have this conversation in front of the medical board and a civil judge. I have you on negligence, falsifying medical records, patient abondanment, and refusal to release MY medical records. I will be reporting Colorado Clinic to the department of regulatory agency and calling Tom martino and I suggest everyone who is and have had the same problems.|Abbie^ is my daughter. My name is Christine. I love Colorado clinic, I have been a patient since 2016. I think over the years I have seen every dr. at the clinic. But now I have Erin Christiansen. I absolutely love her. She is so patient. I feel like she understands me and believes me. Being chronically in pain, it's so important that your doctor believes you. I would recommend her to anybody that is in pain.|Dr shavonne is amazing. She's very personable. She actually remembers details and cares about my life as a whole. She listens and will make changes to meds as needed. I've been seeing her for a few years and I couldn't be happier to have her in charge of my care. The only issue I've ever had was getting ahold of the office and having calls returned. Other than that I have no complaints the new office in Greeley is much further away but worth the trip to continue to get care from my dr. I won't go anywhere else if I can help it. Thank you shavonne for being amazing.|Very impressed with timely follow up for help with my joint pain with good results. Dr Sisson is very informative, took time to discuss other appropriate treatment options and with a caring approach. All other associates from phone calls, to phone visits to treatment were friendly and professional.|If I could give a negative review,  I would!  I really like the doctors and P.As however the administration there is the worst.  Messages don't get passed on and don't even bother leaving one by voicemail because in the many years that I've been there I have NEVER gotten a call back from leaving a voicemail.
The latest issue is that a purely medical issue came up that was urgent and the office manager took it but did my P.A. get it? No.  And so for a week I was left without 2 critical meds.
And this is not just this office's problem as I've been to 3 of the clinics and they are all just as bad.
Unless Colorado Clinic's owner gets his act together and hires (or pays better or trains better because their turnover rate is terrible) a better staff, things will continue and there will be other clinics willing to pick up the slack.|Colorado Clinic disappeared in the night. Their offices are empty, nobody answers the phones, no responses to emails or requests from their web page. They left hundreds of patients without much-needed medications and care. There are patients with severe pain issues and injuries, cancer patients, etc. Colorado Clinic just closed their doors one day without telling any of us! No notice, no referrals to another pain doctor, nothing. I shudder for how many patients also went into withdrawal and how many are suffering right now. I'll be reporting them to the State Board and speaking with an attorney for patient abandonment and encourage any patient who was affected to do the same. My PCP will also be notifying the Board as she also tried repeatedly to reach any doctor or NP with Colorado Clinic, to no avail. What they've done is NOT okay.|I cannot thank you enough Dr.Sisson you and Erin Christensen have been so helpful in assessing my pain needs.I am so thankful for all of you even the staff at the Colorado Clinic. I appreciate you all and again I cannot thank you enough for assessing my needs during all my office visits. You all have been wonderful .
Sincerely
Karen Crouch

Merry Christmas  Happy New Year

column40:
My experience with Kristen has been very professional. She's very upbeat. She knows what she's doing. She is very thorough. She explains things very well. She is very knowledgeable and she thinks about other exercises ahead of time and thinks more about her patience and their rehab rehabilitation. I give her five stars and would refer her to anybody that needs to have physical therapy done.   Thanks, Greg Roach|Brittany  is one of the best I've  ever had. She'ds very nice and respectable. She has found out so many things that was wrong  with my neck , back hips everything I love her|I've been coming to MVP for over a year now after being referred and could honestly say this was the best decision I've made. Brittany, Joshua and Frank have made the biggest difference for my health. Both Wadsworth and Lakewood have wonderful staff that know what they're doing treatment wise. Definitely thankful for them all.|PT lied about available options for pain relief. They push chiropractor which isn't covered by insurance. No massage available though was originally advertised. 20 years of chronic pain and my only options were meds I cannot take injections that have caused more pain or visiting with a psych nurse. My mental health is not the problem it's the 20+ years of medical neglect and trauma. I have no quality of life but as usual all they care about is money not actual patient care. Will never return|Shady Billing department! My account is being charged twice for a few visits and no one can tell me why. I have receipts and no answers. It came out of the blue and the billing department refuses to help!!!! It's been a game of phone tag. I have called for a few weeks, gone in person, and no one can help me.

The clinic and everyone is great, but their billing department is extremely shady and doesn't seem to give answers for their practices.|Josh is a knowledgeable and empathetic person who knows how to listen to his patients and provide excellent support and guidance towards a healthier lifestyle.|Excellent facility overall, but I really need to call out Jaime, the office manager, for going WAY above and beyond the call of duty! Having hit one roadblock after another, with various providers and my insurance, I was beginning to despair that I'd ever get the treatment I needed. Once I got in contact with Jaime, everything changed. She took personal ownership for solving this problem. She navigated the internal company administration, worked with the insurance company, and fully understood my needs and timing. She found solutions when the process hit snags and tenaciously followed up on each step. Within ONLY 2 HOURS of our first conversation, she had gotten the treatment approved and had me scheduled for the very next day! I am truly grateful for her initiative, tenacity, problem solving, and warm and compassionate demeanor. Kudos to Jaime, and kudos to Mountain View for empowering someone like her to solve problems and deliver superior patient outcomes.|Kind, caring, compassionate. I can't say enough about Mountain View Pain Care. But that's exactly what they do, they care. From the front desk, to chiropractor, PT, and the doctors, everyone is amazing!
