column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Colorado Springs

At Capitol Pain Institute, we are dedicated to providing exceptional pain management services to patients throughout Colorado Springs and surrounding areas. Our team of specialized physicians, led by Dr. Meyer and his associates, combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. We understand that chronic pain can be debilitating, which is why we work collaboratively with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans.

Our state-of-the-art facility at 6025 Delmonico Dr offers a comfortable environment where patients receive individualized attention. We provide a comprehensive range of services including:

  • Spinal injections and interventional procedures

  • Medication management for chronic pain

  • Conservative treatment approaches

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Collaborative care planning

What sets us apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our physicians take time to listen and understand each patient's unique situation, ensuring that treatment plans address specific needs and goals. Visit our Colorado Springs location or call us at +1 719-634-7246 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column38: Joseph Touchette|Mary Morgan|Stacy Grossman|Greg Stoffel|Nicholas T|marc richard|Stuart Hensley|Ms. S
column40:
The providers at CPI Colorado Springs, are some of the best that I have seen, particularly Dr. Myer and Patience Jukiewicz. They are compassionate, very knowledgeable, and make me feel valued as a person. Living with chronic pain can be incredibly difficult. It is so much worse when you feel as if no one is really on your side, or even cares about what you are going through. I always leave CPI feeling confident that someone has my best interest at heart and is willing to help me face these challenges with their medical expertise. As a person who tends to be nervous about medical interventions, I also love that they are very supportive and helpful in regards to recommending more conservative approaches to controlling chronic pain. In many cases, there are a lot of things we, as patients, can do for ourselves. When I discuss my personal "tools" with them, I can tell they honestly appreciate what I am trying to do. In regards to the business staff... I have to say that I have not been to a medical facility where they are so friendly since my family dentist when I was a teenager. I have received a polite and warm welcome every single time I have come to an appointment at CPI. Even the folks I have spoken to on the phone system were very nice. That is not all that common in the Medical Industry these days. I highly recommend CPI!|Your one of the worst pain management companies ever dealt with. Called several times about my medicine and they don't call it in or even say why they Are not doing it. They called to change my appointment, I ride silver key and they need two weeks notice to reschedule a ride, so I reset my appointment as your company said with a voicemail which I still have. Then they tell me that they didn't do that and my appointment was on the same day as before after I cancelled my silver key ride and had to reschedule it. I reschedule my appointment first as I was told to do by your doctors. Now they will not give me my medicine. I have a lot of pain and Federal law says that you can't leave any one in pain or leave them without their medication. You have done this to me and as I found out you have been playing this game with several other people. Trying to charge for two visits or something? It is bad enough you charge $800 for an office visit and more if I see the doctor just to get my refills. If it wasn't the law of this dumb state I would never go, the cruelty is over wellming.|I have had 2 appointments at Capital Pain Institute and both times I felt acknowledged. Both  Dr Meyers and Patience, his PA seemed knowledgeable and were kind. They are in their own one story building and disabled parking was right in front of the building.|I had a referral sent to Capitol Pain Institute and have been waiting for a week to get scheduled. The referral has already been approved through Tricare but I keep getting the runaround with the scheduling people. I asked to talk with someone so they could explain why I have been waiting and no one has called me back. Very poor communication with the scheduling department, I can't image what the office will be like. Highly disappointing, I do not recommend this office.|I have been a patient here for awhile. Things use to run smoothly until recently. I have had an approved tricare referral since December 6th. I have yet to talk to anyone about scheduling a procedure, getting around there call screening company is a total pain in the rear! I guess in 2025 you need to show up on person at the office to schedule an appointment.|Dr. Meyer and his team are second to none! I have tried a few Dr.'s with no relief! I researched him and wanted to get into his office for a consultation. He did my spinal injections and gave me my life back! I have now been a few times and my quality of life is still going strong! I highly recommend he and his team!|So for some context. I use the VA for my health insurance as everything is covered. The VA will only approve a referral for a business that will take it. Meaning there shouldn't be an issue whenever you call to schedule as long as the referral has reached them.

Onto the issue. I called on 9/11/2024 to schedule my new patient appointment. They told me that they had received my referral however the insurance wasn't approved yet. So I said " ok we'll schedule me my appointment now so that way I can be on the books and not have to wait any longer and potentially have people get in front of me". The representative said "yes I understand but we can't not do that as the insurance hasn't been approved yet". Thats the first time. I called again today 9/16/2024. The same issue arises with a different representative. I then ask to speak to a manager and the manager told me she approved it and they would call me back to schedule which they haven't yet.

My point is that the VA will not provide me with a referral unless that business has to accept it. Meaning the insurance will be good no matter what. So why can't I schedule an appointment and be on the books instead of wasting my time while I'm in serious pain. Also even if they didn't "approve" it then ok, cancel the appointment...

As far as their actual services go I can't speak on that. As I haven't even gotten past the scheduling yet.

So here we go over a week now with still no appointment. That could have easily been on the books last week. Thank you guys for that. Outstanding performance.

Update: I have been receiving treatment from them now for well over a couple of months and the treatment has been amazing. They work with me and listen to me. The staff there is all kind and courteous as well. I do recommend this place. My only complaint and concern is the call center in which you have to go through initially. If they fixed that problem then this would be a 5 star place. But of course it's a business and their operating cost needs to be managed so they outsource their customer service department which is an interesting area to save money but it is what it is.|I am writing this review here because there seems to be no other way to communicate with Capitol Pain Institute.  I've been seen by Dr. Sandell in Colorado Springs for a year and I'm very happy having him as my Pain Doc.  I would rate Dr. Sandell a 5 star, but I rate the admin/business side of Capitol Pain Institute a 1.  Very unsatisfactory.  I've had 4 injections over the period of a year but have never once received a statement of my account, nor has it been made available online. I was told by Dr. Sandell's front desk personnel that they had no access to billing info, that all accounting operations had been centralized and that I would need to call the Austin billing office. They gave me the Austin phone number so I called and left a message, which was returned by a person named Lindsay on 9/24. She told me I had a credit balance on my account and said she could refund it and I told her yes, please send me a check.  I then had a follow up apptmt with Dr. Sandell on 9/30 and, when the front desk staff member requested a co-pay, I asked her to take it from my credit balance. I then asked her how I could obtain copies of my billing statement and she said she would have to request them online from the Austin office, and that it would take about 10 min to come in. That was the only way I was able to see the billing activity on my account, as there is NO info made available to me on my Capitol Pain Institute Patient Portal. what is shown instead is this message:  'Statements have not been published'.  I waited for a refund check to come but it never did, so I again tried calling Lindsay in the Austin office. I called on Oct 1, 3, 5, 7 and left messages but never received a call back from her, or anyone else.  I then called Dr. Sandell's office and got the answering service, who transferred me - again - to the Austin billing office. I called once again on Oct 9, waited a week and then called a different number I found on Capitol Pain Institute's main website and reached yet another answering service, who transferred me to Leslie Garza's extension, where I left yet another message. So here it is over a month later, I have still not received my reimbursement of funds due and I am unable to get in touch with a live person about it. In summary, 1) a patient cannot get past the answering service,2) there is no main customer service number to call for help, 3) no online chat available, 4) no phone numbers available other than the ones I have already been given that aren't being answered, 5) no online access to billing info, 6) no statements available....in short, zero transparency. I have the right as a patient to see what has been billed and posted to my billing account, yet the administration is making it impossible for me to get access to it.  At this point I have no choice but to drive down to the doctor's office to try and talk to the admin there, because I am out of ideas and shouldn't have to work this hard to get access to info I am entitled to.  In closing I want to stress again that I love Dr. Sandell and want to remain his patient, but the constant problems I've had with the answering service regarding both this matter, as well as scheduling issues, are unacceptable and unprofessional.  I did not want to post this on a public forum but I noticed that corporate seems to read the reviews so maybe this will get someone's attention, and let the people in power know that these problems are pervasive throughout the administrative side of the practice.

column40:
This place is amazing and the staff/doctors takes good care of all the people that comes here. The doctors listen and does what it takes to help people live life better or start living life again. Yes! These doctors truly care about the patient and just not here for a quick buck. They will do whatever it takes to make your life better but you have to be willing, honest, and by by the rules. Meaning if your asked to try something or do something than do it because beating pain takes the patients effort also to try, understand, want the ability to achieve, and by by the rules set fourth from this clinic because its not just up to the doctor. The entire staff is respectful, caring, and willing to help. This clinic offers many different pain management techniques, totally professional, and they are very organized. I recommend to everyone that wants to get their chronic pain under control, live the positive life they been seeking, and to have a doctor that cares and understands.|Update: 10-22-21.  This is insane.  The amazing and wonderful Dr. Nguyen, like all other quality providers that have come to this practice, has left, and we're back to the nightmare that was.  I was encouraged to give Sondra Early another shot, and to her credit she sounded compassionate and filled my prescription.  Here's the nightmare...I called to schedule another refill appointment and was told that Sondra was out of town until after I needed a refill and they would call me back with another provider who could take care of me.  Five days later I get a call that I'm behind on my urine screening and NO PROVIDERS WILL ALLOW ME TO EVEN SCHEDULE an appointment until after I've provided one.  Now, let's just be clear, I've been a patient here for over five years.  In that time I've NEVER had a questionable urine screen.  I'm a model patient.  Here's the problem, they won't even get the results from the screen back until the day I run out of meds at the earliest, and THEN they will schedule me?

Here's the point, isn't it medical malpractice to prescribe someone a medication and then force them to go off of it abruptly for no fault of their own?  I've reached out to the office manager twice with no calls returned.  The problem is that everyone is a pill seeking junkie to them.   I understand that they have to protect themselves legally, but at what cost to the patient? I've now had four providers there in 5 years.  All the good ones leave, and I guess I should too.|Had a medical needs person that couldn't walk that needed help and I had to stop in the front of the building with medical van so they could get out easier, I got told by a Hispanic man that I'm not allowed to park there which I was not parked at all I was trying to help my medical needs person out of the vehicle, there were no parking spots whatsoever in the front because they were filled, my person who couldn't walk needed the best help,  then the Hispanic man who appeared to work at the front desk abruptly told me that he didn't care that I needed to go find a spot in the parking lot if I was that desperate.   It appears that This place does not care about people in need, The only care about business and parking spots, It sadness me that a special needs person is treated so poorly and how rude someone could be when they haven't walked a mile and someone else's shoes. Extremely unprofessional by any means hopefully someday they'll clean up their act and treat others how they wish to be treated.|The only reason I gave it 3 stars and not more is for DR. Erin Christianson, not sure of spelling, but she's been a God send and she's really the only reason I continue with my appts, I've made a good professional relationship with her as her pt, however, the bad part is I've had my last FOUR procedure appts cancelled on me for some different reason each time and I've really needed that back procedure. After several months, I still have not had it done yet, yet I get charged a lot for missing 1 a while back but they can keep cancelling on me making me while in total pain. If it weren't for Dr. Erin, I probably would look for another clinic, but the staff are very friendly and helpful though, so it is hard to give that up too.|If I could rate then 0 stars I could. My husband had been coming here for a year and every time we come, we have to wait 30 minutes past our appointment time before we are taken back. We show up early, he gets taken back 30 minutes late. We show up on time, he sets taken back 30 minutes late. It didn't matter. Then when booking appointments we have to wait months between appointments or hope someone cancels. Every time they have a new excuse. Speaking with other patients I hear similar stories. The only reason this clinic is still in business is because their patients have no other options. Otherwise I know they would be losing patients left and right.|If you have a couple of hours to spend waiting this is the right  place for you. The staff are rude. When I first started going there was seeing a decent person each time and wasn't too bad. She was nice,had you in and out pretty quick. But a couple of times had late afternoon appointments and got calls saying something had came up and if I couldn't get there before 11 would have to reschedule. We live about 50 miles from the place and takes an hour to get there depending on traffic,weather conditions. One time I made an honest mistake and showed up the day after my actual appointment for my scheduled appointment. It was my fault,I wrote the wrong date down. What happened then was almost comical. They told me I could go home and call each morning to see if anyone canceled, Now I couldn't sit there to see if someone called it made an honest mistake like me and didn't show up, but could drive back home 50 miles and call to see if an opening comes up and call each day to see if there was one,this after driving 50 miles one way in a snow storm when the day before when my appointment was the weather was nice. They blame everything on people leaving. Not being able to keep employees should tell you all you need to know. If I had a 10 am appointment would be 30-40 minutes before even getting called to the back,then would sit there another 20 minutes waiting to be seen. The guy who did my last injections was new and horrible at it. He just pokes and prods you like you were livestock of some sort.I've been going to pain management for 11 years now and this is by far the worst place I've been too.|This has been the worst experience I've ever had. I have been going to this clinic for over a yr.
From the very beginning the front desk ladies ( London ) were extremely rude.
I was suppose to get my refill last week, I went in the day before and did my UA. The next day I was suppose get my meds and 20 mins past my phone appt, I got a call from the NP telling me I was dropped as a patient because I didn't get my endoscopy done. I've already had 3 endoscopy and 3 colonoscopies, with still no clue as towh at was wrong.  They did not care if I went through withdraw .|I was just informed that they are closing their doors, which is sad. Leah has been great and I loved her encouragement and she is so knowledgeable as well.  I wish they weren't closing.  .  There was just a small period of time where there were issues, I believe due to staffing problems, but overall they've been great! I can't say enough about Leah!

column40:
really did enjoy this business until a few weeks ago. Morgan and Dr hsu are great - but their staff is not. Their medical assistant dropped the ball on a preauthorization that was never submitted or received by my insurance company. So I called my insurance company and they explained they didn't have anything on file. Not a preauthorization, not anything. Called the office back and the assistant continued to argue with me and say she submitted the request on Jan 22. I called my insurance again and ended up having my insurance leave a voicemail stating they do not have anything even pending.|I'm honestly very shocked at my experience here. I have stage 4 endometriosis and some other suspected issues that cause me severe chronic pain in my pelvis, hips, lower back, and abdomen. My OBGYN referred me here (will be contacting her office to not use this place anymore) and I was originally scheduled for yesterday. I have a TBI and have to put everything on my calendar or I don't remember. When I had made the appointment, the person on the phone confirmed with me that I would be coming in at 11am. I get there day of, they say my appointment was at 10am and I was almost an a hour late. I figured it was on me and my TBI brain, and was rescheduled for today. My appointment (confirmed verbally multiple times) was at 1:15pm. When I go my confirmations this time, I double checked, and it said 1pm. So I called and was told that it said 1pm even though I was scheduled for 1:15 pm because I needed to be 15 minutes early. I get there, check in, no problem. I ended up waiting for almost an hour. Checked in at 1pm, called back at 1:50pm. I had arrived with 2 other people who were in and out while I was still waiting. I get back to the room and it's 2 medical students, which normally I don't mind because I get they have to learn and observe. Whatever. These girls were acting like it was a mock class day or something with a pretend patient. They didn't seem to know what they were doing at all and were more interested in talking to each other than me, the patient, coming in for severe chronic pain and chronic illness. It was a little after 2pm when they left. About 5 minutes later, the physicians assistant came in like she was is in a massive rush and I was the inconvenience. She rushes through her questions and her tone was condescending and rude, which didn't match her fake kind words. She had me stand up to feel around the areas where my pain is and as I did so, she asked some questions about my cane (I have vertigo and pots and chronic pain, I can't be mobile without it) and looked at me like I had no reason to need it. She started pushing around my lower back to get an idea of what hurts and what doesn't. Normal right? Nope. She wasn't just feeling or poking she was digging what felt like her whole knuckle along my lower back and hip area which set off a fiery, burning, sharp pain. I flinched, gasped, and instinctively tried to move away but she didn't stop and just kept digging across multiple times. The only acknowledgement she gave was "ya that hurts, ya okay". When she stopped, I wanted to cry and was thankful she told me to sit on the patient table, but one of the students came back to get the assistant who promptly left, in the middle of my examination. I looked at the clock and it was only 2:10pm. She'd barely been examination me for 10 minutes. I waited until almost 2:20pm and then I just walked out. I can't drive currently so a family member always takes me to appointments and today luckily it was my no nonsense dad. I texted him to come in and meet me so I could have someone walking me out. This behavior to me is insanely unprofessional, rude, and honestly vile. I've never walked out in the middle of an appointment like that. While I know I missed my original appointment, I wish I had missed this one.|Dr Hsu and Morgan are amazing! I've been seeing Dr Hsu for about 11 years, and refuse to even think about going somewhere else no matter how far away I move. He has treated me for chronic pain with several different injection types and has been a literal lifesaver, helping me keep a quality of life after life changing injury. He listens to what I say and knows exactly how to treat my various issues and conditions. He explains thoroughly and makes sure I understand what is happening, potential risks.
Morgan has shown compassion for my current state as well as concern for future needs. She always listens and both agree and Dr Hsu give me the time I need to make sure I am a participant in my care.|Doctor Hsu is super dedicated to releaving pain in my back and knees. Love the staff for their understanding and professionalism.|The doctor was amazing and made me feel so much better made me feel so comfortable. I really appreciate the how kind everyone was. My back and neck feels so much better. Thank you so much|I've been very pleased with the results of the PRP treatment. The doctor and his staff are very helpful. I just wish I had done it sooner|This place is amazing!!! Dr. Hsu is articulate and was very good  communicating with me; even during my procedure, he talked me through it. His follow up is superb!
The office is professional and efficient at getting patients on schedule quickly. Very thorough, friendly and professional team!!
I'd recommend anyone with pain involving spine and rehab to contact Spine, Pain and Rehab!!!!|I have been seeing Dr Hsu for years. Dr Hsu and PA Morgan and all of their staff are always nice and make my experience easy and stress free. I have a 20 year old injury, and have a fusion in between my L5 and S1 and Dr Hsu treats the unfixed disc between the L4 and L5. Dr Hsu has been treating me with cortisone injections on this disc for years now and he does a phenomenal job! Every single time he has done this procedure it has been on point and went above and beyond my expectations of relief. So it's fair to say he is gifted at his job! It is the only thing that has made me completely feel like a normal person over the years. He is the only doctor to provide relief in my back and nerves down my right leg and foot. The only doctor in twenty years out of many until I found this office! This has been life changing to me, in order to feel absolute relief and normal in my daily activities. He is kind and supportive and I really want to thank him and PA Morgan (she is awesome too, easy to talk to, and very understanding) and all their staff- thanks for your kindness and patience- for helping me over the years. I don't trust anyone else with my spine and I look forward to getting the prp injection coming up as a more permanent long term solution. If you are having trouble finding a trustworthy doctor to go see, who cares and will actually help you, in what feels like hopeless situations when it comes to back and nerve pain, I highly recommend this doctor! He will help you. Thank you,  I look forward to my prp procedure.

column40:
Everyone who works here is fantastic. From the moment you walk in the doors, the ladies at the front desk make you feel welcomed and do their best to help you with insurance and any questions you may have. Ben, Carmen, and Taylor are the best physical therapists I have ever had. They listen to you, actually listen, and work with you to help your pain. They work with your strengths and weaknesses and never push you past what you can do. I recommend Mountain View  to everyone with back pain.|I am receiving PT at Mountain View Pain Center for an old neck injury. Ben and Carmen have been super great, professional, and helpful.  I am just beginning my journey but the exercises have been helpful. I feel like I am already starting to experience more range of motion. That's a huge win. I am feeling hopeful!|The appointment was super confirtational and argumentative.  I understand there was an opiod crisis. The whole country knows that . I was not "drug seeking" and had no designs on securing a prescription at my appointment.  I was still treated like I was on parole or something.  Urine test , hostile provider, and left feeling like I had done something wrong for even making an appointment.  If I had my choice again I'd try somewhere else but at this point , they have my urine I feel like I'm locked in lol . This is a doctors office being run like a probation office.|Wouldn't recommend for a variety of reasons: staff, bedside manner and education level of practitioners, and abuse of insurance/treatment plans (they'd love for you to come in as frequently as possible to charge insurance for unnecessary and unwanted medical treatment). If you want your medical experience to feel like a McDonalds, this is your best bet. Look elsewhere for real care.|Having been a patient of Mountain View Pain Center (MVPC)  for a few years, my experiences with them have come full circle. When I first sought out MVPC for my Chronic Pain Management needs I was very pleased with those individuals that were directly involved with my care and the group as a whole. I saw them monthly for my pain management medication refills and medicine adjustments as needed. I also had physical therapy with them, initially 2x per week and then 1x per week as my condition slightly improved. After many weeks of physical therapy I began doing my own physical therapy at home due to the cost of doing it with MVPC. However, I did continue to see MVPC for my prescription pain management needs. After a few more months I personally saw an alarming turnover rate with the PAs that were treating me. Within a period of about 9 months I had been seen by 5 different PAs at different offices all around the Denver metropolitan area because the MVPCs PAs kept quitting for some unknown reason. I had to drive quite far to get to several different MVPC locations where they actually had PAs left that hadn't quite quit MVPC yet. It was at this point in my experience with MVPC that I became quite upset and depressed above and beyond my baseline depression. I couldn't obtain any consistency or build any relationship with MVPCs PAs  I was assigned to because after a couple of visits they kept resigning from MVPC.  I am also not able to work anymore due the severe chronic pain I have been dealing with for many years. A few months ago I was assigned my 5th PA with MVPC in the short amount of time I have been under their care. During my most recent prescription pain management appointment I was completely unexpectedly informed that MVPC would no longer be able to see me as a patient. MVPCs reasoning for rejecting me to receive care from them thereafter didn't seem anywhere close to reaching a reasonable threshold to stop caring for someone like me that deals with severe chronic pain, severe depression and not being able to work due to my medical condition. Additionally, you would think that a medical office who has so much turnover and who made me drive to multiple offices all over the Denver metro-area would want to show me that they actually care about their patients. Needless to say, because of MVPCs revolving door, ever resigning PAs, I felt that no one there was interested in forming a Doctor/Patient relationship with me. It seemed to me that MVPC only cared about the money. The owners and/or principals at MVPC who are Doctors took the Hypocratic Oath towards the end of their academic career. Apparently, given my experience with MVPC, they don't even care about the Oath they all swore to uphold. In closing, given my experience with MVPC and the fact that there are many pain management care professionals all over the Denver Metro-area, I strongly encourage you to seek out others and not MVPC.|I absolutely love the people in this office! They are all polite, warm, and caring! Coming here was one of the best decisions I've made.|they did great job
Carmen,Ben and Taylor did really well helping me with my shoulder and back
They have detail and very patient to do treatment
Very recommended it|Great facility due to it having chiropractic as well as physical therapy. Very helpful PA as well.

column3:
At Northern Colorado Pain Management, we specialize in providing comprehensive and compassionate care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Led by Dr. Jan Gillespie-Wagner, our dedicated team offers personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function. We understand that chronic pain can be debilitating, which is why we take the time to listen to each patient's unique concerns and develop tailored solutions.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We provide a wide range of advanced pain management treatments including:

  • Stellate Ganglion Nerve Blocks

  • Ketamine infusions

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive medication management

  • Treatment for Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

Our practice is committed to treating each patient with dignity and respect. Located at 1175 58th Ave #200, Greeley, CO 80634, we serve patients throughout Northern Colorado with evidence-based pain management solutions. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, please call us at +1 970-495-0444 or visit our website to learn more about how we can help you manage your chronic pain effectively.
column38: Harrison Rice|Kellie Grundon|mark starr|Jennifer Baker|Remy Marie|Hannah Anderson|Honest Pete|Jessica Pratt
column40:
I am writing this review to warn others about my experience with this particular practice.  Unfortunately, after seeking help from numerous doctors and exploring various avenues for pain management, this was my final attempt at finding relief.

Dr. Jan Gillespie-Wagner and Darci Rossitier were Dismissive and Uncaring.  During my appointment, the doctors I encountered displayed a hostile and aggressive demeanor.  They failed to consider the impact of my chronic pain on my daily life.  Furthermore, they seemed quick to dismiss my concerns and stereotype me as a patient, rather than listening to my specific experiences.

They were apathetic towards atypical pain. The most concerning aspect was their lack of understanding or apparent disregard for my non-typical pain condition. Instead of offering help, they were dismissive and pushed me away as a patient.

A Broken System: It's disheartening to realize how many people suffer at the hands of these medical professionals who are supposed to help.  This experience is just one more example of how the current system fails patients with non-standard conditions. DO NOT GO HERE|I love Dr. G and her office! I've been going here 3 years now and I'm so happy to have found them. Been dealing with lower back pain from arthritis and sciatica for many years now. Dr. G and her staff always listen to me and treat me with care and respect. At one point I moved farther away from her clinic and tried a different pain doctor. It was horrible!!! I was so happy to go back to Dr. G! I know a good doctor when I see one and she is one of the good ones! I'm so thankful for her and her wonderful office!|Colorado Pain Management has been very effective at treating me. The people at CPM are compassionate and caring. They take the time to get to know you and to understand your situation. They are equipped with many options to help manage chronic discomfort. I've had nothing but a pleasant and professional experience with everyone at
CPM.|I have been waiting since December for a call to schedule after they got authorization.  My Physician from UCHealth has placed my referral twice now!
When she followed up with them where I am in the process of being scheduled, they told her they tried calling me and my phone number was out of order! Which is a lie! No one called.  I have now called office several times to follow up and schedule, and rudely told someone would call me back! This place is unreal, and if your in pain, I believe they just don't care. I don't want pain pills! I just want some relief from severe lumbar pain before I proceed with surgery in the fall. Someone not doing their job, and definitely don't care!!!  Obviously, just a warm body filling a chair at that office!!! I have reported this to my physician, hoping they will not refer others there. Just terrible!|Dr. Gillespie and her team have saved my life. Before finding her I had almost given up hope. I have a condition known as CRPS. I had become a shell of who I was before my injury that led to my condition. Dr. Gillespie started treating me with Stellate Ganglion Nerve Blocks and Ketamine infusions which have been game changers. For the first time in years I am planning for my future again. I would give them more than 5 stars if I could.

Edit: after reading other reviews I just want to add that they have always gotten me in for a treatment one way or the other. Dr. Gillespie has treated me instead of taking a lunch break. Her staff have always been kind and compassionate. It's a bummer reading reviews from reviewers who never got in to see her. I can't speak to the tedious bureaucracy that is insurance but I can speak to her abilities. After years of struggling to find a Dr. who would actually listen to me and help me I am so grateful I finally did. I know there are so many people struggling with chronic pain and I know that most people won't ever find a great Dr. Who really cares. I am blessed I did.|By far the best doctors and staff in health care. I have been in a great deal of pain for almost 9 months. My mother goes here as well. She told them how much pain I was in. They stayed open later just to get me in to help give me pain relief while I wait for my procedures to be done at the hospital. Every single staff member was so kind and understood that I was in pain. Today I had a video teleheath appointment, and met even more staff. They all were so kind and wanted to truly help me. They listened to my concerns and I felt I was heard. I highly recommend them to anyone that is needing to get their pain under control.|Brought my wife in for a specific knee procedure. My wife has had 8 knee surgeries and a complete knee replacement. Our appointment was set for 2:45 PM we arrived at 2:15 PM as she was a new patient. We did not see the doctor until 5:00 PM, in that span we were moved to 2 different rooms, seen by three different people (who were not the doctor and asked some pretty ridiculous questions). We had nurses? come in and ask if we had seen other nurses because they could not locate them. I stuck my head out of the room at 4:45 to ask when we would see the doctor and was told she had an emergency and that was the delay. If I had not stuck my head out who knows when we would have been told this! So after three hours and two people manipulating my wife's  knee we were ready to throw in the towel. We scheduled the procedure and went home. The next day my wife called the office to ask if they could provide her with some pain medication until the procedure (about 6 days). I will not detail the ineptitude and hostility we encountered/endured but suffice it to say that my wife was treated as if she was an addict shopping for pain meds! Given the total lack of professionalism and organization by the front office we canceled the procedure. I am amazed that this office is still in business as I would not recommend them to anyone. I only wish I had read the reviews here before putting my wife through this experience.|I started the referral process a couple of months ago. Once this office said they finally received the referral, they said the doctor would review my referral to see if she would accept me as a patient. This person also told me she was confused because they do not treat CF. This was NOT the reason for the referral (but included as background health information as it relates to the issue at hand). I heard nothing for several weeks, all the while enduring significant pain flares related to arthritis. I called yesterday and was told that the doctor denied the referral. I asked for the date of the denial and reason. I was told there was no date, and that the doctor does not write reasons for the denial. HERE IS MY COMPLAINT: 1) the doctor doesn't give a reason, and never even spoke with me about why I was there. If the first person believed I was there to be treated for CF, I could have told her that was ridiculous, as I see some of the best CF doctors at National Jewish. 2) I was never called to say they denied me and I should move on and seek help elsewhere. I would still be waiting had I not called. I believe this is MEDICAL NEGLECT. If you CANNOT provide care to someone who is in desperate need of help, you should SAY SO.

I now have to go back to square one and find someone who can help with pain flares related to arthritis. Thank you Northern Colorado Pain Management.

column2: Colorado Pain Relief of Colorado Springs
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Colorado Springs

At Colorado Pain Relief of Colorado Springs, our mission is to help you effectively manage chronic pain and reclaim your quality of life. We understand that pain can be extremely debilitating and impacts each person differently. Located at 1304 N Academy Blvd #209 in Colorado Springs, our specialized team takes a personalized approach to treatment, recognizing that everyone's pain experience is unique. As a full-service pain control clinic and wellness center, we offer comprehensive care through our experienced team of healthcare professionals, including registered general nurses.

Our services include:

  • Personalized pain management plans

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Therapeutic interventions

  • Ongoing support and monitoring

We're committed to helping you become as close to pain-free as possible every day. Chronic pain may not be visible to others, but we see you and understand your struggles. Take the first step toward relief by visiting our website or calling us today at +1 719-488-1315 to schedule an appointment and leave your pain in the past.
column9: Pain control clinic|Registered general nurse|Wellness center
column11: Our mission at Colorado Pain Relief of Colorado Springs, located in Colorado Springs, Colorado, is to help you manage your chronic pain. Pain can be extremely debilitating and we want you to be able to live your life better. We personalize each treatment because everyone feels pain differently. Chronic pain can be difficult to treat because it isn't visible and an injury that causes someone chronic pain may not cause pain for another. We want you to be as close to pain-free as possible every day of your life. Call today to schedule an appointment and leave the pain in the past.

column38: Deborah|Maggie Brown|Mark Ramey|Carly Haynes|Eric Ross|Stefani Peretz|Justin Gabbard|holly F
column40:
Don't go.

I could write a few pages on how awful my experience was with Elena.

No compassion combined with militant mismanagement is the best way to describe the experience with the personality of a rattlesnake..

Had to keep track of my pain management  dosage and numbers were consistently wrong.|I have been suffering from chronic pain from spinal injuries and Fibromyalgia for over a decade. I have been gaslit & humiliated & treated like a "med seeker" by dozens of doctors including other pain management docs before but I have never been treated like that here.
Dr. Elena is an incredibly well informed & thorough. She spent a long time gathering my history & records and she did a thorough hands-on physical evaluation (which is weirdly rare now) and she came up with a treatment plan that even considered my concerns about becoming medication dependent.
Yes, sometimes the office can have a lengthy wait at times, but that is due to the high quality care the providers are giving every single patient and all of the legal requirements laid out by the state.
The office staff are angels. They go well above & beyond to ensure you're taken care of and are always pleasant to see.

I never thought I'd "enjoy" going to a doctor but I always leave feeling better about my care & often in less pain than I walked in with.

I have received trigger point & nerve block injections and her well researched management protocols are light-years ahead of other local providers. I can't recommend her highly enough.

(Office is also clean, well organized, stays on top of insurance & pharmacy issues- and they accept medicaid!)|Dr Elena is the best doctor I've ever had. She's in a category of her own. Never before has a doctor spent so much time with me, shown so much care and displayed such breadth and depth of knowledge. She goes above and beyond and, frankly, puts the average doctor to shame.

For years I looked for the right doctor to help me with significant back issues. After being referred to Dr Elena, my symptoms have radically improved and my quality of life has skyrocketed. I'm deeply grateful to her and her staff.

Disregard negative reviews about this office. The staff is fantastic and very helpful, and the location is easily accessible and comfortable.|I can honestly say that I don't know what I would be like now had I not have started care with Elena 5 months ago. I drive almost 3 hours one way just to see her. Not only is she compassionate, but she knows what she is talking about. I have a rather rare condition that not many medical professionals are knowledgeable on. In fact most doctors in my area either do not know of it or are not comfortable treating me due to lack of knowledge on it. When I first explained my situation she knew exactly what my diagnosis was and acknowledged me and everything I was feeling. I've always felt heard and cared for by not only her, but her ENTIRE staff. From the reviews I read before my first visit there was complaints about the wait to see her. The way I see it is this, she takes whatever time necessary to make sure you are well cared for, and heard. I couldn't ask for a better provider, and I will continue to make the drive to see her! Thank you for being such a wonderful addition to my medical care team.|I've been going to Colorado Pain Relief for a few months and could not be more pleased. Elena has done a terrific job working with me on referrals and medication. She's a compassionate and caring provider who spends the amount of time she needs to spend on each visit. Lori at reception is a real standout in a very friendly and warm crew.|Helena has been an amazing doctor. She listened to me and showed that she cares and has been instrumental in my success at work. I have been able to manage my career and my home life and been a much happier person because of her thoroughness and understanding and she cares! She has been an amazing doctor and I couldn't have become the person I am today without her!|This office is the best and Dr.Elana and her staff are the most accommodating.  The office is always clean and welcoming. Dr. Elena's knowledge with pain and managing pain are exceptional . Every doctor office should be this welcoming and helpful.  It's always nice when you're doctor and the staff, genuinely care about the patients.  I recommend Colorado Pain Releif for anyone!!!|Just like everyone else who's had Dr. Elena as their pain provider I had a horrific experience. My last pain specialist dropped me due to missing too many appointments because I moved and life was hectic. My first appointment with Doctor Elena she immediately bad mouthed Mathews Vu pain management, when I had a great experience with them. It was unprofessional. On top of my first appointment the practice manager Tameshia Campbell was so unprofessional. She made an unsolicited statement about taking to my doctor about a hysterectomy (Not a cure) and when I said that she said well maybe you wouldn't be in pain. It was so unethical. Just like everyone else's negative experience. Dr. Elena wouldn't even look at me.  I'd wait around for almost 2 hours and not once did she look up from her computer. She always interrupted me and when I went to tell her I didn't have time for other PT I wanted UC health PT, she shooed me out of the room, I didn't even know our session was ending. She's quick to assume that because tramadol (schedule 4) worked for me that I was drug seeking and my first appointment they tried to push Gabapentin (schedule 5) on me.  I reached out and asked for a small presc of tramadol and 800mg of Motrin for pain. I was turned down and had enough. After asking to be self- discharged due to the mistreatment and medical gaslighting Ms. Campbell made my letter sound like I just wanted drugs. Horrible, unprofessional, stay away.

column3:
At Denver Pain Management Associates, we understand that pain is a complex, often debilitating medical problem that significantly impacts your physical and mental well-being. Our dedicated team of specialized physicians brings decades of combined experience to help patients find relief from both acute and chronic pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a multifaceted approach to pain management that includes:

  • Personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs

  • Advanced diagnostic procedures to identify pain sources

  • Minimally invasive interventional procedures

  • Medication management when appropriate

  • Rehabilitation strategies for long-term pain relief

Our practice focuses on finding sustainable solutions rather than temporary fixes. We take the time to thoroughly understand your condition, medical history, and treatment goals to develop the most effective pain management strategy. Located in the heart of Denver at 1873 S Bellaire St, Suite 1215, we're committed to helping our patients regain control of their lives through expert pain management care. Visit our website at denverpainmanagement.org or call us at (303) 689-2300 to schedule your consultation today.
column11: Pain is a complicated, often debilitating medical problem that can have a major impact on your physical and mental well-being. The physicians at Denver Pain Management Associates offer a comprehensive range of services for patients suffering from acute or chronic pain.

column38: Lua Franklin|Patricia Ann Rink|Dav2424 "Dav"|Tina Clair|Barbara Spiller|Alfonso P|Cody Aho|Laura Ponzio
column40:
All the negative reviews are true and I'd give these people 0 stars if I could! WORST system I have EVER encountered in 11 years of chronic pain! I was referred to Dr Wright and NEVER saw him in 3 visits! I saw his PA Shannon, who was absolutely awesome. Yes, probably the only one in the office who was pleasant. They were so booked that it was hard to get follow up appointments... I thought, "Wow, they must be really popular!" NOPE. The office was CLOSING and nobody bothered to tell me this as I scheduled my two follow up appointments. In fact, they rescheduled my second follow up because the office was going to be closed before then. They then proceeded to reveal that Dr Wright had undergone surgery himself and ran into complications which is why I had never seen him. They promised they were holding meeting with other physicians to possibly find one to sponsor the clinic and be the stand-in Dr. while he recovered. They told me to call back. So I called back every day and it was the same story until one day, no one answered. I received a hefty bill in the mail for a service which had previously been covered and that I had been promised I would not be billed for. And trust me, my insurance covers nearly everything in the book 100% with a small copay. I battled and battled and the billing company and other managers sent me round and round with multiple phone numbers without any resolution. Now I am being forced to pay this stupid bill without any explanation as to why it I will be sent to a collection agency. If you ever see anyone associated with these people, RUN.|I am convinced that there is no better doctor than Dr. Rob Wright.  I have seen hundreds of doctors, due to the fact that I had kidney cancer and many other serious health issues, and have endured over 30 surgeries.  I know a great doctor when I see one.  Not only is Dr. Wright the very best surgeon I have ever been blessed to be his patient ~ but his staff is second to none!!  Every single nurse and PA, from Ashton, Jaime, Alex, Susie, Bonnie, and countless others, have the utmost of compassion, caring words and perfect bed~side manner that I would highly reccommend anyone in need of a surgeon to get into see Dr. Wright and his amazing staff ASAP.
This is by far the best practice I have witnessed.  I am so grateful !!  May God continue to bless each and every single person in the practice.|Dr Natkin and Crystal are cutting edge when it comes to giving the best current modern treatments available, and always searching for sustainable outcomes. He is relentless in the pursuit of finding the best methods to help completely rehabilitate, or at the least bring better comfort to those that may be a on a long road to recovery. Dr. Natkin always carries a charisma and a comfort with him every visit that helps ease frustration and gets you focused on next steps to recovery. If you looking for a pill pusher this isn't your practice, but if you're looking for results my experience has bee second to none!!!|This is the worst place to do business with. DO NOT EVER GO HERE. Had a procedure done in March for pain in my neck.  Woke up and ended up with pneumonia.  Called numerous times on the after hours emergency line since they don't answer during the day - Ended up in the emergency room twice to be treated.  This doctor put me on Lithium as pain management (NOT ONE DOCTOR I SPOKE WITH SAID IT'S USED FOR THIS TREATMENT).  Never weaned me on or off and still couldn't return my after hour calls for the excessive pain I was still encountering.  They couldn't bill their invoices correctly and still can't figure out why they haven't been paid properly. I filed complaint with BCBS and am filing complaint against him with NORA.  Office Assistant is rude and unprofessional.  Don't waste your time with this place.  It's a joke!!|First, I was greeted by Jason Montgomery for an "evaluation".  He is NOT an anesthesiologist nor a physician at all.  He was an hour late with no apology.  He was rude and hostile to me from the moment he walked in for no apparent reason.  He chided me for being on even the greatly reduced meds I was taking stating that they, meaning the real doctors, couldn't do the procedures when a person was taking meds because they wouldn't be able to ascertain whether the procedures worked.  I stated that since my pain was at a level of 8-9, I could detect any lessening of that pain and that Dr Little from another pain group had performed an ill-fated epidural which exacerbated and widened the areas of my pain. He became more belligerent and I left never to return.  It was a horrible, frustrating and frankly demeaning experience.  I've had several back surgeries over the past 15 months and have been in constant pain like many of you.  Do we deserve this kind of treatment?|Rachel is awesome. I've been going here for years now, unfortunately.  I seem to have issues that aren't in your face on an xtay like yup that's broken. Leave it to me to get stuck with something that's hard to see in diagnose yet excruciating everyday pain, unfortunately.  After seeing so many doctors that look at you like nothing is wrong with you and brush you of the same. It was such a great feeling to finally have someone listen and care enough to not stop thinking outside the box. Because of her, I finally have a name to what causes my pain . Honestly, I'm sure anyone who knows her knows what I'm talking about is just an awesome person and perfect for the job. She's so energetic and literally makes me laugh. Every time she is full of energy, she fills the entire building up with good vibes.  And I'm a super quiet person and definitely not social, but she makes it easy to talk to her.  Unfortunately, the secret is out cause she's always booked now lol but she's great, and it's definitely appreciated.|Dr. Wright is hands down the best doctor I have ever worked with. I was in a hit and run MVA in April 2012 and have been an 8 or 9/10 in pain since then. Dr. Wright spends as much time as necessary to answer all my questions, and after 7 doctors and 19 different procedure: Trigger point injections, medial branch blocks, SIJ injections, 6 epidurals, 2 discograms, etc I can say without a doubt he is  the most knowledgeable, confident, friendly, and all around awesome doc I have seen. I trust him to do anything on my back, and that speaks for itself.. Highly recommend this office.|The receptionist is  very pleasant!   And knows what she is doing!!She always asks me how i am feeling, if i have any new concerns i need to address to the dr.  Dr. Natkins is the best Dr. Ive ever had!!He takes out the time to go over any issue i have.he has always been concerned about any medical condition that I have, and he offers me different types of treatment. I would recommend this pain Management  to everyone.  Sincerely  LauraPonzio

column3:
Dr. Bryan Wernick, MD is a dedicated pain medicine anesthesiology specialist serving the metro Denver area. At our practice, we are committed to improving quality of life for every patient who walks through our doors.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We specialize in treating a wide range of conditions including:

  • Back, joint, and neck pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS)

  • Diabetic neuropathy

  • Facet joint syndrome

  • Various forms of neuropathy

  • Chronic pain and pain syndromes

Dr. Wernick brings exceptional credentials to his practice, having earned his medical degree from Loma Linda University School of Medicine and completed his residency in anesthesiology at the same institution. His educational foundation began with a bachelor's degree in biology from La Sierra University, followed by an internship in general surgery at the University of Colorado. We pride ourselves on providing patient-centered care with minimal wait times at our Louisville location. For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit Dr. Bryan Wernick - AdventHealth or call us at +1 303-661-4100.
column11:
Bryan Wernick, MD, is a pain medicine anesthesiology specialist who sees patients in the metro Denver area. Dr Wernick felt called to the treatment of pain to provide improvements to the quality of life for every patient. He sees patients for conditions like back, joint and neck pain, complex regional pain syndrome, diabetic neuropathy, facet joint syndrome, neuropathy, chronic pain and pain syndromes.

Dr Wernick earned his medical degree from Loma Linda University School of Medicine and his bachelor's degree in biology from La Sierra University. He completed an internship in general surgery at the University of Colorado and a residency in anesthesiology at Loma Linda University.
column38: Jane "Janie" Barbe|Adam Roth|Joe Ross|Charlie Dunn|Michelle Borin|Jordyn Cedillo|Kathy Schwindt|Sherry Geck
column40:
Dr. Wernick is the best.  He is kind, listens to your concerns, and his office is extremely efficient.  I drive an hour and 20 minutes to see him.

Dr. Wernick and his office go way out of their way to make your experience positive.  Once the facility where injections are done miscoded the procedure and instead of having me reschedule until they could figure it out they made a ton of calls during their lunch to make sure I got the injection that day.

I definitely recommend Dr. Wernick.|I hope you never need a pain doctor but if you do call Dr. Wernick. The entire staff at Dimensions are very thoughtful and caring. Thank you!|Dr. Wernick is patient, knowledgeable and listens. He gathers relevant information before making recommendations. I highly recommend him.|Dr Wernick was lovely....very concerned and warm...and really took the time to explain everything.|Very pleasant experience.Dr Wernik was amazing.He explained the procedure. Staff was helpful & friendly.|Dr. Wernick, not only settled any worries or concerns.  He's made my life of mobility, hope for the future and glimpse of the light at the end of the tunnel.  He corrected my last doctor's mistakes. And I couldn't ask for a better doctor. A kind man told me about him in the waiting area and I couldn't agree more that he's worth the drive to see, and the best at what he does.

Extremely grateful|This was my first time seeing this doctor. My CRPS flared up after being in remission for many years. Dr. Wernick took time to listen to me and explain some things. He appeared to genuinely care about my pain. The only thing I didn't like was that he would not prescribe me even 5 pain pills to have in case the CRPS goes full blown. I do however understand because abusers of drugs have ruined it for people who really need something and I would have liked it if the doctor looked into my drug use to verify I don't abuse drugs and was not doctor shopping. I feel some type of pain pill even in a very small amount should not have been an issue. There is no way I will be able to drive to this office to get a nerve block if I'm in severe pain and I won't have anyone who can take me.take me. It will be dangerous if not impossible for me to drive if CRPS is full blown . I do understand his position but it just doesn't help me if I'm in excruciating pain. He did say he could more than likely get me in for a nerve block within a short time though. That will probably be expensive however.
He presented as a very compassionate doctor who is willing to explain things and I believe he is very knowledgeable about CRPS. Not all doctors are familiar with CRPS so I basically feel like he has taken time to learn about this illness! I appreciate him taking me as a new patient too! I just pray this doesn't go full blown because unless you have CRPS, you Will not understand how painful it truly is. I'm hopeful he will be able to help me if needed but am terrified of what will happen if my condition worsens. The only reason for 4 stars is because I have nothing to help me when pain is unbearable.|Dr. Wernick goes above and beyond  for his patients. If the insurance provider denies authorization for a necessary procedure, he will schedule a peer to peer review with the physician for the insurance to discuss medical necessity to advocate on behalf of his patient. The wait time in the office is minimal and the staff are always friendly and cheerful.

column3:
At Mile High Spine & Pain Center, we provide a state-of-the-art integrative, non-surgical approach to treating spine and joint conditions based on the most current research. Our multi-disciplinary team in Westminster, Colorado combines expertise from various healthcare disciplines to deliver comprehensive pain management solutions. We're committed to helping patients who have been told they cannot be helped, achieving remarkable results through our innovative treatment protocols.

Our Comprehensive Services

  • Back, neck, and joint pain treatment

  • Headache and migraine management

  • Neuropathy care

  • Sports performance enhancement

  • Stem cell therapy

  • Nutritional IV therapy

  • Dry needling

Our integrated approach combines dynamic and isometric exercise, spinal manipulation, and non-surgical medical procedures to address a wide range of conditions. We're located at 12061 Tejon St #600, Westminster, CO 80234, and our team includes chiropractors, acupuncturists, massage therapists, pain management physicians, and physiotherapists working together to provide holistic care. Visit Mile High Spine & Pain Center or call us at +1 720-507-0080 to discover how we can help you achieve lasting pain relief and improved quality of life.
column11: At Mile High Spine & Pain Center, we use a "state of the art" integrative, non-surgical approach to treating the spine and joints, based on the most current research. Our multi-disciplinary team offers protocols to treat back pain, knee pain, shoulder pain, foot/ankle pain, arthritis, neuropathy, headaches and migraines, sports performance and more. We utilize the best of what each discipline has to offer, combining dynamic and isometric exercise, spinal manipulation, stem cell therapy, non-surgical medical procedures and dry needling to achieve previously unheard of results, even with patients who have been told they cannot be helped.

column40:
I went in after falling to get some relief, I wasn't sure if I might need an adjustment, they got me in quickly and tested me even my vascular concerns. The whole Staff was very nice and welcoming and comforting, Dr Hettick was a special kind of doctor that really cares about what he does to help however he can and does well with it. Lewis did images of the Vascular in my legs, and neck to check for damages from the fall and he was very kind and also did a good job. I would most definitely recommend the Mile High Spine & Pain Center to anyone I heard say they needed help. It's an excellent place to go. Dr Hettick treated my husband for years before he passed.  I have also been a patient for several years and my 15 year old granddaughter started getting adjusted too.

I have been getting the Meier's cocktail (medicare covered) for 6 months and feel amazing.  It really helps with fatigue and boosts my immune system to help fight off colds and flu like symptoms.
I would highly recommend Mile High Spine and Dr. Hettick.|I was hesitant on seeing a chiropractor but here I was made comfortable and educated on my needs and not just myself for my baby and spouse. At Denver Pain Relief Center, our dedicated team of pain management doctors specializes in addressing the root cause of your discomfort, not just treating symptoms.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a wide range of advanced treatments to restore functionality and improve quality of life for patients suffering from both chronic and acute pain conditions. Our specialized services include:

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy for natural healing

column40: Dr. Kaitlin is an incredible PT practitioner. We have been in a treatment program in conjunction with hyuarlonic knee injections and my results are amazing. She is a good listener, has excellent exercise protocols,  got dry needling which is a great treatment for releasing tight muscles, and overall I have been very pleased with my improvements. I highly recommend Denver Pain Relief Center.|Dr. Kaitlyn took good care of me. She is very knowledgeable and a great listener. She has a lot of great experience and offers solutions that really make a difference.|Dr. Kait & Dr. Lonnie are the best! I was already seeing Dr. Reinhardt at Reinhardt Chiropractic and he suggested I start being treated at DPRC as well! This was the extra treatment I really needed. They have helped with my back pain, hip pain, neck pain & more. If you are already a chiropractic patient, PT is the perfect addition!|I have been going to see Dr Kaitlyn at the Denver Pain Relief Center for around two years now on a weekly basis. She is fantastic at her craft. We go over whatever is bothering me that week and she gets to work dry needling, stretching,  and giving me exercises to work on during our visit and at home. I am very active and have a physical job. I have a lot of aches and pains that creep up on me. Dr Kaitlyn keeps my body going. They also have electrical stimulation therapy available. I don't know what I would do without the Denver Pain Relief Center. Do your body a favor and check them out|Kaitlin is great! I've had my share of PT. I highly recommend her. She's my go to for PT!|Lonnie is an excellent physical therapist.  He listens to you well and develops a plan that is achievable.  After two sessions of dry needling, PT and regular stretching I am already seeing the results.  I highly recommend this practice.|Dr. Kaitlin is an excellent physical therapist who tries to understand your problems and come up with a treatment plan that meets your needs.  I have had really good results from dry needling for hip pain. I highly recommend her.|Dr. Kaitlin was great helping me with physical therapy following a shoulder replacement 3 1/2 years ago and had me back skiing the following season.  I sought her out again after a recent accident leading to a broken hip and arm. Dr. Kaitlin and Dr. Lonnie have been great with their physical therapy at the Denver Pain Center, giving me exercises to do on my own, and focusing on getting me back to hiking and other activities. They use their expertise, encouragement and humor to push me when I need to be pushed and support me when I need a break. I highly recommend them.

I truly feel like she is a friend Period she's down to earth and really cares Period I highly recommend Denver back pain specialist For any pain needs or back issues or anything That you might need. I am sure you will be highly satisfied like I have been. Perry at the front desk has always been so wonderful when it comes to setting up appointments and listening to my needs over the phone. He has been promoted to nurses assistant. I can't tell you how happy I am for him to do this I think this is a perfect position for him. Good job Perry|All of the people at the Denver Spine and Pain Institute are wonderful! Dr. Bainbridge is a very caring and thorough doctor. Michelle Hogue is fantastic to work with as well! The therapy team is great as is the front office staff. All of them listen well and work hard to help with pain. I would recommend them to anyone!!|Scheduled a new patient appt. Showed up to find out they had not actually scheduled my appointment. Didn't have me on their system at all. So if you are going to brave this office call and confirm multiple times and get names of who you talk to. Because they did nothing to help me other than offer to schedule me for an appointment then which would have been on another few weeks.|I've had the privilege of receiving care from Susan Estes, FNP for over a year , and I can confidently say that she is the most compassionate and competent healthcare provider I've ever encountered. As someone who has navigated the complexities of autoimmune disease since I was born I've had my fair share of experiences with various healthcare professionals.

At 50, I've never felt more seen, heard, and understood than I do with her. Her unique blend of empathy, expertise, and dedication to patient-centered care has been a game-changer for me.

Susan takes the time to listen attentively to my concerns, asks insightful questions, and provides thorough explanations.

What impresses me most about Susan Estes FNP is her unwavering commitment to my overall well-being. She actively collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure I receive comprehensive care, and her attention to detail is unparalleled.

I feel grateful to have found this clinic and although I plan on moving an hour away I will continue to come here.  All staff members at this clinic go above and beyond to ensure quality care.|Dr Trainor & his team are great. Suzie, my nurse practitioner is awesome. She is upbeat with her support & guidance, very knowledgeable & helpful.|Great place! Caring and efficient! Susie is the Best!
Last week the doctors and representatives of " Colorado's # 1 Hospital 15 years in a row " managed to put me in so much stress and pain, that if it wasn't for the amazing staff at Denver Spine - especially Karen and Dr. Susie I would have been left without pain relief and under so much stress, that I don't know what I would have done.
I'm so thankful to these wonderful, humane, caring ladies that went above and beyond to help me in my hour of need!
Eternally grateful!|If you have a 24/7 pain that you are living with this is a great place to help you manage your pain. All the staff are sympathetic to your needs and listen to your problems. Thanks for helping me and being there for me

Hello humankindness. It's more than a tagline. Humankindness is one of the many things we all have in common. It's the good within us. The power that connects us. And at CommonSpirit Health, we fuse it into heartfelt healing, inspired innovation, and mindful medicine. It's in how we provide treatment and the way we treat patients.
Our communities need caring, and our families need support. CommonSpirit is committed to building healthy communities by advocating for those who are poor and vulnerable, and innovating how and where healing can happen. Because the way care is provided is often as meaningful as the care itself.

At MD Pain, we specialize in providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Denver metro area.

Personalized Pain Relief Strategies

Dr. Christopher Huser brings extensive expertise to each patient consultation, focusing on conservative treatment approaches that deliver effective results. We take pride in our thorough diagnostic process and commitment to finding long-term solutions rather than temporary fixes. Our practice offers a wide range of interventional pain management services including:

  • Steroid injections for joint and spine pain

  • Minimally invasive surgical procedures

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Non-opioid treatment options

What sets our practice apart is Dr. Huser's patient-centered approach—taking time to listen, explain procedures thoroughly, and develop customized treatment plans. Our professional staff ensures a supportive environment throughout your care journey. Located in Englewood, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions at our modern facility. Visit our website or call us at +1 303-750-8100 to schedule your consultation at our office: 10700 E Geddes Ave #100, Englewood, CO 80112.
column38: jay Bar|pete hill|DK|Lynne Falick|April KM|T-Willy W|Melanie Silverman|Elizabeth Kepcsynski
column40:
One of the most difficult things we do, is choose our care givers. We are so vulnerable, especially when the condition is pain. I have more than one issue, pain-wise. Dr C Huser is serious about conservative treatment, and efficacy, which is how a patient benefits/or not, from a treatment. I am relieved to find that his treatments work well for me. I seriously couldn't walk straight any more. my entire being was failing, spineless, headaches. I can read again, walk, garden, type. Miraculous. The staff, I am grateful to say, has been kind to me. best wishes to all.|Dr. Huser:  Your a great Doctor, wanted to send you a few jokes... Do you know why its great to be a guy?  1) phone conversations last 30 seconds...2) A 5 day vacation requires only one suitcase... 3) Bathroom lines are 80% shorter... 4) you can open all your own jars... My knee is coming along well... see you in about 90 days...|Dr Huser is one of the best doctors I have ever seen.  He was patient, understanding and empathy.  He got me into a good place with realistic expectations.  I would recommend him without hesitation.|The biggest problem with Dr Huser is his support staff and clinc management. Although the quality of his care did degrade as time went on. His MAs Ruby and Victoria are unprofessional and mean. They talk badly about patients and this is clearly seen in my medical record as inter office communications. (do they even know we can read them?) They are young and immature in positions of powed as noted by the words chosen in the office communications as well their flippant tone. I have never been treated so disrespectively before and we as patient consumers need to speak up and not allow this to become the norm in our health care. When I walked into the office the get missing medical records I finally got the attention of the clinic manager, Dava (whom I had left multiple messages for over the last 2 months and never got a call back) and she asked me to shared my concerns with her. She would not see my perspective in any way and only defended her staff. She didn't even have the management skills to feed me lip service, pretend to care, and go about her way promoting poor patient care at this practice. As for Dr. Huser, I'd say he's hit or miss at this point. And if he chooses to surround himself with support staff like this, then what does that tell you?|The best experience I've ever had with a medical office to date! Dr. Huser was very thorough and compassionate. He really listened to me and I feel completely confident in his care as my Doctor. His office always responds promptly and seems to be one step ahead, making my experience pleasant and stress free which helps immensely as a patient with MS who has to deal with medical offices on a regular basis. Highly recommend!
* I also see the P.A. Carissa and she has been absolutely wonderful!|The days of opioid abuse have never been worse and people that truly need and benefit from pain medication suffer because of it. I have spinal fusion from my 1st S1 to L1. Have had multiple back surgeries. As I'm getting older its getting hard to do everyday chores. At urgent cares or ER rooms they treat me like I'm a just wanting pills so I never asked. I was referred to MD pain. I saw Dr. Huser. He was very sympathetic and helped me come up with a plan that has started to give me my life back. Everyone there has been amazing. Ladies at the front treated me like family after 5 min of being there. I was showing pics of my new puppy. Wish I'd gone there years ago. Thank you all.|Dr Huser is a very caring physician. I have been a patient of his for almost 10 years. He does the injections on my spine. His staff is great. I moved out of state and I continue to return to Colorado so that I can continue my care with Dr. Huser. I  have not been able to find a Doctor with his level of expertise or compassion in Tennessee. Thank you everyone at MD Pain!|Had my first appointment with MD Pain about a week ago. The staff was very professional and kind. Dr. Huser was very curtious, professional, helpful and easy to talk to about my health issues. What a different experience then the last place I went to. We just weren't a good fit. Definitely recommend checking out MD Pain if you are looking for pain mgt in the Denver area.
