column40:
Some how a terrible review from me regarding Dr. Brown and his staff  supposedly came from me.  I NEVER posted that review!  I don't know what's going on with technology these days, and the way people can get into your account.  Dr. Brown and his staff have never been anything but wonderful, helpful and professional.   He and his staff have been WONDERFUL!  I don't know who posted this ugly review of them under my name, but it is completely FALSE!  They are a TERRIFIC team.  Whoever posted that review under my name should be ashamed!|Shannon and dr. Brown are absolutely perfect. I have been with Dr. Brown for 16 + years and have nothing bad to say about him. He is very personal and cares. This office is amazing|Just wanted to post a review that mentioned the MILD treatment for spinal stenosis.  I recently had this done, and prior to having it I was a little nervous because I couldn't find any reviews of Dr. Brown that specifically mentioned that procedure.  I have been a patient of Dr. Brown's now for about 10 years, and can't say enough about him.  He is completely awesome!  He has injected me for spinal stenosis quite a few times over the years, and has always been patient, competent, caring, and good at explaining things and working with me to make decisions.  His aura of quiet competency has always made me feel at ease and confident in his judgement and planning.

I had the MILD procedure a week and a half ago, and was pretty nervous going into it, but all has worked out well.  There is a definite improvement (not a total cure), which is what I was looking for.  Hopefully, this will keep me good for a while longer instead of having major back surgery with hardware, which is what a separate neurosurgery consult recommended.

Thank you, Dr. Brown!|I personally have been a patient of Dr. Brown and Shannon Bock for over eight years now. I highly recommend Mile High Regenerative and Pain therapy. Dr. Brown has substantially enhanced my quality of life. I appreciate not only how professional and competent the entire staff is but I also appreciate how much empathy and compassion they have for their patients. Thanks for always making my appointments, procedures and imaging such a seamless process.|Dr. Brown really does care about his patients. He never makes his patients feel unheard or rushed. The staff is the best and will do whatever they can to make you feel at ease. I've had no problem with Medicare Medicaid billing and have contacted billing department before without any issues.|Dr. Brown is my husband's and my pain physician, he is a professional/respectful and truly cares about his patients. I am always pleased with Shannon/Dr. Brown and the office staff. No issues with billing either.|I have been seeing Shannon for a while now, and have seen Doctor Brown on some occasions. Both make it easy for you to be there. When you are dealing with on going pain it is so comforting knowing you can see someone without judgment. The staff at the front desk are always kind and greet you with a warm smile.I'm very thankful to have found this practice.|I have been having Dr. Robert Brown for my pain management care for over 10 years. I recommend him and his staff for your needs. Dr Brown always has a listening ear and will always want to make you feel like you are able to live your everyday life. Dr Brown is not just good at his job but he also shows how much he cares for you as a Dr should.

column40:
Horrible experience!  Forget ever speaking with Dr Brooks, he doesn't allow office visits or phone calls.  You will only see him at the time of your procedure and be thankful if he has read your chart at all.
The office personnel stinks!   Every time I came in the office staff were just standing around whispering and when they had to assist you could tell they weren't pleased.
Even the medical staff were rude and unpleasant.  It was a nightmare.  Im sure I'll be attacked as others who have left honest experiences on here were.  They are very good at twisting the facts to benefit themselves.
Look at all the negative comments on here and ask yourself if all these could be made up.
While Dr Brooks always comes off as being pleasant and friendly, I have to question his ethics to allow all these things to take place while under his name. Seems like he doesn't want to hear any complaints but just wants to do the procedures and collect his paycheck. I know he was let go from another pain specialists before opening this current office so it makes me question his caring for his patients.
Stay away and save yourself a lot of stress and frustration.|Use to give a 5 star glowing review, but changed it. Don't be honest with anything you tell them about life or how you feel.. just always be perfect and lie   I'm sure he will blame me since that seems to be the vibe by the responses bad reviews get. I was never rude to anyone there and over the course of like 6 years had 2 incidents that I was honest about and one issue I had zero idea how it happened. I offered to do whatever was needed to fix that one issue but was told it was no big deal and sometimes it happens. Yea I shouldn't have been honest about anything since I was rewarded with being dropped. Yet they saw no issue with me continuously taking 10,000mg or more a day of Tylenol because I was still in pain, I was only ever lectured that I shouldn't take so much because I was damaging my liver. It's a roll of the dice what kind of care you seem to receive here, it was amazing when I was perfect and just smiled saying yea im good.

Also adding that they seem to think just because you have chronic pain you shouldnt do things to embrace life, instead I guess you're expected to sit on a couch all day. Some of us fight through the pain so we can lead a fulfilling life, it was a blessing to be discharged so that I can find someone who would rather help then hinder.|I went to Doctor Brooks for many years, I was under the immpression he actually cared. I am here on my own and required sedition. I would have to change my appointment dates due to a ride. Their requirements, I always kept in touch with his office staff. They were the best, If I had an issue thay told me "Not a Problem"
My last appointment as I was waiting for my ride, I received a text reminder telling me about appointment details, I said to myself PERFECT I will be early as I always did. I arrived around 40 min. early. I went to check in and much to my surprise they said I was late. I showed them the text, They said I shoud have known to be 1 hour early. I dont read minds. I was told to go home and the office will re-schedule me. I called and they said I am no longer a patient. For a doctor to change your ability to want to live due to all the pain I am in? I dont know how he can sleep at night I dont know!!!|Waited over a month to have my case reviewed and was then told I would not be taken on as a patient. 19 months ago I broke my neck in 2 places causing pinched nerves and c-spinal stenosis, then 15 months ago I was rear ended at an almost stopped position on 225 by a Jeep doing 70+mph. I have Epilepsy and with the increasing pain, I am now having a seizure a week, while prior to my pain increasing over the last few months, I was only having a seizure once every 2 months.

When I politely told the receptionist that the Dr. should re-evaluate how he decides which patients he accepts, she immediately got defensive and rude, then abruptly hung up on me.

Unprofessional, discourteous, rude, and no sense of urgency. Save yourself the stress and time, find a different doctor.|Like many others my PCP sent over a referral almost month ago. When I called to inquire about it the person on the phone was very rude in telling me that the Doctor is reviewing the referrals and said they would call when they call. In the meantime I'm out of medications. I have chronic pain due to a blood clot in my head. I'm the last 4 weeks or so I've lost 15 lbs because the pain in my head makes me nauseous with no appetite. I'm on a written warning at work because I've called in twice due to pain. But clearly these people don't care because it's not happening to them. I don't understand? If you can't get to a referral in a timely manner you could at least let people know so we can start the process over with a Doctor's office that might actually care. I don't understand why you people feel the need to be rude.

Edit- my PCP did fill my prescription for a partial amount while waiting on a response. Sorry for the 1 star review. That was for whoever you have answering your phones. Your office staff is very rude as it's already been mentioned many times.|** I had not met Dr Brooks or any of his associates prior to seeing them professionally. I only have a professional patient-doctor relationship with this office. **

I have been a patient of Dr Brooks/Co Springs Pain Consultants for almost 2 years.

My previous pain consultant had retired so I needed a new pain specialist. I have a very complicated and lengthy medical history consisting of numerous of rare illnesses that most MD's are unfamiliar with.

When I fist requested an appoitment I was able to get in quickly.

My initial appointment was with a PA,  but I have worked with Dr Brooks, as well as his other PA/NP's. All have been professional and concerned about my care plan.

On my fist appointment I expected the PA to be a bit overwhelmed with the amount of medical information I gave her, but she was calm and asked approprite questions about illnesses she was unfamiliar with. She wanted to make sure that my care plan was working and I wasn't minimizing my pain because I was used to it.

The team at Dr Brooks' office looks at each patient as an individual , not just a diagnosis. They take into consideration how each diagnostic code is affecting my body (even if it wasn't causing me physical pain) and are genuinely concerned with how I am feeling overall, not just with my pain managment.

The entire team, from the front office to the PA/NP and Dr Brooks, are always caring, kind and attentive.

I meet with either Dr Brooks or one of his  professionals monthly. Due to being severely immunocompromised my appointments are typically Telehealth Visits, which I greately appreciate. They always contact me on time, having read the notes from my chart.

I do go into the office a few times a year. The wait time is minimal (typically I'm called back before I get my phone out !), and there are few patients in the waiting room. Once I'm in the exam room I've never waited more than 5 minutes for my provider.

The office building was easy to find, they have elevator access, and a good amount of Handicap Accessible parking.

The office staff is always cheerful and kind.  When I've needed to reach them in between appointments they typically answer the phone. If it's at a busy time they always respond to voicemail messages on the same day.

The office itself is clean and comfortable. The restroom is spotless. Inner offices are appropriately appointed, clean and comfortable.When I leave messages they are responded to within hours.

I have been very pleased with Dr Brooks and his Associates. I recommend them without hesitation.|About 10 yrs ago Dr Brooks decided I would not be a good candidate for his office as my other absolute WONDERFUL Dr moved so after reading the reviews I think someone was watching out for me. Thank you Dr Brooks. I have since seen an amazing Dr who has a very caring staff!!! And the staff really does make a difference. Maybe you should look for someone who is actually kind and treat the way they like to be treated. I'm pretty sure I learned that in kindergarten!!!!|I had a referral put in from my doctor over a month ago and called them a week after the referral was place.  The receptionist was unpleasant to speak with on the phone and gave zero information other than "Dr. Brooks is reviewing the referral and will let us know whether your a good fit for us or not."  Since it'd been a month and I still hadn't heard anything, I called them again today.  The receptionist was speaking so quietly at the beginning I could barely hear her.  I never caught her name because she didn't feel like she needed to share that apparently.  When I asked about my referral and if I could schedule an appointment, she gave me THE SAME ANSWER as a month back, "Dr. Brooks is reviewing your referral and will let us know."

When I asked what the timeframe was she responded "We don't have a time frame."

I pointed out that she's giving absolutely no useful information she goes "that's all we are saying to patients."

Talk about rude staff...and how can it take a month to review 1 file?

Hoping my primary care provider can find a better facility because this one seems awful and I haven't even been fully onboarded to them yet!

Update 10/2/24:  The business replied saying they refunded it. Ok, so they refunded to an expired FSA year which means they now don't have the money and I will never see the money. Not helpful, definitely lost money out of my pocket for services not rendered. I'm looking into what I can legally do here.

Welp, I deleted my review because the office account manager, Nikki assured me she would be taking care of it, it's been a month and there is no follow through or "taking care of" anything. I had previously been a patient that came to Mountain View Pain Center because my chiropractor moved to the location. He has since moved on from this facility. The new doctor, who has never looked at a radiograph of my neck or spine adjusted me on 9/19 leaving me in pain and unable to use my left arm for several days. He yanked on my neck, which wouldn't adjust because....my neck doesn't manually adjust due to my C4 being completely out of place, which this place would know if they took the time to ask. I purchased a punch pass for $250 for 5 visits, even though it turns out my insurance would be only $35 a visit so that's already a $75 overpayment. Nikki said she wasn't going to charge me for the 9/19 visit and agreed to refund me for the what would be $200 since I no longer want to use this facility for chiropractic. I had to pay another person to fix what this office did to my body, was never refunded, was overcharged to begin with and overall had a poor experience. I highly recommend not using this office.|Mountain View Pain Center has been really great in treating my husband after his accident. They have been flexible with our schedule and giving helpful tips to help him in his recuperation. Thank you Mountain View for being there.|What a complete disappointment. My husband has been in excruciating pain for the past decade and the physician wouldn't even give my ARMY COMBAT VETERAN (3x Purple Heart recipient) the time of day to meet with us. Their website brags they're a comprehensive office, which was far from the case. If this is how you treat our veterans, maybe you should leave the state bc COLORADOANS LOVE THEIR VETS but this place clearly could care less about the patients and all about the money. column2: Rocky Mountain Spine & Sports Medicine: Rock Navarkal, MD, JD
column3:
Denver's Premier Spine & Sports Medicine Specialists

At Rocky Mountain Spine & Sports Medicine in Denver, Colorado, we live by the philosophy that "you're only as old as your spine is healthy." Led by Dr. Rock Navarkal, MD, JD, our experienced team is dedicated to helping patients maintain their youthful vigor through customized care in:

  • Comprehensive spine health treatments

  • Advanced pain management solutions

  • Specialized sports medicine care

  • Cutting-edge regenerative medicine

As a board-certified sports medicine physician, Dr. Navarkal was among the first to pioneer regenerative medicine techniques including platelet-rich plasma and stem cell therapy. We combine medical expertise with personalized attention to address chronic back pain, sports injuries, and other musculoskeletal conditions. Located in Cherry Creek, we're committed to providing the highest quality care to help our patients regain mobility, reduce pain, and return to their active lifestyles. Visit Rocky Mountain Spine & Sports Medicine or call us at 303-377-7777 to schedule your consultation at our office: 650 S Cherry St #1015, Denver, CO 80246.
column11: The saying, "you're only as old as your spine is healthy," may not quite ring true until you've suffered chronic back pain or a debilitating sports injury. At Rocky Mountain Spine & Sports Medicine in Denver, Colorado, Rock Navarkal, MD, JD, and his experienced team are committed to helping their patients maintain their youthful vigor by providing the highest quality of customized care in spinal health, pain management, sports medicine, and regenerative medicine.Always on the cutting edge of medical advancements, Dr. Navarkal who is board certified in sports medicine, was among the first physicians to utilize regenerative medicine techniques, including platelet-rich plasma and stem cell therapy.
column38: KARIE DAVIS|Christie Wengert|Eugene Anderson|Eric Wakefield|Karry Berry|Rainey Young|Georga Baca|Alexx Abreu
column40:
I really appreciate Doc Rock and his crew. Ive had an awful time with previous pain management clinics and I have a full menu of ailments that has altered my life. Dr. Rock listens to me and is very empathetic and very knowledgeable and very experienced. The office is laid back and Courtney is very nice and patient. I will keep coming here as I feel like Im being taken cared for!|Dr Rock's office is always a a wonderful experience his staff are always awesome with wonderful smiles makes you feel comfortable. Everyone always finds it a enjoyable experience you can never go wrong picking this provider they are second to none|Upon the day of my appointment I had the Flue.  When I called in to report the office did not want to take a chance infecting other patients.  They jumped into action to make arrangements to take care of my needs while protecting others.  I would recommend this office for quality care.  Thank you all for your efforts.  Gene|I've been seeing Dr Rock for years now. If it wasn't for his care I wouldn't be able to continue working and providing for my family. Having a physical occupation I rely on my body to get my job done. He has really helped with my many injuries I've sustained over the years. I highly recommend going to Rocky Mountain Sports & Spine Medicine & seeing Dr Rock.|Dr. Rock is one of the best doctors we have ever had.  He listens and documents your file.  As a person that has various issues like myself, We discuss options that are avaliable.  When I go to my other Physician offices I try to bring in any results so that Dr. Rock has all updated information.
I like to be proacive instead of reactive.|I just Dr Rock he is the best. Very kind, really cares about YOU and your needs, very compassionate and understanding of his patients.|Dr Rock is an amazing pain management doctor he has helped me tremendously. I am so happy that I found him. I recommend him to anybody that is looking for help with back pain.|My experience with this office over the last month has been atrocious. Let's start with the office staff.
- it took a week and a half of calling them daily and being told one thing or another to get a scheduled appointment. That included me going through the entire "provide me your information" process twice. That should have been my red flag to walk away but clearly my pain had me thinking wrong.
- I waited an hour in the office for my first appointment in which when I met the doctor he was wearing cargo shorts, a V neck T-shirt (with his chest hair hanging out) and a blazer. First class professional right there. Then he wrote a script to send over for X-rays.
- when I got to the imaging center, I got to hear an earful about how the script was written so poorly  that she couldn't even tell what she was supposed to do. Who would have thought we only got about half of the images that we're requested...
- went in for another appointment and the plan of action was to now do an MRI. I was told they would send the script to a new imaging center and I would get a call to schedule in 3-4 days once the pre authorization was completed.
- I sit here today.. two weeks later... on appointment day with no communication. So I reach out to cancel and explain there are no images to review. I'm told I could call the imaging center to schedule and they would re-fax the script... so I called... this is the real joke... they sent over my old xray requests to the old imaging center and still can't seem to figure out where the MRI script went AND the office staff tried to gaslight me into thinking it was my fault because I didn't speak up when she TEXT me about resending the script to the wrong place.... Sad excuse of a business.

column38: JChelle Macaspac|mark taylor|Karen Vavasour|Sarah Aitken|Michael Mayes|Jennifer Shepard|Carol Long|Matt Hummel
column40:
Review for Dr. Verhey and His Staff

Dr. Verhey is an exceptional doctor who truly cares about his patients. During my visit, he took the time to thoroughly assess my condition and suggested a better approach to my treatment. Instead of continuing with ablations, he recommended switching to a caudal procedure, which turned out to be a much more effective and appropriate solution for me.

What stood out the most was how well he listened to my concerns and explained everything in detail. His expertise and genuine care made me feel confident and understood throughout the process.

The staff at his office are equally wonderful--kind, professional, and always ready to assist with a smile. The entire team creates such a welcoming and supportive environment.

I'm grateful for Dr. Verhey's dedication to patient care and would highly recommend him to anyone seeking compassionate and knowledgeable medical care. Thank you, Dr. Verhey, and your amazing team!|Dr. Verhey showed up. That's the only reason he got one star. His nonchalant attitude and bragging about his home in Scottsdale occupied most of the conversation during pre-op meetings. The whole spine care system didn't seem to communicate well. On the day  of the surgery an issue that was thoroughly discussed 10 days before hand, became an issue with the OTHER anesthesiologist. Surgery had to be cancelled. If the good Dr. and staff had glanced at my files before I had my IV inserted they would seen the problem before I was ready to be wheeled into OR. Bunch of crack pots trying to act like a university hospital in my opinion. 15 years of dealing with my back problems and this was absolutely the worst. Had the surgery done with CommonSpirit and it was done seamlessly. I will never step foot in a U of CO health facility again.|Perhaps due to the plethora of procedures he has done, Dr. Verhey appears to lack patience when people question a specific procedure's risks vs. benefits. A wee bit desensitized perhaps?

I firmly believe that on the morning of 7/16/19 I would have felt ok about my decision to leave the outpatient clinic had we parted ways on the previous note he uttered: "It seems like you're not ready for this, therefore take some time to think about it and come back and see us when you are" (not verbatim but that was the gist of it).

Instead, because I probably tried his patience by asking about the risks of particulate vs. non-particulate corticosteroid epidural steroid injections and wanted to know which one he uses (particulate it turns out), his demeanor went from general bonhomie to pettiness. He literally told me that spondylolisthesis is caused by weak core muscles. [I have spondylolisthesis L5/S1, stenosis probably caused by the pars fracture that occurred at some point in my life, and osteoarthritis of the spine (spondylosis).] At that point my mood flipped to one of complete outrage.

Anyone with a modicum of knowledge of this condition would know that it can be congenital and MANY athletes are afflicted with it. Do not tell me they have poor core strength, ok? That's absurd! I am still a lithe, 6ft / 147 lb, 53 y/o woman who can STILL touch her palms to the floor despite the pain (on a good day only)! I was an athlete and did all manner of sports to include squash, dressage, show-jumping, swimming, athletics,... My last stint was in 2017 whereby exercising just increased the pain levels instead of improving them despite incorporating strength training! I could do abs better than many of the members my age and even younger! I have good core strength. That was insulting to me! Made me see red actually. I guess he wanted to get me out of there, therefore resorted to a petty attack suggesting my predicament is MY fault!! PT, chiropractic, yoga, pilates ....I've done it all to no avail.

I lost all respect for him in that instant. So many doctors are arrogant. They don't know everything about every condition. Granted he is an expert on spinal anatomy, but not apparently about everything despite having had 2 transforaminal ESI procedures himself (so he said). What's wrong with your core then Dr.? The low blow was not appreciated. I won't be back.|Dr. Verhey is so warm and caring. I have had nothing but excellent care by him and his staff.|Dr Verhey and his staff are amazing!  Dr Verhey continues to explore options in pain management while battling insurance and Medicare.|Dr. Verhey and his staff we're amazing. Dr. Verhey  listened to me. He was amazing when I had the injection done. I couldn't believe how better I felt after 5 years of pain. I trust him.|Very professional,  Dr. Verhey has done a few of my steroid injections and I've never had a problem.  First time I had one I was very nervous but he calmed me down easily and now they're not so stressful.|Spent two weeks trying to schedule an appointment just to have the staff tell me that the service I need isn't provided by their clinic. You could have told me that when I initially called not after having me send the referral over twice, having the referring physical call and send over additional notes, and telling me that your office is busy so you will call me in a few days TO SCHEDULE AN APPOINTMENT AND WHEN YOU DID CALL BACK IS WHEN YOU SAID YOU DON'T PROVIDE THE SERVICE I NEED! Total waste of my time and now I get to live with this terrible pain even longer. Dr Verhey, your staff should be more organized and professional if you expect your patients to have confidence in you and your practice.

column40:
I had great personal care for sciatica pain. Dr. Fuller was very thorough.  The injections were well thought out and really helped!!!|I went here for a procedure in 2022 and though my procedure was fully covered by insurance (this was confirmed by both the front desk staff AND my insurance company), I'm still getting bills in the mail for it. On top of that, Dr. Fuller was very rude and dismissive to me and made me feel very uncomfortable both during the consultation and injection, but I believed the injection was my only option so I went through with it anyway. The extra star is because the injection did technically kind of work (offered some pain relief but wasn't perfect) and the front desk staff was very nice and friendly- I don't think the billing issue is their fault at all.|I have had back pain from sports injuries for almost 10 years. I was feeling hopeless and out of options. Then I found Mount Pain and Spine. Everyone in the office is so kind and helpful. They are always able to schedule in a timely manner. Dr Fuller is very helpful and always listens. I recommend anyone with back pain to come here!|I had a very disappointing experience with Mountain Spine and Pain in Highlands Ranch. I was scheduled for an appointment at one location but was not informed about a change in venue. When I called to let them know I would be 10 minutes late due to this mix-up, they assured me it was okay. However, upon my arrival, I was informed that I would need to reschedule because I was 2 minutes late.

While they admitted it was their mistake regarding the location change, their lack of concern for my time and situation was shocking. The service was incredibly unprofessional, and it felt like they truly didn't care about their patients. I expected more understanding and support, especially when mistakes are made on their end.

I do not recommend this place at all. If you're looking for a practice that values your time and well-being, I suggest looking elsewhere.|Dr. Fuller is one of the best doctors I've ever been to. He really helped me with my back pain, something I've struggle with for many years. I swear, he's a miracle worker. His staff is amazing, they are super friendly and professional.|I took my wife in to get checked out. Brian Fuller seemed like he had better things to do. He wouldnt even bother looking at the xrays we brought in. The visit was about 5min and maybe 2 with him. Nothing was done other than telling us to get more mri. Not even a recomendation on how to stop the pain. Then just left and pushed us out. Very  unprofessional and just didnt care.|I want to share how absolutely grateful I am for being referred to Dr Fuller! First of all you get an amazing group of compassionate and professional staff. The moment you walk through the door you are greeted by Baxter a super therapeutic amazing fur baby. I can't say enough about the experience you have at this office. I came in so messed up with arthritis, bulging disks to the point my life for the last four years have been in excruciating pain. I thought at one point I may need to have to always use assistive devices to walk. WhenI first met with the Dr. I had so many issues he took a very proactive systematic approach to working with me. It has taken several visits to get me back to a version of myself I could recognize again. I am walking without assistive devices any longer. Although not all of my pain is gone I am in better space than I have been for years. I even danced for the first time in years. I am so, so grateful for the help I have received. The staff works overtime dealing with insurance and get it done and approved. Please I want to let others know this is not just any other Doctors office. They can help you and you are heard. What are you waiting for. Get on the phone now and call them!!! Thank you Dr. Fuller and staff at Mountain Spine!!!|Dr Fuller is the best! He's always very courteous and professional. I have an old neck injury from a car accident and he's the only person I trust. His staff is also very friendly and personable. Throughout my numerous visits I've had nothing but positive experiences.

column38: Felix M|holly F|Ky Janel|Bry-lee Lopez|Amber G.|nickea Stroud|Nic Paczolt|Archie Neil
column40:
I don't even care to give my story again. You all tried to fix the issues by addressing my first review. Face the facts. You have no experience when it comes to autistic Black men and that's fine. But maybe you should get to know people outside of your small world, MVPC. You'll treat your patients like humans, instead of wild animals.

Was "discharged" AFTER I left the practice last week because for the second time, I was sent into a panic attack by one of the staffers. I did yell at the staffer to "stop talking" when I was having an autonomic reaction ( I have nerve damage). That is why I'm being discharged.

I would never recommend this place to someone in pain.

Try Joint Effort. They will get you moving again!|I was with you guys around 2 years. I went from  Giving 5 stars to 1 and this is my third time altering my review. I don't want to give a bad review. Staff is really great here. Physical therapist Joscelyn Kelly was amazing, I'll miss her and her help.  Staff was always really respectful and pleasant. Will and Celeste at the front desk, even Natasha,  clinic manager.  Even when I left the bad review the first time because I was in so much pain, I was angry. But I feel my chronic pain was often dismissed in the last 6 months,  Dr. Paull was helpful and felt he listened to me, my last,  final visit. However, When I asked for a small amount of pain pills for emergency pain, like 10, or emergency suppositories. He advised me to talk to my primary physician about that. While I try my best to be understanding. It Kind of defeats the purpose of having a pain specialist if I'm in pain and i'm not being helped. When I first arrived at this clinic I was given tramadol For emergency pain because I said it worked for me in the past.  I was given quite a lot and I even told my physician Who had left the practice that I didn't need that much. I took under my prescribed dose, I drive a lot for my job. And I work with children and the elderly. I also pass medication. I have to be on
My feet, Thinking clearly, And implementing behavioral programming.   Walking up to 12k steps, including lifting and being a single parent household my 2 conditions can cause me Severe debilitating pain due to physical exertion. I would be crying, Collapsing to my knees at work, In front of clients and staff and it's humiliating. This often happened at my last job. Even with a large amount of tramodol it still occurred. I could depend on that medication for when I was In agony take a break wait for the pill to kick in and then be able to go back to work and do my job and be a mom to my son.
I do know that staff didn't suspect me of abusing meds  Because I was taken off that medication cold turkey, With no side effects and I didn't even ask for more for months. I think this clinic should know that I have been bawling my eyes out several times a week from the amount of pain i've been in. I was sent home from one of my jobs because I was crying too much And I couldn't walk or even stand. I'm in a probationary period for another job and I think i'm about to get fired because of my pain. Driving is also dangerous.  I think the main reason i'm upset is because i've been scaring the hell out of my 8 year old son. He knows what endo pain is, And the amount of times I've had to ask a family member to come Get him because my crying and pain would not cease. Then my son would cry because he didn't know what to do when he couldn't help me. I know this is really long but i'm trying to make a point. While cyclobenzaprine,  Naproxen, Tylenol,  heating pads,  and lidocaine patches mildly help-
Any woman who Has ever had uterine contractions and electric lightning in their pelvis knows that those medications don't do Jack. Tonight,  I sat in a scolding bath for an hour crying.  800 Naproxen,  1000 Tylenol,  60 mg cyclobenzaprine 3 times a day,  which is WAY TOO much, but F**k my liver, I'm in pain.
And I just decorated myself in half a box of lidocaine patches.  And ate a 50mg edible.
Cannabis is very helpful but i'm not supposed to use it any of my jobs, Despite medicinal needs. If I get hurt
On the job and drug tested I lose that job.
I cannot use it or be on it While at work, Or driving which is mainly when I need pain management.   I'm not entirely sure what policies may have changed with this company in the past year but it feels so much more different than when I started.
I Just think it's important for the clinician management staff, And perhaps people reading the reviews know that I think this company has always been great,  but perhaps doesn't take endometriosis and Adenomyosis very seriously.|Don't listen to you. I almost lost my leg cuz they didn't believe I was in so much pain. And when I told them what works they argued that the knew better then someone who's living with the pain. They don't want to help people. They act like your trying get drugs cuz you ask for what will work for you. I had to go to different doctor who gave me emergency spine surgery after looking at my mri for 5 minutes and they were trying give me injections instead. I could have lost my leg and I lived with debilitating pain for 2 months before l before getting emergency surgery and they still wouldn't help me.|Mountain View pain center has been amazing in helping me recover. They really take the time out to make sure you're okay with everything throughout your treatment. Not only do they care about making sure you are okay physically but they also stop to make the hard times easier.|Dr. Paul Castellini and Allie have literally given me my life back! This time last year I was in so much pain I could barely walk. I have neurofibromatosis type 3 and my nerve pain was a solid 10. But with physical therapy (thank you Jonathan!) and medication I am back to exercising and I feel like I've gotten my life back! Dr. Paul is amazingly helpful and kind, he takes the time to listen and adapt a pain management approach for my individual issues.  Allie does all of the insurance stuff that I don't even understand behind the scenes so meds are approved and never delayed. And she answers or deals with every message I have left. This is by far the best practice I have been to. If you are needing help dealing with chronic pain, I highly recommend calling these folks and making an appointment with Dr Castellini! They have given me back my quality of life back and made me think anything is possible! Best team ever!!! Solid five stars!!!|Amazing people, spectacular environment ,always pleasant when you go in .They greet you with a smile I've been going here for a year for both physical therapy and pain management. The physical therapist are great . Funny . Good conversation|Will, Natasha, Ashton, Kayleigh, Olivia and even Claudia make every visit comfortable. Friendly,  professional, courteous and efficient are all traits I value when considering service and this group has it all!
They have made a very challenging time in my life much easier and even enjoyable- always greeted with warm,  genuine smiles and all my questions answered.  You could not really ask for much more!
10 out of 10 would recommend|I am recovering from a car accident and it is a great clinic to be able to cover multiple appointments in one session in the same place. I definitely recommend MVPC for any treatments, from pain management, physical therapy, chiropractic care and more

I really like Dr. Sorenson, and wish he had a competent staff and/or billing department who followed their own agreements, and didn't blatantly lie to their patients. Thanks all you make it a seamless and painless( context) experience to make appointments, procedures, and medication knowledge a breeze.|After an accident left me with two shattered heels, cracked vertebrae, and broken ribs I was fortunate enough to end up with Missy (Melissa Smith) as my provider. She has helped guide me through varying levels of pain from 9/10 in a wheelchair, to crutches, to walking with a cane. She has very literally helped give me back my life. I am eternally grateful for Missy.|This was by far the best experience I have had with an injection. column3:
Specialized Corrective Exercise for Lasting Pain Relief

At Pain Free Clinic of Denver, we specialize in teaching corrective exercise techniques that address the root causes of chronic pain. Our certified practitioner, Stasia Humphreys, combines Egoscue Method, Foundation Training, and MUTU System expertise to help clients achieve proper body alignment and lasting relief. We focus on treating:

  • Chronic and recurring back pain

  • Postpartum conditions including diastasis recti

  • Pelvic floor weakness

  • Hip and shoulder misalignments

  • Plantar fasciitis and knee pain

Our approach is different - we don't just treat symptoms but teach you how to realign your body through simple, effective exercises that become part of your daily routine. Many clients experience significant improvement within weeks of consistent practice. Located in Littleton, we provide personalized care for clients of all ages seeking freedom from pain. Visit Pain Free Clinic of Denver or call us at (303) 905-1832 to schedule your consultation and begin your journey to pain-free living.
column11: We practice & teach corrective exercise in order to help people with the following issues: chronic pain, recurring pain, back pain, diastasis recti, pelvic floor weakness and more. Stasia is a certified Egoscue practitioner, a Foundation Training Instructor and a MUTU Pro. She helps people feel better by realigning their body and helps postpartum women (of all ages) heal a weak core and pelvic floor.
column38: Mary Raynard|Leah|Lillian Palmiere|Sharon Shortridge|Katie Edwards|Diane Riechert|Bonnie West|bill saltz
column40: I've been in some degree of pain pretty much constantly for the past several years, waking up every morning stiff, hunched over and hobbling. I have woken up the past 2 mornings pain free! And I'm sure it is because Stasia has listened to me, worked with me to carefully unlock postural misalignments. The exercises are so simple and clear, it's easy to do them every day. I think those daily corrections are doing their magic. So grateful to feel like myself again!!!|Stasia has been incredibly helpful to me! Thanks to her, I can now sit cross-legged, something I haven't been able to do in years, much less comfortably! The Egoscue method has eliminated my plantar fasciitis and knee pain! If you perform the exercises consistently, you'll be pain free too.|I take the sitting Functional Motion class at Vita that is instructed by Stasia.  For the last two mornings when I got out of bed I felt like the top of my body wasn't attached to the lower part of my body.   I took her class this morning and feel whole.  It's an amazing class.  Thank you Stasia|I have been taking Functional Body Movement with Stasia for a little over a month, after at least 10 years of doing no exercise. This is the best fitness class I have ever taken!  Stasia is a wonderful teacher, she adapts every exercise for the varying needs of everyone in my class. I realized I had  more flexibility and range of motion by the third class. I have also started strength training and I realize that I'm better able to maintain safe form because of the FBM class. For the first time in my life, I'm aware of where my body is in space and how to align my body so it works better. I highly recommend Stasia!|I have recently experienced lower back pain and shoulder pain. Stasia was able to show me how my pain is a result of my hips not being in proper alignment. After just a few days of the stretches and exercises given to me, the pain had decreased significantly. I am now making these exercises part of my daily routine, feeling stronger and having more motion without the pain!|Stasia's Foundation Training class has really helped me.  I usually go to the chiropractor every two weeks.  I no longer have to go as often while regularly doing the exercises.  The other day I cleaned my carpets using one of the big cleaners you rent at the grocery store.  I am a few months shy of 70 and have had knee surgery in the past year.  I was certain I would be extremely sore the next day.  I did 30 minutes of Foundation Training after the cleaning project.  The next day,  I felt fine.  I highly recommend Stasia and The Foundation Training program.|I started going to Stasia about 10 months ago when I had constant neck/shoulder pain. Within a month or two it was much better and within 6 months I was pain free. I also regained the inch and a half in height I thought I'd lost dues to osteoporosis but obviously it was alignment and posture. When I pulled a muscle in my back this summer in tennis, I was able to exercise through it and it was gone in less than 3 weeks. The exercises take dedication but it is well worth the time in return for no pain and better appearance. Stasia is so great to work with, she makes you feel very comfortable.|While I didn't have any specific pain issues I went to Stasia primarily for a review/check up.  I had never visited her clinic before so wasn't sure what to expect.  Well, I was amazed at the results.  A week after my visit I went on a demanding hike (heavy backpack, steep and demanding terrain etc) and I truly had much more mobility in my hips (I'm 62) than I'd felt in prior outings.  Again, truly amazed at the improved mobility.  One doesn't have to be in pain to benefit greatly from her expertise.

  • Therapeutic injections and minimally invasive procedures

  • Acupuncture therapy for natural pain relief

  • Chiropractic adjustments and spinal care

Our team approach means we can address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Dr. Drennan and our experienced staff work diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that improve quality of life and restore function. For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our Comprehensive Pain Specialists Website or call us at +1 303-469-3182.

column40:
Was a patient for years. They made lots of money from my chronic pain with countless procedure and even prescribed a Fentanyl patch knowing the highly addictive nature of the pain medicine. Lied about how easy it was to get off the medicine. "When you want to stop, all you have to do is come in once, take an oral medication and lay on the couch for a half hour." That's a lie. I was addicted for years.
Finally I refused to simply show up and be experimented on. They would tell me that my procedures were approved by insurance, have me come in and do the procedure to only find out after the fact that the procedures weren't approved by insurance. So they decided to surprise bill me for and attempt to make me  pay out of pocket.
They then had me come in and attempt to have me sign an authorization for that I would agree to pay out of pocket for my procedures if they were "later denied by insurance". I refused to sign and then they attempted to say I was a No-Show for an appointment while I was standing in their office!!!!
I said No, I came in because you said it was approved but I'm not agreeing to pay for something that isn't approved. And they've been attempting to damage my credit ever since. I've now filed a complaint with the State's Attorneys General Office as there is ZERO chance I'm paying for a NO-Show when I was there but refused to play their games!
Never would recommend them! Thieves and liars. Have the phone records to prove that I called my office to tell them about the situation while standing in there office. No-Show, sure!|Dr Drennan is a great practitioner. He wants you to feel better and understand how he can give you a better quality of life from chronic pain. Great beside manner and all the staff have always been kind, professional, and courteous. T|Stood in the open air lobby waiting to pickup a client and heard an incredible amount of patients information.  Aren't there laws protecting patient confidentiality medically and personally?  I know where several people live, their birthdays, what they were being treated for, and how long they're going to be there. I was only here for 30 minutes.  There must be a reporting agency for this kind of trust breach!|Dr. Drennan and his staff Mark, Johanna, Sara and Kiana  were all amazing  great customer service...I worked in health care for 27 years and they are all first class in customer service ! Dr. Drennan has excellent patient care skills. My husband and I  are both veterans and were very impressed with him....he is very social and has a helluva resume for care. My back and hips feel amazing . My husband soon will get his injections. He got us in a timely manner so we can hike those amazing trails! I absolutely recommend this provider!!!!!|The treatment team is amazing and caring...

However billing is starting to become problematic due to insurance issues. They called me 4 days before the end of the month to tell me that they had to cancel my upcoming appointment 3 weeks out since they would no longer be able to accept UnitedHealthcare going forward. I find this to be highly questionable behavior, especially for a pain management clinic. A doctor's office knows months in advance when they are being dropped by an insurance provider. I did receive a letter from the doctor's office saying that they were having issues with UnitedHealthcare but nothing about stopping taking the coverage for existing patients. I happen to be lucky to have dual coverage so I could change insurance providers outside of the annual enrollment period but the other patients may not be able to pivot like I did to a different insurance company. There needs to be a better way to handle these changes considering that all of the patients seen by this clinic would have massive issues changing doctors with the rules surrounding the care provided by this clinic.|I had an appointment with a doctor that was no longer working there and no one ever told me until I showed up at the appointment.  I agreed to see someone else because I was having a pain emergency and the person that I saw automatically assumed that I was medication seeking (even though I had already said that I didn't want pain meds and all I wanted was Meloxicam).  I walked out of the appointment in tears and never went back.  Two years later, I started receiving a bill from that visit because they were out of network for my insurance.  I paid that bill and then a week later I got a call from the billing lady who said that I additionally owed $150 from a procedure in 2022 that was not covered by my insurance (even though they had submitted the prior authorization and it was approved by my insurance company).  The billing lady was rude and inconsiderate and I ended up having to pay the additional $150 with the office manager because I just couldn't deal with talking to the billing lady again.  I was fine having to pay for the original bill, but then to come back and say that I have to pay an additional $150 is mind blowing........especially since they didn't do their job in the first place because they were too busy judging me.  I will NEVER go back there and would suggest that you don't as well unless you want to feel like a medication seeker.  The doctor and the billing lady should really be ashamed of themselves.|I started seeing Dr. Drennan a few months ago and had my first procedure done here today. It was so easy! It was done so fast and proficiently and with a lot of humor. The attitudes and confidence were so helpful - absolutely wonderful and easy experience! Highly recommend going here if you have pain issues to address!|Dr. Drennan and the staff at this facility are the best I've ever come across. I've been in pain Management for more than 25 years. I've had good doctors bad doctors and fair doctors. Dr. Drennan and the staff are the best I've ever come across. They are, caring, compassionate, effective, they listen, and they help get your pain under control and your life back.

column11: I was drawn into pain management because I like the challenge of discovering a patient's underlying pain condition and being able to help them overcome it. I have a great deal of compassion for my patient's pain experience - how their pain began, why they have it, and how it affects their life, their work, and their family. My communication is open, friendly, and personalized. Patients have told me they feel comfortable asking me questions without feeling embarrassed or intimidated. My goal is to provide quality care to each patient. I want my patients to be assured that they have come to the right place to feel better.

I've bounced from several doctors, as I was relentless on finding proper care for my intense nerve pain. I feel SO lucky to have found Dr. Sharma... I finally walked out of clinic with zero pain. I feel like life is worth living again, and I can't say thank you enough to Dr. Sharma!!!! He is seriously the best doctor I've ever had.|Dr Sharma is amazing! he helped me qualify for botox migraine treatment and it has seriously changed my life. i would get migraines numerous times per month and have tried many different medications both OTC and prescriptions. without Dr Sharma's help, i would still be missing multiple days of work and stuck in bed suffering. thanks to Dr Sharma's treatments, i can live a normal life.

thank you so much Dr Sharma!|Dr Sharma is incredible. He is knowledgeable, attentive, thorough and precise. I have extreme confidence in him and feel blessed to have him as my doctor. I would recommend him to anyone. His is a true gem.|Dr. Sharma is one of the greatest doctors I have met. Competent and caring. He goes above and beyond to help his patients.

column40:
What a pleasure to be able to find Mountain View Pain Center in Denver, Co. I am finally able to deal with the   pain that has been getting worse because of Hannah's help in PT! She hears the stress  I have been having trying to get back to swimming hiking and walking . The future is looking great to exercise without any limits after 45 years in a beautiful environment. Our exercise evolves after her kind touch and patience.Good bye Scoliosis and Degenerative Disc Disease, my future looks bright at 72! Thank you Hannah and all the great healers that staff this Amazing Mountain View Pain Center, God Bless you all...Margie S.|I've been going through workers compensation for over a year and it's been a long journey. Rocky Mountain Pain Center has been a big piece of the process the last few months and even when we've hit roadblocks, the staff and specialists remain focused and caring to make sure I'm getting the care I need. I've worked with the downtown location as well as the Lowry and both have had great, welcoming atmospheres. The staff is personable and professional. Even when I've been in the lower mental states of this journey, the staff has made me feel heard and seen.|Avoid Mountainview Pain Center - Poor Service and Incompetent Staff

I had a deeply disappointing experience at Mountainview Pain Center, and I feel compelled to warn others. Their customer service is shockingly poor, and the staff is woefully untrained when it comes to pain management. It's clear they have no expertise in treating anything beyond superficial discomfort.

The so-called "pain management" services amount to nothing more than a halfhearted, light massage. The staff, though polite enough, are very young and lack the skills or training to deliver a massage that truly addresses pain. It's as if they don't understand the difference between a generic relaxation massage and one designed to manage chronic pain or provide actual relief.

If you're looking for real pain management or a skilled therapeutic massage, save your time and money and look elsewhere. Mountainview Pain Center seems more interested in offering gimmicks than meaningful care. Not only was this a waste of time and money, but with more than 7 attempts to get someone to call me back, and even being told EVERYTIME that someone would call me back, I NEVER received a call back.  To add to this, the most recent time I called I was answered by someone who could only text message people in the office and could only read me the results of their text (chat) messages.   This was a waste of time and, worse, left me feeling more frustrated than when I walked in.|I have been coming to Mountain View Pain Center since March of 2023 for Pain Mgmt, Physical Therapy and Chiropractic treatment.  This is my second pain mgmt facility since moving here in 2022, I have not had any of the negative experiences that I endured at the first facility.
Every person that I have had to work with at Mountain View Pain Center have been more than helpful,  thoughtful, kind, and full of useful advice.
I am very grateful for all of the assistance, suggestions and support from everyone at Mountain View Pain Center from the big beautiful smiles of the kind receptionists, very friendly Medical assistants and extremely professional and courteous medical staff..|Dr. Melati Steven's is an amazing acupuncturist and has helped my pain recovery tremendously. She is incredible to work with and enjoy her approach. The entire MVPC team is an amazing, go to them for your pain treatment. They will take good care of you!|I love coming to MVPC. They treat you like family while helping with all your pain issues. The PT and Chiro team helped me with long term pain that I didn't even know I could attempt to remedy. It's so easy to make appointments and get in when you need it. I love going for my treatments. Everyone from front desk to the service teams is so kind and helpful.|Thank you so much for all your care and kindness !!  All of you girls were amazing ( Olga, Brittany , Melati , the girls at the front desk and Candace!!
I appreciate you all so much for helping me navigate my way through  pain  and helping my body following two car accidents within 6 months .
I will highly recommend you to everyone I know :)
Thank  you again !|Horrible answering system. Called to set up an initial appointment and was told that I'd have to wait 5-7 days for them to even tell me if they accepted my insurance!

This place is the best friendly staff clean and organized facility they get you in right away for appointments they very professional here never had and a bad experience here I recommend to anyone I know|What is there to say? The staff if absolutely amazing.  I came in 10 mon early for an appt and helping catch up paperwork and was able to laugh with the desk team and they were waiting to pull me to the back. I had zero chance of having to wait. This isn't my first appt and so lucky to have been referred to this team. They want me to get better as much as I do.|I have been struggling with chronic pain for most of my life but when I was in my 40s pain seemed to escalate very fast. After getting 3 cervical vertebrae fused earlier this year I decided it was time to find a specialist to help me manage my pain. I tried another provider in Thornton first but when she kept canceling my appointment I decided to find someone else.
I found Mountain View Pain Management in the Northfield area and now I see Kelsey regularly. When I come in she takes the time to hear how things are going from my perspective and I feel comfortable telling her everything about my ongoing pain problems.
At my first appointment I shared that my bio parents were drug addicts and I wanted to do all I could to break this pattern
So I tried quite a few different pain meds and a lot of them I had never heard of.
Well now I'm at the crossroads of deciding how to handle stuff because none of the meds were helping.
So now we've come up with a plan to go on the lowest dose possible of a strong pain pills and we will be checking in frequently to make sure that everything is going ok.
I'm glad that I came here and I deeply value the input from Kelsey to help me continue living a mobile life in my 50s and above.
You'll not go wrong with choosing this company to work with!|Dr. Fuller is amazing,  his staff  are amazing.  I have been coming to the office now for about 2 & a half 3 years.  They have always treated me with such kindness & respect.  Dr. Fuller and the girls are highly knowledgeable. They all make you very comfortable from your 1st visit and on.  It is always a bonus to see Baxter  in the office for that  emotional support .|I've been here multiple times to hang out with my boyfriend while he takes his therapy and the employees here aren't nice because it seems that they don't like me to be here at all event though I'm just sitting far from the designated area to the therapy; the girl in the front is always so reluctant and upset when I get there to ask her if I can come in with him. I mean it's a thing that HE asked me to do, and he's a he patient so they would be fine with the patient being companied, I'm not being noisy or anything but they seem like they don't know how to treat their customers.|Everyone here is great, and kind, they are always positive and love to see you smile even if you are in pain.|I love central park location! The staff are always friendly and helpful! I love the way I feel when I leave! Absolutely amazing!!!|Staff is awesome! They are all nice and always have smiles on. They make sure that you are feeling good, ask you what is hurting to work on it more. At the end of my appointments, I feel like a new person! Very professional, organized, and clean place!

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Golden, Colorado

At Denver Pain and Spine, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Daniel S Bennett, a board-certified pain management physician and surgeon. With over 25 years of experience, our practice specializes in treating complex pain conditions through a combination of innovative procedures and personalized care plans. We offer a range of advanced treatments including:

  • Radio-frequency nerve treatments (RFA)

  • Minimally invasive surgical interventions

  • TENS unit therapy

  • Cutting-edge stem cell treatments

  • Customized medication management

Our approach focuses on developing individualized treatment plans that address the root cause of pain rather than just masking symptoms. Dr. Bennett's background in anesthesiology provides him with unique insights into effective pain control strategies. Located at 14828 W 6th Ave in Golden, CO, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Contact us at 720-541-6800 or visit Denver Pain and Spine to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward improved quality of life.

column40:
Dr Bennett is very skilled in his field. His background is in anesthesiology so you know he understands pain control. He not only prescribes procedures that help patients cope with pain, he performs the procedures himself! Since having to leave him (my insurance changed) I haven't found another doc who does the radio-frequency nerve treatments (RFA) I was so blessed to have Bennett treat me for many years. If you can see him, DO!|Be careful, his staff will put you in very bad positions and not let you have any communication with Dr. Bennett himself.  He has had insurance issues with cigna that were brought to my attention when I called the insurance company. Nothing was said to me by anyone at Colorado pain and spine. They canceled my appointment without telling me, telling me I can pay cash to get my meds.  My appt is TODAY!!
THEY'VE ALSO BEEN OVER CHARGING FOR MY COPAY SINCE 2020, $10 EXTRA PER MONTH... STAY AWAY ANGELA RUNS THE PLACE NOT DR BENNETT.  I FEEL BAD FOR TONY AND ROSLYN.|Since 2003 I've been in and out of doctors and hospitals, always labeled "an interesting and complex case." From the beginning dr. Bennett was ahead of the rest of the medical community in his research, technique, and knowledge. I have been with him since 2004 and he is the best pain mgmt doctor I've ever seen (and I've seen a lot). He truly cares how you're feeling as a patient, doesn't make you feel judged that you need pain meds, is focused on what will make you feel the best and truly listens to your concerns, he is constantly on the forefront of new techniques and new options (ie stem cells) he knows the chemistry behind the medications he provides - how they interact, the best way to take them, which meds are better because they are more pure and better for the body; his office staff works so hard to keep the office running smoothly and in case of emergency will do everything in their power to get you in (i.e. I needed an emergency procedure scheduled and his office got me in the morning before he left for vacation, he came in extra early because it was the only way to fit me in the schedule). Although he no longer takes my insurance, his office does their best to keep appointment costs and procedural costs low, fighting for coverage when possible. I will not go to a different pain mgmt doctor because of the terrible experiences I've had with many many doctors - not believing my pain, throwing cheap meds at me that I know don't work, not upping my doses when they need to be, etc.). I trust dr. Bennett and his office with my life and would fly in from out of state if I had to in order to continue seeing him.|Dr. Bennett is a God-send in my life.  I thought I was going to be in severe pain forever.  But Dr. Bennett and I put together an action plan involving surgery, a TENS unit, and some medication.  It keeps me out of pain most of the time.  I am eternally grateful!|I have been seen in Dr Bennetts office since 1998. Same office for 23 yrs ,and for tr-germinal neuralgia (suicide desease). one of the hardest diseases to cope Without him I would not be alive today.I don't know what I would do if did have him. At the Centeno-Schultz Clinic, Dr. John R. Schultz brings over 20 years of specialized experience in interventional pain management to our patients. As a board-certified Anesthesiologist and Pain Management Doctor, Dr. Schultz serves as Co-Medical Director of our regenerative orthopedic clinic. We're proud of his extensive training at prestigious institutions including Michael Reese Hospital and Medical Center, Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, and Bowman Gray School of Medicine.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer comprehensive pain management solutions through Dr. Schultz's expertise:

  • Interventional pain management procedures

  • Regenerative orthopedic treatments

  • Specialized spine interventions

  • Personalized treatment plans

Dr. Schultz is an active member and former instructor for the Spine Interventional Society (SIS) and maintains medical licensure in Utah, Colorado, and North Carolina. His contributions to the field include numerous publications in anesthesiology and regenerative science. For exceptional pain management care, contact us at +1 303-429-6448 or visit our office at 403 Summit Blvd Ste 201, Broomfield, CO 80021. Learn more about Dr. John Schultz's credentials and approach on our website.

column38: Melissa Stoldal|Rick Finley|Cari|Lori Moore|tina racle-mueller|Jaimie Anderson
column40:
Dr. Gabriel and his staff are great. He definitely hires educated Physician Assistants. I know that walking into a 'pain management' office carries a stigma. "Oh, you just want drugs". Never did I feel that seeing his office. I'm in pain, can you help me? He isn't just handing out meds. He actually treats pain conservatively and uses in patient procedures. If you stick with the treatment plan you're going to get relief. The only reason I'm giving a 4 is because their phone system is a hot mess. He and his staff have a lot riding on the line. The people who use narcotics for fun ruin it for others who truly need meds to get through the day.|Technically, this a negative review. Even tho it requires you to select one star to leave a review.  Do not let Michael, the CEO, Dr.Gabriel, and David. Treat you.  I have Crohn's Disease, a Brain Tumor and a severally damaged low back l5 thru both si joints. I had previously come from the office that David worked at, that office when i asked to be placed on a lower dosage of pain medication, I was given something brand new. So that doctor took me from very heavy pain meds to something that was not even a pain medication. I was found unresponsive in a seizure and it took the ER to bring me out of it.
So, I found Dr Gabriel's office, the visits we're great as long as they had my insurance to keep running for injection treatments. Which last short term, week maybe two at most, then you have to wait till they say you can have the injections again.
In the mean time, David w Dr Gabriel's agreement decided to place me also back on pain medication, I did this for I believe only one month. THEN,  I decided I wanted to try to live w the pain, completely w out the pain meds. After consulting 7 doctors, I was told that in my condition (Crohn's that is severe and a brain tumor that is not controlled), that since I had been on the pain meds that I could not go straight off of them. The pain docs I called, the gp's and St.Ants and U.C. campus doctors advised I get a doctor to get a medication called Suboxone, (this medication is used two ways, for serious drug addicts on big illicit drugs and for normal people that live in Long term pain, but need to come off of the pain meds to let the body have a break) I am the second. I needed a break from the pain meds. So I think in September or October beginning of, I used the Suboxone and in 1 month was done w the negative side of taking your self off of pain medications(the withdrawal), three weeks ago, w my doctor's and family saying your in to much pain, go back on for a little while. So we drive an hour and 15 min to see David the P.A. he wasn't available for my appointment for some reason and my appt became w Michael the CEO.
So, we discuss that I need to go back on. And give a urine sample. All three knowing that I use CBD oils for the tumor and use one strip of the Suboxone one a month to settle the damaged receptors(it's like an electric uncomfortable feel, and yes was still getting that feeling after being off pain meds for over six months. Only reason I used it. So they have the urine. It only takes 48 to get the results, I am told after one week that it still was not back. Waited another two weeks for them to call me back, still nothing untill today. To which the CEO, mind you....calls my mother, I'm disabled so we live under the same roof, well anyway calls her not me. To try and explain that they no longer have any prescribers, and that David has been very Ill and they don't know if he will ever be back to work (their words). I listened to him try to explain why I couldn't come back in to be treated, short term on the pain meds. As I listened it became apparent that this was over them not getting to bill my insurance(Medicaid) for the big ticket items like my injections. They just don't make enough off of us on a Dr office visit and a script. I had all my doctor's/gp/GI, endocrinologists including the prescriber of the medication to come off of the pain meds my first time, tell me. Have your pain mgmt Dr call us. I asked that they do this, they refused.
This is yet another office that failed themselves and a patient. Please do your research, do not just trust that they are telling you the truth, or that they know exactly what meds to put you on, cause they don't, they shoot from the hip, guess...etc. If prescribed medication, research it. Research the doctor's. Watch what they are billing your insurance for sure. Understand that this is a business to make money from the pain your living with.
I can honestly say, I have never been so amazed at how horrible this office changed, and how they treat people. And document everything like I did.
, (r)|I couldn't ask for a better Dr. Office all the staff. From Dr Gabriel to David and all the nursing staff plus the wonderful ladies at the front desk are very helpful patient kind . and informative . everyone explains everything in detail . they are very on about what needs I need from my injection to medication they never push you to do anything you don't want to do they figure out what you need and what's best for you . and if something isn't working then they already have the next step ready for you . I recommend them to everyone .|||

column48: Does Dr Gabriel do Radiofrequency Ablation (burning nerves in back)?
column49: Thank you for you question! Yes, Dr. Gabriel has over 10 years of interventional pain experience, and is highly skilled at radiofrequency ablation (RFA) treatments for the cervical, thoracic and lumbar spine. The most common procedures performed by Dr. Gabriel include transforaminal epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, medial branch blocks and RFA procedures. But his interventional experience is broad, and includes basic large/medium joint injections and peripheral nerve blocks, to more advanced non-surgical procedures, such as kyphoplasty, spinal cord stimulation and stem cell therapies. - Management Team, Mountain View Pain Center

column40:
All of the staff here has been great and helped with my recovery.  Whether it be maintenance or a new injury,  they've always been on point and provide great, compassionate care!|Having never tried chiro before I was nervous but my worries melted away once arriving! They were professional, Polite, and did amazing work try them out!!|Absolutely love being here for accupuncture. Andrea is amazing doctor and has helped my life improve so much.|I spent about 3 months, two times a week at this facility for PT.  I had a very horrible experience and would not recommend this place to anyone that has any sort of long term chronic pain.  The entire experience felt disorganized, the different people I saw on a weekly basis where not on the same page or following the same treatment plans.  There were many days where I did my at home exercises and stretches, then went to my PT appointment and they had me redo the exact same stretches I had just done previously to driving there.  Many days it felt like a completely waste of time.  I saw no improvements throughout the three months I was there.  I had been told on multiple occasions about further treatment options, but then left in the dark for weeks about said options every-time I asked for information. After finally getting discouraged and saying something multiple visits in a row about how I'm not improving,  they did not listen nor did it feel like they really cared.  On the last visit I went to, I was balling my eyes out desperately asking for help, and I was told that the reason I'm not getting better is because I'm not taking my own recovery seriously and doing the work I need to be doing, which is completely false.  I broke down crying saying I didn't want to do this anymore, and they called the cops on me to try and baker act me.  Stay FAR FAR away from this place, it's absolutely horrible.  Months after the fact, here I am still in pain.

The worst part is my girlfriend worked here and was the person to recommend me pursuing this.  She explicitly asked permission to have me as a patient, nor did she have anything to do directly with my treatment.  After this situation happened, they used me as ammo to out right fire her even though she asked multiple times if it was ok.  Now I have to feel responsible for her losing her job.  This place is all about the money, and they want to keep you coming back weekly any way they can.  To give you an idea on how money corrupt this business is, they're currently outsourcing all of their behind the scenes office work to Turkey to save a buck.|My husband and I have been getting chiropractic adjustments here for some time. The entire staff are great! They listen to our needs, remember us by name and take great care of us. We recommend Mountain View Pain Center to everyone that we meet.|I needed a lot of work after an accident I had, my PCP referred me to Mountain View Pain Center because they can handle so much more than just traditional PT.  They have a specialist for everything, all in one location!  I see Atalia for my traditional PT, Larry and Alexis for Chiropractic (everyone needs to be adjusted, even if you don't think you do), and I have recently started seeing Dr. Andrea for acupuncture which is amazing!  She offers a private relaxing room w/ aromatherapy!  This location is large enough where everything is spread out, not cramped like typical PT offices.  There is a true sense of everyone there working together to get me the help I need for pain management.  There is no other place like it!  Highly Recommend.|I've come to the conclusion that this entire company is outstanding. I used to go to the Littleton location, but after that provider left the company, I had to see someone else. So now I see hunter at this location. And again, still amazing! They truly care about how you the patient are doing. Not how they believe you should be doing. I stoll recommend this company to anyone who needs all in one pain management.

Ps. I would have to bet that any of the "bad reviews" are from patients that either ONLY want pain meds, or violated the pain contract one too many times, so MVPC fired them as a patient. If you follow the rules set by the clinic, you will NEVER have an issue with anyone!|Good luck at reaching anyone at their facilities. You can't speak to anyone directly, ever. It's a circus. If you have an urgent question, need forms signed, need to reschedule or a prescription refilled it's a nightmare. They have a call center in Turkey that takes ALL calls. It's like trying to get through to NORAD. Terrible customer service management in my opinion. No real commitment to your patients. IF you're lucky, you can leave a message and they MIGHT call you back 3-4 days later. No joke. So, regardless of what response this review gets from MVPC, trust me. I'm being honest. Good luck.

column3:
Denver's Premier Pain Management & Sports Medicine Specialist

At SPARC of Colorado, Dr. Gin-Ming Hsu and our dedicated team provide comprehensive pain management solutions that help patients return to active, fulfilling lives. We specialize in innovative, minimally-invasive treatments for chronic pain conditions including back pain, sciatica, joint issues, and sports injuries. Our advanced treatment options include:

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) Therapy - Harnessing your body's natural healing abilities

  • Epidural Injections - Targeted relief for spinal and nerve pain

  • Shockwave Therapy - Non-invasive treatment for soft tissue conditions

  • Customized Pain Management Plans - Tailored to your specific condition and lifestyle goals

What sets us apart is Dr. Hsu's thorough diagnostic approach and commitment to explaining treatment options in detail. We take pride in helping patients transition from debilitating pain to renewed mobility without surgery when possible. Located in Denver's Washington Park neighborhood, we welcome patients seeking compassionate, effective pain management. Visit SPARC of Colorado or call us at +1 303-282-7772 to schedule your consultation at our office: 2480 S Downing St #210, Denver, CO 80210.
