column38: Craig Braun|Jeff Wright|HAROLD RUTT|Gideon Gerard|Nancy Reinicker|Stephanie Botts|B McCallister|Linda Howell
column40:
I have seen Dr.Hsu for a couple of pain concerns and he has helped both times. He is very good at explaining what is causing the pain and always offers up a variety of treatments. The 1st time I saw him was for sciatica caused by a knee replacement surgery where he gave me a series of epidural injections and recently he treated me for some debilitating SI joint pain with PRP treatments, both treatments were very successful.|My journey from debilitating back pain, where I found myself literally crawling on the floor, to being able to once again lift weights and hike in these beautiful Rocky Mountains, has now returned to my daily life.  My referral to Dr. Hsu from an emergency room visit has been nothing short of a miracle!  My diagnosis was for a L4-L5 disc bulge and Sciatica of the left side.  I will be forever grateful to Dr. Hsu's knowledge of the pain I was experiencing and his thoughtful Plan of Attack as to how to get me back to living my life.  My initial Cortisone Injection helped take the excruciating pain down to a tolerable level.  I then received three rounds of PRP injections followed by several months of physical therapy.
Thank you to PA Morgen Shaff for her amazing knowledge of the procedures and patient interaction.  My advice to anyone with my diagnosis is to visit Dr. Hsu and listen to his knowledgable ideas of how to make your life pain free, I'm happy I did!|Dr Hsu was so helpful, kind and fully explained what he was doing.  I have chronic lower back pain, and he explained after a couple tests what the course of action would be best for me. I would highly recommend him to anyone. I also appreciated his staff.|I've had a good experience with Dr Hsu, I like the way he completely explained the procedure in advance and throughout.
I feel great relief from my L5 issues.
Staff is great and facilitates the best care and consideration of your needs.
Thanks guys!|All better after two years of daily pain - no surgery needed! Absolutely thrilled with the compassionate thorough care from Dr. Shu and his staff.  Had three rounds of PRP along with Shock wave therapy to treat carpel tunnel, cupital tunnel and elbow bursa.  Ganglion cyst on top of hand 100% gone after 2 shock wave treatments without the PRP in that area. Highly recommend getting care from Dr. Shu and his team; they are the best.|The staff and Dr.Hsu are amazing and so helpful. Very caring and attentive to my needs. Professional and friendly . They are working hard to help me manage my severe pain.|"Dr Hsu in a very knowledgeable physician and his compassion is important for each patient." By managing my pain he has made it possible for me to carry on with most daily activities. It is my opinion that he is the best in the Denver metro area.|I couldn't recommend Dr. Hsu more highly!!! I've had pain for years! I'd Been to many facilities, none could help me. I heard raving reviews on Dr. Hsu and made an appointment. He listened to every detail of my pain report and asked questions with genuine concern. He made space for me to get in very quickly for specific diagnostic tests. Once he understood what was causing my pain, he spoke with his professional, friendly office team and they scheduled me within weeks. He explained every detail of my diagnosis and that he'd like to do an ablation. When in the O.R. , he talked me through each step and continued to ask me how I was doing.  I wish I'd found him years ago! I'd recommend anyone with back pain issues to get in touch with Spine Pain and Rehab asap!!!
It's my pleasure to know Dr. Hsu and to be his patient! He genuinely cares!!!
Linda Howell

column40:
Dr. Kenneth Finn has been my pain management doctor for many years. He has always provided me with his excellent care and expertise. His nurses and staff  at Capital Pain Management are very kind and caring would highly recommend Dr. Finn And Capitol Pain Management thank you for your care always there for me|After being a loyal and no stress patient for 6 years Finn dropped me for having THC on my urinalysis AFTER he ok'ed it at my last appointment with him which my husband was a witness to and there with me. I use different products for Crohn's disease and he was fine with it if my gastroenterologist was which they are. Highly upsetting and extremely unprofessional. I'm assuming he never made a note in my chart that he himself said it was fine. They also never gave me any type of warning she just said the levels are supposed to have dropped on the urinalysis but why would they drop if I wasn't warned first!?!! All the lady on the phone kept saying it's in the paperwork you signed.. apparently he was standing there while she was talking to me and he said drop her...very unfair, unethical and it's Colorado for god sakes what does pot especially in medical form do that is so bad you can't mix it with opiates?! Ridiculous. Unbelievable treatment makes me not want to trust another dr. Save your time and go visit Mountain View Pain Management. Excellent ratings and very kind people! Willing to do more for me in my first visit than Dr. Finn has ever!! They couldn't even find my mri I had to track it down myself. He's also very arrogant and condescending.|'ve been seeing Dr. Finn for pain management, and I am incredibly disappointed.

Despite explaining multiple times that I am looking for natural, plant-based treatments like cannabis, the only thing Dr. Finn wants to prescribe are opioids. It's like they don't care about my personal health goals or my concerns with the risks of long-term opioid use or addiction...

I'm in pain and looking for a more holistic approach, but this doctor refuses to listen. It feels like he's just pushing pills without truly understanding or caring about what's best for me as a patient. I'm tired of not being heard. He will freely dispense opioids like a Pez dispensar and will get temperamental if you insist on him giving you a more natural prescription.

If you're looking for someone who will actually listen to your preferences and take a more natural approach to pain management, I'd recommend looking elsewhere. He gets paid to prescribe opioids.|In 16 months, I only got in once.  My script had to be renewed because the staff Never answered the phone or returned calls.
The scheduling rep who set me up over six months ago just wailed about how busy she was and how horrible it is to work there.
I just wanted an appointment.
When I met Dr. Finn, he was attentive and knowledgeable.
His office is truly the worst run office I have ever seen.|I have been in pain for over a year. In May I was in the Er. I couldn't walk for 9 days. I finally got a referral to see this so called spine clinic that Dr. Finn works at. I should have know better! Had to send this place 5xs the referral.  When you call you are sent to either TEXAS(customer service who can BARELY  speak English. They don't understand you) or Colorado.  Kaiser finally had to call them. Got in finally,  Dr. FINN maybe spent 10 minutes with me. His told me no drugs or injections just go see his friend who is a chiropractor. I have 2 bulging discs, 2 herniated discs,  and a disc that has moved forward. I have serve leg pain from L5. And now this stupid place says oh we don't take medicaid, so you owe us money.  This whole place is ran dirty. Now this place has kept me in pain extra for 5 more weeks. Health care sucks ! Shame on this place and the people who let this happen! Now I gotta drive to Denver from Colorado Springs and start over, yet again. Shame Shame Shame on you all!|I wanted to take a moment to express my deep appreciation for Dr. Finn and all the amazing providers at his office. The care and professionalism they provide is truly exceptional. Specifically, I would like to extend my heartfelt thanks to Krykt, one of the nurses working with Dr. Finn. Krykt has been incredibly patient, always responding to my messages and ensuring that I receive the information I need. Her dedication to providing professional, compassionate care is truly evident, and I am grateful for the way she consistently demonstrates her concern for patients. The ease of communicating through messages on my cellphone and receiving prompt, expert responses from Krykt has been invaluable to me. As a veteran coping with numerous injuries and chronic pain, the supportive environment created by the entire team has meant so much to me. I am immensely thankful for the care and compassion provided, which has made a significant difference in my life.|I have on going back problems, and I have seen Dr. Finn for several years.  Dr. Finn impresses me as being compassionate and a good listener.   He has been a pain specialist for decades, and he is highly competent.  I also see Dr. Sonja Grifith, who is another doctor in his practice.  She is very friendly and highly competent as well.  Everyone in the office has worked there for a long time.  They all know exactly what they are doing, they can answer your questions in plain English, they do not give you the run around, and if they do not know the answer to a question, they will find out AND FOLLOW UP with the answer.   They too are friendly and helpful.  My experience with this entire medical group has been outstanding.|I was referred to this doctor through my network. Being new to the area I didn't know any better.

Kenneth was adamant that the only solution to my pain would be opioid treatment. When I asked him about a natural alternative for my pain such as a cannabis prescription he became snarky and short tempered.

My experience with this doctor is that he is rude and condescending. I left his office and am in the process of finding a competent pain management doctors.

column40:
Dr. Smolenski has been my doctor now for just over a year and a half and I want to weigh in on this review process. I couldn't imagine a more caring and helpful doctor! He has given me all the time I needed each time we have visited. He has weighed in on some of my very difficult decisions with valuable insight. He has taken the time to read my MRI and X-Ray reports as well as viewing them with me, helping me to understand my condition. He has assisted me constantly in making appropriate adjustments to my medications. I'm just very grateful that I found him.|Dr.Smolenski has treated me for the better half 5 years. I was a mess. I have a list of injuries from my younger days that haunted me and had been on crutches almost 18 years.  I don't think I slept much of that time either.  Not only do I walk I can jump rope. I can say there are days I forget I was so bad.  He stuck with me got me moving then on to an exercise program.  i cannot thank Dr. Smolenski and his staff enough for the life I now have. I honestly thought at 52 I'd never walk or drive again.  I'm 58 and can take my granddaughter fishing!  Everyone there is Awesome.|I wish I had read the one star reviews (and there are many) before choosing this practice.
This medical office is broken and patients like me are paying the price! No response to calls, never answer the phone, no pain relief no diagnosis! A lot of promises!! They clearly care  more about the money made from useless injections I had already had than anything else. Kelli is rude and couldn't care less about people. Dr. Smolenski is nice but clearly too overwhelmed to run an office or dig deep into difficult cases. I've wasted my time, my money, insurance money and for what?
LOOK ELSEWHERE!|Dr McLaughlin-Abrams is wonderful.  She is kind and friendly and very knowledgeable.  She takes time to explain things.  She keeps an eye on my prescriptions (I have a few different doctors). I always have a pleasant experience.|No one EVER answers phones here, even when they give you their "direct line." It took over 2 months to make an appt date bc they may or may not return calls. If you can't answer their call, if they happen to call you back, get ready for a game of phone tag that takes weeks to complete (if at all). I can't even get anyone to answer phone calls to pay my bill!|Dr. Mclaughlin is AMAZING!  She is very kind and caring. She takes the time to listen to her patients and goes above and beyond to give her patients the best care. She is the best pain management doctor I have ever had. She has helped me so much with my lower back and neck. Kellie her Medical Assistant is amazing as well! She is always there for her patients. Kellie has helped me so much while being a patient here. I couldn't have asked for a better team to care for me. I am so thankful that I found Dr. McLaughlin. Thank you both for everything you have done and continue to do for me.|Don't base it just on your experience with the doctor. Unfortunately the entire office does not return phone calls after prescribing something that didn't react well they provided zero support.  Also, when we were at the office we provided the insurance and have continued getting bills that did not go through insurance.  When you call the billing number and leave a voicemail, no one calls you back. I have left 5 messages in just under 3 weeks with no calls back and no reprocessing of the bill through insurance.  I have even left a message with the appointment line trying to get someone to call back and no call back. Avoid this office they don't just don't manage phone calls or patient relations well at all.|Dr McLaughlin-Abrams is extremely pleasant! She clearly explained the whole procedure to me prior to the injection. During the injection she told me what she was doing and frequently asked how I was doing.
Kellie G, the MA, was also extremely nice and genuinely concerned on how I was doing.
Great people!

column40:
Dr's and staff are AMAZING!! I've been going here for the past 2 years, and still love going here. The only negative thing i would have to say is that the office is always extremely busy ... That's just because they have a high amount of patients, because of how great they all are. If u are truly in pain, the doctors will take great care of you, and they are all very compassionate|I've been visiting this office for over a year. The staff is very friendly and the doctors only have the patients best interest at heart. They are very dedicated to making sure that the patient is receiving the best treatment possible emotionally and physically witch both play a big part in recovery|I stopped in to Mountain Medical a couple months ago.  Katie, the director of behavior health, could tell I was somewhat in crisis.  She went out of her way to help me deal with it, and I am doing a lot better now.  It became evident repeatedly that the people at Mountain Medical are more focused on serving people than they are in making a profit (although both are good).  Thank you Katie and everyone else at Mountain Medical.|I don't know what all the negative reviews are for. These were all the nicest people I have ever come across in a doctor's office, as a collective. Dr. Ellie wants to help. What more can you ask for. Very happy with my first visit and looking forward to more.|There's few doctors who know the true meaning of pain. There are few doctors I have found who will listen to you as a human without the god complex. I feel treated with compassion, warmth and guidance from my Dr. At mountain medical.
I have trusted only 3 doctors after over 11 spine surgurys that all failed. Other pain doctors rushed to implant or inject until I almost couldn't walk, one tied me down while injecting a needle into my tail bone while I had a no support between two vertebrae, he left me awake after telling me he wouldn't torture me knowing I had been through too much already. He lied to my face and could not keep injecting bone where hardware was in the way. I don't trust easily.
I have obviously been around pain management doctors in the state, One of the three doctor I trust is in Europe, leaving two state side doctors whom I've trusted completely in a 16 year journey... That should speak measures about my Dr at mountain medical.
I trust my doctor at mountain medical. She's a gift to not only her patients but to the world. I beleive if I ever feel addiction I'm free to discuss without fear. I don't fear her in any situation. I trust completely.
The staff of nurses are all friendly, kind and extremely helpful. Natasha does an excellent job, often doing jobs of others.
If I could obtain a proper coded billing receipt I would have the full package.
All in all, I'd rather have a amazing doctor and nurse than worry over the billing an sometimes not professional front desk. I know how rare these Dr's are.|It's been a Wonderful, personable and healthy, caring experience...they care about their patients! Not just the medical aspect of our lives, it is an overall invigorating, educational, and learning experience. Important to them we understand all of our options...Making sure us as patients we are happy and gaining full potential for the medical standpoint and options available to a healthier lifestyle...extending a helping hand in guidance to exploring our options in what care/challenges we as patients face, and need to follow through with care on what as a patient, we need to know. We can choose personally, to further Our knowledge in how to handle our ailments and the steps to recovery. What procedures are available and recommended to have surgery...MRI... x-rays...massage and pain relief therapy as well as other services offered.  Referrals...Through recovery, I'm learning what Specialists are recommended to make my life happy and achievable...baby steps...and how to achieve a relative pain free lifestyle...minimally. Physical therapy, injections and other things are suggested to get to that point to where my body can heal through time, Patience and hard work with guidance from all the Dr.s. It has been a vast key to recovery in a general. I appreciate their honesty for my recovery plan set in play. It's important when you are a patient. That helps me make decisions to my very best knowledge in following my goals all the way to the end and in between. Thank you to the staff and Dr.s for true and honest advice to healing and going about my recovery, A plan to exceed to my best potential. They over exceedingly go out of their way to make my goals what's BEST for me. A personal touch. I most certainly recommend making this office a trusted and safe place for making yourself,  family member or friend comfortable with your health in their hands. It's important to them and yourself. Whether the care you need is simplistic or heavier health concerns. It makes me feel comfortable to know I can walk in the office and know what care I do receive, is THE BEST quality care I could request anywhere. My recovery is helping me achieve my other goals as well in life, due to the progress, I've made while being a patient. It Keeps me positive but, realistic. The recommendations of care have been Right on to what I've personally needed to be able to follow through with my progress in healing appropriately in a timely manner. The healing process is up and down... but in the end, it's the best choice for me and recommended to anyone in pain for various health conditions and concerns. They do indeed CARE about you as a person. And take care of your needs with a personable touch...as such. God bless them all. I will furthermore extend my patient status under their care until I've achieved my therapeutic goals. Baby steps, And will continue to follow through with their advice and guidance as directed. And To remain healthy and, if any more bumps along the way... I know they will continue to be there to guide my progress with any new developments. I'm flexible to the type of care recommended. I couldn't recommend a higher level of standard anywhere else I have received care.
That's what real Dr.'s do... CARE! Feeling comfortable and having an open line of communication and being honest is key to the proper care for any individual, any age or ailment...being able to actually have that, is a high above blessing!
Much gratification to the staff for making the environment a safe and comfortable work/patient place. Making appointments are easy...they work with your schedule and accommodate YOUR specific needs. Emergencies can be accommodated as well.  I feel special.... and the coffee is great as well!  A bonus! My parents n I have prayed for a great Dr. ...well now, I have several. God is good! God bless and take care... of yourself! And your families!|Horrible pain management clinic. If I could give negative stars I would. They will find any way to make you pay more, and more after intake. They are a joke if I have ever seen one. They never receive pharmacy calls or faxes.  They will put you on weekly UA tests that you will pay for. And your lab results will come up positive for random drugs because they mix all of the tests up. Complete robbery! Do not waste your time here. They are not about your health! They are about there money!|I have NEVER SEEN NOR BEEN TREATED SO UNPROFESSIONALLY. I was told my the office manager after I said I would call back tomorrow and deal with my issue with the Dr she said I better have her home phone number because there not open on Saturday. This was not the first time I was treated HORRIBLE. I took my us n they came in & said I had methamphetamines in my urine, I told them that wasn't possible I have never done that. They said Ihad to do a bucal swab I was fine with it because I knew it would be clean. I was still really upset the next day because that's a serious accusation so I went in n asked to see the computer and where it showed methamphetamine. Magically it didn't. So now my insurance just paid for a bucal swab I didn't need in the first place.The Dr I saw that day introduced me to CBD for pain n I could buy some from him but it had to be cash n I paid it to him not the Drs office. I don't even think it was noted in my chart. The next month I go back n this Dr doesn't even use CBD so I'm confused & apparently so are that because there's no treatment plan in place. They are one of those clinics who see there patience as dollar signs and not humans.

column40:
5 stars down to 1-2 stars... My first appointment i was pretty much called a liar... After bringing in my documents showing that i had back problems she then believed me. Since then, and after a complaint was made, she moved on to another company. The doctors that i saw after her were great and the staff was great. A year, or so, went by and when i went back in one of the doctors weren't there any longer. This was odd as that doctor, and staff, were great. After dealing with another new doctor we went over everything again and that's when i finally got some treatments. I ended up having a nerve burned so that i could live without pain, for at least awhile until the nerve grew back. This was all discussed, which was great! Unfortunately, the staff that was in the room with the doctor to do the procedure was another disappointment! I heard them cussing up a storm and were saying things that made me uncomfortable. After the procedure was completed and i got to see the people, that did the follow up with, they told me everything i needed to know and were passionate about what they did and making sure that i was ok. A year, or so has now went by and the nerve has grown back causing me pain again... So, i called to get a new appointment (2023) and was told that i needed a referral due rules being changed. I didn't understand that as i had been going there for, i believe, around 3 years now. I never had a referral any of the times i went in, not even the first time. Looking at their website i don't see the doctor there that did my procedure. They seem to change staff more than i change socks. I loved that they were helping, but i am 100% confused as to why i need a referral now, when i have been going there for years, aka an established patient, and need to be seen again to address the same issue i was dealing with. Due to all of this, i can't see myself going back, unless something changes to where walk-in patients are allowed again. This is 100% disheartening!|I do NOT recommend them. While PA Christie Troyer has been great, there is a huge disconnect between her and the admin staff. I have waited 3+ weeks EVERY time she has referred me for anything. (Edit to update that I've been waiting for several months now with no contact.)
Then I attempt to call and obtain the referrals and get either a voicemail box with no response after leaving a message, or someone saying they will call me back. Yet they never do. This has happened 3 times so far and has been a huge hindrance to getting better after a car accident. Here I am now three (6) months later, and nothing has changed for me because I have been unable to get the care I require. Stay far far away from this place!!!|Miguel is the only reason they have a one star instead of a zero. Miguel is the only that would call or say he was to forward messages. Messages were left with the medical assistant and she didn't call back either. When my husband first started going there, they seemed great. After the procedure 29 days ago, my husband has been in constant misery and pain. It is the worst headache he has ever had and said his eyes feel like they are being pushed out of his skull.  After calling several times and getting no response, even after his follow up telemedicine appointment, they said the best they could do was get him in in mid July. They would not make an appointment at that and said someone would call. My husband couldn't take it anymore and went the VA Emergency Room 70 miles away. Dr. Latch or any of the staff would not speak to the emergency room, so the emergency could treat my husband, because they didn't know the specifics of the procedure that was done 29 days ago.  Would not recommend to anyone! If you have a choice do not go there. I have watched my husband suffer for almost a month.|DONT GO HERE!!! I have a personal injury case and have been trying to schedule an apt for 3 weeks. This past Tuesday I had a consultation over the phone and at the end of that conversation I assumed we could schedule the apt for the following week because that's what I was told the week  before consultation was scheduled. After the consultation the lady over the phone says no your not aloud to schedule it yourself have your attorney call and we can set a date up. 1. How would my attorney know what dates work best around my work schedule or what I personally prefer? 2. My lawyer could t even get them to answer the phone and had to leave 3 different voicemails and still hasn't heard back. It's Thursday today and the people on the phone kept running me around saying we'll call you back we're looking into it. I then had to drive 30 mins to schedule an apt in person because I thought maybe that would work. It did not the staff in both suites where very condescending and I'm willing to work with me. I was running around the office with no idea of where to go. The guy I was speaking with over the phone all morning then told me in the office that the office I needed had been closed all day. IF YOU WOULD HAVE SAID THAT IN THE FIRST PLACE I WOULD HAVE WAITED FOR THEM TO OPEN THE NEXT DAY!! Nothing about this place made me feel secure and I will not be scheduling my back treatment here!!! No one should!! They're closed at 11am on a Thursday?? Doesn't specify online and if you call they won't tell you. Very very very inconsiderate to someone in as much pain as I.|The staff are absolutely amazing!! Krykt is wonderful she always makes sure I'm good before during and after my appointments her Dr Massey and Dr latch make my visits so comfortable and memorable, I always get nervous because I don't like needles they relax me everytime!! I would recommend EVERYONE to that clinic I wish there were more stars I can give place is truly one of a kind with patient experience!!!|Great people, very nice and knowledgeable, I was impressed and I have spent my entire life getting banged up and recovering from damage.
So far so good, I'll know in  a week or so but it was a lot easier than I expected.
Thanks to staff and surgeons.
Looking back with a clear head now, they are terrific, I definitely recommend this great clinic.|Awesome experience!! the staff is excellent from Dr latch to Susan to Heather they're just very nice very professional!! they definitely know what they're doing! the clinic isn't here to give just medications they offer better remedies along with the injections ,they've hooked me up with a stimulator machine!! the stimulator machine has helped me out tremendously!!! I've been using it for just a week and it's the best thing  that they have prescribed so far !! they are a great great place to go get work done  for your back and whatever else ails you I highly recommend them!!|They really need someone else answering the phones. Every time you call you have to leave a message and get a call back from the same person, once he calls back you can barely understand him and then he doesn't know what he is doing. I've asked to speak to someone else for a week now, and never get a call back or transfer. When I called to ask about my referral getting to them his response was "ya we got it but we just do it tomorrow not now" (this was around 3 pm so still enough time left in the day) I was told 2 weeks ago that they take my insurance, then all of a sudden today that's not the case. I would highly recommend getting a new person to run the phones.

Specialized Treatment for Spine, Joint, and Nerve Disorders

Our practice focuses on delivering personalized treatment plans for individuals dealing with spine, joint, and nerve disorders, as well as injuries resulting from auto accidents, motorcycle collisions, and big rig incidents. We believe that every person is unique and deserves an individualized approach to care—at our center, you matter!

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management in Colorado Springs

At Open Arms Pain Clinic, we provide whole body pain management care designed to help patients regain control of their lives. Our dedicated team of pain management physicians offers personalized treatment plans that include medication management and various injection therapies to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a holistic approach to your care.

Our Services Include:

column40:
If i could give negative stars i would  but if you are thinking of going here for pain  run away. This clinic use to be great but now it's the worst clinic I have ever been too they don't care about their patients. They never answer the phone they don't call people back the staff there are so incompetent. There is no care here it says open arms but  it's definitely is not  if you have issues with them  call the Colorado medical board  and Medicaid there is no reason to treat people the way they do especially when your in pain
Let's get them shut down|I'm very happy with the clinic where I go for trigger point injections and medication to treat degenerative disc disease in my neck. Shannon is a caring and competent provider. I'm seen within 5 to 10 minutes of arrival.|Edit: gone from two star to a one star review now. And here's why.:
I don't really appreciate how the "owner"has responded to everybody else's negative review, but not mine. This is what happens when pain clinic start to make a lot of money and they realize that they don't really have to give a crap about their patients quality of care anymore. 

I was about to give 5 stars before my appointment this week.
I've been going here for about 5 months, and it was great at first. But when I walked in there yesterday, something was amiss.
First, the guy who usually checks me in wasn't there. The lady filling in had her back to me checking out another patient, and I wasn't even greeted when I came to the counter. She turns around and is just like "are you checking in"?  No "hello, how are you today?"
The warmth and friendliness that was once here is now gone.
So, anyway....I've always liked my provider....until today when I asked for a med increase (a whole 2.5 mg mind you ) she basically insinuated that all I was doing was popping pills for pain and not taking any Epsom baths or doing exercise or anything else that might help me.

She didn't ask me what else I do for my pain, she just assumed and instead, she begins talking about how she has "patients who won't do anything but pop pills and won't even take a Tylenol if they don't have their opioids, blah blah blah..." as if I'm one of those people. 
This was very much unappreciated, and frankly, it pissed me off, because I've never ever abused my opioids, which I have been off and on for the past 30 years, and I do many other things for my pain besides just pop pills.
Instead of asking me "Hey, China Cat, what else are you doing for your pain besides popping the pills and using the film I give you?" But no. Instead, I just got a lecture on how her patients "misbehave" with their pain meds.
In the waiting room, there is an absolute overabundance of aromatherapy in the air.
This is something new I've never smelled before, and I hate it. I am fragrance sensitive and it gives me headaches.
Fragrances and aromatherapy don't belong in doctor's offices!
The country music blasting in there is not cool. I don't wanna hear country music when I go to my doctor, not everybody likes country music.
The new "Late Policy Change" is kind of  nasty, too. "ZERO TOLERANCE"? Like, don't punish your entire patient base because SOME PEOPLE can't be on time.

I read this while I was waiting to be checked out. Lady had her back turned to me again. I stood there forever. I walked into the room where they do the UAs and asked the two workers back there if I needed to test, said I'd been standing at checkout and wasn't being helped. They acted all pissy, no smiles on their faces, rude...like I was BOTHERING THEM.
I don't like the general attitude here anymore. I'll be seeking out a new provider now.|Worst practice ever  horrible staff very rude they don't care about their patients   I emailed the manager and looks to me he's no good either  I mean shows what kind of practice your running if people keep complaining  about Melissa rockhold and how rude and uneducated she is in the field and he still keeps her  there might be something going on there.  if you experienced  bad service here contact Medicaid and the medical board|I love Vicki and Shannon.! They are very intelligent and knowledgeable about what they do! I would highly recommend them to anyone that is in need of the best  care!! The other Doctors are great as well! The staff here has always been so professional and has always answered any questions that i may have. When you walk into Open Arms the waiting room it is very clean and comfortable  and i love the way it is decorated!! Very welcoming! Highly Recommend!!|Open Arms Pain Clinic is by far the best Pain Clinic I have worked with. Shannon is so knowledgeable and thorough. Without Shannon I wouldn't be starting to finally get my life back. Thank you so much for what you do! I highly recommend this Clinic and especially Shannon!|They are horrible and inhospitable, they charge you for things they know your insurance doesn't pay for. I A male supposed to be office manager walk into the room with me and the doctor knocked and just walked in. My pants could have been down no respect at all. I will be reporting them to Medicaid.

Spoke with Medicaid, if ANYONE has a complaint with this pain management please contact Medicaid. Let's get a better practice in place|We do not understand why Jennifer was let go.  She was compassionate and kind with referrals to excellent physicians for diagnostics and outside care.  She was great with injections.  If you did not help yourself, she was quick to let you know in a stern but encouraging way.

Her greatest quality was allowing you to cut back on medications when you were doing well, because you knew you could increase them if and when you flared up.  That little bit of control, in a situation where patients have no control over pain, gives the patient mental freedom to feel progress without the fear that it might backfire if and when they might need an increase.  This positivity can actually reduce pain both physically and psychologically both by the joy of hitting a milestone and reducing medications on your own as well as by removing the tension and the stress of wondering "what if I have a flare on this lower dose."  Without this relationship, if you are struggling at home and desperately need additional help, and waiting for an appointment knowing that if you ask for help you could be "let go as a patient" or not taken seriously, then not only are you dealing with horrible pain, but the tension and stress make it even worse.

Jennifer had a talent for reading patients.  She could tell from swelling, knots, heat, upcoming operations, and high BP when someone was in trouble.

I respect in this drug-seeking world that physicians have to be responsible, both for themselves and their patients, but some situations are clear-cut.  Some patients are honest and put everything on the table.  When a patient who is full of pride has to beg for a temporary small increase for a week or two, just for a few hours of relief so that they can get moving and start to improve, and yet they are denied, it is embarrassing and humiliating and they start to feel less than human.  I miss that trust that I had with Jennifer.  She just seemed to know that not everything is textbook. and by giving me that respect of having some flexibility in reducing my own meds or (rarely) asking for a small increase to get through a bad flare, I was able to stay even-keeled while I am going through the process of having operations.

column40:
I wrote this review because these drs caused more trauma and harm to my years of medical trauma. I wanted to warn others about my experience with this particular practice. Unfortunately, after seeking help from numerous doctors and exploring various avenues for pain management, this was my final attempt at finding relief.

Dr. Jan Gillespie-Wagner and Darci Rossitier were Dismissive and Uncaring. During my appointment, the doctors I encountered displayed a hostile and aggressive demeanor. They failed to consider the impact of my chronic pain on my daily life. Furthermore, they seemed quick to dismiss my concerns and stereotype me as a patient, rather than listening to my specific experiences.

They were apathetic towards atypical pain. The most concerning aspect was their lack of understanding or apparent disregard for my non-typical pain condition. Instead of offering help, they were dismissive and pushed me away as a patient.

A Broken System: It's disheartening to realize how many people suffer at the hands of these medical professionals who are supposed to help. This experience is just one more example of how the current system fails patients with non-standard conditions. DO NOT GO HERE. They will stereotype you from the start and then don't listen to your situation.|I would like to thank Dr. GILLESPIE AND HER TEAM. You are all an exceptional example of what it means to care for those of us who are suffering daily. Thank you for making my life more full.Your kindness, understanding and empathy are greatly appreciated!|My physician referred me to this doctor and sent in a referral. When I called to make an appointment the receptionist was very rude and asked if my doctor had followed the procedure for referral. Like I should magically know this. Then she didn't explain the process or how long it would take to make an appointment. I called back over a week later and they said that my case might be reviewed next week. I asked how long it would take and she said 2-3 weeks. The second receptionist was somewhat friendlier but getting information on their process was like pulling teeth. I don't know that I'll go there is I finally get accepted as it's just intolerable to deal with type of treatment particularly when you are in chronic daily pain. I suggest that their receptionist tell folks what the process is upfront in a kind and respectful way. It would save folks a lot of time. Including them.|Dr. Gillespie, and her staff have been the answer to all of my pain management needs!

Dr. Gillespie is a no nonsense, punctual, thorough doctor!
Dr. Gillespie and her staff are highly qualified, and make sure all your NEEDS are met, with dignity, and discipline! You must be ready to be proactive in your pain management journey, by doing medical procedures, along with medicine!

Thank you, Dr. Gillespie, and staff you have all been absolutely perfect for me, and my NEEDS!|It  took me nearly 30 years and three states to find a pain doctor who could help me.
Dr. Jan Gillespie in Greeley, CO.  is worth the years it took to find her.

Chronic pain is so unique to every individual and requires a wide array of alternative pain treatment options. Dr. Gillespie listens, cares, and understands before determining the appropriate and customized course of treatment for each patient.  She and her AMAZING professionably trained staff can accomodate every imaginable pain condition and provide positive results for her patients.|Dr Gillespie provides excellent care. She's very helpful in finding the solutions to your problems.|I have never been treated with more disdain than experienced from this office. I respect the current climate with pain mgmt clinics, but ridiculous how I was berated for "following up" on a referral. 32 days and still no response. Disgusted.|Dr Gillespie is one of the best in the business. Finds a true source of pain  and trys to use other alternatives measures as well as medications to come up with a treatment plan to relieve patients pain so as to have a better quality of every day life.

column40:
As a person who has not always had positive experiences with doctors. I love the way this doctor practices medicine. He's not trying to always shovel pills down your throat. He tries to find the cause of the problem before prescribing medicine. I asked him a question once, he responded, "I don't know." This means you can trust him. I don't like the needles,  but if that's the fastest way for the medication to work, I'm all in. I can deal with a little needle  pain. If you can't just stare at him, he's handsome, maybe this can be a distraction.|I cannot recommend Dr. Masri enough! After a car accident left me in debilitating pain, I was at my worst--physically and emotionally. Dr. Masri not only helped alleviate my pain but also gave me hope and a path toward recovery. His professionalism, compassion, and expertise were evident from the very first visit. He took the time to thoroughly understand my condition, answered all my questions, and created a treatment plan tailored to my needs.

Thanks to Dr. Masri's care, I am feeling like myself again and I'm beyond grateful for the difference he has made in my life. He is truly an exceptional doctor who genuinely cares about his patients. If you're in need of a doctor who will go above and beyond for you, look no further than Dr. Masri!|I want to express my appreciation to Dr. Masri and his team with the professionalism, courtesy, timely manner, and detail orientation they provided me for the procedure on my lower lumbar. Dr. Masri and his team remained fully engaged during the waiting period, and provided solutions when and where there were obstacles with insurance. I feel great again and will continue to use Dr. Masri and his team, and of course recommend to all !|Dr Masri is highly professional and did my trial spinal cord stimulator procedure perfectly. He is kind and extremely detail oriented in his approach. I would highly recommend Dr Masri.|This is my unofficial account, I can't seem to log into my serious email. My name is Ashton Winey, Dr.Masri put in my Spinal Cord Stimulator Trial. His office was very professional, and considerate. They helped me out with planning, it is nice that he does leave some things up to you, like letting me choose my imaging center and blood lab. Usually I have doctors just choose whoever they want, having that independence was a little scary at first but ended up being really nice. He talked me through how the surgery would go, how it would feel taken out. I do appreciate that he was very real with me the whole time|Dr. Masri is awesome. He's helped me so much with my back pain after my car accident. He has shown an extensive knowledge in his field and always makes sure my questions are answered. He's my go to for pain.|I was having 24/7 pain in my back and I was referred to Dr. Masri for a RFA (Radio Frequency Ablation.) I had the ablation done a little over a month ago and I am 90% better!  Thank you, Dr. Masri!|Dr Masri helped aid so much pain I had felt for the past four years. He helped solve what was causing most of my pain that many doctors couldn't put together for years. Highly recommend.

I just want to thank all of you is spine one who have taken the time to take me on as a patient and be so flexible in times of where I had to change my appointments several times but I do want to tell you, that you have launched a new part of me that has been missing for a long time. Thank you for being so patient and kind to me especially to Dr Khan who just a week ago this Friday gave me a new Outlook on my life as I left in less than 30 minutes after my first injection and was able to drive home paying free and I actually enjoyed the day and I'm enjoying the days ahead and I can't wait to finish my procedures and continue with my life and I thank you so much from the bottom of my heart. May all of you be blessed in your own special way.

Best

Kent Bath|My wife and I both had appointments at Spine One, and we were both treated with the utmost respect. The entire office was a pleasure to work with from the front desk to the X-ray tech. We couldn't be any happier with this provider.|I had a horrible experience and most certainly won't be back. First, my appointment was at 7:30am but everyone was in a staff meeting until 8am, so I waited for a half hour to be seen. I had to explain my injury to three different people: the check-in nurse, the student, then the doctor. All separately. Across those three people, I was asked straight away if I'd like to be prescribed pain medicine four times (two times by the doctor). Then at checkout, they said I owed around $800. I told the checkout person I had already hit my annual out of pocket with my insurance and I shouldn't owe anything. She insisted I did, I verified with my insurance and offered to show her my policy but she declined to look. Then she said that she "refreshed" her page and verified I was correct. As if I'd hit my out of pocket max somehow seconds earlier (it was actually months earlier). I was already sketched out when the insurance coordinator called a few weeks later, the day before the surgery and said that I would owe around $800 for the surgery! I went through the whole out of pocket max thing again, and asked her to call my insurance to verify. She said "we don't do that". I told her to cancel the surgery and all future appointments!|Now that I've experienced nearly every department of SpineOne I feel confident in my rating. The nurses, reception and especially Macey have all been incredible. Great experience when getting my radiographs as well as my MRI (which was my very first one and everyone was so kind about it!). And most recently an awesome experience with the surgical department, so many charismatic nurses and dr Khan was fantastic as well, a man of few words but very professional and clearly knows what he's doing. Coming here for my back pain was the best decision I've ever maid.|I have a bulging disc, and I was able to be seen immediately (two separate times) and given treatment options that were incredibly fast, which was much appreciated given the amount of pain I was in at the time. I most appreciate my PT who lays out options but leaves the decision to me. I felt she was my thought partner through the process and didn't have any judgement about my plan.|Excellent customer service from receptionist to Stephanie's assessment of my neck issues.  Appreciated that she was easy to talk to and she answered my questions.  Never felt rushed.  Follow up in four weeks after I start p.t.  for neck and shoulder.|My emails were adulterated in obfuscation of the fact of this office's transmitting a forged set of medical records for a fabricated patient from behind Microsoft encryption, before I caught them following me across state lines--see below. column3:
At Peak Orthopedics, we're proud to have Dr. Matt Lucas as a key member of our medical team since 2020.

Specialized Expertise in Pain Management

As a board-certified Interventional Pain and Sports Medicine specialist, Dr. Lucas brings exceptional knowledge in minimally invasive and non-operative treatment strategies for painful conditions affecting both the spine and extremities. We offer comprehensive pain management solutions including:

  • Advanced orthobiologic treatments including cellular therapies (stem cells)

  • Precision-guided injections using musculoskeletal ultrasound

  • Customized treatment plans for sports injuries

  • Innovative spine pain management techniques

Dr. Lucas maintains an active role in advancing his field as Chairman of the Ethics Committee for the Interventional Orthobiologics Foundation (IOF) and serves as a clinical instructor for advanced musculoskeletal ultrasound. His research and clinical interests have led to several published manuscripts on orthobiologics for orthopedic conditions. For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website or call us at 720-598-0805. We're conveniently located at 7800 E Orchard Rd #350, Greenwood Village, CO 80111.
column11: Dr. Lucas is an Interventional Pain and Sports Medicine specialist. He joined Peak Orthopedics in 2020. Dr. Lucas is actively involved in the Interventional OrthobiologicsFoundation (IOF) where he serves as both a clinical instructor for advanced musculoskeletal ultrasound and functions as the Chairman of the IOF Ethics Committee. Our integrated medical team works relentlessly to provide safe and effective care through research-proven techniques and comprehensive physical therapy. Located in Highlands Ranch, Colorado, we proudly serve patients from Lone Tree, Castle Pines, Parker, Centennial, Englewood, and surrounding areas.

Our Specialized Services

We specialize in treating a wide range of musculoskeletal disorders including:

  • Back pain and sciatica

  • Neck pain and headaches

  • Shoulder pain

  • Joint rehabilitation

  • Pregnancy-related discomfort

  • Sports injuries

Our holistic approach focuses on the whole body by strengthening weak muscles, stretching tight muscles, and relieving pressure on joints, discs, and nerves. Through a combination of chiropractic care, spinal decompression, and other non-invasive therapies, we develop individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

We accept all major insurance plans and welcome patients of all ages, from children to seniors. column40:
When I first met Dr Reish, I immediately knew he was going to be a wonderful health care provider. He is professional, caring and compassionate. He spent 90 minutes with me on my first visit. He asked me a lot of questions about my health history and my habits. He spends quality time with me at every visit. For this, I am very grateful to him.
Dr. Reish has done more for me to provide relief for my migraine headaches than any other Doctor I have ever seen. He will not stop until he finds the right medication for you. He has been a blessing for me, and he will be for you as well.  It makes a huge difference to have someone who really cares and listens.
Gloria O. Arvada, CO|I had my first visit with Dr. Reish and it was unlike any experience I've had with a doctor to date. To be able to sit and talk with someone about my migraine experiences for an hour was so incredibly helpful. I felt like he was really interested in helping me more than anything else. I didn't feel rushed out the door after five minutes like so many other doctors. I felt like he really wanted to help me understand what was going on and how to work through it. What an incredible luxury to have so much time with a doctor fully focused on you. I know it costs him a lot to be able to spend so much time with patients; even if he were to cut his session time in half, I'd still feel way more taken care of than my experience with most other doctors.|I've been seeing Dr Reish for over two years for issues that he always helps me with, including migraine and hand and wrist pain.  He never seems to be rushed when seeing his patients and gives all the time needed to each person.  Besides the comfortable atmosphere and care, Dr. Reish is a most excellent and brilliant Physician and Osteopath.  He sees each patient holistically and so treats them with a wide variety of modalities.  I wholeheartedly recommend him for all medical and pain issues.|Dr. Reish is an extraordinarily caring and empathetic doctor. He listens to all of my concerns, and spends time in each session adjusting the places where I'm not in alignment. He has set me up with services that help my pain (icold therapy, compression stockings, SI belt) that I would never have thought would be covered by Medicaid. I've consistently been impressed with the level of time and care in our sessions. I've recommended him to my friends, and would recommend his practice to anyone with chronic pain issues.|Dr. Reish is the 9th headache specialist/neurologist I have seen.  My migraine headaches, about 4x/year started in college sixty years ago.  They persisted until April, 2013, when a far worse, debilitating headache began.  These start each day about 8:00 a.m. and last all day.  I have been prescribed more than 90 different medications and numerous devices and "treatments."  None of these have been effective except opiates, which are successful for only a short time - until my system builds intolerance to them.
In April, 2023 I was referred to Dr. Reish by a physiatrist at UCHealth because he determined he couldn't help.  Dr. Reish really "hit the ground running," with a thorough initial exam, followed by Botox injections.  The injections were not very effective so Dr. Reish prescribed a medication usually used to treat opiate dependence, Buprenorphine.  For the first time in 10+ years my headache pain is blocked and one dose usually lasts all day.
Dr. Reish is.a very dedicated, thorough, caring physician who listens and evaluates carefully, then prescribes the treatment he feels is best.  If that doesn't solve the problem, he doesn't hesitate to try another treatment.  I highly recommend Dr. Reish.|I have been a patient of Dr Reish for several years now and I am very grateful for the care I have received. He is always very accommodating when I am in need of immediate care to manage my migraines. He has also developed a very solid medical plan that manages my pain and migraines day to day. He has truly changed my life allowing me to function in a way I was unable to for many years.|Dr. Reish is a caring physician who listens to you and actually cares.  He has a great bedside manner and has no agenda other than improving your health.  He took a thorough medical history and truly listened to me, unlike some other docs who don't spend enough time with you and just give you medicine.  I totally trust him and would recommend him to others.|I have been going to Dr. Reish for over five months and could not be happier with my experience. He is truly one of the best physicians I have gone to see. He listens and treats every symptom and takes the time to look into current research to help find the best possible answer. I have never had a physician who works so hard and diligently, always explaining what he is doing and why he is doing it. He presents information and treatments in an unbiased way, letting me ultimately decide what I want to do for my body. His staff and office provides a warm and inviting atmosphere, I have never felt uncomfortable. I could not recommend Dr. Reish more highly as a doctor.

column2: Panorama Orthopedics & Spine Center: Dr Michael N. Horner
column3:
At Panorama Orthopedics & Spine Center, Dr. Michael N. Horner, D.O. brings exceptional expertise as a board-certified pain management physician and physiatrist. With his Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine from the Philadelphia College of Osteopathic Medicine, Dr. Horner received specialized training in musculoskeletal manipulation, giving him a unique approach to treating pain conditions. We're proud of his comprehensive education, which includes completing his residency in physical medicine and rehabilitation at Michigan State University, along with fellowships in both electrodiagnostic medicine and interventional pain management. Dr. Horner's dedication extends beyond clinical practice—he has served as a volunteer team physician for the Michigan State University wrestling team and contributed to Special Olympics.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a range of specialized treatments including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Musculoskeletal manipulation

  • Electrodiagnostic testing

  • Personalized rehabilitation plans

  • Conservative and advanced pain management solutions

Located at 660 Golden Ridge Rd #250, Golden, CO 80401, our facility provides a comfortable environment for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. We invite you to learn more about Dr. Horner's approach or call us at +1 303-233-1223 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Doctor Michael Horner, D.O., is a board-certified pain management physician and physiatrist. Dr. Horner earned his doctor of osteopathic medicine from the Philadelphia College of Osteopathic Medicine, where he received extra training in manipulating the musculoskeletal system. He completed his residency in physical medicine and rehabilitation at Michigan State University, where he also completed fellowships in electrodiagnostic medicine and interventional pain management. He served as a volunteer team physician for the Michigan State University wrestling team and has volunteered for Special Olympics.

column3:
A Non-Medical Approach to Chronic Pain Relief

At Pain Cure Clinic, we offer a revolutionary alternative approach to healing chronic back pain and other pain conditions based on the groundbreaking work of Dr. John Sarno and his Tension Myositis Syndrome (TMS) diagnosis. Our clinic specializes in addressing the psychological factors that contribute to physical pain, helping clients overcome conditions that traditional medical treatments often fail to resolve. We provide comprehensive support through our proven program that has helped countless individuals reclaim their lives from debilitating pain without surgery or medication.

Our services include:

  • Personalized TMS coaching sessions

  • Educational workshops on mind-body connection

  • Practical techniques for pain reduction

  • Ongoing support for lasting recovery

Located in the heart of Boulder at 1023 Walnut St, our clinic offers a welcoming environment where we empower clients with the knowledge and tools needed to overcome chronic pain. We're proud to build upon Dr. Sarno's pioneering work while adding our own practical improvements to help clients achieve faster, more sustainable results. Learn more about our approach to pain relief by visiting our official website or call us at +1 707-815-1834 to schedule a consultation.
column11: The Pain Cure Clinic is a non-medical alternative for healing back pain based on the work of Dr. John Sarno and his Tension Myositis Syndrome diagnosis.

column38: Mark McFarland|ALLAN SPIELMAN|jan whitney|Emily Beaver|Mariah Denley|Lisa L|CODY FAHRNEY|Levi Koonlong
column40:
John & Laura helped me overcome back and hip pain when "traditional" methods didn't work.  They addressed the root causes and provided RELEIF and PEACE OF MIND!  I didn't need surgery or a lifetime of pills after all!  So many aspects of my life have improved thanks to the Pain Cure Clinic.

This course was definately money well spent.  Just what I save on co-pays alone makes it worth it.  :)|Many years ago my wife turned around when I started to read the books of John Sarno and my lower back pain which at the time was really a problem went away.

Now that other chronic pain has returned  I am getting a lot of help from the pain cure clinic
They take the work of Dr John Sarno and improve on it in many practical ways.|BEWARE  of joining this.  You WON'T  get your money back if you still have pain in 3 months as they advertise.  They aren't qualified to be making TMS  pain decisions for people.  Just two people who read all of Sarno books and say they were cured of pain.  I reported that I still had same headaches after 105 days and business owner denied me a refund because  "I went past the 90 days".  Shyster business.  But do read John Sarno's books.  That's all you need to do.|I used to be a dancer in college but I had suffered a horrible injury in one of my classes that has caused me chronic back for the past four years. I've seen so many specialists and massage therapists and nothing I've tried has had lasting results. I thought I would never be able to dance again and my back pain has subsequently lead to crippling anxiety and depression as a result of being in too much pain to dance or even work out. When I found Pain Cure Clinic last December, I was skeptical at first, but willing to try anything to get my life back! But with the help of John and Laura's amazing coaching techniques, I am now pain free. It is such a relief to be able to dance again without pain, and I am so grateful to John and Laura for their help. I would highly recommend Pain Cure Clinic to anyone searching for relief, whether you're suffering from back pain, fibromyalgia, or any other chronic pain disorder.|For years I've suffered with anxiety and multiple chronic pain, I've seen multiple doctors, an all seemed to be showing me no results on the caused and how to prevent this from happening daily. I asked my doctor's about Dr.Sarnos books and they told me that it was not what I needed to these problems. Howevebi had felt like it was worth the try these books lead me to an online search where I found Pain Cure Clinic, I decided to try out this practice and see if there way of handling things was going to work for me and I'm so happy that I did not listen and went and check them out for myself the people who worked here were great and very helpful. I was there for two days learned so much more then I had in years dealing with these problems and I can honestly say the Pain Cure Clinic is the BEST thing that's ever happened to me. I can now say I'm in apsolutely No Pain and that had a positive effect on my anxiety and the things I was shown here help me stay this way months later HURRAY is all I can think. I highly recommend this office.|I did not receive value from this program.  I was impatient and eager to get started on my TMS, and this seemed like a great way to accelerate my progress, but instead it set me back.  I wish I had waited.  There are so many great resources out there - books, videos, blogs, FB support groups, etc, and I am doing well because of those.   This program is very expensive, and I did not feel that they provided anything unique or any information that is not available elsewhere.  They are very clear that they are not trained medical or mental health professionals, and I don't feel that what they do justifies such a premium price.  I highly recommend you spend a $100 - $200 on books, watch relevant videos, etc and give yourself some time to do the work before you consider investing such a large dollar amount (plus travel) for this program.   You can improve on your own!  April 12, 2019 - I feel I need to update my review based on the clinic's response.  What business replies to a negative review by trying to discredit a client who paid them a LOT of money?  It's upsetting to me and my family that they would be willing to say things that are completely not true or were taken way out of context.  It's also extremely unprofessional to bring up personal information about a client in such a public forum.  I know the actions I am taking, the dedication I have to working through my TMS, and the improvement I have made so far - they don't.  Even though this program was not a fit for me, I am so happy to be on this path to recovery!|Suffered with Fibromyalgia for years with no help from medical doctors. But the two days spent at the Pain Cure Clinic really helped with pain levels.|I actually worked with Dr. Sarno before he retired. And I can tell you that these folks are as good or maybe even better. Thanks so much to Laura and John.

column38: Tyler Wilson|Tatsu Rikugame|Joy C (Kaya)|Jenny H|Natalie Powers|Christopher Harper|Debbie Hedgers|Drew Rothfuss
column40:
I have only had good experiences with Interventional Pain Management. The staff here is very courteous and Dr. Malinky has been very helpful. They answer any questions I ask them and help put my mind at ease about procedures that need to be done. Good care is hard to find but luckily I found it here. Make sure you are early for your appointments because they are usually booked a few weeks in advance. Late is late, no excuse can change that, and no they cannot just "squeeze you in" because that would be disrespectful to all of the other patients they need to see. Being polite and common courtesy usually goes a long way anywhere you go. Anyways, I like Dr. Malinky, he seems to genuinely care. Same with the nurses and staff, I really appreciate everything you've done for me so far!|I went to this man after my spinal fusion surgery when I was in my early 20's and he was extremely harsh and rude right from the start and I was a very good patient, compliant, helpful, didn't take meds too early, and he never became any nicer. He was just a nightmare and straight up disrespectful. I am putting this out here to warn everyone thinking of going to him. I think his stars already speak for themselves.

Thank you.|I had a procedure and the IV site became infected. They said they it would be tight, but they could fit me in 2 hours later. I told the girl if it's a problem I could go to Urgent Care. She said, no come on in. Well my husband got in an accident just before this phone call and luckily the car worked, he just had to put the donut on. Well we tried our best to get there on time, but we didn't realize just how bad the traffic was going to be, with very icy roads, driving on a donut. I ended up being 12 minutes late. The girl at the front desk told me the doctor just took his last patient and since I was late, he would not see me. I explained about the accident, driving on the icy roads on a donut, and the traffic being slower than usual because of the roads and she said oh well, you'll have to go to the ER. I explained to her that I told the girl on the phone that if it was so much of a tight squeeze to get me in, I had no problem going to Urgent care. She just shrugged her shoulders. Things happen that are out of our control sometimes and would it hurt to be kind, considerate, and sympathetic? I missed work to get there as soon as I could. Their nurse caused this infection in my vein when she gave me the IV. I suffered enough, they could have been courteous and saw me. Especially, the day before Christmas eve when getting into a doctor was near impossible and the infection getting worse as each moment passed. It would have only taken a couple minutes to see me.|Dr. Malinky is incredibly caring and a brilliant doctor.  He has a very calm demeanor, which I suppose other reviewers have mistaken as uncaring, but they are wrong.  He is very passionate about helping people, and is a great diagnostician. I drive an hour and a half from home to see him even though there are many pain docs much closer. He is the best of the best!|I saw Dr Malinky for maybe 3 minutes.  I paid a $60 copay for 3 minutes.  I was then told to get an MRI.  That was it.  Now to get the MRI I have to pay another $600.  Dr. Malinky didn't discuss anything else with me and didn't offer anything else like a steroid treatment or an anti-inflammatory treatment, nothing.  What a waist of $60.  I have already had x-rays.  I don't need an MRI.  I need to get the inflammation down.  I just got off the phone with them and they say it is standard practice to order an MRI.  Well, if that it true why don't they just order one before you have to pay the $60 just get introduced to the doctor.  What a rip off!  For anyone looking to go there make sure they order the MRI up front so you aren't out the first $60 and then have to pay it again when the doctor sees the results.  This is why medical cost are out of site!  Doctors that just don't care about the cost to people.|I have been going to Dr. Laub for the past 6 months. He has been really helpful explaining to me my condition and what options I have in long term treatment. I work in construction and have a demanding job that my condition has made really difficult living with. If it wasn't for Dr. Laub's caring attitude and can do personality, life would be so much more challenging and unbearable. I will be seeing him for many more years and would highly recommend him to friends and family.|Absolutely the best and most caring pain specialist I have dealt with. He was not only concerned with different ways to control my level of pain but also with my overall level of health. If you are looking for a pill pushing Dr who does not care about your health Dr laub is not the one for you.|I go to Dr malinky and have been really disappointed in his treatment. He didn't even give me any kind of a physical examination.  He just doesn't act like he has any kind of passion for what he does. I am definitely switching doctors and goin to someone who actually acts like they care about their patient.

column40: They were very reluctant to give my daughter a second appointment because she canceled the prior due to being in the hospital (something they could easily confirm because it is within the UCHealth system). They told her she didn't seem to be committed to getting better. Terrible thing to say to a 20-year-old girl who is in constant pain and doesn't enjoy it at all, and whose only other options are two hours away. We are required to go here by our primary so we will have to give it another shot. Will report back if the experience improves|I will start by stating this is an extremely rare review, however if I can help just one person decide then it is worth it.  I started with this clinic around 4 years ago and it was the best place you could go.  Dr. Siegel was an extremely compassionate and caring physician who never left out the human factor.  Then Amy was an absolutely amazing person who truly cared about your well being.  Combine all that with Stace Toye, a physicians assistant and it was as good as it got.  A while back it was taken over by UC Health, and both Amy and Dr. Siegel had left.  The entire nursing staff was new, and the entire place had a corporate feel.  Not a good feeling when it comes to your well being.  They brought in Dr. Gebauer and it immediately went from Caring and Compassionate to Corporate and Corrupt.  As soon as a Pain Physician loses the Compassion you should start looking elsewhere, even if it is a 2 hour drive each way as your well being is too important.  The new case manager who replaced Amy is Maria, and it feels as though she is just a Minion of Dr. Gebauer who can't stand her job.  This place has gone from top notch, to run like hell who not only treats you poorly, but also practices Unsafe and Unhealthy methods, and an ethics committee should revoke her right to practice any medicine.  I hate having to do this, but the unsafe practice needs to be known.|Can't get appointments correct.|

column40:
Working with Dr. Ross's office has been the worst experience I have ever had dealing with any medical provider.  They lied to me when they said they were in network with my insurance I asked them multiple times to confirm I was in network when making the appointment and the day of the appointment. I spent 3 months to get the bill reduced then they disregarded the the arrangement and turned it over to collections. Now they just scream at me over the phone when I call. I did not get the procedure I went in for and if I would have I guess I would be on the hook for thousands. I have spent untold hours dealing with this one Dr. appointment and received absolutely no benefit from them.  They got my deductible when I checked in. In my opinion they should reimburse it to me much less coming after me for more.|My daughter & I have been seeing DR Ross for 2 years now. We have never had an issues with him or his staff. His staff is top notch especially all the nurses! He explains everything in detail. Not sure why some had bad experiences but we need to keep in mind that he is a human being not GOD or a miracle worker. He does what he is skilled to do nothing more. If the procedure works then great, if it doesn't well it just doesn't. That should not get him a bad rating! Moving locations yes there was a huge delay in getting back to me, but that was because of the new building and new phone line. Just keep calling until you do reach them not the end of the world. My 1st RF worked wonders for 9 months the 2nd did nothing. The nerves do grow back & can even become worst. This is out of his control. My daughter is a competitive gymnast who has Bastrop Syndrome. He praises her for doing it for so many years and dealing with that pain. He unlike most doctors said to her " I cannot tell you to give up the sport you love however that will the best way to fully be pain free" he genuinely told her I will do everything in my power to make you have a successful season and he has! She says he is her angel! She tumbles now with no issues. Is it a permanent fix? absolutely not. But then again, there is no procedure that is 100% Shantusha is absolutely great, she is always on point with getting our authorizations & quickly schedules us. My daughter went in for her procedure & one week later was all smiles at practice, not a single back pain. She wanted me to tell him that her 1st meet went beautifully & that she came in 3rd place all around. She's ready to rock & roll. We won't see another Doctor here in the springs that's for sure|I had a procedure with Dr. Ross on April 19, 2021. This procedure was to see if the injection would work. The procedure however did not work it made the pain worse and now I have numbness in my feet. reached out to the doctors office About the numbness in my feet and the excruciating pain that im having in my L-5 and S-1i was transferred to his nurse she left him a message because he was on his way to a meeting that was on April 21, 2021 still hadn't received a call from the doctor so I  reached  back out to their office to learn the doctor left the nurse  a email to tell me to go to the ER. This doctor is definitely not connected to his patients I have switched doctors through my TRICARE. . I explain to the nurse that the doctors job is to check on his patients not send you an email and because of that result I am switching doctors and I have done so please stay away from this doctors office because he doesn't care about the patients he only cares about the money. I feel as though since the other procedure that he wouldn't be doing since the first procedure didn't work he's not gonna be getting as much money so why connect with the patient I'm just a number not a patient this now explains why he's at a 2.3  in reviews|Doctor relationship with myself was apparently not that of a good one. I recieved a letter to separate services from me due to receiving pain meds from another doctor which was my primary care for other issues and at said time Scott wasn't giving me appointments but every 3 months. I would never recommend him to anyone.
He wanted to keep giving me infections when doctors in Texas had said i needed surgery and had been through all injections needed to prove this.
This is his 2nd time doing this, they are very unprofessional and wait time with scheduled appointment is always longer. So they get a 1 from me. If you want to give your money away do so but i warned you. This is my personal experience Ann's i approve this message|I had a procedure on Monday morning and was told to call that afternoon with a pain rating! I tried to call at 4:10, got no answer! This is now Thursday afternoon and I have called several of the extensions to try to talk to someone, approximately 14 calls, and not one return call! I was under the  impression there was to be another procedure in a week! I don't have any way to confirm this! All I know to try now is to drive 40 miles to the office and walk into the waiting room to try to talk to someone! This is not acceptable care in my view, and I can not recommend this clinic for anyone!!|Dr. Ross is a very meticulous, caring, professional of the highest caliber. He's taken care of my issues with attention to detail, and has been able to cut my need for medication by 50% through radio frequency ablation. I recommend him without reservation.
RSH|My mom Lyn White called in and Madeline went above and beyond to help my mom. She made calls to Ft. Carson and her insurance provider to help her get verified for care. She hasn't seen the dr. yet, but the office personnel has been absolutely amazing.|Very heartless cold group . Don't care about you personally you are just another body to control . Read the contract they will not exsplain anything . And they will cover theyre you know what if they say something and dont want to admit it . Im not a disgruntled ex patient I would admit my wrong doing but they dont care . The video in one of theyre rooms has people praiseing them i believe those were they're own employees because what i went threw was horrifying not Grand wonderful careing Drs . I will never go to another pain clinic if thats what they all.do . I'm in exstreem pain they handed me a paper saying they will help me foe 30 days then they will close my case well that is a lie she didnt even have the heart to give me enough pain meds til i found a new dr 30 days . Heartless now what do i do but lay here in pain and suffer til i find a new Dr . Thank you to the o e that has a heart that took my blood pressure
