column38: Christina P|Chris French|J snow|Joshua McKim|Becca Ginns|Donald Hutchinson|Jen|Yvette Anderson
column40:
The staff is wonderful. Dr Knopp is very knowledgeable and patient. I never feel rushed and he answers all my questions. I have felt very comfortable and confident with any injections he has given me. And Erica Falger has been such a tremendous help to me. She remembers her patients, is very personable and relatable. She cares about the patient as a whole, physically and emotionally. Pain can be very exhausting and depressing so it's nice to know someone is looking out for you. She also takes her time and makes sure she reviews everything with you and answer any questions. I have trusted her judgement/recommendations with different things she has tried to help my pain, podcasts and books she has recommended. You can tell she truly cares about her patients. The only downside is the wait time for appointments. It can sometimes take a couple of months but I don't mind the wait knowing the expertise and care they provide. Thankful I was referred to their office :)|I have been a patient since 2010. The place used to be good, but it has gone way downhill. Before COVID, it took two to three months to get a procedure such as an injection or to see a doctor. Patients are left to suffer in the meantime. After COVID, things really started to go into decline. Now, I understand that the doctor may have had financial difficulties because of COVID, but haven't we all? That shouldn't be taken out on his patients. Several good providers have left since due to internal BS. The staff is way overburdened. If you leave a request for a prescription refill, it can be up to four days before the staff addresses it. This just doesn't work if you have a medication that the pharmacy doesn't typically keep in stock, and there is no pharmacy in town that will order it ahead of time without a prescription. The office won't let you request your medication more that a week ahead of time. But, if they don't handle your request until days later and it's a Friday, then the pharmacy can't get your medication in until Tuesday, and you're screwed. The unfortunate thing is that this happens often, and the staff just doesn't care. I do understand that the problem lies somewhere in management, because the problems here persist no matter how much the staff changes over. But, it's even less of the patients' fault then it is that of the staff. There is no reason to be curt with the patient when he (or she) has a legitimate complaint. Once upon a time this place could say they were elite. But, no matter how elite the staff may be, there are so many deficiencies that it doesn't show.|The unprofessionalism and neglect from this establishment is disgusting. To be met with hostility when asking a simple question is uncalled for. Also, prescribing an epileptic patient a seizure increasing opioid is nothing but criminal. Someone will be held accountable.|Zero stars if possible. Severe pain for months and have been waiting on my spinal epidural for 4 months while in pain to have them cancel the appointment last week last minute and tell me they can't reschedule me until April. How is this ok? Im in pain.|The trigger point injection I was given made my pain worse so I had to go to an orthopedic surgeon who was very confused about the injection's location. Insurance didn't cover much of the visit or injection and I just received an additional bill six months later months after paying my balance.|Beware of this office.  It is not a part of Hartford Healthcare but a private office that is just affiliated with HHC.  It has all the signage and logos but it is really a private practice run as such.  I have been a patient through multiple back surgeries and found out this week that I need to find other pain management care because of a medical staff storage in this office.  They gave me pretty much a month to do this, which will be challenging because of the lack of pain management care in this area.  HHC has no pain management care in the Hartford area, which is a total surprise to me.  I got in touch with HHC and they also have no solution to this situation.  This is a disappointment to me because I was receiving quality care from this office.  I think Hartford Healthcare need to reassess its pain management care for its patient.|I am changing my review I wrote 5 years ago from a 5 to a 1, but I would give a zero if I could.

Here are a few of the many issues I had that caused me to leave:
-The clinical decision making stopped making sense. They would not refill a NON-controlled medication I had been on for over 5 years without me being seeing me in the office when I had just been seen 3 months prior.
-I had an adverse reaction to a medication, they denied that such a reaction was possible despite the medication having a black box warning. Also, I learned years later that the medication should not have been given to someone with my health condition, which I was not made aware of.
-Against my consent, one provider gave me an injection in a location I said not to touch. When I asked him to stop, he did not stop. I left the office sobbing and was truly traumatized to return to the office.
-Patient identification issues: During that same office visit, I had 3 different people coming into the room thinking I was a different patient.
-Provider consistently coming into work late, making me late to work even though I was first appointment. Happened at least 3 times.
-When I brought concerns to the office manager Sue Staples, I was berated. When I mentioned I did not appreciate the way she was speaking with me, she asked me where I work, which was threatening and inappropriate.
-The office is poorly managed, poor staff morale. High staff turnover. They can't keep providers there happy. I know it is a hard speciality, but I have been a patient at other pain clinics that are able to safely and appropriately deliver care without these issues.

I switched to a different clinic and am much happier. Would not recommend|The Pain Treatment Center was  a vital part of my plan of care.  The office can not handke the number of patients. Most times, you are waiting a considerable amount of time for your provider when scheduled for regular appointments . The management staff is absolutely rude and unprofessional and will support unprofessional conduct for their subordinates, including the aprn's. There is no need for me to bash this office. My review is from experience and is an accurate representation of care received but not by all the physicians or staff.  The problem is that there are not many pain treatment offices/doctors that give epidural injection under light anesthesia as a part of their care I've found locally. Dr. Kost really needs to do more and be present to witness the level of unprofessional being displayed by management and "some"aprn's.  This has been my personal experience
and is my review of my experience.  Doctors leave the practice very frequently, and I now see why most don't stay.  They have had some good doctors in the past.

At Pain & Spine Specialists of Connecticut (PSSC), we were founded with a clear vision: to relieve pain and improve overall quality of life through an individualized approach to patient care. Over the years, we have established ourselves as Connecticut's leading pain management group, offering advanced professional care at five convenient locations throughout the state. Our Farmington pain management center is located at 11 South Rd, Suite 250, where our dedicated team takes pride in the time we invest with each patient to discuss personalized treatment options.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of specialized treatments to address various pain conditions:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Customized medication management

  • Innovative spine care solutions

  • Multidisciplinary treatment approaches

Our goal is to help patients become functional with as little pain as possible. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take a holistic approach to pain management. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit our website or call us at +1 860-674-0222.

At Pain & Spine Specialists of Connecticut (PSSC), we were founded with a clear vision: to relieve pain and improve overall quality of life through an individualized approach to patient care. Over the years, we have established ourselves as the leading pain management group in Connecticut, providing advanced professional care at five convenient locations. Since 2015, our affiliation with National Spine & Pain Centers has enhanced our ability to serve patients by providing access to superior practice management resources and cutting-edge research opportunities.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Contact us at +1 203-373-7330 to discover how we can help improve your quality of life through expert pain management care.

column38: GGALLIN1776|Penny Lima|Deb Clark|Harriet McClay|Donna Fontano|Frank R|Jenn Hilton|marge dowling
column40:
Extremely disappointed, had to leave practice because of the new employee who unfortunately replaced Betsy.

Both my physical therapy (several months now) & medication regimen (same as the past 20 years) were set to continue to improve my quality of life since my spinal injury amongst others have completely ruined said quality, health & mobility.

I was planning on getting a brace as soon as the practice begins fitting them as I am in dire need of assisted posture correction, thus further preventing spikes in pain.

All of this progress gets thrown out the window as soon as at one appointment (whilst everyone else was busy/on vacation), I get stuck with the new guy who decides he wants to upend the set treatment plan & go with what "he sees fit".

After this appointment, I had an extremely foreboding feeling (also realizing I knew him from elsewhere with a similar condescending/unpleasant experience) & asked to NOT be scheduled to see him under any circumstances, insisted on only seeing my usual two doctors, David & Eli.

Appointment comes up on 7/31 (I had to book weeks past my normal once a month as only the new employee was available otherwise), I come in & against my wishes I am informed that I will instead be seeing exactly whom I do NOT want to see due to scheduling conflict.

I should have just rescheduled to see David/Eli upon hearing this but didn't think of it as all that was now on my mind is overwhelming dread, felt like vomiting as knowing I'd have to deal with this guy was that bad!

After an extremely uncomfortable extended wait (45-60mins), a nurse I've never met calls me back....nasty attitude & look as soon as I sit down, not what I'm used to coming here. Usually I'm greeted by the same couple friendly nurses.

Oh not this one, exact opposite of the norm. Stares at me as if I just insulted her when giving my height/weight, didn't even bother with vitals. Great, someone with an axe to grind & chip on the shoulder.

At this point I decided it would be a good idea to get my phone out & start recording as soon as the following interaction occured.....

She starts to grill me about why I'm there if I don't need a refill,  said "It was filled yesterday, I'm just here for my required monthly follow-up".

"Wait, wait, how'd you get this script?"
"As usual I tell the pharmacy I need a refill & they filled it, what's the problem?"

"NO, NO, NO...YOU WAIT RIGHT HERE!"

In strolls the new employee(the indian guy whose name isn't listed nor do I care to speak it), same condescending aura fills the room.

"You know you commited a felony, right?"
"What are you talking about?"
He's goes on driveling nonsense repeating "You're lucky I don't have you arrested for this."

Why all this nonsense? Riteaid had been sending refill requests to both my pc & their office, filling whichever came first. I explained  back in February this happens, no issue then. Only one was filled per month, nothing wrong there, never did "anything illicit" nor did I try filling both.

Regardless, he who shall not be named continued with the felon nonsense until I spoke up & said "IF I DID ANYTHING ILLEGAL, CALL THE POLICE RIGHT NOW & HAVE ME ARRESTED!"

Nurse Ratchet says "You have your script, go find a new dr before it needs to be refilled next month."
It took MONTHS to even get the form 43/book an appointment here, clearly she either hasn't gone through this process (or more likely simply doesn't care) as you can't just magically go to a new provider in 28 days.

I again insist they call the police for the alleged crime. Once the door opened, both h.w.s.n.b.n & nursee change their tune to "What are you talking about? Leave."
I repeat the words on my way out, they play dumb.

Then the realization hits, new guy wanted me to look irrational for a reason to discharge. Knowing I'd raise a stink after being accused/told I'd be arrested, did just that then followed me out saying "What are you talking about?"

Thankfully I have proof of the incident.|First off I would like to begin by saying. Dr Levy is heaven sent. He took the time to listen to my problems and discuss a treatment plan. I have been feeling and doing better since my treatments with Dr. Levy. Is part of a amazing team. From the first time you walk in the staff is outstanding. I've also had the pleasure of being seen by Betsy King! Her compassion gose beyond expectations. I have never had a doctor and staff take the time to relate to a patient. I will recommend this team to anyone suffering from chronic pain.|I want to thank Dr. Betsy for her kind and caring nature. She is always willing to listen and help in any way. She is a terrific Doctor.  I highly recommend her.|Even though the practice is new the team at the office had come from another company, and have been together forever. I was a patient of theirs as well, at the other office. I love these people! The receptionist Fatma is great. Dania is one one of the Medical assistant and my favorite. She has a great personality and is professional in her job.  The APRN'S and PA's, Beth, Betsy and Alison really have care about the patients and are great at what they do. I am so happy Dr. Levi went back into private practice, and brought his team with him!! I have been a patient of his for about 12 years. He is an amazing Dr. I would highly recommend him and his team for pain management!! They really know their doing!!|Excellent staff.  Very caring and they do their jobs in a very professional but compassionate manner.  Betsy King, APRN is an excellent provider and professional.  Everyone that I have dealt with in the Waterbury and Danbury offices are excellent.  Dr. Levi is wonderful and I would recommend him highly.|Dr Levi is a rare MD! He is not out to write a prescription for your pain, he wants to get to the root of the problem or find natural alternatives to manage first and if that does not work then he will move forward with meds or procedures. One of the biggest problems I see in medicine is MD's just want to write the prescription, he does not do that which I think is admirable and ethical. Great bedside manor and super knowledgeable! You won't be disappointed!
As for office staff, they were great as well, very friendly, had no issues with appointments or payment.|De Levi is fantastic . He and his staff are great . Dr Levi tries to get to the root is the issue . Not just write a script and leave . He sits and gets to know you, takes his time no rushing . .. I been going for 5 years , highly recommend this office!|I have been cared for by Dr. Levi and staff for many years.  I have always felt they collectively truly care about every patient.  it is evident in the way they interact with me and every patient there.  I highly recommend this practice for pain management!

column40:
What a wonderful team. Ms. Mary is compassionate, knowledgeable and dedicated to patients. The whole team at Total Pain Treatment are wonderful people. They chose health care and accurately as they all do care.
Highly recommend coming here.|I can't say enough great things about Total Pain , Dr. Mary and her wonderful staff! I think i am on the road to managing my pain well. They truly want to help you and I appreciate that so much. I look forward to seeing everyone monthly. Thanks so much, Dr Mary!|Mary Colburn APRN and her team are kind, compassionate and professional. They are exceptionally organized which makes the entire experience stress less.
Mary Colburn APRN is the paragon of providing holistic care. Her assessment is inclusive of your pain experience and the impact on your personhood. I cannot express enough how grateful I am to be her patient.|The reviews are accurate. From the moment I walked in I didn't feel uncomfortable or anxious. The front desk staff and the dr's and dr assistants are all honestly amazing. Being a pain patient you don't find many dr's that have empathy or compassion. This place is all of that. I was treated with respect and not made to feel bad at all. If you need a new pain mgt I suggest giving this place a try.|The moment you walk in the front staff is amazing! The MAs are so wonderful and the drs there take their time to understand you and your pain. The wait time isn't long at all and everything is very professional. I would highly recommend anyone to go here.|I've been seeing Dr Colburn for about a year now, and I can't say enough good things about both her and all of the staff at her office. They are in all seriousness the sweetest and most genuinely caring support staff I've ever encountered. They follow up on calls and emails promptly, call to remind you of your appointments, and are just generally pleasant to interact with.

I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes to be seen. I have never had an issue with my medications. I literally drive 45 minutes from where I live and still spend LESS time overall than at my previous pain clinic because I spent so much time waiting and trying to reach someone to straighten out problems with medications, often suffering medical withdrawal due to errors on the part of the clinic staff and doctors.

As for Dr Colburn: she's fantastic. She's no nonsense, and expects you to follow the clinics rules- and as long as you do, she will make sure you have what you need to live your life. She's clear, direct, organized and honest. She doesn't overbook patients, she knows your medical circumstances because she doesn't pawn you off on RN's, and is organized and just on top of things.

Overall I'm just really impressed with this office, and plan to stay until I no longer need pain management. They're so kind, so organized, so professional. And they have a clinic cat named Whiskers who I just....I love him.|So this is my husband's second visit here I said I would do an update and here it is The place is very clean , as soon as you walk in your greeted with beautiful smiles from the staff everyone is so welcoming and very friendly they are genuinely kind and very attentive to the patients. Mary is very informative on different things to help with all aspects of pain and treatment which I absolutely love, she is very friendly and respectful and works with her patients not against them. Melanie fixed so many issues we had with the pharmacy and went above and beyond and made sure to take her time so my husband didn't have to get frustrated and worry all weekend she made every step stress free and left us with our minds at ease that was definitely something new and appreciated. The entire staff is just so different then what we have ever seen from a pain management treatment center and I'm so grateful for this establishment and the kind of genuine love they have for their jobs|I have been struggling to find proper pain management for many, many years and I have finally found an entire practice of professional care givers who go above and beyond to help their patients achieve a far better quality life in a well rounded way of total care, meeting needs and being heard. They are up front, no judgement and more than happy to provide the much needed help communities everywhere are seriously lacking. This practice is setting the standard of care bar way above the rest and making a huge difference in the lives they gladly touch daily. Thank you to every single staff member who makes me feel heard and truly cared for. Many blessings to Mary and her staff xoxo

column38: Catherine Smith|Jessica Palozie|Michele DAndria|Annalyees Hill|Sway Skits|Deziray McWilliams|Cristin Cucurello|Shane Sleep
column40:
I've been a patient for almost 6 months and every experience with the staff has been pleasant, and most importantly with Toccara, my APRN. I can walk, stand, sit, and lay for longer periods of time and sometimes with no pain at all. She understood my pain and is helping it, unlike this other clinic in West Haven (no names) that treated me like a drug addict in my intake interview, though I was never on pain meds before in my life. I can now prolong my surgery as I desperately needed to. I'm grateful.|I am a health care provider and have been one for 2 decades. Unfortunately, I have DJD in my lower back, worsened from a fall. I was on gabapentin and flexeril, that's it, and I needed a provider to fill my scripts. I Like the NPs, they respected my request as I didn't want/nor can I take any opioids chronically. The "owner", a masoginistic jerk, "Ben", was dictating how often I needed to come back. They make you follow up at frequent intervals, and since my regimen is "stable", I graduated to a 2
Month follow up. There was an issue with my script because the refill allowance was "0.87 refillsz". I thought it was an error and the APRN approved a 2 month supply. I called "Ben" asking if my rx could be changed, he said "no you have to be seen since it's a controlled." I said, "OK BEN! Check the quantity that was approved because 2 months was APPROVED!" He refused to let me speak to the provider, moreover, you can't message them directly in the portal. This guys is such an ass hat-very misinformed about what "controlled meds" are. Flexeril is not controlled, in CT, gabapentin is NOT controlled. He is arguing because it's prescription, "it's controlled". Prescription means it is dispensed by a provider and dosage and monitoring is managed by the provider. To date, gabapentin is not assigned a schedule (check the CT DPH Consumer report from September 2020, ITS NOT CONTROLLED!! BEN!" Moreover, when you do intake, HE looks at your previous records and decides if you would be treated. He's not a MA, LPN, RN, MD, PA or APRN. I don't know where he thinks he is qualified to render care. An owner doesn't extend you licensure.He looks at your insurance to see if it's cash cow-seeing how many unnecessary visits he can squeeze. Also look at the state attorney lawsuit from 2022. He was named in a fraudulent insurance scheme to overbilled patients' insurance for UNNECESSARY visits-the state mandated he pay $1 million dollars back for fraudulent billing.He holds "your prescriptions hostage" until you make another appointment. The chewing tobacco  habit is disgusting too, likely an OSHA violation. There are other pain centers out there, I will say the  NPs were helpful. Patient beware!|The male receptionist is plane out rude and disrespectful. The provider Sandra Charles don't listen to the patient. She gives stuff that affects someone's mental health. I honestly believe she's racist. I will be making a report to the state of Connecticut. I refuse to return to that practice. Trust me on this if I didn't have to press a star I wouldn't have. If you deal with chronic pain and have mental health issues stay far away from this pain center.|Each time I call, receptionist are rude and don't even answer with a greeting. Yall gotta remember you are the pint point person for patients, the company, etc. that goes for everyone who walks in that place too. Each time I speak to either the girl or the boy, they both throw me off and I haven't even gotten in to book an appointment. Smh I hope to see different energy in person. Yall hiring just anyone fr no value or compassion when talking to patients. And yall represent all those who suffer from chronic pain?? Clearly if we getting referred to this business, we have that bit of joy and excitement. You guys are just killing all energy and hopes that we're gonna actually support and REAL help from these physicians.|I've been coming here for about a year and I only have positive feedback. Because of them I can live a pretty normal life, I can spend time with my wife, kids, family, and not be in pain like I used to be. You hear people complain about certain people and in reality when any medical facility that deals with RX Pain meds they have to be strict as well as follow government guidelines and regulations. They care and they want to make sure that they help as many people as possible.|This place should be reported to the state. The man who runs the place is extremely rude and difficult to deal with. I waited 2 months to get an appointment there and as soon as they saw my file they said they couldn't help me. They had my records prior to my appointment.  They could have saved me a hour long ride,the pain of getting there and I'm turned away. I asked to at least talk to the doctor. The doctor,a woman,sta rted off being polite but then saw my file and told me she couldn't do anything for me. Total waste of time and a whole day of pain,someone took a day out of work to take me...the place also was dirty ,had dirty looking people in the waiting room. Everyone was complaining about the wait. It was a terrible experience and I left in tears,literally, running down my face when I left. I've had chronic pain from multiple surgeries on my back and they act like Im not crippled...I am disabled now and they did Nothing to help me.|By far, THE WORST pain management facility. Benjamin is a rude jetk and wouldn't even schedule an appointment for me to speak to a doctor.|Sooo. I called to get help. Whoever answered, answered like i was bothering them. I was referred to this place from my primary care physician because she understood that the "pain" medications I'm on are having severe side effects and that I need to be on proper pain medication. The moment I told this person one of the medications I was on, because it doesn't work for my pain issue and I'm weaning off of it, INSTANTANEOUSLY they said, "we don't prescribe narcotics!". I never asked them about narcotics so don't assume! I consider that very rude since this person was NOT a doctor. Now unfortunately, like way too many of us, we have to jump through hoops just to attempt to getting help. These doctors don't care if people don't get help with chronic pain management and get prescribed proper pain medication and that the un-aliving rate will just keep going up. What is the the point of a pain management place if after all other routes have been tried that an opioid will finally be put on board? This is why there are pain contracts. You mess up you're done. Simple as that. These doctors take a Hippocratic oath to DO NO HARM. Without being open to all choices you are doing a disservice to the patient and causing harm mentally and emotionally. I can only hope one day they take a long look at themselves and reflect and understand that statistically a small percent of people that they turn away without even being listening to have most likely been forced to the streets, in jail or u-alived themselves. Very sad indeed. We all know that if they were chronic pain patients they would be saying the same as us all and crying for help.

At Integrative Pain and Psych Care, we provide comprehensive medical services focused on treating both chronic pain and psychological conditions with a holistic approach. Located in Woodbridge, CT, our clinic is led by Dr. Pervis, who brings extensive expertise in pain management and mental health care. We take pride in offering personalized treatment plans that address the complex relationship between physical pain and psychological wellbeing.

Our Comprehensive Services Include:

  • Chronic pain management and treatment

  • Psychological and psychiatric care

  • Virtual appointments for convenient access

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Collaborative care coordination with other specialists

We understand that living with chronic pain can significantly impact quality of life, which is why we take time to listen to each patient's concerns and develop individualized approaches to care. Our integrated model means we don't just treat symptoms—we address the whole person. Visit our official website or call us at +1 203-693-1164 to schedule an appointment at our Bradley Road location in Woodbridge. Our goal is to help improve your quality of life through compassionate, evidence-based care.

column40:
My experience has been great for past 3 years. Dr. Pervis consistently delivers the best care and treatment available! I always recommend his services!|Great visit with Dr. Pervis today... He is so professional and he takes time to listen to me about my disability and chronic pain I deal with on a daily basis. I been dealing with this chronic pain since I was a child and under his management as my doctor, life as been so much better under his care.. I have not been to the hospital 'ER' since I been his patient.. I was going to the E.R almost everyday because of the pain I go through on a daily basis.. My neurologist, psychiatrist, P.C.P and Dr. Pervis are all on the same page and I couldn't ask for a better doctor then him.. I thank him and his staff for being there to help me get through this.. Thank you from the bottom of my heart Dr.Pervis and I couldn't ask for a better pain doctor then him..|Dr. Pervis is a nice guy. He's soft spoken & very understanding. Definitely a good role model for young men.|Dr. Pervis is great--professional, compassionate and is knowledgeable.
The scheduling system is a little crazy took a couple of calls to get it right but at least someone gets back to you pretty promptly if there is an error.
Integrated Pain for my MM card is also a great value! They don't take you over the coals, which shows they're interested in helping people get resources not price gauge! Thank you!|Very understanding and helps with the understanding of what you're diagnosed with to accommodate your need of care. Listens to your concerns and very knowledgeable. He's a Doctor that's concerned about your health.. Dr.Pervis really helped me with major concerns with my plan of care and treatments. For that I'm grateful..|Dr. Pervis is the kind of doctor everyone hopes to have for their healthcare needs. He has quickly become one of my favorite physicians, and I've been so impressed with his care that I referred my son to him as well. Dr. Pervis has been just as amazing with him, providing the same level of attention and compassion.

In today's world, it's rare to find a doctor who truly listens and cares, but Dr. Pervis does exactly that. He takes the time to understand your concerns, works diligently to identify the root cause of any issues, and ensures they are treated properly. He is not only incredibly knowledgeable but also kind and thoughtful. My only complaint is that I wish there were more doctors like him!

His staff is equally incredible--friendly, professional, and attentive. It's the complete package! This office has created an environment of genuine care and dedication, making it a shining example of how healthcare should be. If we had more people like Dr. Pervis and his team, the world would be a much better place.

I can't say enough about this pain management office. They set the standard for excellence in care.

Unlike many others, Dr. Pervis has never been dismissive or made me feel unheard. Instead, he goes above and beyond to make sure his patients get the care they need.

Thank you, Dr. Pervis, and your amazing team, for your dedication and compassion--you are a rare gem, and your efforts are deeply appreciated.

Update: Dr. Pervis just resolved another issue I've been dealing with for over four months! He went above and beyond to do what other doctors were too lazy to address. His commitment to patient care is unmatched, and I genuinely don't know what I would do without him as my doctor.

Dr. Pervis and his team, thank you once again for everything you do. Your hard work, kindness, and professionalism don't go unnoticed, and I'm so grateful for you!|My experience was very formative and very well taken as far as the best process for my care continue to encourage. I highly recommend Dr. Pervis and his staff to anyone who is experiencing severe pain. He does his very best to improve your quality of life, which I am very grateful for.|I have been with Dr. Pervis for little over a year now. He continues to help me with managing my pain in an aspect that other doctors won't and without his help I don't know how I would survive my pain. He keeps up on all my medical records and he always remembers my medical conditions and what treatments I have had or am going to have. He is extremely knowledgeable about pain and pain medications and always has my best interest in mind. He is empathetic, compassionate, and encouraging. My frequent visits with him keep me motivated to keep seeking out any all treatment options and to still have hope. He treats me like a human rather than a condition. Most physicians treat me as a weak person for not being able to tolerate my pain, Dr. Pervis does not! I am unbelievably grateful for his expertise and willingness to care for people like me.

At Connecticut Spine & Pain Medicine, we specialize in providing comprehensive

Non-Surgical Pain Management Solutions

for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Dr. Bhavesh R. Patel brings extensive expertise in both non-surgical spinecare and orthopedic care, offering innovative treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. We provide a wide range of advanced interventional procedures including:

Located at 1579 Straits Turnpike in Middlebury, CT, we're committed to providing compassionate, effective pain management solutions. Visit Connecticut Spine & Pain Medicine or call us at +1 203-598-7246 to schedule your consultation today.

column3:
At the Center of Excellence in Pain & Regenerative Medicine, we bring over 20 years of specialized experience to patients seeking effective pain relief and improved quality of life. Led by Dr. Roshni Patel, our practice combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care to address a wide range of conditions.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

We offer advanced solutions in both Interventional Pain Management and Regenerative Medicine, including:

  • Platelet-rich plasma therapy

  • Bone marrow stem cell therapy

  • Specialized interventional procedures

  • Holistic pain management approaches

Our treatments are specifically designed to help patients overcome chronic pain, recover from sports injuries, and regain functionality without relying solely on medication or invasive surgeries. As a premier pain management center in Connecticut, we're committed to providing personalized care plans that address the root causes of discomfort.

Expert Credentials

Dr. Patel completed her Anesthesiologist Pain Management fellowship at the prestigious NYU School Of Medicine (Ranked #3 in 2018), where she trained under leaders in interventional pain and orthopedics at the world's top orthopedic hospital (HSS). Her exceptional care has earned recognition as one of the best pain management and regenerative medicine specialists on Vitals, HealthGrades, WebMD, and other platforms.

Contact us today at +1 860-773-4332 to schedule your consultation at our Farmington location: 55 South Rd, Suite 120, Farmington, CT 06032.

column40:
If ever there was physician who truly loved her patients, it would be Dr. Patel.  I'm one of many who go to her for chronic, nagging headaches.  She ALWAYS sits down with my husband and I to discuss my treatment and to make sure that my quality of life is comfortable.  The entire staff is extremely friendly and I find the environment in her office to be welcoming.  To be cheerful.  I've been going to her for years and have recommended Dr. Patel to others who suffer chronic pain.  They too have raved about her.  I'm enjoying watching her practice grow, as her dedication and commitment amazes me.|Dr. Patel is one of the kindest and most astute doctors I have ever seen. She has been so incredibly helpful to my healing by addressing issues I have struggled with for many many years. She is able to offer innovative solutions and treatments, and spends considerable time thinking through diagnoses and options. My pain and fatigue have been considerably reduced and I have been able to greatly reduce the amount of medication I was taking. My quality of life is so much better for having become her patient.|I have been a patient of Dr. Patels for around 20 years or so. I began seeing the doctor when her office was in Newington, where she helped greatly with my back issues. (Spondylosis, stenosis, herniated discs, etc.) She left practice to raise her family, and, in that period, I saw 4 other docs, none of whom helped much at all.  About 5 years or so ago, I was looking for a new M.D. and I saw online that Dr. Patel had returned to practice. I immediately made an appointment and have been much better ever since!! I can't thank her enough for all she has done. A couple of years ago my wife also went to see her. She had 3 back surgeries in the past but was still in pain. Dr. Patel has helped her as well, especially in minimizing that pain and maintaining a reasonably active life. The doctor is kind and caring, takes time to listen, and has a really good sense of humor. If you are having any issues with pain, you MUST see Dr Patel.|I completely 10,000% trust Dr Patel! She is caring, kind, thoughtful & a physician that actually listens to you. I will explain my amazing experience. I had a TFCC tear in my right wrist, which is my dominant wrist/hand. This tear was misdiagnosed by another doctor as a wrist sprain after x-rays did not show a fracture. He told me to get a brace from CVS & wear it for 12+ weeks. After 12 weeks it did not improve, in fact it felt worse than before. I tried this for several weeks after without any improvement. Time passed, nothing changed, no improvement in wrist pain. I had an MRI, scheduled an app with a hand wrist "specialist". He recommended cortisone, cortisone & more cortisone. He suggested if that doesn't work, surgery is my only option. I realized I need a doctor that is the right fit. Finally, I found my hero DR. PATEL, I wish I found her sooner. DR PATEL is AMAZING!! Her entire team is kind & understanding. She took the time to sit & listen to me. Everything about her is genuine & warm. I started to cry in her office. She gave me the hope that I no longer had, by the time I came to see her. We scheduled the PRP treatment date. Please, listen to her step-by-step instructions prior to the PRP treatment. What you do leading up to the treatment is just as important as the PRP treatment. Prior to the PRP treatment I had pain in my wrist from the moment I woke, it was relentless. I am at my 1-year mark after PRP, I feel great. I am so grateful for Dr Patel. I wish she could be my physician for everything. Other doctors should take notes from Dr Patel. She is spectacular!|I have been lucky to be an existing patient of Dr Patel's for years now. She is incredibly intelligent and extremely kind. She has helped me manage my pain so very well. Her office staff is all lovely. I highly recommend Dr. Patel|I cannot recommend Dr. Patel highly enough. I sought her help due to significant wrist pain after getting nowhere with an orthopaedist.

The ortho told me I was "fine" when, at age 42 and otherwise in good physical health, I suddenly could not lift a pan or twist open a door handle. The ortho prescribed physical therapy yet told me "it probably won't help." He basically told me whatever the issue is I will live with because he doesn't see anything wrong.

Dr. Patel took a different approach. She listened. She listened to me about my symptoms and reviewed the records from the orthopedic. Dr. Patel found what the ortho was not able to, diagnosed, and treated the injury with PRP therapy. I can say I am now 100% recovered thanks to Dr. Patel's medical care. That may sound like a corny line but it is the truth.

I have recommended family members and friends to Dr. Patel because she is a doctor who listens and thinks through issues instead of simply going by what the insurance/medical playbook says to do. She thinks holistically about the individual and the best way to treat the pain, not merely what insurance will pay for but what is best for the patient. Dr. Patel has my thanks and my support.|After a failed back surgery three years ago, I never thought I'd find relief for my lower back pain. Dr. Patel has changed my life! In a few short months, I have begun feeling relief after seeing her. No opioid treatment, which is exactly what I was looking for.

She was recommended to me and I have since recommended her to three others. She's the best! Thank you!|Dr. Patel is the BEST doctor I have ever met!! I am so Blessed to have met her and to have her support and care as I battle chronic pain for the past 20 years- I have worked with Dr. Patel for over a decade and each visit is new and her approach is planed and strategic. She doesn't just take you as a patient to treat your pain, she cares about your whole life and she goes above and beyond for us. I have never met a doctor that truly understands the impact that pain has on my life, she is thoughtful and she is puts so much consideration into every treatment procedure and/or recommendation she makes. She is not only the smartest and most skilled doctor that I have ever had, she is also very protective of our needs and ensures that every part of our treatment plan is implemented in a way that keeps the quality of our lives as the most important factor in our care. Her passion for the work she does is evident and I am very grateful to her...she has given me and my children a complete life that without her would not be possible.

column40:
Dr Levi is the BEST he has helped me with my back pain for 20 years and I wouldn't be where I am without him! He made my quality of life so much better then it would have been and for that I can put into words how grateful I am.|I've been a patient of Dr. Levi for almost 7 years. At times, I've had to wait a bit longer than expected, but I understood at those times, there's always been a reasonable explanation. Aside from the occasional emergencies (which is completely understandable), the other reason for the wait is due to Dr. Levi's caring and patience with his patients. I have NEVER felt rushed during my appointments. Dr. Levi has ALWAYS listened to my questions, and taken the time necessary for me to understand. He is professional, personable, and has a great sense of humor! Dr. Levi will remain my spine and pain specialist as long as I need his care and services. He is an A+ physician.|Great practice. Was referred to Dr. Levi by my spine surgeon several years ago and have been going ever since.  I see him and have gotten to know several other fantastic practitioners - Beth, Betsy, Donna - that have or do work for him. They are always attentive, professional, empathetic and responsive. Dr. Levi is very competent and up to date on latest procedures to help alleviate chronic pain issues, and all the practitioners listen and identify procedures that can help. From reception on, all staff members are really friendly and extremely efficient. You can tell that they pay very special attention to who they hire and that customer service and competence are top priorities for Dr. Levi. Having permanent and painful nerve damage due to pervasive arthritis, multiple joint surgeries, etc., they've actually given me my life back so I can function on a daily basis.|Highly personal and highly knowledgable service from the office staff to Dr. Levi himself. Although my treatment plan ended up with a surgical consult, after seeing Dr. Levi successfully for several years I felt 100% confident in his plan. His office helped to expedite the plan due to my pain. In addition the injections he gave me supplied significant pain relief which will help me to get through the next hurdles. I cannot recommend Dr. Levi and his team enough. The care is personal and of the highest quality!|Three months ago I had my initial visit with Dr. Levi who came highly recommended. I was happy with the appointment and liked Dr Levi. He sent me for further testing and after waiting a week for the testing facility to contact me to schedule the appointment I called them and they had not received the prescription for the testing. I called Dr. Levi's office, left multiple messages and after about a week, I finally heard back. The women I spoke to was very polite and very honest saying that it was buried on her desk, and she would sending it in. This was just before labor day so she told me to give it about (another) week. I appreciated her honesty and eventually was finally able to get the appointment scheduled - unfortunately they were very booked and scheduling 6 weeks out. When I finally had the testing done, I had to schedule an appointment  at Dr Levi's office to get the results (they do not give over the phone) since I was eager for the results and I wanted them sooner rather than later, I scheduled an appointment with the PA (Dr. Levi was scheduling weeks out). At my visit I thought I really liked the PA. She seemed to know her stuff and recommended a procedure that she said her and Dr. Levi consulted on. While explaining this procedure to me, I reminded her of an allergy I have (which was in my chart). She wasn't sure if I would still be able to have the recommended  procedure so she stepped out of the exam room to consult with Dr. Levi. When she came back into the exam room she explained that she could not speak to the Dr. because he was in a procedure. Rather than having me wait she said she would call me first thing the following morning to let me know if I should schedule the procedure or not. I did not hear from her the following day. Two days later I began leaving detailed messages almost daily and heard back from office staff 2 or 3 times. Each time the office staff would call and act as if I did not leave all the details as to my reason for calling on the voice message so each time they would take a message they were going to pass on. For some reason I was not able to get a call back from the PA or Dr. Levi. Finally, after a full week and a half they had me schedule a "tele-health" call (just a phone call - not even a zoom) in order to get Dr. Levi on the phone. I wanted to share my experience with him as it is his business (as a former business owner I thought it was the right thing to do - let him know about the administrative issues). The appointment was schedule on a Friday for the following Tuesday at 5:45 making (which made it 2 full weeks before I was going to be able to get any answers.  The appointment was for 5:45. At 7:00PM, as I was writing this, he finally called me. I explained all the above tp which he said "I'm sorry" (which came across as insincere) and said he didn't want to talk about that but my procedure which I was finally told I am unable to have due to this allergy. I have been living in pain for months - this unnecessarily added weeks to it when all someone had to do was call back and say "I'm sorry no procedure" so that I could have moved on to the next thing. Needless to say based on the administrative issues in this office and the fact that it is next to impossible to get an actual person on the phone I would NOT recommend Pain Partners LLC. Needless to say I am looking elsewhere for the next step.|I am so Happy to have Dr .levi and his staff back at the Danbury ,office.
Dr Levi  in my opinion , is one if not the top ! Pain specialist Dr 's I have ever had the privilege ,to met and to have as my Pain specialist. His knowlege and his expertise , is second to none. Along with his staff of nurses, and front desk secretary's make each visit assuring and relaxing,Top notch practice. 10-star|Their office abides by social distances rules, so everyone stays safe.
The care provided is always very professional & caring.  The doctors and staff, are empathetic and listen to your issues, which enables them to correctly get to the root cause of your physical problems.
They also have multiple locations, which makes appointments convenient.
I highly recommend the doctors and staff.|I love the new office arrangement. The front reception desk works are like family very great energetic profession and happy.  I am confident in my treatment plan as this has help me and continue to feel confident in my future treatment.  Thank you Dr Levi.

The Pain Management Partners practice is absolutely the best.  I have been a patient of Dr David Levi's for many years & I can honestly say that I actually look forward to my monthly appointments!
The doctors, P.A.s, & the entire staff are dedicated, warm & caring people.  It is more like being with family than with a medical staff!
In spite of the severity of my condition, they have done their best to keep me going year after year, & I am extremely  thankful.|In these challenging times I was so impressed with how often EVERYTHING was disinfected, the office immaculate. The staff so incredibly compassionate and professional. I have dealt with neck and low back pain for too many years, the only relief I have gotten was thanks to Dr Levi. He is an extremely knowledgeable and compassionate Dr.!!!  Dr Levi and Betsy are the only reason that I can live and function at work and home!!!  They have kept me "moving" for almost 10 years!!!|I have been a pt of Dr.Levi's for awhile. I trust him with my life. He listens when you talk about your concerns, helps to come up with the best plan of action. I have never left feeling as if my voice wasn't heard. The staff is always understanding and helpful. I am grateful for Dr.Levi and his team. I would recommend him to anyone.|I've been a patient of Dr Levi's for about 10 yrs and they all have helped me get through numerous spinal surgeries and other surgical procedures. I've had so many spinal injections, nerve blocks, rhizotomies & epidural injections I lost count. I did whatever was suggested to see if it helped, you won't know if you don't try. I had previously been treated for pain management at The HSS, my physiatrist was excellent and saw him for 15+ yrs, I thought he did the best injections, I've had a few given by Dr Levi and I didn't feel anything! I actually asked if he really gave the injection! Everyone goes out of their way to help in anyway they can. I highly recommend the care given by everyone involved in your care. column2: Dr. Eric D. Grahling, MD - Comprehensive Pain Management
column3:
Founded in 2007 by Dr. Eric D. Grahling, Comprehensive Pain Management of Central Connecticut (CPMCT) is dedicated to delivering the most advanced pain management therapy to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain. At our Plainville location, we utilize state-of-the-art equipment and innovative procedures to diagnose and address the underlying causes of pain—not just the symptoms.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We customize effective treatment plans for each patient's unique needs, focusing on long-term relief rather than temporary solutions. Our specialized services include:

  • Advanced diagnostic procedures

  • Non-narcotic pain management options

  • Minimally invasive interventional treatments

  • Specialized injections and nerve blocks

As both a pain management physician and anesthesiologist, Dr. Grahling brings exceptional expertise to our orthopedic and pain control clinic. We're committed to helping patients regain their quality of life through compassionate, evidence-based care. Visit ctpaindoc.com or call us at (860) 793-0500 to schedule a consultation at our 440 New Britain Ave location in Plainville, CT.

Very nice staff. From the medical assistants, APRN, and Dr Grahling. Very professional. Listened to my issues from other physicians who just threw me from doctor to doctor and didn't want to treat me. My second opinion which was a Rheumatologist referred me to pain management due to no concern for my health issues. I knew pain management was not the place I should be going due to the type of pain I have. Was referred to a Rheumatologist that will take the time to take care of my issues and not be dumped from doctor to doctor and was also referred to a Lyme specialist who will look further into my Lyme disease and why I'm having these terrible symptoms. Thank you Dr Grahling and staff. Very compassionate to my needs.|Was in a car accident and now have neck pain.  Been seeing chiropractor.  Went in due to still having pain even with chiropractic, stating I do not want pain meds or surgery.  Without laying a hand on me himself, and with no imaging at his fingertips to look at he told me I needed surgery.  He ordered X-rays.  Two days later told me to"continue with chiropractor and call if pain got worse". I said "that's why I called you in the first place! ". They then told me there was nothing they could do for me!    What a joke and a waste of a $40 co-pay!  Don't waste your time! Zero stars if I could!|Went to Dr. Eric Grahling office recently for an injection.  Last time was 2015.  This time went again and 1 day after injection,  I am sore where injection was done but normal.  But overall I feel 80% better than before. I have been dealing with chronic back pain for over 12 years.  Recently had surgery and did not help. But because of his extraordinary staff and his expertise,  he was able to lessen my pain so much. They are the best and recommends only going to them|I've been a patient of the practice for more than 5 years and every person in the office is professional & truly compassionate.  Dr. Grahling & his associates are extremely knowledgeable in identifying & treating pain.  Their explanation of procedures leaves nothing to question. I highly recommend the entire practice and can't thank, all of them, enough.  But most of all, the gratitude I have for Dr. Grahling and his knowledge of pain relieving procedures is so great.  Without him I would still have debilitating neck and low back pain.  He has given me a much better life!!! Thank you!|Dr. Eric Grahling is a wonderful doctor. Grahling is very professional and courteous.  He knows how to get to the source and what he can do to help relieve the pain. He takes the time to listen to your concerns.  We feel the whole team is one of the best we have ever dealt with in all our years of medical care.  We would recommend Dr. Grahling to anyone that has any kind of pain. column2: National Spine and Pain Centers - Kristoffer de Lara, MD
column3:
At National Spine and Pain Centers, we're proud to have Dr. Kristoffer de Lara as a valued member of our team since 2012. Born in the Philippines and raised in northern New Jersey, Dr. de Lara brings a unique perspective shaped by his immigrant parents' pursuit of the American Dream. This background has instilled in him a deep commitment to contributing to society through exceptional medical care. As a

Board-Certified Pain Management Specialist

, Dr. de Lara completed his education at Rutgers University and the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey, where he served as Chief Resident during his Anesthesiology Residency before completing his fellowship in Interventional Pain Medicine.

Our comprehensive pain management services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Joint and spine injections

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

Located at 11 South Rd Suite 250 in Farmington, CT, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Visit National Spine and Pain Centers or call us at +1 860-674-0222 to schedule your consultation with Dr. de Lara and our compassionate team today.
column11: Dr. de Lara joined National Spine & Pain Centers in 2012. He was born in the Philippines and raised in the suburbs of northern New Jersey. The child of immigrant parents, he has a deep-rooted appreciation for the American Dream and desire to contribute to society, both of which have fueled his career in medicine. He is a graduate of Rutgers University and University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey (UMDNJ), where he attended the Robert Wood Johnson Medical School and served as Chief Resident during his Anesthesiology Residency. Dr. de Lara completed his fellowship in Interventional Pain Medicine at the NJ Pain Institute of UMDNJ.
column38: Dorian Ley|Kimberly DeVault|margaret flores|Amber Winters|Chestine Johnson|dani marshall|Tirolia AU|kim romanski
column40:
Dr. De Lara is the BEST pain management doctor I have had.  He doesn't do any unnecessary procedures.  All former PM docs gave me cortisone shots no matter how many I had from previous docs.  Either thinking they would be better than other docs or just wanted easy money knowing they wouldn't work.  Not Dr. De Lara.  No more shots in my lumbar region for no reason.  PHEW!!

During all my years in pain, not one doctor addressed my neck issues but Dr. De Lara did.  He gave me what was, hands down , the best cortisone injection I have had.  Gave me a lot of numbing agent so I felt no burning or needle jabs in my disc.  He told me what to expect each and every step of the way and he was spot on in his description.  I feel awful for not remembering his assistant's name but she was awesome!!

Kelly Wilber, Dr. De Lara's PA, is AMAZING!!  She went over my cervical MRI report line by line explaining what was going on in layman's terms.  I have never had any doctor or surgeon do that for me.  During my last visit, she even looked at my knee that is swollen for some reason.  I only mentioned it due to being as active as I could be and she wanted to take a look at it.

The front office is FANTASTIC!!  They are always very nice to me even after dealing with very nasty patients.  I have seen them deal with a lot and they are always kind while they are getting yelled at.  Those women deserve some kind of medal for dealing with that day in and day out.

I have passed other employees in the halls and they have all had a smile on their face and say hi to me.

If you are looking for a PM doc and staff that will do right by you, look no further than Dr. De Lara and his team.|2023 Review: Dr. DeLara and his PA Kelly are just wonderful. They are both compassionate; never racing through our appointments or making me feel hurried or pressured. I always feel heard, supported, and understood. I truly appreciate the individualized care; especially from my recent visit with Kelly when she helped me navigate some complicated options. After a few minutes with her, I left the office more informed and ready to make my decision with confidence. I'm grateful to have their medical care and support.

2022 Review: Dr DeLara is the best pain specialist I have ever seen. I have autoimmune issues that have deteriorated my joints over the past 20 years to the point of no return. With multiple surgeries behind me, and more to come, it has been a horrible and defeating journey to say the least.

I make this review with the following in mind:
Knowledge - 5
Solution Mindset - 5
Office staff - 5
Variety of treatment options - 5
Bedside Manner - 5
Authentic connection to patients - 5|Dr Delara is fantastic! Due to several joint issues I've had to find a pain management practice. Dr. Delara is friendly, patient and listens well. Best of all he is an expert at injections! I've had to have several joint and spine injections in my life and my experience with this Dr is second to none. He is efficient and accurate all while distracting me so I'm not as nervous and focused on the procedure.|I love Dr. deLara's kind, thoughtful bedside manner- He is a true professional, and he wonderful at what he does. He has spent significant time with me, making sure I knew what was happening with my care plan, making sure I was comfortable with everything, and just truly showing how much he cares about his patients. This is extraordinarily welcomed, in a world where kindness is hard to come by, so it means more to me than I can put into words. Especially being in pain for so long, he took time out of his busy schedule to see me earlier, and his staff helped make that happen. I can't say enough good things about this office. Thank you!|This was my first visit with Dr DeLara, and it was GREAT! He was friendly, professional, attentive. He took great care to listen to my concerns, and addressed this in great detail. I felt quite at ease, and assured that I had made a good decision in picking Dr DeLara.
I have suffered with chronic pain for many years, and finally I feel a sense of hope!
The staff were pleasant, the office nice and clean. And the wait time was next to nothing!
I can not say enough good things about Dr DeLara, and my experience with him. I look forward to a long and successful relationship with him and his practice!|Dr Delara is hands down an amazing doctor he does everything he can to make you comfortable and listens to your every concern!!!! I have had injections in my lower back and RFA done both went so smooth and pain free!!! I wouldn't recommend anyone else! You will definitely leave happy!|My teen-age son and I have both been seeing Dr. Kristopher De Lara for nearly two years, and we both have been tremendously pleased with the care both the Dr. and the rest of staff have provided us with.

Between the two of us, we have had injections the cervical, thoracic and lumbar spines, with zero negative side effects. I highly recommend Dr. De Lara and his team as an excellent pain management clinic for anyone suffering from spinal pain.|My first visit with Dr. Delaura gave me hope after 4 1/2 years of agony. He suggested injections in the piriformis muscle to alleviate pain in lower extremities. He said if that didn't work then seek out a different neurosurgeon for another opinion on lumbar and if they still wouldn't do surgery then the next step was a spinal cord stimulator. He won't stop until he finds the problem, unlike other Drs.,17 total. He also didn't push more pain meds, I was very impressive with his knowledge and the fact that he was a Dr. that finally listened to me .

I have had nothing but a extremely positive experience with the entire team of staff members. Even during the pandemic the entire team bent over backwards to figure out how to keep everyone safe while attending to the patients individual needs. Dr. Ligham and all of the Physicians Assistances to the staff when you walk in to greet you are just amazing! These doctors are just shy  of a Miracle in my eyes. Pain is difficult on any level but when you have tools, procedures and medicine that actual help along with caring and dedicated doctors... that's a win win! Dr. Ligham is compassionate, caring, respected as well as highly intelligent that is experienced in the field of pain management. I trust him above and beyond any doctor!|Dr. Lingham was kind, considerate and is always working with the patient. I went with my spouse and it was my second appointment in 4 months. He listened and we talked about the specifics of how to move forward.  He didn't look at a computer once. It was more like a meeting to share information.  He is soft spoken, kind and sensitive. I am currently trying some different methods to deal with pain but I wanted to share where I am at. I may be back to him if I don't make progress. He ended by saying please come back if there is anything I can do. Just a nice guy,

Scot|I simply do not understand the negative reviews for Dr. Ligham and the staff at his clinic. The first day I went in he spent over an hour listening to me and really caring to make suggestions and take into account what I wanted. He met me with for an urgent consult to make sure that his office notes supported what my insurance needed to approve a therapy just because he believed it would help me. He has offered to manage my meds or allow my current doctor to do so and even recommended medical marijuana to improve my quality of life. He also has responded to my emails with questions very promptly. Additionally, Brittany his prior-authorization helper has gone out of her way to help me achieve a chance at the procedure I will try on Saturday. Really, be honest and open and he will listen and help you.|As a young person with chronic pain from a confluence of different causes, I've had a lot of bad experiences with doctors dismissing my pain or shunting me off to different specialists. My past experience made me incredibly nervous to see a pain specialist, but as soon as I met with Dr. Ligham for the first time I relaxed. He didn't judge me for having pain, didn't get frustrated with me when he couldn't easily parse out which of my conditions was the cause. Instead he carefully examined me, asked thoughtful questions, and took my pain seriously. Over the last two years in his care I have been treated so well by him and his staff. He has tried out multiple treatments, taken my desire for conservative management into consideration, but also pushed me to take my pain seriously when he felt I needed to do so. He is a thoughtful and intelligent doctor who I am lucky to have.|Prior to seeing Dr. Ligham, I had been on crutches for four years, and then on crutches or in a wheelchair for four months before some spinal shift happened that, overnight, left me unable to stand or walk.  I had been able to walk about a block on crutches, hold myself in standing with crutches, and walk up a couple steps, but because my mobility was already impaired, there wasn't much concern from my physicians when I lost what little I could do.

Dr. Ligham was the first doctor, among many excellent and compassionate practioners, to accurately recognize what was happening in my body.  He facilitated two urgent referrals, and helped me through the emotional process of preparing for a difficult surgery. 14 hours after surgery, I took my first steps on strong, steady legs, with feet that were relaxed and flat against the floor.  Eight days after surgery I transitioned from a walker to crutches and was able to walk up and down stairs.  It's looking like I'm going to be able to walk without assistance in a couple months.  I can't adequately describe the experience of having been moving through the world in so much pain, on unbalanced jelly legs, unable to hold myself upright, and going from that directly to being able to stand and walk with ease.

I will never be able to thank Dr. Ligham enough for his perception and care.  He will always be a hero to my friends and family and me.|Dr Ligham doesn't listen, he manages pills not pain. He makes his patients have an office visit every month with his PA who is not allowed to change meds even when they were giving me adverse reactions.  My choice was to keep taking them or be in pain. His PA wouldn't even call Dr ligham to tell him what was happening. So I realized the once a month visit was just so he could get paid for an office visit. Ligham is an apathetic man and really shouldn't be in pain management   He should just stick with being an anesthesiologist because he seems to have very little knowlege of patient care.|unfortunately due to being disabled,, I've been a patient at this office for over 15 yes. I started with Dr Levin and when he left for Baltimore I switched to Dr Robbins. I can't say enough good things about Dr Robbins and the staff at the office. Everyone Ive dealt with (too many for me to name everyone )has always been friendly and  helpful..  Dr Robbins is very thorough, always professional with a great bedside manner., ,he's always  trying new methods  lto help me get painfree.. He uses cutting edge treatments instead of meds to help me obtain better quality of life. I can't say enough good things about Doc Roc, I  highly recommend him !|This man was awful! I was there for almost 90 mins for an initial consultation. I tried to speak & he told me to stop, he'd read my records and ask questions if he had any. He trashed the head of Neurosurgery at Yale and told me he never should have done the 12 hr surgery on my thoracic & lumbar back! It left me with a 14in incision scar, 9 vertebra with pedicule screws & rods anchored into my pelvis. 18mths of PT, still ongoing. I can't step on my right foot without excruciating pain. I've lost 3/4 of an inch on my right hip & leg requiring a shoe lift. Can't stand or walk unaided. Can't stand for longer than 3 mins due to excruciating spine, leg, & foot pain, before needing to sit. Told me not to do the cervical correction still needing to be done. He'd give me the name of another surgeon that would agree with him. Told me that my chronic pain mgmt Dr of 6 yrs was incorrect for continuing my opioid pain meds, he couldn't justify it. After berating me for my lack of character for even thinking my pain might have risen to the level of someone really needing pain meds, he starts suggesting possible remedies. A 30 day inpatient drug treatment facility or a methadone regime. Then he hands me a literature package for an implanted glorified tens unit. So let me get this straight? He doesn't think further spinal correction surgery is a good idea but an $80k surgery to implant another medical device that has limited ongoing success, is? I wonder what the bonus he receives from the medical device manufacturer is? This man has a God-complex. How dare you ask him any questions. He is one of a handful of drs in the state of Connecticut still prescribing opioid medications and that power has gone to his head! The pendulum has swung so far to the other side, chronic pain patients such as myself that have a real need for opioid pain meds, are belittled and made to feel like drug addicts. And currently there is no place we can go for help! So what happens now? One thing is for sure, don't look to Dr. Ligham for support, compassion, or help. He's deaf on that subject!

column2: Connecticut Centers For Neuropathy and Chronic Pain
column3:
At Connecticut Centers For Neuropathy and Chronic Pain, we specialize in providing non-invasive treatment solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our medical clinic, located at 17 Farmington Ave in Plainville, CT, features a dedicated team of healthcare professionals committed to delivering personalized care plans that address the root causes of neuropathy and chronic pain.

Our Specialized Treatment Approach

We offer innovative therapies designed to help patients find relief without relying on pain medications, including:

  • Synexus therapy for back and hip pain

  • Specialized treatments for lumbar pain

  • Comprehensive neuropathy management

  • Personalized care plans for leg spasms

Our team works collaboratively to ensure each patient receives attentive care throughout their treatment journey. Many of our patients experience significant improvement within just a few sessions, often regaining mobility and enjoying pain-free sleep after years of suffering. If you're struggling with chronic pain or neuropathy, contact us at +1 860-351-5528 or visit our website to learn how we can help restore your quality of life.
column38: Cheryle Gardner-Billian|Jolie Brown|Maureen|Frank Critelli|Y "mrssoapsoap" Devost|Annette Mathews|Paula77 Bernardino
column40:
After 10  years of severe and persistent leg spasms, which would keep me from sleep for several days at a time...and attempts to medicate for pain by my Primary Physician...I was searching for something, ANYTHING, to get my life back without using pain meds.  I was searching on my computer and found The CT Centers fo Neuropathy and Chronic Pain.  I made the appointment and met with Michelle, the APRN.  That was the best decision I have ever made.  The Nurses who set up my treatment for the 30 treatments I went through, Pam, Caroline and Jen, were awesome.  They explained everything to me, their care was flawless and I have had no spasms and sleep every night!  These ladies were my angels and gave me back my life.  I highly recommend this treatment to anyone suffering from Neuropathy & Chronic pain.|OMG I have suffered from chronic Lumbar pain for many many years and all doctors would do was order me pain killers.... I saw the commercials for Neuropathy & Chronic Pain in Plainville CT and I was like I have got to go to this treatment center and I am so happy I did go.... The treatments have done wonders for me and I can finally stop saying I have chronic back pain because thanks to the treatments I've been given within 2-3 treatments I started feeling less pain....they are amazing and I am so glad I called for an appointment...I never thought I would get relief on my back but thanks to Ct Neuropathy & Chronic Pain I am so happy to say my pain is gone!  So if anyone suffers from chronic pain call the center I am so glad I did.|I have beeb a patient for a few months - I have suffered from chronic low back pain for over 5 years = The staff has been exceptional and caring =They work together as a TEAM !  Thank you for providing relief to me in a non-invasive treatment plan  Maureen|I have known the owner for many years I had an issue with my hip and back I was in a lot of pain. I tried the Synexus therapy And didn't notice anything at first but after doing it for I believe a couple of weeks I started to see major improvements and currently I am about 90% pain-free. The staff was excellent very attentive and it was a very pleasurable experience I highly recommend it to anyone|Answering service for this office is a joke and they never relay the messages. The office itself is even worse. Everyone dabbles in the scheduling process creating a big mess.
When I complained about getting threatened that treatment would be terminated if I no showed again. ** remember I NEVER no showed** it was answering service's issue** the nurse APRN that runs the place sat with me and told me no problem and went into the computer and supposedly "fixed it".
So here we are on Friday 12/10/21 I have a family emergency and I can't go to my appointment I call and of course no one picks up and my call is sent to the answering service, knowing that I'm wasting my time I continue to leave a message. No call backs no nothing!!!  Come Monday 12/13/21 I show up for my appointment and the door is locked and only back room light is on. I waited 5 min and nothing. At this point I'm ticked off with all the unprofessional antics that have taken place but I decided to try one more time and I show up for my next appointment on 12/15/21 and the LPN  on duty stops me and says "no no no your done you blew off your last appointment". I ask her according to who? The nerve of her to blurt out "everyone" and continues on to tell me that I was well informed that treatment was terminated. lol of course I show up knowing I am no longer a patient.... What a joke !
Never mind that she isn't the friendliest person or that she talks about inappropriate topics with patients for everyone to here.
Needless to say I'm angry that I was treated so unfairly, that my treatment was terminated without explaining what my next steps are going  to be. ECT.........|The care I got at the center was really great ..it helped alleviate the pain in my back and I was really satisfied with the results .I would definitely recommend it here.|
