column38: Kimberly Foley|James Murch Eschert|Riema Saria|Isabelle Bravo|Chris Duarte|Tony Mazz|Rootsgal|Carina Cesarano
column40:
I've been a patient of Dr Kost for 12 years. He listens to you takes the time with you and plans ahead for your care. He's very up to date with new procedures as things change in the field of medicine. Dr Cherry is his partner that compliment's the practice. They are a busy office. I do recommend the practice if you experience pain.|Dr Kost is the best. I was going to a different doctor for pain injections and I always had to wait over an hour past my appointment time to see him and then he spent about 4 minutes with me, didn't answer questions and sped along to the next patient. Dr Kost is the opposite - he is on time with appointments and takes the time to talk to you about your pain and consider different ways to deal with it. You can tell that he really cares and the treatments are very effective.|All staff and docters are great! Dr. Kost was able to diagnose me after 12 years of visiting all kind of drs with wrong diagnosis. I see Beth and dr. Mitchel as well.... i am happy i finally know what's going on with me. And Thankful for dr. Kost and his staff.|I paid out of pocket every single visit for a laser treatment and still received a bill of almost $600.00. I called several times and took them forever to review and update to Cero balance.|overall my experience has been wonderful, during the initial consult they found I'd been treated unsuccessfully for chronic migraines for over 3 years and suggested a new treatment they were trying with patients and for the first time in years I'm now migraine free for over a month. The staff is friendly and  professional and the doctors and PA's have been fantastic. I recently received a cortisone shot for sciatica and the difference has been fantastic. Unfortunately the first shot for sciatica only lasted 2 weeks, and the 2nd a month later only lasted 3 weeks.|Dr. Kost was able to diagnose my husbands problem after several visits to other doctors. He took the time to listen and explore causes of his pain. His staff followed through on phone calls and answered problems that he had in a timely fashion. I don't see that much now a days in other offices. We would highly recommend Dr. Kost  to anyone who needs answers for their pain.|Dr. Kost has been wonderful to me over the years at Bristol Hospital and then Blue Back square.
He has the best "bedside manner" and ALWAYS shows compassion for his patients. After all we want to be validated when we are in pain not condescended to. He is so good that it became impossible to get an appointment with Dr Kost. His assistants are ok, but they are not HIM and he is who you want.
I needed radio frequency following a 4 level cervical fusion. I had chronic headaches on the left side (surgery side) My date got changed and I was dying, so, he ended up referring me to Dr Grahling,, at  CT.Comprehensive Pain Management, in Plainville, CT. He also is very good, but he is not as personable as Dr Kost is. Very stoic and not responsive when things go wrong. after the 2nd RF caused me to get "spaghetti legs",for many weeks and I ended up in the ER, he was angry at me. Not sure why, because the first RF worked great.

There is one nurse in Dr Kosts office who is the most rude thing out there.
Everyone says it not just me.
She is a snippy, rude, witch who has zero compassion for someone that works in a PAIN MANAGEMENT CLINIC.
Dr. Kost needs to get rid of her vibe, because it is not at all helpful, needed or wanted, I wish I could remember her name.
She has no business working around people.
Little wretch.

I read the other review about someone having a bad result from an ESI, and then kicked out for having marijuana in their urine test.
Dr. Kost sits on the DCP Medical Marijuana Board.
As long as a person has been issued a medical mj card, legally, there is no foundation,
to "kick" anyone out of any pain mgmt clinic. .
That is pretty hypocritical at best & Dr Kost should walk the walk.
Does Dr Kost recommend medical mj & prescribe narcotics, like he advocates?
I have it in writing from a 2015 DCP board meeting.

Those shots over time, just wear off. I got them for over 10 years and I am done.
I even tried the pain pump trial. Not a fan of those wires pulling out just for tying my shoe.
I am anti-injection now.
That is why I TRIED the medical mj program.
Nobody wants to prescribe actual pain medication any more.
Plus, who can afford those pricey urine screenings, every (3) months"?
My insurance will not pay for them that often claiming; "not medically necessary".
People in chronic pain, are looked down on, judged and dismissed.

January 2016 I ended up listening to Dr Kosts advice, (waiting for artificial discs) made an appointment to see Dr Aferzon, who ordered  a new MRI of my lumbar spine. In 10 days, WC approved a 360 degree lumbar fusion with 2 artificial discs to be implanted, where L-4&5 collapsed. I had the worst spurring and every disc was bulging and I had "too many tears to count."
I am here t say, that the surgery was a SUCCESS, no more rods and screws people!
These artificial discs invented by Dr Joseph Aferzon, are amazing.
Middlesex hospital is the place to go and get your LIFE BACK.
Thank you Dr Kost for your sound advice to wait as long as I could to get the fusion, "because better things are to come".~|Dr. Kost is an angel of mercy. He worked with me through two different injuries that ended with chronic pain. He will not give up on you, and he is extremely sympathetic to his patients' pain. I have never once heard patients in the waiting room talk badly about him or any of his staff. Quite the opposite, in fact. Personally, his staff has always been cordial and professional in all of my
interactions with them. I would unconditionally give Dr. Kost and this office 5 stars.

column3:
Expert Pain Management in New London, Connecticut

At Shoreline Pain Specialists, we are led by Dr. Sudhir Kadian, a highly qualified pain management physician with extensive training and credentials. Dr. Kadian completed his internship at Louisiana State University Medical Center in 1998, followed by residencies at both LSU and Harvard University's Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center through 2001. His expertise was further enhanced by a specialized one-year fellowship in pain management at Harvard University. Since joining Anesthesia Associates of New London in 2002, Dr. Kadian has maintained dual board certifications in both anesthesia and pain medicine, demonstrating his commitment to excellence in patient care.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of specialized treatments including:

  • Pain control interventions

  • Cortisone injections

  • Ablation procedures

  • Customized pain management plans

Our approach focuses on providing thorough evaluations and personalized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located at 194 Howard St, New London, CT 06320, our clinic is equipped to address various pain-related concerns. For consultations or to learn more about our services, call us at +1 860-771-4960 or visit Shoreline Pain Specialists Providers to explore how we can help you manage your pain effectively.
column11: Dr. Kadian completed an internship at the Louisiana State University Medical Center in 1998 and was a resident both there and at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center at Harvard University, concluding in 2001. Following that, he completed a one-year fellowship in pain management at Harvard University. In 2002, he joined Anesthesia Associates of New London and became board certified in both anesthesia and pain medicine.

column40:
Dr. Kadian is wonderful. He takes his time to explain every detail with you and isn't rushing you out the door.He is very pleasant and has a very calming effect. He is an amazing doctor.|I contacted this doctors office in early May for ongoing severe back pain when I arrived in Connecticut for the summer. The PA sent me for an MRI which took a month. Then another month to see the doctor for review. He recommended an ablation. I was told I had to wait for them to clear it with insurance. I'm still waiting at the end of September. Worst medical office and staff I have ever experienced at a medical office.|I had a referral to Dr Kadian for a cortisone injection. First the office could not locate the referral (I had to have it resent) then they told me it would take up to 2 weeks for "Donna" to review the referral. After several follow-up calls I was told not to call them, they would call me once the referral was reviewed. That was 3 1/2 months ago. Fortunately I got a referral to another doctor in the meantime.|One of the nicest doctors . The reason for the 3
star - Iv been waiting 2 months to get my second and third injection- and his office tell me they are still waiting for the insurance to accept him as a doctor . Still don't understand why - I have not changed insurance and they were already accepting it before .  All I can say is I met my deductible 3 months ago - it is ridiculous !|Dr. Kadian is one of the nicest Drs. to work with. I have had injections in my neck and lower back and have had such great relief. His bedside manner and the staff at L & M's Pequot Outpatient is outstanding.|I want to thank Dr kadian and his staff during my surgical procedure I have been gradually getting better after going through the three rounds of pain blocker I feel that with my current therapy and the procedure hopefully won't need to have spinal surgery. Dr kadian was very accommodating and explaining the procedure his staff was impeccable very professional and very caring I would recommend the pain center to anyone who wants to use a different avenue than surgery at least to give it a try, he asked my respect and gratitude.|Great experience once I was able to get appointments.  Took awhile to get pain relief injections, no doubt slowed down due to Covid.  Even Dr Kadian asked why it took 2 months after my screening appointment with him to get hospital visits scheduled.|Dr. Kadian is professional, caring, understanding, listens well and very personable as is his staff.  Bein in pain is a terrible way to live life and Dr. Kadian really does is very best to do what he can.  Thank you to Dr. Kadian and staff.

column40:
Before I went to Dr. Abraham I could not walk because of the pain in my back and legs.  The next day after my first injection the pain was gone.  Would recommend him to anyone in pain.  Everyone in the office are very nice and helpful,|I am so grateful for Dr. Abraham!
I was in excruciating pain and lost feeling in my left leg due to a herniated disc. Dr. Abraham was very kind and listened to my history. He answered all of my questions and made me feel very comfortable. The secretary was fantastic! She checked with my insurance and made sure it was covered. The injection was not fun, but Dr. Abraham took his time and reassured me. It's been almost 9 months since his treatment and I'm doing so well. I'm running and working out again. Thank you, Dr. Abraham.|Dr Abraham has been outstanding! He is the only Dr out of several that has given me relief for 3 months and then we do more epidurals when they wear off. It beats surgery that the surgeon said I needed.the nurse Stacy is very comforting and sweet. Always helps me with my shoes etc. Then there's the receptionist Joy, very professional and super polite. Always has tried her hardest to get me in to see Dr. From day one. It's worth the hour drive from Newtown. I am very pleased with all. Thank you.|My lower back has been in pain for almost a year and nothing would ease or take the pain away. It started to get unbearable, to the point where every position was uncomfortable and I didn't think anything would help. My chiropractor referred me to Dr Abraham, I was skeptical about the treatment helping but the outcome is incredible! Doc said an epidural would help, the injections were excruciatingly painful but my back pain has been a lot better.
If you want almost instant relief I would recommend seeing Dr Abraham. Ill have to figure out a more permanent solution and still take it easy since this procedure didn't fix my lower back but it' a huge improvement.|Dr.Abraham has really helped me through this journey of pain that I've been experiencing for 8 years plus.He is an amazing doctor who actually cares about making sure that your pain free. I highly recommend that if you're experiencing any pain that Dr.Abraham is the doctor that can help you to regain your life back pain free.|My name is Judy.I have had painnin my wcervical spine for 20 years and no doctor has been able to help me. Dr Abraham injected my cervical spine and my pain was gone for mo. He injects me every 4 mo now and I am pain.free. He is kind and gentle and cares abouts his clients. I would recommend him to everyone.|0 stars. I have been diagnosed by many doctors that I have Chronic Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS), degenerative arthritis in multiple locations, and fibromyalgia. I told him Kratom affected my tolerance to Tramadol (which helped slightly but made me dizzy bc it can cause serotonin syndrome) and he said "I know what you're doing. I've had (over 40000) patients, and I know what you're trying to do." His female and dark-skinned assistant (who is gorgeous) was smiling and most laughing. I was SHOCKED. I never abuse drugs and my pain is 8.5/10-9/10 averaged. He is not a good doctor, because research shows pain is not always psychological. He gave me a referral to therapy to cope. Guess what- my pain got worse. He is judgmental and neglected my pain. He shouldn't be a doctor if he doesn't care about science and patients.|I've been see Dr Abraham for a few months now.  He is a personable friendly doctor who takes his time and explains anything required.  He deals with folks respectfully and with care.  I highly recommend him.

Just a great all around person.
Thanks Dr.G|Dr. Gutierrez is a kind and comprehensive physician. My wife found him after we had given up hope that I would ever improve after being misdiagnosed and treated by Dr. penny Dr. garden and Dr. Patel. After an ablation at L4 given by Dr. Patel, I became disabled adult consume severe to excruciating pain for seven months I gave up hope and we went to Dr. Gutierrez to learn how to deal with the life that was going to be a continual suffering God bless Dr Gutierrez, he is cheerful, kind, and friendly manner was very refreshing as was his diagnostic instinct. I will never forget the first word she said to me after my examination. And I quote " Mr. Dworkin something doesn't feel right would you please let me just do an x-ray of your pelvic region" I agreed and five minutes later he came back smiling. He told me I was missed diagnosed, and that my primary problem was that I needed a total hip replacement, because there was no Cartlidge between my hip bone and my hip socket . He gave me some names of good surgeons he would recommend we took those and did our research and came up with a different doctor Dr. Mark Schachmann, who did an excellent job

But the most amazing thing. to figure out I had not been treated correctly, but rather was treated with by people without hearts and minds. He restored my faith in the medical profession.

His kindness and cheerfulness gave me hope. His diagnosis save me from a life of chronic pain. I would highly recommend this man with no reservations whatsoever. He gets top evaluation in every aspect.|My experience with Dr Gutierrez was very helpful. I'm sure I'll be seeing him again.

I was so sick from the pain that I felt nauseous, I knew I was gonna throw up and started calling out for someone to help me, but nobody came. The pain I was feeling was almost unbearable, but I had to get myself out of bed and throw up in the sink. The sad part is I was just there recently for surgery not once but twice.

At Greenwich Pain & Spine, led by Dr. Christian Whitney, DO, we deliver a proactive and whole-body approach to pain treatment that focuses on restoring function, overall health, and wellness. Our philosophy goes beyond simply masking symptoms – we create personalized treatment plans that help you return to the activities you love, free from pain.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We begin with a thorough 360-degree evaluation to understand your unique condition. Our multi-disciplinary methodology combines:

  • Cutting-edge interventional pain management procedures

  • Bespoke wellness services

Whether you're dealing with chronic pain, recovering from an injury, or seeking improved mobility, our team provides compassionate care in a supportive environment. We function as both a pain control clinic and wellness center, offering comprehensive solutions under one roof at our Greenwich location.

Ready to start your healing journey? Visit our website or call us at +1 203-992-1845 to schedule your consultation today. Located at 500 West Putnam Avenue, Suite 440, Greenwich, CT 06830.

column3:
Are you tired of living with chronic pain? At Advanced Laser Pain Relief Center, we help patients throughout Hamden and New Haven County find relief from persistent pain conditions quickly and effectively. Our specialized approach centers around innovative MLS laser technology - a multi-wave locked system that promotes natural healing and reduces inflammation without medication or surgery.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our highly trained doctors utilize state-of-the-art Class IV MLS laser therapy to address numerous painful conditions, including:

  • Joint pain (arthritis, knee sprains, TMJ dysfunction)

  • Foot and ankle issues (plantar fasciitis, Achilles tendonitis, tarsal tunnel syndrome)

  • Back problems (disc herniation, spinal stenosis, cervical radicular pain)

  • Upper extremity conditions (tennis elbow, carpal tunnel, shoulder pain)

We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we're committed to providing personalized care in our comfortable Hamden office. Our treatment protocols are designed to reduce inflammation, accelerate tissue repair, and improve mobility without downtime. Visit Advanced Laser Pain Relief Center or call us at (203) 507-2290 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.

column3:
Expert Pain Management in Danbury, Connecticut

At Connecticut Pain Care, we specialize in providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from various chronic and acute pain conditions. Led by Dr. David Kloth, our practice combines advanced medical expertise with personalized care to help patients regain their quality of life. We take pride in our collaborative approach, working closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans that may include:

  • Targeted steroid injections for immediate relief

  • Nerve ablation procedures to address persistent pain

  • Medication management when appropriate

  • Physical therapy coordination for long-term recovery

  • Trigger point injections for muscle-related pain

Our state-of-the-art facility at 2 Riverview Dr, Danbury, CT is equipped with the latest technology to diagnose and treat complex pain conditions. Dr. Kloth brings decades of experience as a nationally recognized pain management specialist, helping patients with back pain, joint issues, nerve disorders, and post-surgical pain. We're committed to finding solutions that work, even when other treatments have failed. Visit Connecticut Pain Care or call us at (203) 792-7246 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.

column40:
I'm so surprised by the negative reviews here, but if you want a pain management doctor who will fix your problem, Dr Kloth is the one you need.  His staff is friendly, but most importantly, Dr Kloth is the best, most knowledgeable, comforting doctor there is. When I was told there was nothing that could be done for my dislocated and very painful collarbone by several doctors, I was thankfully, referred to Dr Kloth. In 2 visits, I was pain free after a year of suffering. He is amazing and won't stop until he finds what will work for you. I'm so glad I found him. He is the very best there is!  Thank you, Dr Kloth.|David Kloth. He has been fantastic. Listening and taking care of my issue. I had back surgery and still on excessive pain finding out it's my sacroiliac joint. I have rods Putting pressure on my lower back Causing extreme pain in my back. I had gotten shots that helped for a little while, and he just recently did an oblation trying to kill the nerve that's causing the issue. I seem to be better. but from walking like an old man for a year, my back is curved badly trying to walk straight is very hard. But he's doing a great job helping I really appreciate him. David. Thank you, Gary Crisci.|At the time of writing this review I have been an established patient of Dr. David Kloth for 20 months. To write a review, an established patient's experience will be much more meaningful and compelling to one who may be seeking treatment.

After 6 years of complex medical conditions, no overall diagnosis and chronic pain as a result, I had the occasion to be referred to Dr. David Kloth for pain management. Dr. Kloth has excellent medical instincts, training, experience, and a high level of conscientiousness. From our first appointment to the present day, Dr. Kloth has been able to create a treatment plan which has included various modalities of pain management: long-acting steroid injections, medications, physical therapy, ablations, and trigger point injections. There is a logical process of addressing specific areas of pain as well as an overall strategy to reduce pain overall. The successful treatment of my pain with Dr. Kloth has been accomplished with collaborative discussion, reviewing medical records and imaging, answering questions, managing expectations, and educating me as the patient. Treatment is recommended, and based on the trust created in our relationship, I have the relief and assurance that I am achieving the best possible outcomes for pain management. This is evidenced in asking the correct questions, undergoing procedures which have resulted in a higher level of functioning and quality of life. It is a fluid process of addressing pain as medical conditions and functioning changes over time. The permutations of pain management with knowledge, techniques and recommendations are nearly inexhaustible. Dr. Kloth is a nationally renowned pain management specialist with the training and experience unequaled by any other physician in the area. His waiting room reflects his ability to collaborate with people of any age, gender, race, social background or presenting medical conditions in which a patient has found themselves in need of pain management services. His office staff abundantly supports his efforts in a busy medical environment. In the time I have been a patient, the office staff, assistants, and receptionists have been responsive in a timely manner. His treatment rooms, office spaces and waiting areas are immaculate and well organized.

Finally, inescapably, a patient who is seeking medical expertise that I have described in detail and experienced personally will find it in Dr. David Kloth's Ortho Pain Care practice. His office, including assistants, office people, receptionists and everyone who helps to keep that "wheel turning" are more than helpful, dedicated and compassionate to your needs as a patient. Everyone is to be commended for creating and maintaining a private medical practice of this caliber.

I am grateful for the few physicians who have helped me at an exceedingly challenging time of my life. After 7.5 years, I have just been finally diagnosed by a physician in a different specialty. Dr. Kloth is and remains one of those physicians who has made all the difference in management of this rare condition.

Susan Foster Hayo|I am thoroughly in disagreement with the negative comments.  I find Dr Kloth to be professional, knowledgeable and kind.  He has a very funny sense of humor.  And is concerned about my issues.  The staff is also professional, answered any questions I had.  I recommend him highly|I CAN NOT BELIVE HE is STILL IN PRACTICE!! I'm writing this years later after seeing many very similar situations... I went to see him with my young son and daughter still in a car seat... long story short I asked for him to show me on the skeleton model where I would be injected .. when I tell you this man became violent ... with my young children present...I was escorted out by the poor girl at the desk and I called the police ....it was that terrifying ... They took a report .. I filed complaint with the state and he got a slap on the wrist... I got booted from the practice... one that I had been with for several years... this was my first time ever seeing him tho...
Something needs to be done about him...|After sending in documents so the doctor could review them to understand my situation I get this response from his secretary," Dr.Kloth said he would see you for a consult for you chronic back pain and could take over management of your Hydrocodone and Methocarbamol but not the Ramelteon or Suvorexant.
Please let me know if you would like to move forward with scheduling a consult.
Now how is it when I ask about following up with what I thought was part of the treatment plan am I the one who is seeking drugs? No Doctor Kloth what I'm seeking is RELIEF and thought I wouldn't have to hear an excuse about losing your license to not continue the treatment that has been working.|Dr Kloth is certainly HONEST about what he thinks is going on and what will, or will not fix it.
And he's extremely knowledgeable in his field. I trust him, which is the most importantly thing|Dr Kloth was very thorough & professional when treating my lumbar & stenosis. I spoke with a member of her staff who told me I might not be a candidate for her services. Since he isn't a doctor, I'm not sure why he would tell me this. He advised me the cost of treatment would be out of pocket - which I knew. I asked the price of each PRP injection and he told me $2500. I've been given a cost for the same treatment of $800 per injection, so I asked what made Dr. Patel's treatment worth so much more. He told me the treatment was high quality, and if I was shopping around for other prices and cost was important to me, I should probably go elsewhere since he doubted they could help me. He made me feel cheap, unreasonable and disrespected. Very bad experience.  I've never before been told to go away because I was getting more than one quote for an out of pocket procedure. Awful experience that added a level of emotional distress to my already difficult level of pain.|Dr Patel has been my pain management doctor for over 15 years. Dr Paz has helped me for years. Dr Paz and staff throughly explain everything and discomfort was very minimal. I would definitely recommend this practice !|Oh, Dr. Paz, you wizard of spines,
You've given my mom back her sunny shines.
She was in such pain, it's hard to explain,
Even Oxy couldn't dull that insane strain.

Two ibuprofen, two acetaminophen,
She tried it all, but the pain wouldn't soften.
She said, "I can't live like this anymore!"
Then you walked in, her knight to restore.

With hands so steady, and skills so divine,
You fixed her spine--not once, but twice, so fine.
You made it look easy, like a walk in the park,
While we sat there amazed, mouths agape in the dark.

No recovery time? No lingering ache?
Doc, you're a legend, for heaven's sake!
You didn't just heal her, you gave her a restart,
You've got the magic touch, the healer's art.

Now Mom's back to life, no pain in her stride,
Thanks to you, she's got years by her side.
She's laughing, she's walking, she's living anew,
All because of the miracles you somehow do.

So here's to you, Dr. Paz, our hero in scrubs,
You've filled our hearts with gratitude and love.
You've given us more than words can convey,
Thank you for giving Mom her life back today!

Forever grateful, we sing your praise,
Dr. Paz, you've brightened our days.
A surgeon, a savior, a master, a star,
You're the reason Mom's pain is now afar!|Dr. Paz came highly recommended to me by a friend and patient of his.  So far, my experience is very positive. column2: Connecticut Pain Care, Dr. Kloth - New Canaan
column3:
Specialized Pain Management in New Canaan

At Connecticut Pain Care, led by Dr. Kloth, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout New Canaan and surrounding areas. Our practice specializes in treating complex pain conditions using advanced interventional techniques, including epidural injections, nerve blocks, and minimally invasive procedures. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, focusing on creating customized treatment plans that address the root cause of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Nerve blocks

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Medication management

Located at 38 East Ave, New Canaan, CT 06840, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure the highest standard of care. Dr. Kloth is recognized for his expertise in treating challenging cases, particularly those involving spinal conditions and patients with complex medical histories. Many physicians refer their family members to our practice because of our reputation for excellence and our commitment to improving quality of life through effective pain management. Visit our website or call us at (203) 792-7246 to schedule a consultation.

column38: Ninette Halpin|Dwanna d'Allagino
column40:
Many years ago Dr Kloth gave my elderly mother an Epidermal injection when she was suffering so badly from herniated
discs that she could no longer sleep, sit or walk and had lost 31 pounds due to lack of appetite from extreme pain.

My Mother, in her 80's had advanced CLL (Leukemia) which made her a very difficult case because Dr Kloth had to approach her spine from an unusual angle being ultra careful not to hit any small capillaries or veins due to the CLL.. This made the procedure far more complicated and it's outcome/success far less sure. But what he did for her that day with one injection was nothing short of a miracle.

While Dr Kloth is a very serious man who can appear at first blush to be brusk, he is rather, a kind, caring, compassionate and brilliant Dr who is fully committed to his patients and their well being. He is the Dr. that Drs. send their wives, children and family members to and with good reason. There's simply no one like him - he's the best of the best.

I should note, my mother's surgeon insisted that she was not a candidate for Epidural injection. He tried to motivate her to opt for back surgery which at her age and with her comorbidities might have ended her life.
Via a recommendation from the president of a noted hospital we consulted Dr Kloth and with one injection he restored my mother's life back to normal. She had no more pain from that day on and lived to be 92.

Dr. Kloth is without equal - he's the best in his field.|

Dr. Sood saved me from a device that would have hurt me. Treating my syndrome was challenging to say the least, but Dr. Sood was kind and compassionate during that awful period in my life. Also, Dr. Sood's office staff and medical team are  really nice and helpful. BTW, this is not a fake review.

At HSS Stamford Outpatient Center, we are proud to have Dr. Joseph Hung, a triple board-certified specialist with exceptional expertise in interventional pain management and clinical informatics.

Advanced Spine Care & Pain Management

Dr. Hung specializes in diagnosing and treating painful spine conditions through minimally invasive procedures that help our patients manage pain, restore mobility, and improve quality of life. With prestigious training from Johns Hopkins (where he was selected as Chief Resident) and Harvard Medical School - Massachusetts General Hospital, Dr. Hung brings world-class expertise to our Connecticut location. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Interventional pain management procedures

  • Minimally invasive spine treatments

  • Sports medicine rehabilitation

  • Personalized pain management plans

We combine cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care to address complex pain conditions. Learn more about Dr. Hung's approach to pain management at Dr. Joseph Hung at Hospital for Special Surgery or call us at +1 203-705-0870 to schedule a consultation at our Stamford location.

I've required the help of pain doctors for 25+ years.  Dr. Hung is excellent.  He listens actively, communicates clearly, assesses the root issue, and works with me to design a plan.  He is careful to discuss the potential ups and downsides of various medications and approaches and allows me to participate in my own pain management.  He is highly respectful and appreciates the impact of chronic pain.  He has worked at the most prestigious hospitals in the USA and works with a team of extraordinary talent at HSS.  His office, clinical, and nursing colleagues are the best I have encountered.  I recommend him all the time.  Great leaders have great teams.|I've had two procedures with Dr. Hung, both of which went quite well.  Dr. Hung was very aware of my condition, signs, symptoms, and extended health matters. I recommend Dr. Hung unconditionally.|Dr. Hung is fantastic! column3:
At our pain management practice in Norwich, Connecticut, Dr. John J. Paggioli specializes in providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. With years of dedicated experience, we offer personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function. Our approach focuses on finding the right solution for each individual, whether through minimally invasive procedures or advanced interventional techniques.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We provide a range of specialized treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spine-related pain

  • Neuro-stimulator implants for complex pain syndromes

  • Comprehensive diagnosis of difficult pain conditions

  • Management of post-surgical pain

  • Treatment for fibromyalgia and CRPS/RSD

Our practice is committed to helping patients regain control of their lives through effective pain management. We take the time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop treatment strategies that address the root causes of pain. Located at 190 W Town St, Unit 1, Norwich, CT 06360, we welcome new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. To schedule a consultation, please call us at +1 860-885-0333.
column38: Donna Franklin|Anne Mac Fadyen|Lori Houser|Ron Korzeniewski Jr.|Audrey Abdo|Michael Collins|Dawn Rosacker|vincent kopp
column40: He went by another doctors diagnosis with no tests. When it didn't add up, he refused to order an MRI and he treated me like a criminal. He told me constantly the pain was all in head, and all I needed was a psychiatrist. I had no where to go so I put up with him. Finally with pain unbearable there was a big blow out. When the MRI came back he said "You need surgery asap for the disc pressing on your spinal cord! " Years of abuse from him and no apology. After that he didn't need a nurse in the room with me! Rude, insulting not to mention poor ethics and terrible judgement.|Rather than do tests to see what was causing my pain, Dr. Paggioli gave me an epidural shot that did not work and which resulted in pain at the injection site that continued until I ended up in Urgent Care two weeks later because I could not walk. He refused to speak to me about this. Dr. Foster from the Windham Hospital Pain Management Department later discovered that the pain I saw Dr. Paggioli for was the result of an unfused vertebra in my spine. I still have pain at the epidural injection site, am seeing a neurologist for it, and will be undergoing physical therapy to repair the damage there. I am glad others find this doctor helpful; he did not help me.|Dr. Paggioli is the most compassionate doctor I have been to. I have seen alot of others that have blown off the fact that every part of my body hurts. I have been told if you weren't fat you wouldnt have pain well my arms and hands aren't fat and they hurt everyday. He was the one that finally said you have frybromyalgia.  Years of pain for nothing. This man changed my life and I am forever grateful. Office staff is wonderful also.|Dr Paggioli is an incredible physician. I was recommended by my spine surgeon years ago for my cervical spine issues. Dr. Paggioli is a compassionate, and understanding doctor that listens to your concerns and offers multiple solutions. He is the BEST in his industry. I would highly recommend him for chronic pain sufferers, such as myself.|I have had spinal surgery and needed more but because of diabetes some had to be held off. I have bulging disk in my neck. I have developed arthritis from prior back surgery. I have tendonitis in  my hips and shoulders that is so severe it feels like the bones are rubbing together. I also have bone spurs that grow back even after removal. Finally I suffer with fibromyalgia and diabetic nerve pain. Sometimes no,pill,in the world will help and you are begging for a shot of cortisone or an epidural  help ease the pain though you will get a headache. It's good to have a doctor who knows what I'm going through and I can talk to. I can't keep getting surgery but my doctor listens and tries to help as much as possible and is now wanting me to use swimming to help me, and I agree. He's a good doctor and tries various treatments to give relief not just pills although I would be in terrible pain without them.. this is why my surgeon who is a brain surgeon recommended me to him so the shots, medicines patches and different low impact exercises to help. I give him a five because even if I try hard to be strong he discusses with me a treatment plan. I'm so glad to have him so I can Have some bit of normality in my life. Thank God for a good Dr. Surgeon, a good PHP, a good pain doctor who can formulate a plan of treatment for me. I give him a 5.|Having been a client of Dr. John Paggioli for years I now write this post for others who may be in severe pain.  Identifying those features that enable a person in pain to chose the correct practitioner of medicine for oneself can be challenging.  Primary features I could identify in choosing my physician were his knowledge of my condition and his ability to communicate a plan of action. Dr. John Paggioli professional knowledge is more than comforting, over the years we have been able to address my pain levels and approach it logically.   His ability to clearly relay technical information to a lay person is outstanding,  never do I depart feeling confused as to our direction.  I do feel very comfortable recommending                  Dr. John Paggioli|I have RSD (reflex sympathy dystrophy ), now more commonly known as CRPS (complex regional pain syndrome).  It is a Incurable disorder that attacks your central nervous system, causing relentless pain, swelling, spasms and a plethora of other symptoms. Over the now 15 years I've had it, I have undergone nerve blocks and much more. Finally ready to give up entirely, I met Dr. Paggioli.  He recommended we try a neuro- stimulater implant. I can now walk again without the use of my canes. I bless Dr Paggioli everyday for his help in making my life worth living.|Dr.paggiolli has helped my pain situation with my lower back immensely. his knowledge and expertise when i needed apidural shots in my spine, and walked completely normal within a few hours, showed me, he is a true professional. i am gratefull !!!

column40:
I have been attempting to make an appointment for the past 2 weeks, pushing 3 weeks. I've had to call everyday to check up on the status of my referral from my primary MD, which was faxed last week. The nurse has yet to call me to discuss scheduling an appointment. I have only spoken to the front desk. I am not satisfied with the way I continue to get pushed off. I understand the computer system has an issue but I also don't feel that they are tending to it in a timely manner. I am looking into another location as I I'm not happy with the service or care I'm receiving.|This was one of the worst experiences I've had since moving to Connecticut and with the healthcare system. Up until this point I've been in awe of how kind and organized everyone has been.

First, I show up and no one but the front desk lady is particularly friendly. I was reduced to giving one word answers because my being nice was almost immediately shut down.

They made me fill out a big packet of paperwork at home and didn't even ask for it.

The doctor came in texting, barely acknowledged me when we started our appointment and at that point everything was civil. I was not expecting much.

A few minutes in he got a phone call and barely excused himself before putting it to his ear and rushing out. He came back a few moments later and I was expecting he had a medical/family emergency. No. His adult son was moving to college and was having issues. I don't even answer calls when I'm in my accounting meetings. This is a doctor.

The appointment got progressively worse the more questions I had and he clearly did not have time for me.

I was not rude, but when he got short with me I knew I wasn't getting anywhere and would rather have not wasted my time. I just ended up giving him the information he wanted to hear and that was that.

I should have left the moment I found out the phone call wasn't life or death. I just didn't matter.|

column40: I was disheartened to see the negative review left on the Woodbridge location as my experience with this office as well as other locations have been vastly different over the past 3yrs I was a patient. I LOVE the puppy first of all. He's part of the family. I have been in and out of numerous clinics/offices for pain over the past 5yrs and these people are the ONLY ones who have TRIED to help me. They've put forth the effort to try to find solutions for my case. They never once threw their hands in the air like every other Dr/surgeon has. Aside from how wonderful they've been medically, the ladies in that office have become friends. They are so compassionate, supportive, quick to respond to issues, and have gone above and beyond for me personally. They genuinely do care about their patients which is a rarity in this specialty. By far the best office staff I've experienced. I used to get panic stricken prior to every appt with past providers because of the way I was treated even though I was always compliant. My anxiety was just terrible for days prior. For YEARS. This office erased that. I actually looked forward to my appts. The "pill counter"  Is anything but just a pill counter. Her name is Angelica, and she GOES HARD for her patients. That girl advocates like no other. She does the work behind the scenes patients don't get to see too often unless they are back there with her. She's on the phone with pharmacists making sure patients have their medication in time and doesn't take their crap if they make things difficult for the patient which we pain patients know happens all too often. We are LUCKY to have her! I've never smelled anything animal in that office and I'm the type of person who is the one to smell something when nobody else does. That puppy is GREAT to have around for the patients and very well trained to not run under feet. Dr. Thimineur would never allow the puppy to be in the office if he thought it was a threat to his patients or a liability (neither would puppy's owner) trust me. He's our in office therapy dog. I've seen that puppy put so many smiles on patients faces especially the wheelchair bound and elderly. Everyone is entitled to their own opinions of course, but go be a patient at 10 other pain specialists offices THEN circle back and rank this one. I'm devastated to have lost my care here due to insurance reasons. I know I'll never find another office like these guys or care like this ever again.|Woodbridge office is a mess, there is a small dog that is free roaming and can trip someone who has and number of back issues. The smell of dog as well is unbearable. The young lady that counts medications is rude and has server attitude issues. Consider another doctor.|I've been a patient for several years now, and I find Dr Thimineur to be one of the best pain doctors I've ever seen.  He saved my life and cut my pain level by 60-75% implanting an occipital neurostimulator. I also receive epidurals for my upper and lower cervical and they work wonderfully thanks to Dr Thimineur!!I can't say enough about his staff! They are beyond terrific and you never have to wait to be seen unlike many other pain doctors where you wait for at least 3 hours.Your not going to find a more knowledgeable, kind and caring pain doctor around!|As a new patient, I had a very good first meeting with Dr. Thimineur and an equally good follow up with his medical associate, Andrew Paulson.   As a Complex Regional Pain sufferer, as well as someone who has a childhood spinal injury that requires epidural injections, I have responsibly used prescribed opioid drugs for my pain; though because I have been in remission and free of them for more than a year, I saw Dr. Thimineur only to schedule epidural injections for my back, not to ask for medication.As the date of the procedure approached, I called with questions about follow up care and was told by his coordinator, Gina, of whose medical credentials I'm uncertain, that I would not be allowed any further direct contact with Dr. Thimineur, or his medical associate, Andrew, and that all decisions about my follow up care, including any pain medication I might need as a result of the procedure, would be made by or through her.Having been off opioid medication for so long, I was concerned about post procedural pain and wanted answers from my doctor, and tried to schedule a meeting with him before the procedure.  I was told by Gina that doing so was impossible and I cancelled my epidurals and scheduled the first available appointment with Dr. Thimineur before rescheduling the epidural procedure.  Before that appointment could occur, I received a notice that I was terminated as a patient, for no specific reason.  I have since unsuccessfully tried to contact Dr. Thimineur for an explanation, and can  only assume that asking questions and insisting on answers from a qualified medical professional disqualified me as a worthy patient.While Dr. Thimineur and his medical associate, Andrew, were courteous, knowledgeable and seemed very competent, his assistant Gina basically  accused me of trolling for drugs because I expressed concern about postoperative pain management.  As a longterm pain patient, I fully understand the need to better control opioid abuse, but drug shaming responsible and legitimate patients isn't a solution.  Great doctors, absolutely terrible and arrogant support personnel.   Jean Calabrese|Dr.Thimineur's group informed me that my insurance company rejected a radio frequency procedure on my lower back, and that they wanted to perform a nother lumbar injection which I have had done twice in the past, once recently performed by Dr Thimineur, both times it didn't work, the pain came back within a week. What makes Dr Thimineur believe that the results would be any different this time around??I contacted the insurance company, and they have no record of a Radio Frequency Procedure been submitted by Dr.Thiminuer.????|I have been a patient for over 10 years. Dr. Thimineur is very knowledgeable with CRPS, scoliosis, and herniated disks. He is able to understand my pain. When I see him my appt isn't 5 mins. He takes time to explain my condition and doesn't sugar coat my future. Without him I would of never made it this far. His staff can be hit or miss but long term staff like Andrew is just as good as the doctor. Do not listen to all the negatives you may read. Take it from a decade long patient that he is truly the best!|I was a patient at. Comp. Pain and headache center since they opened. I went for over 20 years. I even went on Sundays when Dr. Thiminuer had a Dr. who would wire you up like a PINBALL MACHINE,  you had to sit there for over an hour, you had to look at a computer and make objects connect. How this made me feel better I will never keep. I went on Saturday and Sunday for 6 weeks. I was working then, leaving my family. Anyhow,  I left the practice April of 2018, because every time you go there, they would question you pain medications usage, and if you took more than they thought you should, Andrew would chew me out like he was the teacher and he caught me SMOKING IN BOYS BATHROOM. At that time I moved out of the area, Again, When I moved back to this area I called them 6 times and left my name and number with NEVER a call back. I don't know how a Dr. asst. can feel your pain, I guess they are MIND READERS.|I had a horrible experience at a pain management center and asked my doctor for another recommendation. Dr. Thimineur was like NIGHT AND DAY from the other provider. I let my doctor know that he should be recommending Dr. Thimineur over any other pain management center.Dr. Thimineur gave me a tremendous amount of time during my first visit and he really helped me understand the issues I have following a car accident almost 4 years ago. His staff were amazing and treated me so professionally.I highly recommend Dr. Thimineur and his team!

One doesn't need the staff to add more negativity to it.|I have a dear friend who went there with her mother. They were berated for being a few minutes late and yelled at-told them only one could be taken in. The other would have to reschedule. But she was out of medication. They told her "too bad. It's a privilege to be here and you shouldn't have been late" Days later, on the phone asking for their records to be transferred to another practice, given a hard time about sending them in a timely fashion.  When she called the new office that finally received the records, they said they weren't taking new patients, when prior they had said they were. The old office told them lies about her and it was basically their intention to have her denied from every office she might try and go to. She and her mom are NOT addicts. She and her mom are wonderful people with chronic illness who suffer daily pain. She told me the Dr. is great. But the office staff, especially Andrew Paulson APRN were verbally abusive. My friend, who has MS asked if he was minimizing her pain. He said yes he was, her pain was insignificant and there are others who are in more pain than her. Awful! Don't go here!!!!|I'm surprised about the reviews. I've been going to this clinic for years. My experience is:
If I am patient and kind to them, then they are likewise with me. Makes me wonder about the people who give bad reviews. Andrew has been extremely helpful for my pain.|I'm a brand new patient both to pain management and this office. Like many I have several medical issues but the one causing the unrelenting pain is relatively rare. column38: Hope Bailey-Slauta|Kim Gibson|Suzanne Caruso|Dolores Ross|Janice Bondi|Jason Rodriguez
column40:
Dr. Forzani is a highly professional pain management specialist with excellent bedside manner. He listens carefully, explains treatment options clearly, and prioritizes patient comfort and care. Highly recommended!|Fantastic bedside manner! Took the time explaining to me about my problem which is arthritis in my back and knees and what we could do about. I wouldn't hesitate to go back to him!|My Mom is an elderly woman who has every one of her mental faculties. She began seeing Doctor Forzani for back pain.  She met with him weekly for nearly six weeks completing an ablation procedure. She completed one side, but before she could begin the other side, she unfortunately was diagnosed with lung cancer.

Over the next month with Yale, we had set the date to begin radiation and chemotherapy but the day after Thanksgiving, she was taken by ambulance to the hospital for SEVERE back pain.  She remained in the hospital for 10+ days, missing the start of her cancer treatments, and she lost over 20 pounds while she was there.  During her stay, incredibly stressed about her back issue now prohibiting her cancer treatments, I called Dr. Forzani and asked if he could order an MRI to figure out what was going on. Something had happened, she was in incredible pain, and she needed to be able to get onto the radiation table and lay flat on the hard surface for the treatment.

Despite the fact she was his patient and she had done multiple procedures with him, he refused to order an MRI without an "office visit".  I explained she was immobile, in the hospital, risking the ability to complete her cancer treatments at all.  It didn't matter. No office visit, no MRI.

Unfortunately, my Mom's long hospital stay due to her back injury had weakened her to the point where Yale felt the chemotherapy would be too much.  Now it was radiation only, a much less effective treatment plan.

On January 22, 2024, I wheeled my mom into Dr. Forzani's office oxygen tank and all for his required "office visit".  He prescribed Norco for my mom's pain, no MRI.

By mid-March, 2024, my Mom had finished Radiation and was trying to recover.  The Norco Dr. Forzani prescribed was making her sick to her stomach and she needed pain relief. The hospital had given her lorazepam which she felt helped her pain.  Lorazepam is an anti-anxiety medication. It is also a controlled substance and has narcotic properties that can explain pain relief even though it is technically considered anti-anxiety medication. I would think as a "pain management specialist", Dr. Forzani would know this.

So again, I called Dr. Forzani.  Even though we had (painfully) met his office visit request less than three months ago (Jan 24), he insisted on another one.  When I complained that we had just been there and she only needed a medication change, his PA came back on the phone and told me he wouldn't prescribe that particular medication for her.  I was talking to his PA because, according to her, he does not take phone calls so she would put me on hold, talk to him, then get back on the phone.  Twice this was the drill and twice, Dr. Forzani was completely ineffective, unreasonable, and refused to help.

For Dr. Forzani, "office visit" fees are his greatest concern even when his patients need him very badly.  The only way for me to summarize our experience with Dr. Forzani and the effectiveness of his "treatment", is to say that he should be ashamed of himself.|I initially saw Dr. Forzani in Nov 2023 and he collected an X-ray followed by an MRI. I was happy to follow these steps to figure out why I had so much back pain. He then recommended a lumbar steroid shot to reduce my back pain that was found to be caused by a herniated disc. Unfortunately, Cigna denied the prior authorization (typical Cigna move). I thought Dr. Forzani and staff would submit an appeal to have Cigna cover the necessary injection. I called his office and they assured me that they had already submitted an appeal and they would contact me in a month when the appeal was either accepted or denied. A month had come and gone so I called the office and left a message (4 weeks later I still haven't been called back) and I also called Cigna. Cigna said they never received an appeal! So I waited a month for no reason.

I decided to see a new orthopedic doctor, so I obtained a copy of the MRI report and a CD of the MRI. Turns out, the radiologist noticed a cyst on my right kidney (failed to report any specifications such as size, or simple/complex) and Dr. Forzani never mentioned a cyst at all! So I have had a cyst on my kidney for months without knowing. (The cyst is likely nothing to worry about but it would've been nice to know so I could get an ultrasound to confirm.) I looked at the MRI images myself and the cyst was obvious even to someone who has no experience with MRIs.

I am now seeing another orthopedic doctor who is more attentive so far. I will never be back to see Dr. Forzani or his radiologist again.|It's hard to find a good Dr. That actually  listens to you when you talk. He doesn't rush you out like must Dr's do. I highly recommend him. Desiree that works with him is also wonderful.|Simply outstanding in all aspects of medicine. Great human being

column38: Brenda Guzman|Greg Stascavage|Rual R|Karen Perrault|Robert Douglas|Christine Cost|Bruce Balemian|Tanya Schreffler
column40:
Every time I go there, I get a different MA and NP. I have severe lower back pain and upper back pain. I got an injection today for my lower back and now they want me to come in on Monday to discuss getting pain pills as I had been getting monthly until I had a family emergency in Iowa and was gone for a month and another emergency in Illinois and was gone for 2 months. The NP that was training actually said, " we don't know what you've been doing," as she didn't trust me. I have never given them reason to doubt me. Never anything illegal in my urine. So here it is Friday for my injection and I had to make, yet another appointment for Monday to discuss medication. I was there 2 weeks ago. They also tell you all kinds of things on the phone and then you get there and no one knows what you're talking about.They make a lot of money having most of their patients come back 3 times each month. No!! A big NO!!! I do not recommend this pain clinic!!! They do not care about old people. I did get upset when they seem to think it's alright for me to continue with pain while they wait for a urine test. NP casually says we'll have you come back in 2or 3 weeks when we get your urine test back, as if I'm not having extreme pain. They do not care about old people in the least bit. I had an injection during this time and it did not help one bit. I've tried everything they want me to try. This place is terrible!!!|This place is horrific.  I waited 45 min at the appointment for them to then tell me it's a comp issue.  Long story short it is a medical issue.  Today when i left, the dr said they would call me that day.  Never heard from them.  In a week and a half span I called a few times.  Today they literally told me to stop calling and the girl that answered was extremely rude in the way she said it. Sge said rudely "They would call me"  .Not even letting me explain or ask questions   I'm just a piece of paper.  I contacted the cold fridge human resources woman she was just as bad.

Here you are just a $$ and paper.  Not a human suffering.

Thanks for wasting my time!!!!!!|Very poor internal communication. Every time I go there is a different doctor asking for more information. Last time I went the provider said if you don't like it go find another clinic. Really the worst treatment I have ever received as a patient. I have a severe spinal cord injury and they treat me like I'm a drug addict.|I have experienced a lot of peace coming here,  and the employees are wonderful. Very kind and caring. I am thankful for this place I'm just thankful that I have a place to go to to get care.|I have been a patient there for a little over a year now. I can't say enough great things about this place. Transparency is the key when going to a pain management office. I feel like I am listened too and they have give me great tips on how to reduce my pain. I know the injury I have will never leave me pain free but this place gives me hope that they will assist with getting the best quality in life being pain free. I understand I will never be 100% free of pain but with their help, I am able to manage it with living life. Thank you for everything and listening to me. I would recommend this place hands down to anyone. Again Transparency is key!!! They have seen/heard it all so just be honest with them! They will help|The staff are wonderful. From front desk to medical assistant to nurses and doctors, they strive to be professional and keep their patients safe and healthy. They have rules to ensure we, the patients, have the best pain management aids available, and utilize them safely. The billing is a little behind, I've been told, so I make my copay at time of service to avoid any late notices. Other than that (which they really can't control), this is the best and safest medical group I've ever experienced. Safety and professionalism at its best.|My experience with Comprehensive Pain management was amazing, from the minute I walked in I was treated with welcome and respect. The wait was very short, they brought me in and the room is immaculate, the doctor and her staff were great, they explained every step of the process. After the procedure my 25 year back pain was gone. I will return as needed but 8 weeks later and I'm still pain free.|Absolutely horrible.  Every time that I go there, I ask myself why by the end of the appointment.  Dr. Chan is amazing, however, the rest of the staff, not so much.  Every time I go, there are new people working there, including nurse practitioners.  Hmmmmm.  At all of my visits with a nurse practitioner, they never examine me.  Today was the first time in 2 years, that I was examined!!!  Also, today was the very first time that someone has gone over my medications with me since the very first visit.  They have prescribed medications for me, so don't you think it prudent to check for interactions before prescribing?  That is appalling!  At my last visit, the NP prescribed a compound.  The pharmacist called me to go over my meds.  He asked me if Comprehensive Pain was aware of what I was taking.  He absolutely could not believe that they had zero knowledge of my meds!!!  As I said, prescribed a compound 6 weeks ago.  Today was a follow up for that.  It was not addressed at all.  Never even brought up.  How is this good medicine?   It's not!  I'm sure that this practice has had to be sued by now.

Expert Pain Management at Stamford Health

At our state-of-the-art multidisciplinary pain center, we provide comprehensive care under the leadership of Dr. Ofer M. Wellisch, a distinguished pain management physician. Dr. Wellisch began his career at The Stanford University School of Medicine, where he not only practiced clinically but also served as teaching faculty, mentoring medical students, residents, and fellows. His background includes significant research in Molecular Neuroscience and the "patient experience," with numerous published articles and medical reviews to his credit. After returning to the East Coast with his family, we've established a premier pain management center at Stamford Health to serve our community with exceptional care.

Our services include:

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Advanced interventional procedures

Visit us at Dr. Ofer Wellisch at Stamford Health or call us at +1 203-276-2451 to schedule your consultation at our convenient location: 29 Hospital Plaza Suite 601, Stamford, CT 06902.

column40: Dr Wellisch and team are professional, superbly knowledgeable, patient individuals who take the pain management profession and indeed the practice of medicine to a new high standard. They cared for me for months in Stamford Hospital both during multiple surgeries and my lengthy recovery. I recommend them ALL without reservation. Including their front office staff and nurses - all so kind and so polite!!!|Follow-up post.  Staff at office location is inconsistent.  Many errors were made in processing refills for essential pain medications so that I did not receive my medication on time or at the correct location.  Many times I did not receive call-backs on essential matters within a timely fashion.  When I did not receive my medication refills in a timely manner and had to rely on back-up medication, I was treated like an addicted child.  Hence, I quit seeing this doctor.  Patients in pain should be treated with respect and in a timely fashion.  It is very hard to function when in pain.  If a doctor does not understand this, he should not practice pain management.|Dr. Wellisch had been my husband's (H. Aibel) doctor for many years.  When we page him, he always calls us back anytime during the week. He  saved my husband from having invasive pain killers  which his previous doctor had prescribed for many years ... My husband regained his mental and physical ability without having any invasive pain medications. Dr. Wellisch is a conscientious doctor. He listens to his patient and attends to their need with utmost kindness and consideration. Thank you ,Dr. Wellisch.|Dr. Wellisch is patient, thorough and a good listener.  With his assistance, I was able to get off other debilitating pain medications and onto a better regimen that helps me have a better quality of life and better clarity of mind.  PM is a constantly changing process.  He works with me and maintains great communication.  I feel that he actually cares whether I am doing better and that makes all the difference.|Fantastic doctor! I was so fortunate to have been referred to Dr. Wellisch over 3yrs ago. He is professional, knowledgeable and has a high regard for (my) chronic pain. My health issues are complex and span from Pain Management to other areas of medicine. Dr. Wellisch takes my entire history into consideration to treat effectively. He takes the time to explain the treatment options, in detail, often pulling up graphics to be sure I understand exactly what  procedures he is recommending. I've had many procedures with Dr.Wellisch and will most likely have more in the coming years. I highly recommend Dr. Wellisch. You owe it to your chronic pain to schedule an appointment with him and his staff.|When my mom was undergoing chemotherapy treatment for her cancer she developed shingles for the first time, and the pain she experienced from that kept her from doing most activities.  After searching for some time for a pain management doctor we found Dr. Wellisch.  I chose him because of his medical background and experience and affiliation with SHMG and Stamford Hospital.  My moms health condition at the time was complex as she had a lot going on medically.  Dr. Wellisch treated her pain with prescribed drugs which worked for her and got us through a very difficult time.  Our experience with Dr. Wellisch was very positive all around.  I found that he was kind, receptive and very professional.  On occasions when we met with this doctor after listening to my moms medical history he provided us with options and his recommendation on treatment.  If we had questions or didn't understand something fully he took the time to answer or explain things in more detail.  On a couple of occasions, based on considering our feedback to his recommended plan, he made revisions in his treatment plan based on our concerns which is why I gave him 5 stars.  I also remember that mom ended up in the ER on one occasion, I asked his office if he could come visit her as she was experiencing severe pain in her head, he did visit with her during this stay.  Support staff for this practice are very good and the facilities are new and based on the grounds of Stamford Hospital.  I would highly recommend this doctor.|Worst doctors appointment experience of my adult life. So unprofessional, made me wait for 35 minutes for my first appointment and 45 for my second. Only to be told that I was 10 minutes early. Fine. That's still 35 minutes. He treated me like a drug seeking addict. Told me to go to AA or NA meetings after prescribing me drugs to be taken daily and a weed card recommendation. He also told me that I had to go see a psychiatrist at Liberation house (a rehab and the same place he told me to attend meetings). In my opinion this man has not been taught or has not learned about pain management for people who are not coming off of heroin and are in actual need of pain medication. I told him how I couldn't wait to be seen that long, especially after calling ahead of time to make sure that he wasn't running behind schedule! He got upset with me because I said that in his waiting room. We then broke up mutually. Now I'm not allowed to see his partner which is odd because of HIPPA or HIPA laws his partner shouldn't know my name, right? Anyway, I wanted to warn future patients that don't want to feel talked down to or treated poorly by an arrogant doctor.|The only reason for one star is because you cant give zero. The office staff is second to none specifically Kelly, Patrick, and Jake. However, this so called doctor isn't worth the paper his degree is printed on. I am a veteran of two wars and several incursions that resulted in combat experience. I do not think that entitles me to anything other than to be treated with the same respect as anyone else. I waited for over a month for an appointment which is O.K. I guess a little excessive but I understand. I have several herniated discs in my neck, which cause chronic headaches and migraines, I have several bulging discs in my lumbar spine and degenerative joint disease in bilateral knees. All of this confirmed by imaging, MRI, and X-Rays. From the time this guy entered the room he was insulting, degrading, and totally unprofessional. I am on one medication, down from several high dose, high strength opioids that the military had me on and all he wanted to focus on was the medication, he NEVER addressed my pain issue. He insulted me and fixated on one medication for about 30 minutes then abruptly said he couldn't treat me. I wouldn't send my worst enemy to this guy. Chronic pain is not joke, we are not all drug seekers and it is terrible when someone that is sworn to help people makes them feel belittled instead. Please for your sake and the sake of your loved ones stay away from him.

column2: Pradeep Chopra, MD, MHCM, Center for Complex Conditions
column3:
At the Center for Complex Conditions, led by Dr. Pradeep Chopra, MD, MHCM, we specialize in diagnosing and treating patients with complex medical conditions that are often misunderstood or overlooked by traditional healthcare providers. As both a pain management physician and anesthesiologist, Dr. Chopra brings extensive expertise to patients suffering from challenging conditions.

Our Specialized Services

We provide comprehensive care for complex conditions including:

- Ehlers Danlos Syndrome (EDS)

- Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome (PoTS)

- Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (MCAS)

- Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

- Advanced treatments including IV ketamine infusions

What sets us apart is our dedication to thorough evaluations and personalized treatment plans. We take the time to listen, understand, and address each patient's unique symptoms and concerns. Our approach combines medical expertise with compassion, ensuring that patients who have often been dismissed elsewhere finally receive the validation and care they deserve at our Center for Complex Conditions.

Located at 102 Smithfield Ave, Pawtucket, RI 02860, we welcome patients seeking answers for their complex medical conditions. Contact us at +1 401-729-4985 to learn more about our services or to schedule a consultation.

column40:
Dr. Chopra is absolutely wonderful!!! He finally gave me answers to all of my chronic pain symptoms! Unlike many doctors who could careless, Dr. Chopra dedicated so much of his time for me along with a long thorough diagnosis report. He has helped me at such a great deal. I will never forget my visit with him. He was absolutely wonderful. So caring, EXTREAMLY knowledgeable, with a classy sense of humor. Nobody compares to him. Unbelievable!! 
Thank you, Dr. Chopra!!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!|Outstanding physician who is so insightful, curious, knowledgeable, and compassionate. His initial evaluations are extremely thorough, which makes for a detailed report based on individualized observations that are then actionable and genuinely helpful.

Unlike other EDS "experts" we've now encountered, Dr. Chopra uses proper evaluative techniques, asks loads of relevant questions, and does not have preconceived notions based on other diagnoses. This makes him all the more rare and special in an overall medical world where patients are being reduced to check lists and dollar signs.

When we implement his suggestions, we see marked improvement. When we return for followup, he offers new layers and approaches to improve quality of life. We wish there were more doctors like him!|Dr. Chopra has wonderful bedside manners. He is very intelligent and knows his subject well. After having seen 22 doctors for my child (who gaslighted me) he spent almost 3 hours going through every bit of her symptoms and examining her. He was compassionate, humorous (which helped her feel at ease). It has been 10 years and I now look at my child who is all grown up with tears thinking what would have happened if we had not seen Dr. Chopra. She is doing very well and is medical school.|I am unable to make an appointment after they asked where I lived and what insurance I had. Donna emailed me back and said "The Dr's schedule is closed for new complex patients". Really unfortunate and disappointing that the "Center for Complex Conditions" can't see a new complex patient!

Edit: You never mentioned I would be on a cancellation list your only reply was "The Dr's schedule is closed for new complex patients".  Therefore, you made it seem like Dr. Chopra was never taking anymore patients. As far as you taking me off the cancellation list, thank you. Your lack of care and empathy shows greatly.|Dr. Chopra is the best doctor I have met. My daughter had a complex medical condition. Every doctor I went to would gaslight me. I went to Boston Children's, Mayo, Cleveland Clinic and they all gaslighted me. I finally saw Dr. Chopra and as I write this I have tears in my eyes. He was so kind, listened to my daughter and diagnosed her correctly. It has been 15 years, my daughter is starting medical school. She has gone from being bed ridden to a beautiful young lady who dreams of becoming a doctor like Dr. Chopra.|will be forever grateful to Dr. Chopra for saving my children's lives. They were both diagnosed with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome and my daughter also had CRPS.  Dr. Chopra was so kind and compassionate. He spent hours with us trying to understand what the problems were.  His guidance, kindness and compassion along with his superior knowledge have made a huge difference to the children. They are growing up fast. It brings tears to my eyes when I look at them thinking what would have happened if it was not for Dr. Chopra.  We had seen over 22 doctors before and they were clueless.|Saw him today! Best Specialist I've seen! They made my friend & I feel at Home. He took his time & his staff were amazing & hilarious! Would recommend to anyone suffering and seeking valid rationale, as to why?!?! I've been dropped by practices for begging for answers! One past provider almost allowed me to "yeet" this earth, by allowing me to slip into Rhabdo! I've been dropped by previous providers, due to my tendency; in relation to having true diagnostic, evidence based practice in relation to treatment goals and validation! Today, I had my prayers answered. It all makes sense and 36yrs of suffering, answered! If you are struggling, in search of a "REAL" Physician , to do a thorough exam and take his time explaining his rationale/reasoning behind it... Choose, this practice!!! ~ Jessica Dalton|Regrettably we never got to see Dr Chopra.

We were told that he doesn't accept our primary insurance (despite his being listed on their site). We explained that we also had secondary insurance, and were told that was fine and they gave us an appointment.
We also confirmed with our secondary insurance that they would cover the bill.

Then they sent an email canceling the appointment the day before saying that they don't take our primary insurance. They don't answer the phone. So my husband drove over, and was told that he clearly doesn't understand how insurance works. And they won't see him. There were two people behind the counter, no one in the waiting room, and they still weren't answering the phone.
It seems so sad to learn that such a beloved doctor has a staff that seems to completely lack empathy or professionalism.

UPDATE: As this review received a response that clearly indicated that the responder either didn't read or didn't comprehend the above. I will condense. Our secondary insurance agreed to pay for the visit. This was known when they scheduled the appointment. Then, regardless of insurance or not, two employees at a pain clinic spoke to a suffering man looking for help like he was an idiot. Shameful behavior. And all people deserve better.

I was dealing with constant hip pain for over a year before I started treatment.  I had limited mobility and the pain kept me up at night. I am happy to report that now that I've completed my treatment plan I am completely pain free. I no longer have mobility issues and am sleeping through the night.  This has been a game changer!  I'd like to thank the staff who were always so kind and helpful. You guys are amazing!|It's a beautiful place with a wonderful support staff,  but the treatment doesn't work. They did offer me another treatment, but since the 1st 5 didn't work I doubt another one would.|Just finishing up my treatment today I'm extremely happy with the staff. I'm extremely happy with the treatment. I'm extremely happy with the outcomes! I would encourage anybody to come. At Norwood Comprehensive Pain Management, we specialize in providing compassionate and effective pain management solutions for patients throughout the Norwood area. Located at 45 Walpole St #1, Norwood, MA 02062, our practice is led by experienced physicians dedicated to improving quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of advanced interventional procedures and therapies including:

  • Nerve ablation procedures for chronic back pain

  • Spinal cord stimulation and implant therapies

  • Targeted injections for pain relief

  • Customized medication management

Our team takes the time to listen to each patient's concerns, developing individualized approaches that address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.
