column40:
The people at this pain clinic are top notch. Joanne an NP, saw me first, and was so knowledgeable and caring. Dr. Hummel, is excellent. He did a procedure called, "nerve ablation", on my lumbar area. It went so smoothly, and wasn't too painful at all. His assistant, Michelle, is really nice and helps you feel comfortable before a procedure. I had back pain for many years, and saw many doctors without any help. Dr. Hummel, listened and helped me. My pain has decreased at least 50%, or more. I can now move, and do things again! I'm now off to PT. Thank you, NCPM!|I love Norwood Comprehensive Pain Management Because all the staff members go above and beyond.. Marylou is an excellent scheduler, she's always kind, caring and  understanding. The medical assistants are efficient and empathetic.. Dr. Hummel is one of the Best Doctors I have ever had. He is compassionate, empathetic and he listens, he came up with the best plan of care for me.
I was referred to Dr Hummel in 2016 by Dr Friedberg who is my neurologist. I had  unimaginable and unbearable pain. Dr Hummel came up with a great plan of care for me.
Dr Hummel has a NP that works with him, her name is Joanne, she is also kind and compassionate and empathetic. Joanne is also a big part of my pain Management Plan. I am Grateful for Dr Hummel and Joanne.|I was absolutely blown away today.  Dr. Hummel and his physicians assistant saw me promptly and efficiecently.  And beyond my wildest expectations he found a way to fit me in for a procedure to help with sciatic pain i had been living with for over 3 weeks.  Excellent bedside manner and huge points for finding a way to fit me in.  I will highly recommend!!!|Not a good scholar. Was first treated with respect and good explanations of risks involved with injections. Even the injection was in part successful but only in part. He kept having me make appointments to return for another injection but then became very unprofessional and each time blew me off not taking responsibility that he just didn't get it right and was unwilling provide any further treatments saying they were too risky. If he was that incompetent and unsure of his profession then why bother to give me any treatment at all. Will never return to His office after this unprofessional behavior!|I spent three years in pain that was so bad, I stayed in bed except for doctor visits.  I went to pain doctors ar hospitals in Boston, Norwood, Providence, and more.  I tried therapy, hypnosis, acupuncture and any other thing that was suggested.  Nothing helped.  Finally, my GI doctor asked if I would try Dr. Hummel.  I told him I'd walk naked in downtown Boston during rush hour if it would help.  I was desperate.

So, I went to Dr. Hummel.  His first question was why so many doctors.  I told him about my search for help.

He started looking for various ways to help relieve my pain. Long story short, he was the first and ONLY doctor who helped me!  That was many years ago, and I still see him.  To me, he was, and IS, a Godsend.  He gave me back my life!

I am NOT pain free, but there are times when I AM pain free and I owe every pain free moment to him, and my GI doctor.

I cannot thank him enough for his help.|Dr Hummel is the best! I've been seeing him for 5 years and after a total of 2 back surgeries and a pain implant he has gotten me to a point that I'm
comfortable without the opioids|I have been a patient of Dr. Hummel since 2009 to help me with my pain management and I will be having a spinal implant through his office. column2: New York Spine & Pain Physicians - Westchester
column3:
Leading Pain Management Specialists Since 1999

At New York Spine & Pain Physicians (NYSPP), formerly New York Pain Consultants, we've been dedicated to relieving pain and improving quality of life through individualized patient care since our founding by Dr. Craig Shalmi and Dr. Luis Fandos in 1999. Over the years, we've grown to become Long Island's premier pain management group, featuring six specialized physicians across three convenient locations. Our 2013 affiliation with National Spine & Pain Centers has significantly enhanced our practice by providing access to superior management resources and cutting-edge research opportunities. Located at 550 Mamaroneck Ave Suite 503 in Harrison, NY, our Westchester facility offers comprehensive pain management services including:

  • Specialized treatment for chronic and acute pain conditions

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Individualized pain management plans

  • Expert physician consultations

  • Minimally invasive treatment options

Our team of board-certified physicians combines extensive experience with compassionate care to help patients regain function and reduce reliance on medication. We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we're committed to providing the most effective, evidence-based treatments available in a supportive environment.
column11: New York Spine & Pain Physicians (NYSPP) formerly New York Pain Consultants was founded in 1999 by Dr. Craig Shalmi and Dr. Luis Fandos with the vision to relieve pain and improve overall quality of life through an individualized approach to every patient. Since it was founded it has become the leading pain management group in Long Island with 6 pain management physicians and three convenient locations. In 2013 NYSPP became affiliated with National Spine & Pain Centers one of the largest pain management practices on the east coast. This partnership has benefited patients by allowing access to better practice management resources and research opportunities.

column40:
My experience at New York Spine & Pain Physicians has been very positive. The staff  are all very friendly and professional. Yesterday was my second time going there, for a procedure to treat my back pain. The initial treatment was ineffective, so the doctor recommended that this alternate treatment be performed. Both procedures were carried out in a very professional manner, with the doctor explaining everything she was doing, step by step. After each procedure, I was instructed on what to do and what not to do, as well as when I could expect to experience pain relief. Follow up appointments were scheduled for two weeks later on both occasions, to document the results of the procedure. I'm completely satisfied with this practice, the treating doctor, as well as the staff members. I highly recommend this practice to others, who are in need of a source of pain relief.|The doctor Dr Shalmi does great at the procedure, however the constant check in after each appointment even though we come up with a plan of up to 3 epidural shots, or if the pain returns come back for the shot is unclear and unneeded. I do not want to do a follow up for something that was already stated should be done if this occurs. This place waste time with unnecessary appointments that last 10 minutes when the medical necessity was already documented. The only reason for this is a money grab to get as many appointments out of the client as possible. Go elsewhere.|I have been suffering neck pain for many years until I met Dr Shue .
She has a blessing hands because since the first time she treatment my pain was relief. She is very professional and the most important care her patients very well .|Sue up front is the most efficient person I've ever had the pleasure of working with.  You need to understand the importance of somebody upfront, that has the back of those who are performing to work. Dr. SHUE is amazing. She had all the right spots. I was in and out before you know it. I would highly recommend them to anybody who is having severe pain. All A1 class services!|Dr Shalmi has been so wonderful during my chronic back problems. Specialized Care for Neuropathy and Chronic Pain in Connecticut

At Hartford Neuropathy & Chronic Pain Center, we provide comprehensive treatment solutions for patients suffering from peripheral neuropathy and chronic pain conditions in Plainville, Connecticut. Our medical clinic combines advanced therapeutic techniques with personalized care plans to address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms. We specialize in treating:

  • Peripheral neuropathy

  • Chronic back and knee pain

  • Mobility issues

  • Foot care concerns

  • Nerve-related conditions

Our team offers innovative treatments including PRP therapy and Synaxis procedures that have helped countless patients regain their quality of life. Located at 17 Farmington Ave in Plainville, our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to deliver effective pain management solutions. We welcome patients of all ages who are seeking relief from persistent pain conditions. Visit Hartford Neuropathy & Chronic Pain Center or call us at +1 860-351-5528 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.

column3:
Expert Interventional Physiatrist in Connecticut

At Orthopedic Associates of Hartford, we are proud to have Dr. Pietro A. Memmo as a Partner and Assistant Director of our Orthopedic Associates Surgical Center since 2003. Dr. Memmo stands out as one of the few physicians in Connecticut who is Board Certified in both Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and Pain Management. As an Associate Clinical Professor in the Department of Orthopedics at the University of Connecticut School of Medicine, he brings exceptional expertise to our practice.

The focus of our specialized care is diagnosing and treating painful spinal conditions using conservative, non-operative approaches with minimal reliance on narcotics. Dr. Memmo performs advanced, minimally invasive spinal procedures including:

- Fluoroscopically guided injections

- Interventional pain management techniques

- Specialized diagnostic procedures

- Targeted therapeutic treatments

We invite you to learn more about Dr. Memmo's expertise and our comprehensive approach to pain management at our official website or call us at (860) 549-3210 to schedule a consultation at our Hartford location.
column11:
Dr. Memmo is an Interventional Physiatrist, one of the few in the State of Connecticut who is Board Certified both in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and Pain Management. He joined Orthopedic Associates of Hartford in 2003, is a Partner and Assistant Director of the Orthopedic Associates Surgical Center. He is also an Associate Clinical Professor in the department of Orthopedics at the University Connecticut School of Medicine.

The focus of his practice is to diagnose and treat painful spinal conditions in a conservative, non-operative fashion, with minimal utilization of narcotics. Dr. Memmo performs the most advanced, fluoroscopically guided, minimally invasive spinal procedures at the Orthopedic Associates Surgery Center.
column38: Erina Lander|Sasha Naylor|Sandra Hamilton|Karen Hutchinson|Samantha Granbery|Debra Carey|Terry K|Sandra Galiffi
column40:
My mom has been seeing Dr. Mammo for about two years, and our experience with him has been deeply disappointing. From the very beginning, he displayed a lack of empathy and genuine care for his patients. During our initial visits, it was evident that he seemed impatient and uninterested, often acting as if our questions were an inconvenience.

Dr. Mammo administered one shot for my mom that was effective, but the second one didn't work. When we brought this up, he became defensive rather than addressing our concerns constructively. Recently, my mom returned to his office due to severe hip pain and difficulty walking.  Dr. Mammo stated that he didn't have time to give her a shot and referred her to PA  Brian instead.

After the procedure, my mom experienced severe swelling and bruising from her hip down to her ankle. When I called the office out of concern, I was told that Dr. Mammo was busy and that Brian would call us back. Two days passed without a response. When I followed up, the receptionist informed me they were busy with other patients, which made us feel ignored and dismissed. We ended up seeing her primary doctor who took  care of my Mom the same day.

At her follow-up appointment, I reminded Dr. Mammo about the swelling and bruising. He asked if my mom was on blood thinners (which she was), but instead of taking responsibility for not reviewing her medication list, he defensively claimed it wasn't in her online chart. I pointed out that other doctors always review her medications first, but this critical step was neglected by his office.

The final straw came when my mom asked what could be done to alleviate her pain. Instead of offering hope or a plan, Dr. Mammo coldly told her that it would only get worse and she would always be in pain. My mom was devastated and left in tears.

The next morning, her pain worsened, and we had to seek help from her primary doctor. Thankfully, he reassured her, provided treatment, and within a few days, she started to feel better.

Dr. Mammo has demonstrated a lack of knowledge, empathy, and responsibility. His behavior was unprofessional and heartless, leaving my mom feeling hopeless and dismissed. I do not recommend him to anyone.|I do not recommend no one to this man. He is racist. I am a black female who was referred to him when I went to the office. He act as if he did not even want to touch me. His receptionist is rude. They're very hard to contact. he's rude. He does not know how to talk to people he over. Talk to you, and he shoves you off like he don't want to be bothered. He's the worst unprofessional doctor I've ever met.|I had a very upsetting experience in Dr Memmo's office recently. I was scheduled to see Brian his APRN for a follow up on a nerve test Dr Memmo sent me for. I had arranged to see Dr Memmo after not being happy with my current doctor and wanted to switch to this office. The first appointment was very good with  Dr Memmo. He said he  needed to do some tests to determine what was causing my pain. He hoped he could help me as the previous doctor didnt. When I came for the follow up appointment with Brian, he stormed in to the exam room telling me that Dr Memmo can not take your case and I needed to leave now!. He said I've been seeing another doctor so I can't be seen in this office. I explained I made it quite clear that I am not returning to that doctor and switched to Dr Memmo. He would not go over my test results and said he would refer me to a surgeon to match my personality. He was so rude and condescending. I left the office in tears. I sent a letter to Dr Memmo that day. Then I made a call a week later to the office manager after not hearing any response to my letter. She said she would not be able to handle that but would prefer me to the CEO of the company and he would definitely be calling me Monday morning. I never heard anything from him or Dr. Memmo. How sad you can't call your patients back after being treated awful with no explanation!|Office staff is very friendly.  Dr. Memmo is pleasant and explains everything so you understand.|My primary care doctor referred me here for my spine on august 11th. I hadn't heard anything by august 24th so I called them. They placed me on hold for almost 10 minutes without acknowledgment. As a medical assistant, I would never work for an office that has such poor patient care. There's no reason why a patient who has gotten a referral should be waiting longer than two weeks for a call back. I also should not have been on hold for that long. Someone should have come on the line and spoke to me even if it was to ask me to hold again. Absolutely disgraceful|Met Dr Memmo on 6/14/2021 for the first time, if I could rate him 10 stars I would. He is a caring, professional and very educated doctor. He took a good amount of time with me with examination and answered every question I had. Dr Memmo came highly recommend by by PCP and a good friend. I was very impressed that he took the time to explain my MRI films with me, view by view. Showed me where my pain was coming from and why. He has been the only doctor that took the time and explained it so I understood it. I've had lumbar issues for 22 years. He knew I wasn't there to seek out pain medication, but a facet block. He suggested 2 facet blocks, which I'm greatful he didn't say let's do an epidural to start. Would recommend him to anyone who needs a good pain management doctor. The office staff is wonderful as well. Love this doctor.|I had a spinal injection for my sciatica pain.  It was the worst experience of my life.  The injection didn't help me at all. After the procedure, I was in more pain than before the injection.  Google the success rate of spinal injections and the possible complications before proceeding and if you do go ahead, ask for sedation and someone to drive you home afterwards.  This wasn't explained to me or described in the written material.  I was offered another injection or surgery which I declined.|My son had a a procedure done a few weeks ago and has had to call the office several times due to severe pain. He is currently out of town and he called again because he's in excruciating pain. They had the APRN Mike call him back...Mikes reply was I am not licensed out of state good luck and hung up. Disgusting behavior by a medical profession who is supposed to care for people. Dr Memmo call your patients back and provide proper care. You're a pain management doctor??!! He is in pain.... DO YOUR JOB! Get rid of Mike too.

We tried nsaids, tramadol, lidocaine patches, but the pain did not resolved completely. We went to Stamford Hospital offices close to Chelsea Piers looking for a pain management/rehab physician because i thought she needed a intraarticular injection. column40:
Do not go here!! Painful injections. Went one week got an epidermal for my back and leg pain. Then had to go to get a blood patch done since I had been rushed to the er for horrific headache. Then they billed incorrectly. Sent me a bill. I called billing and she said I will tell rebill it under other insurance first then rebill your secondary. So she zeros out the bill in my name. I get a call from the office today cancelling my appointment for tomorrow until the Dr receives the payment. That they will call me when the payment is received to come back!! Who does this,!??.. I have same insurance for all my back drs and primary and medicines and hospitals. I have never got calls saying I had to wait till my insurance payment goes through! Do not go here!!!|I was referred to this pain clinic. I was told I had to do injections and / or any treatment he suggest and if I do he would help me with pain medication. He did an Epidural which didn't work. So second treatment was freezing nerves in lower back that should help for 6-12 months. It was a very painful treatment. It helped for about 1-2 weeks and I had more pain than ever. Next he did this again. Went though this painful treatment. He said if I felt this treatment going into legs it wasn't good to let him know. I did express it was to intense. He told his tech to turn it down, she turned it way up and it shot pain down my legs. He kept saying sorry as I cried loudly. I have NOT been the same since, so much worse than when I went in. He refused to help with medication at all as he falsely said he would if I got injections etc. He wanted to continue to do same treatment he was doing and failed to help. Why? I'm not a Guinea pig. Im a patient/ human. I said NO! I never went back and ended up getting a bill for treatments, I have insurance. When I called number on bill I was told it was refused, now I have to pay! I told this woman she billed wrong insurance and she said she would not resubmit to right insurance. I continue to get a bill and I will not pay it, for I have medical insurance and it covers that last treatment, and covered the treatment done the second time seen , third time was same treatment. This happened in 2020-2021. Now I have heard that he's doing and dropping patients if they don't get enough injections, cutting his patients off without notice that have been on oral pain medication for over 20 years!
Don't go to him if you value your physical health. Go elsewhere and report him. He only cares about himself and not the patient at all!|Creepy office. Painful injections like hell . Im also getting billed for injections i didnt get because i did not go back. Secretaries were very unpleasant too|I was referred to the Sturbridge office for injections in my hip and sciatic nerve! It hurt so bad I wanted to simply die. The doctor told me it's ok to cry, and what happens here stays here (he saw I was embarrassed) and it comforted me a great deal.
Today I can walk upright, finally after months and months of agony, I can walk upright! The pain is there somewhat as it always will be, but Dr. Farid helped me so I can be a better mom for my children. With my injury due to a car accident, I was desperate for pain relief! Thank you, from the bottom of my heart.|Rude, silly with arrogance, dismissive and he seems to be running an assembly line. Try getting anyone on the phone. His staff is quite good and polite though. Never again!|Excellent doctor. Caring and compassionate explains everything so that I can understand it. Highly recommend him.||

column48: When should I see a pain management doctor?
column49: If you've been experiencing any of the following symptoms, talk with your doctor: Sudden increase in the intensity of your current pain. Sudden loss of muscle power in your legs or arms.

Dr. Knox did not give up and was able to locate and ease the pain on the right side of my neck. Yes, I have herniated discs but what seemed like unending pain came to an end with a couple of injections and patience. The staff, Irene and Harrington, I send 5 gold stars also for their patience and kindness.  Thank you, now back to golf !|I am a dentist and was suffering with significant lower back pain until I met this wonderful English gentleman. I cannot recommend Nigel highly enough and his staff are equally kind and compassionate. I highly recommend Dr. Knox and his in house technology and work ethic. You owe it to yourself to meet this man and get out of pain. I'm off all NSAIDS and never had to go near narcotics with his help. I pray the effects last with his help. Pain is awful to live with, it affects everyone around us too. THANKYOU Nigel.|I can't say enough about the professional and concerned care I received here. The reception, intake and treatment is exceptional. Dr. Knox is a throwback to the country doctor, with the most advanced care. I have had other pain management treatment where I felt I was just a number. Here I felt like my questions and concerns were all addressed. The Dr. takes the time to find out your needs and fully explains all treatment possibilities.|I have never left a Dr review before, but my visits with Dr. Knox compelled me to do so. I highly recommend Dr. Knox. I went to him after a fall with 2 large herniated discs, a pinched nerve running down my leg, hip pain and sacrum pain after the ER did nothing and my orthopedist could only recommend surgery (not my first choice) or physical therapy (i could not walk or move much, so how would i do that?). He took his time to speak to me, no rush, was interested in trying to find the source(s) of my pain, and then addressed it rapidly.  Most importantly he truly cares about your well being. He made it clear that we were "in this together." Two visits and a week later, I am now upright, walking 90% better and feeling an impressive amount of pain relief and restoration of my range of motion so that I can go now do physical therapy and start to go about my life again. He compassionately seeks to understand the source of your pain, explains it clearly, and then fixes it. He then follows up to make sure he got it all and advise on next steps. On top of that, he's a great guy with an comforting bedside manner which is incredibly rare these days. If i could give 10 stars, i would.|A wonderful physician! Caring, explained all options available for my treatment.|Dr. Knox is  an outstanding physician and wonderful with pain management. I would rate him the best of the best.

Excellent results from Dr Tortland regarding my neuropathy in my feet, ankles and legs. I had given up hope and had a grim diagnosis. It took a year to get into his office. I haven't been able to exercise since 2019 and now more and more is coming back to me. Dr Tortland is the best. column48: Does New England stem cell do stem cell therapy for COPD?
column49: Unfortunately not -- outside of clinical trials, stem cell treatments are only for musculoskeletal issues, such as osteoarthritis, partial tears, etc.

At our pain management practice in Redding, CT, we specialize in providing innovative, non-surgical solutions for chronic pain conditions. Dr. Perry M. Perretz brings over two decades of experience in osteopathic medicine, offering comprehensive care that addresses the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms. Our approach combines traditional medical knowledge with alternative therapies to deliver lasting results.

Our Specialized Services Include:

  • Prolotherapy - A regenerative injection treatment for chronic pain

  • Trigger Point Dry Needling - Targeted therapy for muscle pain and dysfunction

  • Neural Therapy - Advanced treatment for nerve-related pain conditions

  • Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment - Hands-on care to improve function

  • Acupuncture - Traditional technique for pain relief and healing

We pride ourselves on thorough assessments and personalized treatment plans. Unlike conventional pain management approaches, we focus on healing rather than ongoing symptom management. Our patients appreciate our commitment to spending adequate time during consultations—we never rush appointments because we believe understanding your condition is essential to effective treatment. Located at 112 Portland Ave, Redding, CT 06896, we welcome patients seeking alternatives to surgery and medication. Contact us at (203) 544-9090 to schedule your consultation.
column38: R Green|Dylan Fragomeni|The Kid|April Chappuis|Rich Lipset|Sarah Smile|Robert Aillery|Wendy Moldovan
column40: This man is either a genius or a magician. I went to Dr. Perretz on the recommendation of a colleague who found his prolotherapy to be extremely helpful in relieving her chronic foot pain. Her husband also had success curing his back pain. I had been suffering from what my PT diagnosed as frozen shoulder. Major shoulder pain and a reduced range of motion. After 4 months of dedicated physical therapy with zero relief and worsening range of motion, I decided to try out Dr. Perretz. My first appointment was an hour and a half. After a unique assessment, he ultimately said my issue would best be treated with trigger point dry needling. I returned for a 45-minute follow-up a week and a half later where he performed more in-depth trigger point therapy. Within 2 days of that second treatment I was nearly back to normal. Now, 2 weeks later, I am completely cured and my PT just "graduated" me from her care. My mind is blown. And bc I didn't need prolotherpay, my insurance covered my entire visit and treatments. Dr. Perretz was not interested in pushing costly treatments nor is his goal to have patients return for months on end. He genuinely wants to cure people. I am so grateful to have found Dr. Perretz and have already sent 2 friends to see him. If you're experiencing pain and not getting anywhere with traditional doctors, please do yourself a favor and make an appointment.|Dr. Perry and team have helped my health tremendously. I saw Dr. Perry for neck instability and issues that dated far back. Dr. Perry was careful and listened to everything I had to say. He got to the root of my problem and solved my neck issues. He's a trustworthy doctor who is extremely professional and genius! Thank you Dr. Perry and team for getting me my body back!|I had terrible SI joint pain for 20 years.  I visited 10 different DCs and PTs over that time and relief was always temporary.   I didn't want surgery.   I knew I had to try something different, then found Dr. Perretz.  He has the perfect combination of training and skills I thought.   At first I was skeptical that alternative therapy would work.   In a short amount of time I am now pain free due to Dr Perretz.   I am a believer.   An incredible resource for our community.  He is a wonderful doctor and person.  And his staff is warm and welcoming.|Dr. Perretz is the BEST! He has helped me in more ways than I can count! My husband, my 9 year old and I have gone to him for various prolotherapy, neural therapy, acupuncture and osteopathic needs and we have all had amazing results! My 9 year olds bladder dysfunction that was quite serious was eliminated with neural therapy after all conventional methods had failed. We are so grateful for him and his compassion, listening and being a doctor who is truly different from the rest!|Dr. Perretz is one of the most caring and compassionate doctors you will ever meet. He will take the time to actually listen to you and discuss ideas. Never arrogant or condescending, simply interested in finding a solution to your problem no matter how intractable. Always willing to learn and provide honest feedback or admit he does not know the answer. If the medical professional was full of an army of Perretzes this planet would be a happier and healthier place.|I had a very pleasant experience . I am very grateful to have found This Dr , he is very thorough and I never felt rushed or pressured . The Prolotherapy gave me instant relief in my neck , shoulders and lower back .  I will definitely be back in two weeks for more treatment.|Dr. Perretz helped manage my severe hip and shoulder pain.  He completely healed my friends back pain.  All of this done without drugs and surgery.|Very impressive doctor with so much knowledge about so much which he is willing to share and spend time with you. A thinker out of the box! Works to arrive at the correct diagnosis. He is my doctor now.

column40: I am aghast at hearing that this doctor has given anyone opioids! I am crying for them since my full knee replacement threw me into severe sciatic pain. It has been 8 weeks since the surgery, I have not had one pain-free day, had an mri and an xray confirming sciatic nerve issue as well as a bulging disc . I have asked for PAIN MANAGEMENT. I was again given steroids that don't work. Now I'm told to set up an appointment for an injection but have been given nothing to mitigate the pain in the meantime. I am not an addict. I was drug tested. I need relief. I have done pt, massage, acupuncture, tramadol, steroids, what else do I have to do to get PAIN RELIEF from a pain management clinic?!?|I have 5 surgeries on the lumbar spine, several neuropathic lesions. A year ago there was a pain in my right hip and I went to several doctors, I did several tests and nothing helped me. I was treating it as if it were a femoral arthrosis, but it was actually neuropathic pain and Dr. Wu was the one who had the sensitivity to see my problem and treat it correctly. Contrary to the comments above, no opioids! I did a radiofrequency ablation. I recommend it with my eyes closed!|Dr Wu is a dangerous doctor. Without any tests or reason he prescribed my husband pain meds. My husband had a pill addiction Dr Wu made it easy for him to walk in and get an RX for Vicodin. Dr. Wu makes his money off of pills & addicts. Highly recommend.|Wow I came here to say what's already been said.  My drug addict soon-to-be-ex- husband was prescribed oxys with a perfect MRI.  Given a crutch, yet he goes to the gym 3 hours/day. column40: I have been a patient of Dr. Patel for many years. She has helped me with my chronic pain issues and takes the time to explain any treatments/procedures. There is never a long wait in her office, and everyone always greets you with a smile. The office is extremely clean and the waiting room is comfortable.  Her PA Molly is very nice nd always returns calls quickly.|Dr Patel is kind and compassionate.  She is a great listener and is eager to help her patients.  Dr Patel is also an excellent clinician.|The location was very easy to get to and it was super clean/very tastefully decorated. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I found Dr. Patel to be kind but very fast-paced, to the point of missing some of the information I took time to not only fill out on line in specific, time-consuming detail but also covered with her staff in detail just before I saw her. I appreciated Dr. Patel's willingness to address the appointment based on my needs but I did have to advocate for my care despite having, again, pre-set all information and being very clear with my minimal asks several times over in my correspondence with the office.  I will definitely go back but I do wish that Dr. Patel could have taken just a slight bit more time to address all of the information I entrusted her with. I will add that I had been sent a text message earlier in the day letting me know there had been a cancelation and asking if I could come earlier - and staff were lovely when I stated I just couldn't leave work earlier. However, they still asked I could arrive any amount of time earlier than my scheduled appointment (it was not to fill out new paperwork or anything of the like as they had everythine they needed). Thus, I do not know if something came up for the doctor and she had an urgency to leave. This did trickle down to my appointment interactions though.|The minute you walk into your office you feel welcomed, everyone seems happy! The entire staff including Dr Patel have always been patient and understanding and teaching me what is going on with my body. I would recommend Dr Patel and her staff to anyone that is looking to feel better and healthy again.|Dr. Patel and the care team was excellent in all the services they provided. I was clearly explained about the condition, what is causing it and the best line of treatment possible to mitigate the issue and also prevent further complications in the future. Dr. Patel was very patient and spent enough time which is unfortunately becoming a rarity in the medical profession nowadays. I would highly recommend her practice!|Dr. Patel thoroughly listened and provided many options for treatment, taking the time to explain each one. She immediately addressed the issue and made me feel comfortable in her care. I am thankful for my visit.|Dr. Patel was wonderful, she listened to my issues and discussed a way forward. She didn't rush me or make me feel like she didn't have time to hear my problems. I look forward to a great patient/doctor relationship to help my back problems from here on out.|I have been going to see Dr. Patel for years and to this day she always gives me straight answers with amazing explanations on what is actually going on with my body. If ever there is a set back the team at this facility is great and responsive on getting you the proper care. Thanks so much for all that you do....Peter Ger...

column40:
I really thought Apico would be a great fit for me. I had an appointment it went well, so I thought. He prescribed a medication to take at night. I definitely explained to him that I needed something to take during the day that would relieve my pain and still be able to function. I called the office several times trying to find out if he could send something over to the pharmacy. It was extremely difficult when all I got was this mailbox is full no one ever pick up the phone the whole day! Thursday 12/19/24. The next morning I received a voicemail, "hi this message is for (my name) I got a voicemail from you and I'm returning your call if you still have concerns give us a call back at 855-".
Never said who she was or where she was calling from. Left me the same number I've been calling with the full mailbox. So I called on Friday morning a few times finally Bree answered with her nonchalant, I don't care about your pain attitude. "I'll send him a message and if he responds I'll get back to you". I'm not feeling like family. So I called back in the afternoon spoke with a very sweet young lady who said yes he responded and said I should ice it or use heat. I've been using all my tools in the arsenal, nothing has worked. That was the purpose in calling the doctor! Is it all offices in DE that have staff that don't answer phone calls/messages or respond in a professional manner. I'm done I've canceled my appointments and I'll find an office that I can contact and the staff is professional. Maybe he's used to patients that just want drugs, you can't treat patients with actual pain like they don't matter.|Dr Abdallah has been great for me, have been working with him for the past two years. Placed a pain stimulator for my back and leg pain. I've had no problems with the stimulator and my pain has decreased significantly. I personally recommend Dr Abdallah for your pain management program.|I can't begin to tell everyone how happy I feel coming to Apico ! Their entire staff are amazing ! I am so glad Ann Maresca took the time on a late Friday evening to help me with my issues. Ann along with Dr A got me the help I needed in a bad time for me . Don't look for anywhere else Apico will help you or any of your loved one's in a kind professional manner.|The staff is always very professional and courteous. Dr.Abdullah always takes time and listens to my concerns without making me feel rushed. Highly recommend this office!|Dr Abdallah and his entire staff are amazing! They go above and beyond for their patients. Pleasant, friendly,  caring,and compassionate are just a few of the words  to describe everyone.
Dr A is incredible, and so understanding.  I highly recommend Apico pain management to anyone who need them!|Dr. Abdullah and staff are wonderful to work with. They are all compassionate, friendly professionals, who are very attentive to your needs. A new patient, they made me feel very much at ease like I had been working with them for years. Dr Abdallah's vast experience with many forms of pain management make him a great choice for improving one's quality of life.|I have no complaints so far and Sonia really listens and doesn't get up in arms if you ask questions or ask about a different treatments. Since I moved here I have been pleasantly surprised at the healthcare I've been receiving. Please keep up the good work.|What an awesome team of Doctors. Dr Abdallah, Jasmine, and Sonya are the best at helping you feel yourself again. What a great experience with out and hassles. Definitely recommend this practice to anyone who needs help.

column40:
Dr. Graham is very good at her job! She takes the time to explain things and she doesn't beat around the bush. I have had a very pleasant experience at her practice.|Two years ago, I visited for the first time, and my initial evaluation wasn't done by an MD, but by a nurse practitioner named Heather Graham. For the first time, she told me that my PCP-prescribed pain medication, Hydrocodone APAP 10-325 (one every 6 hours as needed), would be replaced with a 24-hour pill. Without getting to know me, she switched my medication to Morphine 20mg, to be taken every 4 hours as needed. The result was that I was left with only one pill that caused me to sleep for nearly 18 hours straight.

My husband and I returned to the office to inform them of this, and once again, we were seen by the same nurse practitioner. She then put me back on Hydrocodone APAP 10-325, but I was never contacted by the office to check on my condition after the medication switch. It felt as though their primary concern was the money I was paying, not my well-being.

On two separate occasions, I was scheduled for a lower back injection (nerve block) at the office. One month after the procedure, I was charged $600.00, but I was never informed in advance of the cost. It wasn't until my next appointment that they told me about the balance. The injection was performed by an MD specialist, but unfortunately, it didn't help alleviate any of my lower back pain.

In September 2023, after a year, I underwent a urine drug test I got the specimen but, I observed the cup didn't have any name. The clerk was rushing me because I was the last patient that day and they was ready to close. Because the clerk was an a rush situation she scheduled me for the appointment for October and made me to leave immediately that evening.

In the next appointment I went by mistake to the previous location and when I saw the place closed I called the office and they gave me the new address location but that was impossible to get on time. I arrived 15 minutes late due to a change in location from the original office to Blue Hen, and when I explained the situation, they refused to accept my explanation. They made me reschedule for November without any understanding or empathy, and during the process, the staff was laughing and making fun of me.

When I finally returned for my appointment, I was met with laughter from the staff. Nurse Practitioner Heather Graham informed me when I got in her office, that my drug test had come back positive for a controlled substance. I immediately requested that the test be rechecked or taken by blood work, as I had nothing to hide. To my surprise, the NP had already shared my test results with everyone before I even arrived at the facility. Then Mrs. Graham told me that I could not longer continue as a patient at Clear Way Pain Solutions, and she also said: that " maybe if I'm honest I will find another place to go for pain management." That was a very offensive, sad and embarrassing situation I had never had in my life. As a patient or as a professional in 26 years working as a RN.

After leaving her office, I went to the restroom, and from there, I overheard the NP discussing my situation in the clerk station where both staff and other patients could hear. This was a clear violation of HIPAA laws.

I had never used any substances that would cause a positive result on a drug test. While I have many medical conditions, I have never taken anything that would trigger a positive reading on a drug screen. Mrs. Graham never gave me the opportunity to defend myself as a patient, she could assess me and repeat the Lab work but she just said that's the policy, then I walked out from her office and immediately went to the restroom then I was able to heard Mrs. Graham laughing and talking in loud voice to the staff about me; mentioned my name so loud enough that I could hear everything from the restroom.

That situation was really hard for me that I started getting very depressed. I'm not recommend "CLEAR WAY PAIN SOLUTIONS" to anyone because you will not be treated with respect and dignity which anyone deserves to be treated. Without having in consideration the fact of race, religion or sexual preference.|Dr. A is great and communicates well, the thing that makes me drop give three stars at this moment is the check in process. They text you 2/3 days prior to your appointment and talk about check in now for your appointment. After you spend like 10/15 minutes checking in. You get to the office and they say you're not checked in and you have to repeat all of that over again. Very frustrating and very inconvenient. But my doctor is good.|They were punctual. No hassle with filling out forms upon arrival due to the use of the portal for completing your sign in prior to arrival. The doctor is very experienced and takes the time to explain everything. He even gave me a copy of my diagnosis for future reference and my personal file. He is also monitoring my previous surgery which has not returned after his treatment. Totally satisfied with my medical treatment.|Sadly had a very disappointing experience with a nurse. Even when the conversation was not even with her , she decided to the conversation with an attitude and rudeness. Very unprofessional and on top of that the Dr. Decided to speak about in front of 4 other patients, extremely unprofessional. After that while trying to check out with the front desk and cancel other appointments,she once again tried to interrupt the conversation and add her unprofessional attitude and conduct, all this in front of other patients. I did apologize to the young lady that checks you in and out , while she was trying to do her job the nurse decided to come to the front desk and escalate a situation that could of been avoided if she wouldn't interrupt a conversation between other people that dod noy include her. Unfortunately the Dr also was very unprofessional and cross the line when he tried to speak to me about the situation,out loud in front of other patients trying to check out or in.|I found the professionalism, Customer Service, staff  outstanding.   Dr. Ahmed attentive and caring.  This was first visit and extremely encouraging for possible pain solutions.|Doctor Lopez was in no hurry and listened to every word intensely.In my 60years he is one of a few doctors that genuinely cares about his patients. I would not
hesitate to recommend him to any one needing a Doctor in pain management.|I have had good experiences with the doctors and staff in the Dover, DE location. Everyone listened closely to what i had to say or ask and for the most part i was satisfied with the interactions. They did their best to address an issue I had and explain what had happened.

Dr. Abdullah has a very gentle touch during the procedures. The staff is friendly and helpful. To make comparisons of the injection procedures pain is usually extremely uncomfortable. However, Dr. Abdullah manages to make the experience almost pain-free. Always a positive atmosphere. And this practice really has excellent bedside manners and listens to their patients symptoms. And adjusts the treatment protocol, as needed to reduce any unwanted side effects.|I can't express enough how much I truly think that this practice is the best in the state.  The staff goes above and beyond assisting patients.  The staff never "brushes" anyone off if they call in with any questions or help dealing with insurance companies/pharmacies. Dr. A & Erica always take their time to listen to a patient and I feel, they truly care about each and every person that walks into their office.   This is the only practice I know where they listen and explain everything.  It has been my experience with other doctors where the doctor sees a patient for like 30 seconds, leave the room to see next patient while leaving the nurse or other assistant to explain/review everything else or the doctor will just give you a brochure to you to read making you feel like they don't really care about their patients but this NEVER happens at this practice. I purposely tell them everything during my visits as I value their opinion more than they know and honestly I follow all their advice & recommendations.  I can't stop recommending this practice enough!|I'd like to give a big shout out to Dr. Abdallah and the APICO team. I was referred to his practice after a car accident to help with my recovery. column3:
At Delaware Orthopaedic Specialists, we stand as the only completely sub-specialized and fellowship-trained orthopaedic practice in Delaware. Dr. Selina Y. Xing brings exceptional expertise in pain management to our distinguished team.

Specialized Care for Superior Results

Unlike general orthopaedic surgeons who practice across multiple areas, our physicians focus intensively on their chosen specialties. This concentrated approach allows us to perform higher volumes of specific procedures, which research has proven leads to better patient outcomes. Our Middletown facility offers comprehensive care with on-site diagnostics and physical therapy services, making treatment convenient and accessible for all patients. We provide:

  • Expert pain management solutions

  • Comprehensive diagnostic services

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • On-site physical therapy

Our practice philosophy is simple: We Are Specialists — better surgeons, better patient outcomes. Visit Dr. Selina Y. Xing at Delaware Orthopaedic Specialists at 252 Carter Dr, Middletown, DE 19709, or call us at +1 302-655-9494 to schedule your consultation.
column11: DOS is unique as the only completely sub-specialized and fellowship-trained orthopaedic practice in Delaware. When choosing an orthopaedic surgeon, looking for one who specializes in the problem that you are experiencing is important. Our Doctors education and training was specialized to their chosen area of expertise. Unlike general orthopaedic surgeons who do a little bit of everything, our specialists do a lot of one particular thing. This allows our physicians to perform a higher volume of surgery within their specialty. Studies have proven that physicians with larger volumes in a particular specialty have better results. It's the focus of our practice: We Are Specialists -- better surgeons, better patient outcomes.

This practice was recommended to me by family who have had very successful experiences with DOS. My dad was a patient of Dr. Patel for years, I went with him to all of his appointments. The wait time was always very short! He has a great bedside manner. When I notified the office of my fathers passing, Dr. Patel took time out of his day to call and offer his condolences! I would definitely go to him in the future if ever I need a pain management doctor!|I have been a patient of Dr. Patel's for almost 2 years and I have no complaints. He is thoughtful, considerate, listens to ALL issues and answers questions. Since Covid, he and his staff have taken great care to ensure his patients are as protected as possible. Whenever I have needed injections, he is so gentle. Anyone looking for a wonderful, gentle and compassionate doctor should definitely call this practice. The office staff are friendly, helpful and professional with booking your appointments and handling various insurance issues.|I've been a patient of Dr Patel for over 3 years.  He is professional, understanding and listens to any concerns I have.  He's always on time and never rushes the visit which is not typical of most doctors.  He found a treatment that relieves my pain and allows me to do things I would otherwise not be able to do. His office staff is friendly, knowledgeable and resolves any insurance issues quickly.  I'm extremely grateful I found his practice.|I've been with Dr. Patel for about three years and only have had good to very good experiences with him and his staff.  On one occasion, I was in excruciating pain. When I called, he and his staff fit me in immediately for treatment.   That kind of service is typically unheard of!  Their attention to details and in follow-up have been great.|Dr. Patel is very kind, compassionate, and understanding. He has been my doctor for over 3 years, since I moved to Delaware. As soon as I walked in the staff was very friendly and did not rush me.  The wait time was short and when I went to the examine room the wait time to see Dr. Patel was even shorter!  He went through all my paperwork and images and we talked about a plan moving forward. I was not rushed or felt it was like a cattle call. Dr. Patel listens and makes very informative suggestions and allowed me to decide how to move forward. Because of my extensive back injury, he is in tune with my hesitation but willingness to try new things to help manage the pain in a safe and long term way. I am glad my insurance had his practice on their list!! Excellent Doctor with a great bedside manner and staff is always friendly.!! 5 stars all the way.

column40:
This man had me waiting over 6 months for no outcome or solution. I saw a NP there and she ended up quitting during my care and he didn't know anything about my condition and he didn't care either. He loves speaking over patients and offering dry needling but not actually surgery to fix the issue. My fingers are numb, I deal with constant pain, and now I have to add waiting on a new orthopedic surgeon to look at my neck.

The staff is great and very sweet but if you don't want to waste time and run around doing 12 weeks of physical therapy to end with being asked if you want another 6 weeks is absolute madness. Don't be like me - an idiot, and wait for this "doctor" to do something other than making your condition worse or drag you along. Now I feel like I'm looking down the barrel of a gun, waiting to see how long until I can't use my left hand.

After reading through the reviews it looks like most of the high rated ones are from car accidents. Do you get more money for those patients? Is that why you treated me different even though all my scans and MRIs and EMGs showed how badly I need surgery??

"Dr." Grossinger, you should retire and free the public of your ignorance.|From a view of having been a fellow area physician of 25 years, I can say with great confidence that Dr Steve is THE BEST!
Beyond being superbly experienced and knowledgeable, he is kind, gentle, and a consummate professional!
Injections that most of his peers generate much pain upon administering , Steve's practically go unnoticed..Yet they really truly work!! Especially his regen therapies .. He's AMAZING!!|He is such a wonderful doc. I have been in pain for a very long time. Saw doc after doc that gave me pills. Dr. Grossinger took the time to find the problem. I no longer have shooting pains in my back. The PRP shots were a miracle. The ladies at the front r so nice as well. U know when someone likes where they work.|Firstly, I never write reviews however, I have to share my experience with Dr Steven Grossinger and his staff.
From the moment you walk in, you're greeted (which is very important to me), it's a very warm and welcoming environment. I've been receiving care through two motor vehicle accidents and to say that it was extremely pleasant is an understatement. Dr G suggested that I started a series of epidural injections for the severe back pain and sciatica that I had been experiencing. Honestly, I was sooo nervous, afraid and also skeptical of if it would work or not. I've had 4 natural births, so the idea of me receiving injections in my back was pretty frightening.
Dr G and his staff made sure that I was well aware of what to expect, allowing me to make a clear and solid decision. Once I made the decision to move forward with the injections, his staff made me so comfortable, answering my million and one questions and just reassuring me that I was going to be ok... and they were right. I'm so happy that I made the decision to have them done. I'm actually able do things that I need to do now, like run errands and stand long enough to finish making dinner,
Although the circumstances were unfortunate, I'm thankful to God to have the care of Dr Steven Grossinger and his amazing staff.|Dr. Grossinger is one of the BEST doctors I have ever been to. He is not only professional but is kind and compassionate. I have never had such a supportive doctor. He also hires wonderful people. His staff is great and in particular I want to give a shout-out to Heather. She is a lovely person that is so patient. She has been very helpful with all my administrative needs. I was referred to this office by a friend and I, too, recommended it as well.|I am a Jersey Girl and have been with Dr. Steve Grossinger in 2008. He and his staff have always been kind, and gentle.  giving superb treatment.    It has always been like one big family affair......which is also healing. I have watched him grow in all the latest techniques, procedures, medicines, and a variety of holistic approaches.  He will critique in a specialized angle...Just For You......His staff all listens and takes time with you like you are the only one that matters.  You do not feel alone in your struggles. He is concerned with the littlest things. He can see the best possibilities and give you options. You have the freedom to make choices and suggestions too!!!
Dr. Steve is a Visionary.  Thank You everyone!  With love, Lori|Very good n respectful doctor. He willing to help. I just wanted to say thank so much for all your service!|Dr Grossinger; Always excellent care.   Watches especially how I'm progressing after post  traumatic, serious, 5 facial fractures and skull bleed with drainage of 1//20/2018. Still ongoing. Evaluates  med treatment before ordering refill. ( he knows how I feel about taking them )! Could not ask for better treatment and concern. This includes Shawn, his assistant and others who assist him, as well as front office girls.
Thank you all. Happy  Thanksgiving. Be lost without your care. Can not take marijuana or other drugs that mentally affect me. They are all aware of it and treat accordingly. Margaret Wagner

column3:
At Interventional Spine Pain Consultants, we provide personalized, comprehensive care for patients experiencing pain throughout the spine, from cervical to sacral regions. Our

Minimally Invasive Spinal Injection Therapy

is performed under precise x-ray guidance, allowing us to target specific nerves with medication that reduces inflammation and irritation, effectively alleviating pain in affected areas. Our physicians, Drs. Downing and Witherell, are both double board certified with over 40 combined years of experience in pain management. We specialize in treating various spinal conditions through our advanced injection techniques, offering patients non-surgical alternatives for pain relief. Our services include:

  • Targeted spinal injections

  • Comprehensive pain management

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • X-ray guided precision procedures

Visit our official website to learn more about how we can help you manage your spinal pain, or call us at (302) 437-1770. Our practice is conveniently located at 774 Christiana Rd, Suite 111, Newark, DE 19713.
column11: The physicians at Interventional Spine Pain Consultants provide personalized, comprehensive care for patients experiencing pain extending from the cervical through sacral regions of the spine. Treatment of the pain is provided through minimally invasive spinal injection therapy. Performed under x-ray guidance, medication is precisely placed around the specific nerve(s) to help reduce inflammation and irritation, thus reducing pain in the affected region(s). Both double board certified, Drs. Downing and Witherell have over 40 combined years of experience in the field of pain management using injection therapy.
column38: Pam Krim|Linda Natali|Shay Seaborne, CPTSD|Brenda Marciniszyn|Brenda Marciniszyn (I am Preacher)|Ashley|Janeka Peggy
column40:
Dr Witherell and staff are responsive to all communications and questions, in a very timely manner. Dr and Assistants have been caring and professional in my treatment.|ISPC has kept me moving for over 10 years!  Their compassion and skill with injections has kept me out of surgery. Not enough good words to express my gratitude!|Thank goodness for Dr. Peter Witherell! He treats me like an individual with individual needs, unlike many other professionals. This, despite my highly unusual case, which requires a unique and specific treatment plan that includes repeat Stellate Ganglion Blocks (SGBs) for relief from symptoms of Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS, also called "the suicide disease"), dysautonomia/POTS, and severe Complex PTSD from extreme Developmental Trauma, compounded by recent psychiatric and surgical abuse from the physicians I turned to for help.

I've seen Dr. Witherell about 8 times since October 2023. Each time he has *listened* and responded positively. He even performs the "Patel Pause" protocol devised by a prior pain specialist to help rebuild my sense of agency and safety in medicine.

Few pain specialists have been able to recognize and respond appropriately to my needs, so I am expecially thankful that Dr. Witherell is up for the job.

Oh, yes, and he sometimes sings a bit in the OR when we listen to bossa nova during the SGB procedure. Might as well make it fun!|I've had numerous surgeries on my lower back and cervical spine that left me with a different kind of pain.  I first saw Dr. Witherell in 2006 prior to surgery.  Since then I still need his expertise in managing my pain.  He is very friendly, very caring and compassionate, and excels in managing pain in any part of the spine.  I wouldn't go to anyone else for my pain management.|I have been seeing Dr. Witherell since 2006 when I first started getting back pain, sciatica, and arthritis-related pain.  He is an excellent doctor, friendly, a "knows what he's doing doctor" (and aren't we all looking for someone who knows what they're doing?)  Excellent care, very up-to-date on procedures for pain and a very good cordial.  I wouldn't go anywhere else.  He's a special specialist!|I waited 2 hours to see my doctor, my appointment time was 1:30 and I didn't see my doctor until 3:30. He argued with me when I asked how he came up with my diagnosis, and began getting defensive because he thought i was "doubting" him. No advice or comforting, just arguing. I will not be coming back.|Great place. Great staff. Always referring patients to this office.

To attend his
Attempting to lure you into attending any appointments the staff tries to get you to attend after your coverage has ended from your insurance provider please think about magnet therapy yes you with a helmet like device to solve your problems you must be delusional or the person asking you to do this is defrauding you of money for a alternative treatment Tyson left and moved on to the city you can blame Balu his employees never got much of a raise ever they quit and I have a great respect for them help me as a patient.   Tyson left like so many other people have and it's so sad sometimes employees didn't get compensation that was good enough for the effort they put into their careers with doctor Balu you can't keep using your employees and patients or they're going to move on to better medical providers.... I believe the churning of patients with continuous suggestions of useless procedures is purely about money.  Oh my gosh Tyson is gone from this practice and be prepared for whatever happens as you better believe that it's going to be worse than before Tyson and hopefully the rest of the staff doesn't have to quit to get a raise because they don't get raises but he takes extravagant trips thank everybody who suffered until the end|My experience with Dr: Balu has been northing but positive. He takes the time to address the situation. He has offered the best treatment and i an well pleased.
He has put a good team together and i would highly recommend if you need a pain management doctor.|Before coming to see Dr. Balu, my depression was so severe I would just want to sleep and my pain was extreme. Dr. Balu'scontinued care and his team are making such a wonderful difference in my overall health. It's amazing.|I saw Dr Balu for about 6 months. I personally feel like he didn't really help me or my pain. He was persistent with me PAYING OUT OF POCKET( he told me insurance wouldn't cover it) for some sort of stem cell therapy. I'm on a fixed income and could not afford it. He said I was a good candidate for medical marijuana to control my pain and anxiety but it would cost $300 to go to the seminar and pay for the card. So, I had to go without pain treatment until it got bad enough that I had to go to an urgent care center AFTER I was directed to do so by a member of the physical therapy staff. I was forthcoming with all information from the urgent care visit with Dr Balu. He was upset and called his therapist into the room and verbally reprimanded him in front of me (I have anxiety and PTSD and confrontations are a trigger). After, Dr Balu seemed upset with me and told me I had to chose which place I wanted treatment from...his or the urgent care center. I'm still in pain and stopped seeing Dr Balu. I was even directed to his mental health specialist for my anxiety, Dr Dave. He was WONDERFUL but medication was limited and with life-long anxiety issues, I know what works and what doesn't. I tried them all. I was put on a medication that helped some but not enough. No one seemed to care to address the lack of sleep from the anxiety. I wasn't happy and can't really recommend Dr Balu. It seemed to be a practice of "all about the money". Dr Dave was EXCELLENT, though.|Dr Balu and all the staff medical and administrative care deeply for all their patients. Dr Balu offers many options and treatments to fit your medical needs. Genuinely cares about your healthcare needs and companionate. I can't imagine going to or trusting another physician with my healthcare relief. I was injured 16 years ago and have suffered many years until Dr Balu offered more than the deal with it attitude or just offering temporary relief. Highly recommend Dr Balu.

column2: Interventional Spine Pain Consultants - James E. Downing, MD
column3:
At Interventional Spine Pain Consultants, we provide specialized pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. James E. Downing, MD. A Delaware native and Tulane University Medical School graduate, Dr. Downing brings over 20 years of experience in interventional adult pain management to our practice. He is board certified in anesthesiology with sub-specialty certification in pain management, having completed his residency and fellowship at both Tulane and The Ochsner Clinic. Since founding our practice in 2003 with Dr. Witherell, we've been dedicated to helping patients manage chronic pain effectively and compassionately.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a range of specialized interventional treatments including:

  • Advanced spine pain management procedures

  • Personalized treatment plans for chronic pain

  • Minimally invasive interventional techniques

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations and consultations

Dr. Downing maintains affiliations with Spine Care Delaware and Delaware Outpatient Center for Surgery, serving as medical director at Spine Care Delaware while also contributing to the State of Delaware Health Advisory. Our team is committed to providing compassionate, patient-centered care in a supportive environment at our Newark location. Visit Interventional Spine Pain Consultants or call us at (302) 437-1770 to schedule your consultation at our office located at 774 Christiana Rd, Suite 111, Newark, DE 19713.
column11: A native of Delaware, Dr. James E. Downing, M. D. is a graduate of Tulane University Medical School of Medicine. He completed his residency and fellowship in anesthesiology and pain research at both Tulane and The Ochsner Clinic. He is board certified in anesthesiology and sub-specialty board certified in pain management. He has over 20 years' experience in interventional adult pain management. In private practice since 2003, when he and Dr. Witherell founded Interventional Spine Pain Consultants, PA, Dr. Downing has affiliations with Spine Care Delaware and Delaware Outpatient Center for Surgery, both ambulatory surgery centers. Dr. Downing is a medical director of Spine Care Delaware and a member of the State of Delaware Health Advisor...

I am grateful for Dr. Mehdi and his kind staff at the Pain Center. I was referred there by my primary physician and a bit unsure as to what to expect. column3:
At Sussex Pain Relief Center, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions through our team of board-certified physicians.

Advanced Diagnostic Approach

We utilize evidence-based techniques to precisely identify the exact nerves causing your pain, allowing us to treat discomfort at its source rather than merely masking symptoms. Our multidisciplinary team includes specialists in various fields, ensuring a holistic approach to pain management. We offer a wide range of interventional pain techniques including:

  • Targeted nerve blocks

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Regenerative medicine options

Located in Georgetown, Delaware, our facility brings together anesthesiologists, pain management physicians, chiropractors, physiotherapists, psychologists, and sports medicine physicians under one roof. This collaborative approach allows us to develop personalized treatment plans addressing both the physical and psychological aspects of chronic pain. Visit Sussex Pain Relief Center or call us at +1 302-514-7246 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward lasting pain relief.

column40:
I am writing to express my heartfelt gratitude and appreciation for the exceptional care and services I received at the Sussex Pain Relief Center. Your team's dedication to addressing my back pain has improved my quality of life.
I was met with professionalism and genuine compassion from the moment I walked through your doors. The entire team took the time to thoroughly understand my condition, listen to my concerns, and develop a personalized treatment plan tailored to my needs. I was particularly impressed by the attention to detail and the comprehensive approach your specialists took to ensure I felt confident and informed throughout the process.
The treatments I received have been life-changing. What once seemed like an insurmountable challenge--constant back pain--has now become a manageable condition thanks to your expertise. The cutting-edge techniques and the warm and encouraging atmosphere made all the difference in my recovery journey.
I want to acknowledge Dr. Antony, Dr. Elmati, and Candice Roberts, APRN, for their exceptional care and dedication. Their expertise, encouragement, and kindness have left a lasting impression on me.
I appreciate your commitment to excellence in patient care. I am truly grateful for the relief and renewed sense of hope that your team has provided. Please feel free to share my story with others who may benefit from your outstanding services.
With sincere appreciation,
John D. Bails, CWO USN-Ret.|I went to the office 3 weeks ago to get in to see someone. I am new to the area, and they said they were taking new patients. I did my paperwork in my car and then handed it in. I have not even received one call from them. I dont know how professional a place this is. When I called to check on things, I was rushed off the phone after whomever the woman was that answered the phone, telling me, "Someone will call you." Still nothing! I am very disappointed so far.|If you are referred here ask for another option. Dr. Anthony is always "running a little behind" usually having a 60-90 minute wait. But if your 15 minutes late for your appointment you will be rescheduled no excuses. Some of the staff are rude and have no empathy as this is a place of business. I've been coming here about 6 months and still experiencing pain which also tells me they are only after money they make for constant appointments. I wish I had chosen alternative care.|I've been going to them for years. Yeah it took a long while to find the Right Health insurance then the Right Doctor and the Right Information to figure what is going on in my back and hip with my pain.

Dr Anthony has figured out where my nerve is in my back that has caused me to go numb from the waist down.

Just waiting on the right insurance company to help pay for the work on my back.|It has been many years since I have seen Dr Antony and still get terribly upset thinking about the horrendous way I was treated. I had been seeing her for pain management and had tried many different injections as well as medications. I have MS and suffer from debilitating pain in my legs. The pain had become unbearable and, when I called her office, I was told she could get me in at another location the next day for additional injections. When I arrived I overheard her heated conversation with the office staff about my records not being there. She went ahead and gave me injections and right away I noticed she did them in a totally different location. I received zero pain relief from them. When I called the office and suggested that she may have done the injections in the wrong area she adamantly argued that she DID have my file at the time she did the procedure and it wasn't done in a different location. I continued to suffer  and I returned for my regular scheduled appointment with Dr Antony.   I was hurting and desperate when I told her that my medication wasn't helping me enough to function through the pain. She got angry with me and told me she didn't have time to prescribe something else. She said she had too many appointments, was overworked  and was a single mother and never got home until late to her daughter. She practically forced me out of her office. I left in tears with no prescription of any kind. Needless to say, my pain and my blood pressure shot sky high. My primary care doctor had to admit me to the hospital. I was screaming in pain and obviously suffering from withdrawal from the medications I had ran out of.  When I was discharged I was told by Dr Antony's office that I was no longer a patient. She was working with another pain doctor at the time and later went on to open her own practice. I should have gone to the medical board but just wanted to forget the whole nightmare. Please, please, please, do not trust this woman with your well-being. She should not be allowed to practice medicine. I would never have given her one star but couldn't leave a review without doing so.|My name is Pam Ferguson. I have been a patient of Dr Antony for almost 2 years. I am pleased with my care. Dr Antony spends time to listen to your concerns and offers treatment that meet your individual needs.
The support staff are great.
Wait time is short|I have been seeing Dr Antony since 2016 and have never had a problem with her or her staff. She is a very thorough doctor. If I need something she and her staff are always there to assist me with anything I need. When I had to switch from my old doctor to her and Sussex Pain Relief Center, I was really worried. Once I got a chance to see her and see how thorough she is all my worries and apprehension went away. She has helped me to be able to lead a somewhat normal life. I would definitely recommend her to my family and friends. Thank You Doctor Antony for all your help.|I left a raving review for this place after my first 40 days with them. I was thrilled to finally be close to pain free, thanks to One epidural shot.
However, soon after that when my epidural wore off & I was back in pain,  I began to completely understand why there are so many terrible reviews.
They don't care about patients at all in this clinic. In all seriousness I don't know how they are still open. I was dropped by them because I did my excursises at home instead of in a germ filled physical therapy office.
I mean we are dealing with a pandemic right now. Some of us can't take the chances that healthy people can. The patient Coordinator is probably the worst I've ever seen. She shouldn't be involved with patients at all.
Dr. Anthony is all I've read negative reviews on. Maybe the other Drs aren't as bad.
All I can say is be prepared for anything if you decide to look for pain relief in these uncaring individuals.

column40:
While I was a patient there it was impossible to get prior authorizations from the staff. My doctors were great. But when support staff won't follow through, there is an issue. I spoke with both of my doctors numerous times about my use of medical marijuana, but not one time did they list it in my chart. Now I've moved to a state where it is illegal and they have cut off my medication because I can't get any assistance from the office staff in having my doctor there, send my new doctor a letter that I was authorized to use MM. It's not right that I now get to suffer because people don't want to do their job.|This is probably the worst Dr's office that I've ever been to.  First of all, when I was checking in the receptionist gave me an attitude because I didn't have the new patient paperwork with me.  I told her that I didn't have access to a printer which is why I was there 20 minutes early like I was told when I scheduled my appointment.  She then proceeded to give me my paperwork along with a cup to do a urine test.  I was cool with that,  but was not given any direction on where to go or what to do with it.  Then when I was finally able to see the dr, she came in and handed me my MRI disc's and said,  I couldn't look at those because my laptop wasn't working.  She never once asked me about my back injury.  Never did any kind of examination or anything Never asked how it happened,  what kind of issues I'm having or anything.  She just wanted to schedule me for an injection.  I will definitely not recommend this place.|Well, I have to say my back got reasonably better after some shots - However I've have spent more time resolving billing issues and applied payments than I ever did at the doc.  This causing more anxiety and anger than I needed while still recovering - just got my latest bill today - haven't seen the doc in 10 months.  This was NOT an insurance issue - just their own internal billing - never do what they say, misapply payments and so on.  So in short - I'm never going back.  1/3/2017 Update - and the bills continue and have been sent to collections - about 35 bucks - they have no clue - go ANYWHERE else you can!|The doctors at this practice are the best at what they do. If you are TRULY in severe pain they will get you what you need without jumping through a bunch of hoops. The office staff is nice, friendly and very professional.  Do not bother going here if you are a doctor shopper or a junkie. They are legitimate doctors who treat legitimate patients.|The doctor was way off course from the first visit.
