column3:
At Interventional Spine Pain Consultants, we are led by Dr. Peter Witherell, MD, a distinguished pain management specialist with over 20 years of experience treating spine-related pain in adults. Dr. Witherell graduated from Thomas Jefferson University Medical School in Philadelphia and completed both his anesthesiology residency and specialized fellowship training in pain management at the prestigious Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center. He is board certified in anesthesiology with sub-specialty board certification in pain management, and has been recognized as a "Top Doc" in his field by his peers.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

Our practice focuses on interventional treatments for chronic pain conditions, including:

  • Specialized back pain injections

  • Nerve ablation procedures

  • Comprehensive spine pain management

  • Personalized treatment plans

Founded in 2003 by Dr. Witherell and his colleague Dr. James Downing after Dr. Witherell served as director of the Christiana Care Center for Pain Management, our practice is committed to providing compassionate, effective care for patients suffering from chronic pain. Visit our official website to learn more about our approach to pain management or call us at (302) 437-1770. We're conveniently located at 774 Christiana Rd, Suite 111, Newark, DE 19713.
column11: Dr. Peter Witherell, M. D. graduated from Thomas Jefferson University Medical School in Philadelphia. He completed his residency in anesthesiology as well as specialized fellowship training in pain management at the Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center. He is board certified in anesthesiology with sub-specialty board certification in pain management. Dr. Witherell has been providing interventional treatment of spine related pain in adults for over 20 years. He has been recognized by his colleagues by being named a "Top Doc" in pain management. He also served as director of the Christiana Care Center for Pain Management until 2003 when he formed Interventional Spine Pain Consultants, PA with his colleague, Dr. James Downing.

Was treated by Dr Anne with no results except the money gone that I gave them. The receptionists and back office are ruthless. Not friendly at all
Yes, and as others say, I was charged almost 200$ for obtaining my records.

Total disgrace,  money grabbing Richards!|Thank the Lord I relocated and was forced to see another doctor who shed a whole lot of light on things. Otherwise I'd probably still be receiving this inadequate/ineffective/inaccurate/dragged out treatment. I came to Beneck with injuries from being in an accident and he passed me around his office as if I was a dollar sign for all the doctors he works with. He asked on multiple occasions where I'm going to physical therapy and when I [again] told him where, he [again] informed me that he has a "really good physical therapist I could see here" and didn't seem to like it when I declined. Also didn't seem too thrilled that I didn't go to him for the injection I had. I went to his chiropractor 3 days a week for 2 months and I don't know why. What chiropractors do don't treat what I am diagnosed with - as I have been told by my current doctor. Acupuncture, physical therapy,  psychiatrist, chiropractor, X-ray, 3 MRI's a CAT scan... He sent me to everyone! Nothing even flirted with the idea of relieving my pain. He gave me a bunch medications that did literally NOTHING. I'm not sure if he thought that I was faking an injury because I'm young or simply wasn't the doctor I needed to be seeing. He expressed multiple times during my visits that I do not need surgery. 3 visits and and an in-depth explanation of my MRI with my new doctor, I have a date scheduled for surgery. This should have been taken care of by him during the 5 months he was "treating" me. Beneck failed me. I'm currently losing a lot of money because of his failure. Really dropped the ball here. I DO NOT RECOMMEND! I am very curious to know how much money they made off of me to do absolutely nothing.

Also- Beware: DO NOT MISS APPOINTMENTS! The curly haired lady who does the PT and/or the receptionist for the chiropractor in Glasgow medical center will make it known how annoyed with you she is if you do. Her body language, lack of eye contact and the "oh wow you made it in today" attitude was discouraging to say the least. She tried to schedule me at the end of the day instead of my normal late morning appointments because it was more convenient for her if I were to miss it. She made coming in very uncomfortable for me. FYI, I missed 4 appointments in 5 months... Appointments that ended up being a complete waste of my time but thanks for shaming me.

Aimee is the only good thing about this place. She deserves a raise.

*** This is my first time reviewing anything; Restaurant, book, amazon purchase, TripAdvisor.... a doctor office is my FIRST review. That might give you a little insight into how bad this place screwed me ***|This review is for my experience with the Dover location. This oganization cares more about money than your pain or concerns. I was referred here by another doctor for a test. I was told information was sent here and to wait for them to call. 9 days went by....no call. So I called and got someone on phone who had a poor attitude from the start. It was like I was a bother. She confirmed that my referral was left on someone's desk. She told me she needed management approval to schedule my apt because it was an auto accident policy from out of state.she told me that she would call me back next day. Well I waited till noon next day...no call so I called. She told me was still working on it and she would call me back before end of day. 5 pm came ....no call. Next day noon. No call back. So I called. She was very rude and really could care less about my pain or concerns. She was only concerned about insurance coverage. I asked her how much procedure was and if necessary I could pay cash. She still would not schedule apt without management approval of my insurance coverage. It appears to me that this organization is only concerned with money and has a lack of care and compassion for your pain or concerns. The front office staff needs training in patient care 101. column40:
Dr Kim is very abrupt in his manner but if you can handle that, he is fantastic. He won't lie to make you feel better, he won't beat around the bush. He is an excellent Dr and personally I would rather have honest than "nice." I am really happy to have found him when we moved to DE. EDIT: After a year of seeing Dr Kim I like him even more. As he relaxes with you as a patient his sense of humor starts to show and you can have very good conversations with him. Once again, I am very happy to have found him.|Dr Philip Kim has given me back my life. I couldn't do anything before I met Dr. Kim. Just sitting at a desk would cause me mind blowing pain. I was stuck in bed most of the time for well over 6-9months. Gradually I began to feel better and better. I am a functional and VERY happy person again. Having lost everything due to pain, no words can describe how grateful I am to have met Dr Kim. Go see him and let him help you. Live and enjoy your life again.|I was a LOYAL compliant patient..... for 15+ years. Went every month, and never missed a random drug screen. Then a couple months ago I had to have surgery. I discussed with Dr. Kim about him being ok with my surgeon giving me pain meds, and he said he was ok with that. But when it came time for my discharge, Dr. Kim did a 180, and refused to allow my surgeon to prescribe stronger pain meds (Dr. Kim  said I shouldn't need them for longer than a week......from a TOTAL KNEE REPLACEMENT!). Dr. Kim then said I needed to get off of ALL narcotics (which I have been taking for 15+ years for chronic pain......and HE had prescribed for me), called me an addict, and refused to write ANY more prescriptions for me.......basically forcing me to go COLD TURKEY, and making me go through withdrawal!
ANY doctor is better than Dr. Kim. He is uncaring, and incompetent, and should be sued for the emotional and physical pain he has put me through! Run in the opposite direction, and tell others to go to another doc!|I thought I was the only one who came out of his office in tears.  His staff was apologizing for my bad visit.. he wasnt even the doctor i normally see, he looked at my folder and said to me i see you had surgery for the 4th time so since i had surgery what do i want he freak out because my other doctor perscribed me 5mg  pain medicine  and said we do not do this at my office. I was deliberately put down for taking the medication made me feel like i was the one who did something wrong and hollered at me, something i really am not used to especially when I was in alot of pain and i left crying. He did do 9 injections on me though before my surgery,  my money was good enough then, hes a medicare scammer and will be reported. NOBODY should have to go through that kind of abuse  from any DOCTOR, if wants to call himself one. Please find another doctor since apparently he dont need patients..|For those of you that are having a hard time with Dr. Kim, I urge you to call his partner Dr. Michael Fishman .  He is located in Exton, Pa. but he is well worth the drive.  I think he has another location but not sure where.  His staff is fantastic.
Dr. Maryum Rafiqure is another colleague  of Dr. Fishman.  She practices in Middletown and Milford, De.  They both are great pain management doctors,  have a great personality and listen to their patients.  I no longer leave the office in tears, nor do I suffer from anxiety the day before my visit   Both offices have a great staff.|Great experience with Dr. Kim, he fixed a fractured vertebrate that was left untreated by my spine surgeon. Yes he is direct and to the point but I would rather have that then fake concern. He gave me my life back|If I could give zero stars I definitely would. He has the worst bedside manner I have ever come in contact with. Please do not go to this doctor. column40:
I been going to this place for a few months now
They are very nice in the office and the doctor is very helpful and understanding. He's also good at what he's doing. The only thing I don't like is that they don't answer the phone or text messages.
Or call back. That's the only let down.|Always a great experience here. Everyone at every aspect of my visits are professional and personable. This is very important for me specifically because I need to see them regularly. Literally every person has been helpful. Not only do I trust them but I also like them and look forward to my appointment. Which, in my experience, is rare.|I've been living & coping with chronic pain for 26+ years, ever since the day I had a tragic "slip & slam" at work, in 1997. The injuries I sustained, during that unexpected fall, forever changed our lives as I gradually got worse over time, until I was in danger of becoming paralyzed from my neck down. See, I was pregnant with my youngest son when I fell and we were rushed to the ER/ED immediately afterwards because I went into premature labor. I couldn't get X-rays, have any tests done, or go to PT because I was pregnant. The nurses/ doctors told me to wait until 9 months after I gave birth, to allow my body to go back into its rightful place. By 2002, I had emergency surgery/ spinal fusion on my neck, they found my c5-c6 disc had actually ruptured & lodged in my spinal cord, so I became disabled by the time I was 33. Since then, I've seen many doctors, had endless tests & blood work done, been on meds, had procedure, gone to PT, ETC you name it... BUT none of the doctors I've seen really listened to me. I always felt like I was "just another patient" to call into their patient room, while they write out my scripts, and then leave.....

That was until I started going to CIP&S in 2019! They listen to you, they answer your questions without rushing you along or out the door, they really care & give you the undivided attention you need to discuss your issues. Not only that but they're extremely organized on how they run their practice. You don't have to wait 7 hrs, pacing in the waiting room, to see your doctor- like one practice I went to for years!

On my very 1st/ consult appt, at CIP&S, I learned more about my condition and how they wanted to treat me, to help lesson my pain and deal with my problems areas directly, then all the years with other doctors added together. I cried, I literally cried in front of my new doctor(s) when they were explaining everything to me in detail, things I didn't know- that I should have known, and... I didn't even have to ask them first. I adore all the doctors, PA's, receptionists, etc that I've met so far- from the Silverside Office and the Pike Creek Office.

Some procedures are done right there and the premise, which is nice too. You can meet each member of their "team" on their website and find out a little about each person and where they earned their degrees, which is always helpful too.

They actually shut down from noon til 1 pm every day, so all personal can enjoy their lunch together or go out, and take a well needed break. I have never seen this, at any doctor's office before, and I think that's awesome management to have.

They also have a answering system for all live "chats" or calls but everything is done by text. Once you are connected to the area you requested from #1-10, the live chat operator will come on and you'll proceed with texting, to chat about whatever you need to ask or tell. I especially like this because you can always refer back to what was said in your communication, and chat without having to write it all out quickly or have to constantly repeat yourself in the process- like when you are talking on the phone.

So yeah, I'd give more than 5 stars if I could. I've never been happier to go to my monthly appts... No more waiting forever to be seen- for less than 5 minutes with your doctor- and they take all your concerns seriously!

If they're accepting new patients and you are dissatisfied with your current pain management doctor &/or treatment... then text "HELLO" to make your "new patient" appointment today. You will not be disappointed... I  found the perfect doctor's office that has doctor's who really care about you and your well-being.

God speed my friend...
~Debbi~|I have been service by this office for several years. Deb who works the front desk and very proficient. Very pleasant and helpful. She goes above and beyond to assist patients. I had the pleasure of meeting Koji a medical assistant with the best bedside manners ever. He is patient, precise and very thorough. His customer service is excellent. This practice offers a group of MD, PA & NP that specialize in pain management. Dr. Duffy, Dr. Stern & Chris are the best  just to mention couple. Overall I am very satisfied with services.|I have been getting relief from this practice for over 10 years. I have seen many of the physicians, chiropractors and PT specialists and they have all been excellent. From receptionists to nurses, you won't find better people. I'm a former nurse anesthetist and now a patient. I get epidurals and blocks every few months and they have saved me from more pain than you can imagine. I can truly say that they have helped me live a life not bedridden!! Special shout out to Dr Nasr, Dr Woo, Chris and Eli.|They tried to force me to take medication that didn't agree with my body and it made my pain worse|Had one appt. In Middletown.  After that, couldn't reach office and wouldn't return calls or request for call back.  Guess they don't need patients.|This practice wanted me to seek chiropractic treatment and PT for my pain relief w mild meds for pain!   This was suggested w/o imaging to consult!!!  Turns out I need neck surgery and have spinal compression. Good thing I didn't go to a chiropractor!!!!

AVOID AVOID AVOID!

column40:
I'm 23 years old, I came in 6 months ago with extreme jaw pain and I was always fatigued. I thought my fatigue was due to my anemia how ever getting my jaw looked at they figured out my airways were small and that I was actually waking up several times through out the night. In conclusion I wasn't getting good quality sleep in a long time. I had x rays done and saw that my left side of my jaw bone was starting to wear down. I immediately was given a plan set up for treatment and I got a day time appliance and a night time appliance and I started to see a difference. Now 6 months today I don't wear my day time anymore I still wear my night time and I don't even wake up to use the bathroom at night! I wake up refreshed in the mornings. I have a routine now of going to bed at a set time! My life quality is so much better now that my jaw doesn't hurt and I can eat normally without pain AND not be fatigued everyday. I recommend this place to everyone I know! The staff here is so friendly and very welcoming!|Dr. Lake is absolutely phenomenal! He worked with my little guy today and the difference in his overall mood and well-being after just one session has been incredible. My little one has always been a bit resistant to new treatments, but Dr. Lake's gentle and caring approach put him completely at ease.

By the end of the day, my little guy even asked me, "Where is Dr. Lake? I like him." That kind of trust and connection speaks volumes about Dr. Lake's exceptional care and talent.

If you're looking for a provider who truly makes a difference in both physical and emotional well-being, I can't recommend Dr. Lake enough!

Thank you Dr. Lake|I had a 1-year follow-up appointment.  My sleep apnea has been resolved using the oral device and nasal surgery.  This was verified by a 2nd sleep study recently done by a different doctor to confirm resolution.  There was no way I was going to use a CPAP mask the way I normally sleep.  The device was not covered by insurance.  The staff have always been professional and helpful.  I met with Monica this time prior to meeting with Dr. Robinson and she was very friendly and helpful.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because at time of checkout I was told my visit was a $150 additional charge.  I was not expecting such a high fee for a 20 min visit.  But again, the doctor and staff are great, the device, along with the nasal surgery, resolved my sleep apnea.|I paid 5,000$ for them to tell me they won't unlock my jaw and they IF didn't get the treatment I would NEED surgery. To give me a retainer that made my jaw hurt like it was fractured. And for them to give me popsicle sticks to "help" unlock it. After telling them that I didn't want to continue they told me that I had to sign out of treatment for me to sit on a call for a half an hour to talk to someone for less than a minute. They are a scam and they do not want to help or fix anything. DO NOT go to the pain and sleep center.|I had to write a review after my experience with this office, in the hopes that others are able to find alternative offices for these services that are more patient-friendly and concerned about your health over making money.

I was referred here from the dentist for teeth grinding during sleep. The initial appointment was a teledoc appointment, where they ask you the same questions you already filled out on 3 different forms, and then recommend you for an in office consultation. They also signed me up for an at-home sleep study.

The consultation with the NP was fine - x-rays were done, and the NPs who took care of me were very kind, professional, and helpful. After the appointment, the office director, Dana, took me into her office to discuss a "treatment plan" which consisted of a custom mouth guard and some follow up appointments where they do x-rays again.

I was told this "plan" would cost $3000.00 with no guarantee of insurance coverage for reimbursement, and was asked to sign a contract to start it. There was absolutely NO indication prior to this what the cost and insurance coverage limitations would be, and there was no alternative options for consideration, except to be put on a payment plan with interest.

As soon as I told Office Manager Dana I couldn't afford that, her demeanor completely changed from kind and coercing to cold and disinterested. I was promptly charged the $300 for the appointment that day, and rushed out of the office. I had to ask the lady at the front desk to get her to come back out to the waiting room to give me the info for my follow-up appointment.

My follow-up appointment consisted of them: calling me 20 minutes early, then putting me on hold for 10 minutes, then hanging up on me, then calling me back again, finally talking to the doctor.

The doctor told me nothing new except that I have sleep apnea, and just tried to sell me on the $3000.00 mouthguard again. I again reiterated that it was unaffordable and was hoping for some cheaper options. He told me (verbatim) that "Maybe once I decide to prioritize my health, I can find the money to get the oral appliance." and that I "wouldn't believe how much money [he] has spent out of pocket on [his] health." Must be nice when you can afford all the medical treatment in the world you want, while making others feel bad about when they can't, and charging them for the pleasure.

I have never had such a rude, unprofessional, and completely transactional experience with a doctor's office. I will not be returning here nor recommending them, and will be following up with my dentist as well as to why they referred me here. I've never written a Google Review before, but had to relay my experience after going through this.

And as for the at home sleep study - the pulmonologist who reviewed my results (from a diffferent office) told me my numbers were ok, I did NOT have sleep apnea, and that I should try losing weight first before going into any other treatments.

Save your money - go to an ENT or a different sleep center that takes insurance. Avoid this place and get a second opinion - their priorities are clear.|Had a consult with Ashley and Liz to evaluate my airway and trouble sleeping.  They did a thorough exam, explained everything and answered all my questions.  Susan was great going over my treatment plan and options for payment and the front desk was friendly and helpful in setting up my next appointment.  Thank you for giving me such a great experience!  You have an amazing team!|Summary:
I feel scammed by this practice:
They charged me for $3k for a 3D printed plastic mouth guard . My sleep didn't improve . They didn't "fight" for me on my behalf as they stated to me with my insurance.

I was recommended this practice by my primary care physician for sleep apnea (mild case) as they have good reputation. The office is nice , clean, and the staff are friendly. My real issue lies with billing/ insurance (I would argue deceptive practices/ bad communication ) and the end product they sell result in $3 grand piece of 3D printed plastic, that they exaggerated the efficacy on. They operate as a cash up front type practice and they submit the claim to your insurance after.Beware they promise you they will work hard to get the appliance covered by your insurance but a lot of insurances don't cover oral appliances as they aren't as affective as CPAP machines. They assured me they deal with insurance all of the time and they would submit a gap  waiver with my insurance since they were out of network. I was leary but I accepted as my sleep quality was suffering. They told me that the claims wouldn't be submitted until I recieved the device. I picked device a month later and I noticed no real changes in my sleep quality and after multiple follow up appointments I still am in the same place with the end product. The billing/ insurance end was a complete nightmare, there was a huge miscommunication between my insurance UHC and the practice where the gap waiver was not submitted or the insurance didn't see it ( both sides blamed one another) after hours on the phone and emails exchanged the problem got fixed. Pain and Sleep Therapy would sometimes respond super prompt to emails and other times I would wait a week or more which caused frustration as well. UHC ultimately rejected my claim and they appealed which the appeal got rejected as well and the response I got from UHC was out of network every time. Pain and Sleep Therapy pretty much threw their hands up and gave up. The back and forth was exhausting 6 + months and total. The end result I got was an overpriced mouth guard that doesn't work by a provider that was deceptive ( they didn't fight for me after promising to do so) and bad communication.|This is the best provider office that I have ever been to all the staff are caring. They take the time to listen to all of your concerns and not rush you through just the most pertinent ones. They take the time to explain everything to you and answer any question you may have. They even tell you to call them and ask them if you have any questions later. Dana was Assistant working with Dr Robinson today she is amazing. She's very sweet and kind she made me feel like she really cared for my well-being. Dr Robinson he's a very soft spoken kind man he's the first doctor that sat there and listened to me and explained to everything to me openly and honestly. Not only do I come to see him for my TMJ but my husband now will come and see him for sleep apnea and we will come back to see him for our routine dental work up. If you have any pain or discomfort or sleep apnea come to pain and sleep therapy center you will not regret it.

The pictures that I took of the lobby and the bathroom the bathroom is so comfortable and just beautiful they don't have directly antibacterial that strip your hands they have the one set do not cause you for the damage to your skin they have a baby changing table with diapers and wipes they care they really care.

column40:
Went to falco's practice for years! Always had the best of experience just always had to wait a good while. I didn't mind doing that considering how great a doctor that he is. But then the wait times became quite excessive, and like others have said Dr Falco just stopped coming in and seeing patients. If he had brain cancer I'm very sorry for him however they should have been honest with their patients and upfront with them. I had two instances there where my urine screenings came back positive for something that I absolutely positively did not take! I don't know how, why, anything at all about how this happened, all I know is I didn't take any medication then what was prescribed to me and did not mess with illicit drugs. The first time it happened they said they would work with me and excused it until my next year and screening came back clean, which I knew it would! Then about a year or so later it happened again! They discharged me that time, without any pain medication to leave with or any referrals for new doctors. I was livid! I would definitely say they need to get more doctors in there and they need to develop a system for your own screenings that is more than foolproof! By the way I even went home and took a Walgreens drug test and my system showed up clean, not a darn thing in it other than what I had been prescribed! I would not recommend anyone go here unless absolutely necessary|They lie to their patients. My doctor was Dr Falco. All of sudden he disappeared.I kept asking to see him.Was told oh he looks at your file when he doesn't see in person(lie)Was told he only working in the Newark de office and I would have to see him there(lie)made appointment to see him went all the way up there 2hr .ride one way.Got there the  nurse practitioner came in oh Dr falco not here today.They hid that he was not in the office cause he has brain cancer.They wanted to keep using his license to stay open.When they knew I knew what they were doing. I got a dirty drug test.Then said I couldn't fight it cause it was over 30days.Candice didn't tell me for days after test was done.I have gone to the state of de medical review broad to have them investigated. Very shaded what they did.|I was responsible for transportation of a patient. The wait times are excessive - never less than an hour late, often as much as five hours, because they purposely overbook appointments. [A patient witnessed staff discussing this fact.] The entire staff is (IMO) addle brained and quick to phone police the second a client dares question their perceived authority. I saw it happen three times in six months for what was non-threatening language and/or behavior. They treat everyone that walks through the door as though they are beneath them [translation: perceived as addicts and/or trash] and none of them are worth their elevated self esteem.

Patients with more than one type of insurance should carefully review their invoices. The "surveys" they are asked to complete on the tablets are only allowed to be billed by most companies ONCE yearly and other doctors' offices give such surveys accordingly.  THIS office gave patients the survey repeatedly.  So it appears that the office pads their pockets by surveying patients as many times as they have insurance companies to bill.|I would not even rate a 1,  but there is no other option.  I was seen by Dr. Flaco who seemed to know his stuff.  But if you have any life and do not want to sit in an office for 3-6 hours to be seen by him even though you have an appointment i would extremely recommend not going to this jack____.  My first appointment was at 8:40 am.  I did not leave until 1:30pm.  I thought maybe this is a fluke and would not happen again.  I went to my next appointment that was scheduled for 1:50pm.  Waited until 2:30 pm and heard someone say they were still waiting to be seen from a 10:30 am appointment.  I went to counter to see if this was true, sure enough it was.  If i would have stayed i would probably have been there until 7pm that night.  I asked for my notes from first visit.  I read later to find that thye were incorrect.  I called to have it changed, was told make an appointment.  Are you freaking serious!!! I rescheduled for a 8am appointment which took me 3 weeks to get, thinking first in first out probably take 30 min.  Wrong!!!!  I did only wait 2 hours that day.  Had to take PT for 4 weeks then make a follow-up which i did, once again for 8am.  Well we had a snow storm and they cancelled appointments.  I left several messages to have someone call me back.  Finally called office up North to reach someone who scheduled another 8 am appointment.  This was yesterday.  I went in at 8am which they leave a message stating to be there 30 min. prior if you are having a procedure.  I was getting a test done.  The nurse finished with me by 830am and stated not sure when Doc would be in.  He comes from Chadds Ford, PA.  I finally heard his voice at 930 in the lobby, that right he got there at 930am when he had patients scheduled for 8am.  So i waited a few minutes for him.  He never showed.  I asked the nurse at 1015 where he was, she stated she was not sure where he was.  I got up and told her to let Dr. Flaco know he could kiss my _ _ _ and i would never be back!!!!!!!!!!!!  PS the office is also filthy, the water dispencer was replaced with a stand alone.  There is a big hole in the wall which looks unsafe.  Very unprofessional.  Should be reported to health board.  Good luck if you choose him.  Hope you are very patient.|Wait time used to be bad. Now he sees patients 2 days a week and I haven't had much wait time since in the Milford office. The staff are all very nice people too. All of you people commplaining about wait time then go elsewhere. Dr Falco is an excellent doctor that's why it's so crowded. He is one of the top spine and pain doctors in the United States. If there is a wait time it's worth it.|I was referred to Dr. Falco by my PCP.  The first time, after a four hour wait, he came to the exam room.  I specifically and carefully told him the drugs I am allergic to.  My next visit was with Deb Streeter, P.A.  she entered the exam room totally disheveled.   First thing she did was write a script for the one drug that could kill me.  It was a different brand so I didn't recognize it.  I became exceptionally ill with my creatanin rising to 3.5.  I was in kidney failure.  Our final visit was a shouting match with her and Dr. Falco.  Ms. Streeter purged her file so it didn't show those two scripts.  Walgreens has the records.  I will be filing with AMA and Med Malpractice.  I would never wait for any physician more than 20 mins.  Should you care about your health, find a board certified therapist.|Deb is the absolute worst doctor. My doctor is suppose to be Dr. Falco. He is amazing and takes time to look at his patients records. However, he takes on a lot of patients so you then have to see other doctors instead. Now he has been out for several months which is unfortunate but I'd rather him get better. Those other doctors, however,  don't care because you aren't their patient. They don't take the time to review your history. The CDC thing where you are only suppose to be on X amount of medicine that is equivalent to 90mg of methadone is ONLY a GUIDELINE. It is not a rule or law or anything like that. The paper specifically says guideline. Now having 14 surgeries, a heart surgery, nerve damage from my waist down, chronic Crohn's disease, Lupus, 76 hospital stays.. I think that justifies being on a pain regimen to help with pain. If your medical history can clearly show and prove the reason you are on the medications you are on then clearly that is enough but if these doctors who aren't even your actual doctor are just going to up and change your medications, not look at your previous medical history, not look at the fact that Dr. Falco has IN FACT done everything by the book that he was suppose to and we tried other medications that did not work, having Crohn's disease and an ileostomy bag justifies why a patient is unable to take long acting medicine therefore if long acting can not be given then the break through medication needs to be adjusted accordingly. If I have clearly tried the medications and they did not work so MY DOCTOR DR. FALCO, change my medicine and adjusted it accordingly to give me RELIEF FROM PAIN SINCE THAT IS YOUR JOB AS PAIN MANAGEMENT DOCTORS then if he is unable to see me and I have to be seen by another doctor, that doctor SHOULD NOT just go and start changing medications because she feels like it. If she would take the time to actually look at what Dr. Falco has wrote and has previously done she would see that she is literally back tracking and putting a patient back to a point where they are in pain that Dr. Falco tried to get me out of. It literally is absurd and unreal what Deb did if she is even a doctor or whatever she is. She couldn't even tell me one thing about me, my medical history or anything so she didn't even look at my medical history or what Dr. Falco has already done and just changed the medication because she felt like it. Unless you are seen by Dr. Falco, these other whatever they are that see you could careless. So many patients are leaving and have already left. It is such a shame that Dr. Falco is unaware of what these or wanna be doctors are doing to his practice.|I brought my grandmother June Morris to Dr. Jie Zhu today, 11/22/16 in Newark, driving ONE and HALF HOURS. This doctor is what I think about when I live in Argentina and Bolivia for 3 years (3rd world). The mentally is, they don't pay for health care, so why should I care. He tried to tell me my 83 y/o grandmother was suicidal because she wanted to live in heaven instead of earth. If you don't know by now Dr. Zhu that people that age are very comfortable talking about death and dying. They talk about being ready for heaven, etc. I explained to him on more than one occasion she has 24/7 care, no means, no intent, no plan and my grandmother repeatedly laughed at him when I asked her if she was going to harm himself. On a side note, we live in Sussex County, she and my grandfather have rifles and handguns all throughout the house for years, if she was truly suicidal, she would have killed herself a long time ago.
We ended up having to go to the ER because this doctor thought a psychiatric evaluation would be appropriate for an 83 y/o with vascular dementia. I really don't know how he sleeps at night. I want something done about this. This practice SHOULD not stand for a doctor to treat a new patient in that manner. This is what is wrong with our system. You are suppose to be lower hospital admissions not increasing them. We go to the PCP, refers to a pain management, he does nothing, so what's next? The Hospital. So they gave her IV dilaudid and ruled out any suicidal ideations because she has NO mental health background, neither does her mother nor her mother.
Dr. Zhu said, "go ahead and sue me" while I was there, as if that is some threat. Listen I don't believe in suing people, I believe in right and wrong. And as the advocate for my grandmother who can't do it herself, I will file a report against your license. And I will write EVERY single bad review about you and this company until I die because you don't deserve to be in that position.

column40:
As a patient, a sense of safety is critical--especially during intimate medical examinations. Unfortunately, I wasn't adequately informed about what to expect, which left me feeling vulnerable and unnecessarily stressed.

Trauma-informed care is not just psychological; it is deeply neurobiological. When patients are not prepared for what is about to happen, their nervous systems can enter states of hyperarousal or dissociation, which undermine healing and trust. For example, I wasn't told in advance that I'd be lying face down for most of the procedure or that access to my legs up to my knees would be required. A simple heads-up or guidance about wearing appropriate clothing would have reduced discomfort and prevented the feeling of being caught off guard.

During the procedure, the lack of verbal communication further added to the discomfort. Even small actions, like approaching to listen to my heart and lungs without explanation, triggered dissociation. Clear verbal cues--such as "I'm going to listen to your heart and lungs now, is that okay?"--would have allowed my nervous system to prepare, reducing stress and the need to dissociate.

This was particularly challenging during the needling and EMG. While I wasn't bothered by the procedure itself, the absence of simple phrases like "I'm going to poke here now" or "Are you ready?" left me feeling overwhelmed and objectified. Providing these small verbal cues would have given me a sense of control and reduced my nervous system's stress response.

The experience underscored how essential clear communication and informed consent are as tools to help patients regulate their nervous systems. These simple adjustments--providing clear instructions, explaining what will happen next, and ensuring patients feel a sense of agency--can make a world of difference for patients, particularly those with medical trauma or PTSD. I hope the practice considers adopting more trauma-informed approaches, as they would benefit not only the patients but also the care relationship overall.|Do yourself a favor and do NOT go here. They must of paid for these "raving" reviews. They are not professional and do not respect people's time at all. Richard will schedule you while he is talking on the phone and do not put your info in the system. Show up for appointments to be told that the doctor isn't in or swearing me up and down that its not my appointment day. This has happened three times. They do not even have enough courtesy to call the patients and let them know something has changed. This entire office is incompetent. Surgery was supposed to be scheduled for me today but after this I don't feel comfortable with them doing a procedure on me when they can't even keep appointments straight and the doctor awake!!!!! Do Not entertain this practice, you have been warned!|Infinity Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation has been nothing shy of amazing. Rich is warm, welcoming, and so helpful. Dr Zelefsky is patient, kind and understanding. Both have really provided me with a level of care that has been personable, professional, and most importantly comforting.

I was involved in an accident that has been pretty traumatic.. From the total loss of my car to the physical pain and changes in my mental health, it has been a very difficult time for me.  However, coming to this office has restored my faith in medical practice of true genuine and caring providers who don't look at me for my past, but as an individual, and patient with a complex history they're willing to work with and aide in finding comforting resolution.

Truly, I can not thank them enough for proving me with this level of care.

*****
5 out of 5 stars. Highly recommend.|The quality of care I received at Infinity Physical Medicine & Rehab was top notch.  Richard Tyas (Practice Administrator), and Dr. David Zelefsky provided a wonderful and warm experience from start to finish.  I also must say that the staff at Infinity was like dealing with trusted family.  Dr. Zelefsky was not only personable, he also is a great listener, and very empathic to the concerns of his patients.  I would definitely recommend Infinity for patients who are experiencing chronic pain due to injury.

Signing Off,

Healed, and very impressed|I was referred to Dr. Zelefsky for an EMG. The whole experience was nothing but exceptional. Rich was very responsive to my inquiries and I was able to be seen very quickly. Dr.Z was very professional and I felt genuinely cared for as a patient which is rare these days. The EMG went smoothly and Arthur made me feel comfortable even though I was nervous and did not know what to expect. The experience I had with Infinity was top-notch and I highly recommend this office.|Very efficient and caring experience which is refreshing in today's medical climate. Highly recommend!

At Anodyne Pain & Wellness Solutions, we provide comprehensive, nonsurgical pain management and wellness services to adults throughout Newark, Delaware and surrounding communities. Our dedicated medical team specializes in nonopioid therapies for both acute and chronic pain conditions, combining traditional, functional, and physical medicine approaches to help our patients reclaim their health and achieve a more balanced lifestyle.

Our Specialized Services

We offer a range of evidence-based treatments including:

  • Customized chiropractic adjustments to realign joints and spinal vertebrae

  • Advanced techniques to improve blood circulation and optimize wellness

  • Professional acupuncture therapy for arthritis-related neck and back pain

  • Targeted treatments for headaches and various chronic pain conditions

Our approach focuses on addressing the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. We take pride in creating personalized treatment plans that help our patients experience meaningful, lasting relief. Visit our official website to learn more about how we can help you overcome pain and improve your quality of life. Located at 2600 Glasgow Ave #200 in Newark, we welcome you to contact us at (302) 208-5589 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Anodyne Pain & Wellness Solutions provides high-quality wellness services to adults in and around Newark, Delaware. The medical team uses nonsurgical and nonopioid therapies to treat acute and chronic pain. They also offer traditional, functional, and physical medicine resources to help people regain their health and lead a more balanced life.
In-office, customized chiropractic care is available to address pain and other symptoms of injury or disease. The team uses advanced chiropractic adjustments to realign joints and spinal vertebrae, improve blood circulation, and optimize wellness. Acupuncture is also available onsite to treat arthritis-related neck and back pain, headaches, and other chronic pain conditions.

At John P. Rowlands, MD DOS, we stand as Delaware's only completely sub-specialized and fellowship-trained orthopaedic practice. When seeking relief from pain or orthopaedic issues, choosing the right specialist makes all the difference.

Specialized Expertise for Better Outcomes

Unlike general orthopaedic surgeons who perform various procedures, our physicians focus exclusively on their chosen area of expertise. This specialized approach allows our doctors to perform a higher volume of surgeries within their specific field, and studies have proven that physicians with larger volumes in a particular specialty achieve better results. We are proud to offer comprehensive pain management services through our team of specialists, including:

  • Expert diagnosis of complex orthopaedic conditions

  • Specialized treatment plans tailored to individual needs

  • Advanced pain management techniques

  • Fellowship-trained surgical expertise

Our practice philosophy is simple: We Are Specialists — better surgeons, better patient outcomes. Visit our Delaware Spine and Pain website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 302-565-0828. Located at 1941 Limestone Rd Suite 101, Wilmington, DE 19808, we're committed to providing exceptional care for all your orthopaedic and pain management needs.
column11: DOS is unique as the only completely sub-specialized and fellowship-trained orthopaedic practice in Delaware. Unlike general orthopaedic surgeons who do a little bit of everything, our specialists do a lot of one particular thing. This allows our physicians to perform a higher volume of surgery within their specialty. Studies have proven that physicians with larger volumes in a particular specialty have better results. It's the focus of our practice: We Are Specialists -- better surgeons, better patient outcomes.

column48: What spinal conditions does cell therapy treat?
column49:
This natural and effective alternative to major surgery has many benefits including shorter downtime and significant pain relief. Stem cells are specialized cells that can naturally develop into many different cell types throughout our bodies. These cells can be used to treat many spinal conditions including:

- Degenerative Disc Disease
- Herniated Discs
- Spinal Facet Pain
- Sciatica
- Sacroiliac (SI) Joint Pain

column40: Dr. Glassman was a great doctor and this was my first experience at the office. Ladies were wonderful at the front when checking in. Unfortunately though when asked to pay my $75 copay I had told the lady I did not get paid this week so asked to get billed. I did not have a problem paying once I received the bill BUT I could not afford this copay at the time. I have never had a problem getting billed EVER at any medical practice. I'm a 26 year old who is dealing with loss of disc height with extreme lower back/leg pain with numbness to my legs. I've had many appointments with other doctors before seeing Dr. Glassman for my issues. I had to wait to get into this office for an appointment. I also work in the medical field so it is hard to take off work to even have my appointments. Lady who runs the front desk said if I was not to pay today that I would have to reschedule and they would not see me. I was forced to basically overdraft my banking account to be seen which now puts me in a financial bind. I'm not one too write reviews nor complain but personally I think this was wrong to do to any patient. I had stated prior that I've been to many appointments before seeing this office in which I was billed for all of my copays to take care at a later time when I was paid again and could afford it. If this practice seriously does turn away patients for not paying DAY of service they should state that when the appointment is made so nobody else runs into this issue and left just as upset as I was. I did not plan to not have the money but life sure does through wrenches into lives. Hence why I did not have the money. Again Dr. Glassman was a great doctor but the office needs to maybe make patients aware when booking.|I had an EMG August 22, 2023 and my doctors office has yet to get the results. I now have to take time out of my day to go to this office and get a copy, meanwhile, I am still in excruciating pain. Would not recommend going to this place to anyone!|Dr Glassman is really great. These guys even called and left a telegram saying Happy birthday|I have been trying to schedule an appointment with this office for several weeks. The front office manager stated she would call me back on two separate occasions. She never called me back I had to call the office and every time I called the front office manager never remembered my name or that she was to call me after the Dr received my records so we can schedule an appointment. I would never recommend this facility because they do not seem to care about their patients or potential patients at all.|Never got a appointment? Not Professional at all. Now they sure ready to charge your insurance. There's no Care behind the medical career anymore. It's about the $$$$$$$$$|

column40:
Dr Christians treatment for my back pain and overall health has made a significant change in my  quality of life. He is compassionate and listens intently.|Dr. Christian is an exemplary doctor and person. He is brilliant, empathetic, caring, friendly and very knowledgeable. When you are his patient you are part of a team and an active participant in your treatment plan.His ability to actively listen to your concerns and collaboratively set goals is outstanding. He is very patient and explains everything in easily understood terms. He looks at you when you speak, not as his computer. You never feel rushed. He honestly cares about assisting you with your recovery and improving your quality of life. He understands that pain is a lot more complex than injury to tissue, muscles or body parts. He has introduced me to the Curable program which has been an invaluable tool in my recovery journey. You need to be willing to do some hard work but if you do you will be rewarded with amazing results. He acknowledges that he is constantly learning and a lot of that learning comes from patient feedback. He isn't afraid to admit when he doesn't have an answer, but will get that answer for you. I can tell you based on my 42 years of nursing experience how truly rare these traits are. I would absolutely recommend Dr Christian, and his staff, to anyone without reservation!|Dr Christian is a wonderfully caring doctor, incredibly knowledgeable and makes me, as the patient, feel inspired to work very hard at recovering.  He gives me hope in such a  way that me believe I cannot fail. He listens well and takes the time to answer questions - for me, there are lots of them - and never makes me feel as if he is rushed

Dr Christian's support staff in the Spine Center greet me in a way that I always feel a part of a big supportive family. I am happy to see them every time I have an appointment.|Dr.Christian is the Doctor you dream of. He is caring, compassionate so knowledgeable. He is so humble and respectful to alternative modalities. He is truly a gift to the world of healers.    He REALLY cares and is intuitive to look into your soul and provide you with what you need.    This is almost unheard of in medicine, unfortunately. I can't say enough of the Man and Doctor he is. He should have 100 stars.|I would HIGHLY recommend Dr. Christina! Dr. Christian and staff are wonderful! I'm so glad I was able to find them. I drive just under an hour to see him! Dr. Christian is the only doctor that actually sat and listened to me, believed me and is helping me. I suffer from debilitating migraines and he has helped me cut the amount I get a month in half. He has also helped me with my shoulder issues. If you are reading this because you are not sure, PLEASE consider giving him a chance!! He is truly helping me!!!|Dr Christian has been my doctor for several years now. I was unable to walk when I first met him. 5 years later I am able to walk and I am again a functioning beyond anything I would have dreamt would be possible. I am walking again and also driving. I'm able to live my life again.

Please allow Dr. Christian help you should you need his guidance.|I have been to a lot of different doctors and Dr. Christian is the best and he is my favorite doctor  I have been seeing him for four years, now. He is very caring and a good listener and he never rushes you out of the exam room. I  would gladly recommend Dr. Christian to my friends and family knowing that they will get the best of care.|Dr Christian is a fantastic pain management doctor. He looks a you holistically and is very compassionate and understanding. He listens to you and works with you to come up with the best treatment plan for you. Even if it requires referring you to another doctor. I have had 3 spine surgeries with constant epidurals and rhizotomies in between them. My last surgery was 3.5 years ago and afterwards  Dr Christian came up with a new plan for my muscle spasms. It has been a life saver for me, as my falls had been less frequent for me and I haven't needed any additional therapy besides what I do at home. Plus the best part is, I do not want to be on narcotics yet and he respects that and treats me without ever needing to use a narcotic! He truly listens to you and works with you, to care for you! I wish there were more doctors like him!

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Dover, Delaware

At Pain Management and Rehabilitation, PA, we specialize in providing personalized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our practice, conveniently located at 240 Beiser Blvd #201A in Dover, offers a multidisciplinary approach to pain management with a focus on improving quality of life and functionality. We understand that pain affects each individual differently, which is why we develop customized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical rehabilitation programs

  • Diagnostic evaluations

  • Non-surgical treatment options

With over a decade of experience serving the Dover community, our team is committed to helping patients find relief and regain control of their lives. We accept most major insurance plans and strive to make the scheduling process as convenient as possible. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit our website or call us at +1 302-741-0111.

column40:
I believe this place is a scam. I called for a week no answer. Called back a foreign lady answers so unprofessional I was astonished so I hung up. I'm search for pain management for my mother forgot that I already called days prior she answers again and I instantly knew so I say "I'm sorry what's the name of your business again" she says "I'm not sure, what business are you looking for?" I say "What? I'm looking for pain management." Then she hangs up the phone. I called back to see if she would answer but she didn't. She never says the name of the business when she answers.
DO NOT CALL AND GIVE ANYONE WHO ANSWERS YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION. THIS NUMBER IS A SCAM.|Dr Balu is a very poor doc I have never been treated with such disrespect then with him and the staff making patients feel like a bunch of drug addict  and that is straight up wrong that's what's wrong with these doctors today also under proscribeing  patients to save their buts wile we live in pain!|Wouldnt even give Dr. Balu 1 star I have multiple bulging discs and today I finally got some medication that works 1 month later but only a 1 week supply|
